Just good ol  fashioned street tacos.Excellent carne asada  and   breakfast tacos. They cook with good fats and butter and the taste is wonderful. If you a calorie counter  or vegan don t bother stopping. This is good food   not for the faint of heart  yes intended . Next time we re in Austin I m going back  Only wish they deliver to Houston

Granny s has quickly become my go-to spot in Austin for Tacos. The crew that runs the food truck is awesome and really helpful when trying to decide what to order. My favorite is the abuela taco...the pork is just indescribably delicious. You can t go wrong with the Campechano  Alambre  or shrimp taco either.   The quesadillas here are HUGE and really tasty also just FYI. Don t ever change  Granny

Best taco I have ever had  Chicken mole was to die for. Cactus and egg was delightful as well  but that mole sauce is special. Haven t been back since we started the taco tour  but that was by far the best taco I have had.

Wow. Best tacos of our entire visit to Austin. Veggie options galore. We went for breakfast  the broccoli and veggies were just so delicious. My daughter loved her bacon and potato. The tortillas were really good. Enjoy ya ll

Perfect Al Pastor tacos. I got mine with corn tortillas. They are obviously handmade and delicious. The man that took our order was very kind in explaining what things were  I don t know much Spanish . The Mexican cokes are huge. The dining area is big and clean. Love taco trucks so much. Definitely will go back when we are in the area.

Flat out great tacos   Everything was hot  fresh and exactly what I needed. I took them to customers and they raved about them. That is unusual in Austin since you know there are a ton of places serving breakfast tacos   I will definitely come back.

This place is incredible. Let me start by saying there are a ton of taco places in Austin  so the competition is stiff. I m not a huge fan of mol  in general  but I always order what is recommended in the reviews  even if it doesn t sound too appealing to me. I ordered the chicken mol  taco  and the migas taco. The mol  was my favorite and was the best mol  I ve ever had. The migas was delicious  and HUGE. My husband had the chilaquil and the abuela. Both delicious  but the chilaquil was the winner of the two  believe it or not. This place has got to be in the top five taco places in the city. I can t wait to return

Super fresh and delicious  Highly recommend. Puts a taco from Tacodeli to shame  frankly. And  I pretty much  love that place. Granny s is on a whole other level  for sure. Much more of a home-cooked vibe.

These guys are the best. Cost effective  homemade and delicious. I go at least twice a week. The 25 minute drive is worth it for me. Support your local businesses and go downtown and get the best breakfast taco in Austin

Austin is known for their tacos - end of story. There are a lot of establishments cranking out  the best taco ever  is this small big town.   Trust me when I say these are the BEST tacos I ve ever had. From the freshly made tortilla to the crunchy chips inside the taco to the best mole sauce I ve ever had in my life topping the taco - BLISS  Granny and Armando are the friendliest people I ve met in quite sometime and you can feel their welcome the moment you walk up. I ve ever had them sit with me and chat while I eat their magical taco creations  Can you say chilaquiles    Situated next to Franandos  BOTECO  and the Vintage Heart coffee shop - there is something for everyone. Do yourself a favor and try these tacos.  My previous taco stop was Veracruz All Natural but these blew Veracruz out of the water.   I ve ever had a friend from Mexico City tell me she hadn t had tacos this good since Mexico

Delicious  Top 5 taco spots in Austin. They have the BEST green salsa.   We visited Granny s tacos today to pre-taco before the Taco Libre festival. Not one taco we had at the entire festival held a candle to Granny s. So glad we came here first to satisfy our delicious taco craving

This is one of the delicious dishes - cheap winter is indispensable.  Imagine on a cold  windy day  holding a hot bowl of porridge filled with flax and shrimp  add a little pepper to add a warm  rich taste  porridge is both smooth and fragrant  inviting people to eat until the last piece  .  Just eat you just watch the street watching the street  inhale the cool air typical of the monsoon days  feel the warmth spreading from the tip of the tongue to the whole body when eating each piece of porridge  ... coffee  Very always.

This was really incredible. Even when it was raining out it was more than worth waiting for. We had one of almost everything on the menu between our group  and it was all excellent. Also quite cheap and fast  definitely recommended if you re looking for tacos.
Muy bueni.  Just had the chirizo  egg  potato y cheese .  Git  2nds I enjoyed the first one soooooo much

Oh. My. GOD   I had an unforgettable taco experience at Granny s called a chilaquiles taco. The taco starts with chilaquiles made with the salsa of your choice cooked to crispy perfection. Those are placed in a soft  hot tortilla  also of your choice  then topped with shredded chicken  crumbled cotija cheese  diced onions  and a pickled jalapeno. Boom  Flavor explosion  I tried all 3 of the salsas  and I recommend the green salsa because of its bright tomatillo flavor balanced with a warm  savory  smooth garlic and chicken broth flavor. I also recommend getting a corn tortilla  I m pretty sure it s home made.  I had another taco  the abuela. I remember it being good  but I clearly don t remember it well since I remember it having steak and avocado while the menu clearly says it has chicharron and egg. I also tried la gringa  and I regret ordering it. It s basically a gourmet crunch wrap without the crunch. Sure  it was full of cheesy goodness with plenty of flavorful meat and vegetables  but the tacos are so much tastier in my opinion.  If I ever have the pleasure of returning to Austin  I will be sure to get 3 life-changing chilaquiles tacos and wash it down with a Topo Chico at Granny s Tacos. I know that I ll regret ordering anything else.  In case I wasn t clear  C H I L A Q U I L E S   T A C O S

The food here is SIMPLE VERY AUTHENTIC   LOCAL  FRESH   ANYTHING U ORDER ... will satisfy ur craving for authentic local Austin food trucks   Must stop in even for a very popular breakfast tacos  2.50 each

After extensive field research  I feel confident in saying that I ve found the best taco place in Austin. It took a while for us to make the trek to the food truck in East Austin  but oh man  was it ever worth it.  For starters  there s a solid selection of tacos available. And the gentleman running the truck  Armando  is passionate about their food  and it shows. Asked for his suggestions  and got a tour of the menu. We settled on a pair of breakfast tacos  a chilaquiles  and a shredded pork and avocado.   Now  I m not generally a corn tortilla person  but if I can give one tip  get the corn tortillas. Hand-made to order  they take the tacos to the next level.  Prices are totally fair   2.50-3.50ish a pop   the flavors are all on point  didn t even need salsa on the breakfast tacos   and the folks running the truck are a joy.   Next time you re craving tacos  or want to show off why tacos are a staple food in Austin  make a point to swing by. Simply sublime.

Thad breakfast tacos of course. They were good  but could use just a little something more. I would eat there again though  Has a cute little area to eat right in front of the truck. Be careful of the black birds  if you leave your food alone for even a second  they will help themselves to it
This place literally has the BEST tacos in Austin   super friendly staff and a sanitary place   also the food is all fresh which is a big plus
mouth watering flavors. the al pastor is super bomb. i can eat these tacos everyday

Found myself here 3 times this week. The green chilaquiles tacos are the fucking bomb  Chicken torta is pretty good as well. This spot is a must if you re in the area. The lunch rush here is serious business. I usually call in my order
this place was so good. the tacos  i got two abuelas  were absolutely amazing and the staff was super nice. i will definitely be coming back here and i can t wait to try their breakfast tacos.

Best breakfast tacos I ve ever had  The salsas were incredible. Rancheros was my favorite  but will definitely go back to try some more. The owner was so sweet as well  Enjoyed the Christian music playing.

Chorizo breakfast taco was delicious... but it wasn t 30-minutes wait in the sun whilst watching the people who ordered after you get their order and finish their food- delicious.  30 minutes for 2 tacos  one with basic ingredients  seems excessive.

I don t do Yelp reviews. But after trying the machaca and the mole taco I was compelled. Currently have a chorizo  egg n cheese and a potato egg n cheese taco left. I m sure they are delicious but def get the mole and machaca you will not be disappointed. I don t have a picture because I ate them too soon.

Holy crap this is a fantastic taco stand.  We went there on an hour lunch break in between classes because our buddy had seen the reviews.  The funny part is I was initially pretty unhappy with them because they are...not....fast.  We waited a long time for our food and ended up being late getting back to class.  I totally was thinking  how does this place have a 5 star rating   I tried my food.  5 stars.  Unequivocally 5 stars.  These are hands down the best tacos I ve ever had in any US State  including California where I grew up.  Their food manages to be original while hitting all the right classic taco truck notes.  A close second to the awesomeness of their food is the homemade salsas they have chilling in the cooler by the window.  I tried  and loved  all of them.  These guys took 35 mins to make me 3 tacos and I was late for class.  No doubt in my mind they deserve 5 stars.  That should tell you how good they are.
This place is really good. I see why they are 5 stars. Probably some of the best  if not the best  tacos I have had in Austin and I ve been here 15 years now. Well done.

I m giving this place four stars because the owner was so kind and patient when taking our order. We ordered 2 chilaquil tacos and I asked them not to include cheese because I wasn t sure it was pasteurized. I was so excited because they make them the true Mexican way  Chicken  salsa  homemade tortilla chips  queso fresco and crema Mexicana. To my disappointment both my tacos were covered in cheese     they also had a really strange seasoning in them that I was unable to get by. My husband ordered the ranchero taco and tacos and the granny taco... he wasn t impressed either. I wanted to love this place but it just wasn t for us.
Amazing tacos. I love it here  This has to be the most delicious taco truck in Austin by far.
probably the best tacos ive had in my life  i had grandmas and the breakfast ranchero one. Very random stop  very satisfied. coffee next door is good as well

Fresh veggie ingredients with beautifully seasoned meat.  The truck is well stocked with napkins  various salsas  water  utensils  handwipes and sanitizer.  The wait was a little long  but worth it.  I wished I lived in Austin so I could go here every week.

Granny s tacos are legitimately on the running for best tacos in Austin. Each taco is expertly crafted yet still a great value. What I love most about this place is that you can tell everything is high quality  from the salsas to the corn tortillas.   Speaking of tortillas do you yourself a favor and get any taco on corn. You ve never had a corn tortilla like the ones here. Additionally  they use nopales in their tacos which is not something you ll see often around Austin.   In a city inundated with great taco places  granny s tacos elevates itself above the rest.

This taco truck is everything one could possibly want from a taco truck in Austin. I was directed here by the fine folks at Texas Coffee Traders  when I asked for a  heady taco spot within walking distance.  East Austin is seeing similar growth to the rest of the city  but this taco truck isn t a recent hipster addition  rather  it s a family-owned spot that serves a delicious variety of authentic tacos. I had three  which I unfortunately can t remember exactly  it was a couple of weeks ago   but the corn tortillas  homemade salsa  and taco fillings were delicious.   If you re in Austin and have an afternoon off  definitely head over to Granny s and get at least three tacos. You won t regret it

If you are in Austin or live in Austin and you don t go here you are a complete fool.   The mole chilaquiles taco is quite possibly the best taco I ve ever had.   Also the broccoli  egg and cheese breakfast taco was surprisingly good  as was the chorizo egg and cheese.  Handmade flour tortillas are delicious. Will try the corn next time.

I go to granny s tacos food truck every weekend and it never disappoints. Every taco from this place is amazing and the  only  downside is how popular it is -- I would recommend ordering online in advance so you don t have to wait in line. The staff are great as well  Definitely grab some of their home made salsas before you go - enjoy

Seriously some of the most delicious tacos I ve ever had  I got the abuela taco   the ranchero taco and I loved both of them equally. The portions are great for the price and service was excellent   fast. It was a little busy when I went but we still managed to find a nice table to sit at. Will most definitely be returning
Absolutely amazing  I m from Austin and these are definitely some of the best tacos in Austin

Ridiculously good tacos from very sweet people. They ran out of corn tortillas by the time we got there  but the tacos and filling were so good that it didn t even matter. Strongly recommend the Mole Chilaquil taco.
Granny s Tacos is simply amazing  You really can t go wrong with whatever you order  every is fresh an delicious.

Delicious      I stumbled across this taco truck before meeting a friend for coffee and I am so glad I did  I had a bacon egg cheese breakfast taco  which was great  But...the key is the homemade salsas.   So fresh and flavorful. I will have to make a return trip to the east side just for tacos

FINALLY  ESTA MILAGRO GRANDE  My husband and I had pretty much given up on finding good Mexican food in Houston and didn t think we d find a good authentic place in all of Texas besides El Paso  at this point. This is a serious matter for us since my husband s Mexican American and we have never had bad Mexican food while growing up in southern California. Stopped here for breakfast this morning and this was my first time not being disappointed by so-called  Mexican  food in Texas. I ordered the Chilaquiles Mole taco and the cactus  egg  and cheese taco. My husband ordered the Hayley bowl. Everything was so delicious and wonderfully actually Mexican food and in the case of the bowl great Mexican fusion. It was in no way Tex Mex crap  We would ve immediately ordered more if we both weren t so full. Muchas gracias por todo Granny s Tacos

Granny s is the spot to get the best tacos in Austin. The abuela and the rico are must try s. The tortillas are so fresh and delicious. The tacos are pretty big so you ll want two if you re pretty hungry. It s a wonderful family run spot  and granny is there making the tacos   I can t say enough good things about it. What s also awesome is they have plenty of shade.
Best tacos I ve had in Austin. Great customer service as well. Had the al pastor  la abuela and the campechano. Delicious  All very authentic flavors but the campechano takes the cake.
Great breakfast tacos  I had the chorizo and the bacon breakfast tacos. Amazing  The salsa is phenomenal as well.
Haley Bowl was really good  Eggs  avocado  bell peppers  onions  potatoes  broccoli  spinach and cheese. Their chips and salsa I would also recommend  Big portions
So good. I just got hip to Granny s and this is now my low key taco spot. Hipsters and tourists  please give them your business  but don t make me wait an hour for a burrito or I ll kill you all.

Delicious    We went to Granny s Tacos for breakfast and ended up ordering nearly the entire menu    Must gets  - Haley Bowl  absolutely delicious and hearty yet so healthy  - bacon  egg  cheese breakfast taco  you can t go wrong with this one  highly recommend trying with some of the sauces  adds a little heat  - ranchero taco    Everyone who works there is so so nice  The lady supposedly makes homemade corn tortillas too  To try next time

Enjoyed the chillaquiles and abuela tacos.  Outdoor seating is plentiful while everyone stares at their phones  hopefully reviewing this place on yelp .  They definitely make the tacos fresh as this place tries your patients on waiting for a delicious taco.
Great prices  quick  large amount of food  and SO YUMMY   My go to is the migas taco and chorizo  egg  amp  cheese.

I literally just had a BEC breakfast taco in flour and knew this place was golden. The tortilla was made fresh and had the right amount of crunch. bacon was so good and the cheese they used was so meaty and gooey and UGH need this every weekend. Great food truck spot too on the Eastside with some benches. Cheap bfast tacos too
The tacos were not only good  but overflowing with meat  The burritos were amazingly delicious
Great food   Ordered 1 and ordered another to go   All three of us loved the tacos.  I got the veggie.

Yum  I got a chicken taco and a fajita taco. The total was  6.50 w o tip. The chicken was cooked perfectly but the beef fajita was certainly the winner of the two. Their corn tortillas are homemade and you can definitely taste the authenticity. I will definitely come back next time I m next door at Vintage Heart Coffee.   Tip  If you order to go  eat them ASAP. They re deliciously juicy and can get soggy quick.
Great lil truck recommended by local East Austin ers. The ice cold salsa is really special. Dont be shy. Great slice of Austin cuisine and food scene IMO. You can taste the love.

I came because of the yelp reviews and I was not disappointed. I ordered the gringa at 7 in the morning and didn t have time to eat it until 9pm at night. And just saying  I would ve given a 5 star review  for the 14 hour later cold version of the gringa. The t o who took my order was super nice and friendly. It was the only meal I  bought in Austin  i was only there for 1 day  and I m delighted that it was. I m so sad they re not in California    10 out of 10 I recommend.
Granny s Tacos is life changing. All of the taco s I ve tried are excellent and the chilaquiles taco is extra special. Staff is always super nice

If my granny made tacos like these I probably would visit more often. The flavors  the filling  the food coma. 2 tacos was enough to leave you completely full. Recommending chicken mole and the ranchero tacos  add a little salsa for an extra spice and i might just have found my new favorite spot.
My favorite spot for breakfast tacos in Austin. Right next to Revival coffee  which is a plus

Granny knows tacos   Last time I came to Austin  I was introduced to Torchy s.  Granny s surpassed it.  Their tacos are tasty and inexpensive. I got the egg and spinach  al pastor  amp  carne guisado.  Each taco was better than the next.  The eggs were seasoned with just enough salt while the al pastor was sauteed in a slightly spicy red sauce.  I got a refreshing Watermelon juice made with fresh watermelon.  They offer a Mango drink as well but these beverages are not advertised on the menu so make sure to ask. Dislike  I went on a Saturday morning and there were 6 other people there.  I placed my order at 9 55am and got my food at 10 45am.  I witnessed 2 people before me ask when their food would be ready.  I would have rated Granny s a 5 star rating if it wasn t for the  long wait

Was looking for a good taco lunch on the East side and came upon Granny s here on Yelp. My son-in-law and I tried a variety and I have to say the Chllaquilles with Mole Sauce was the winner  they were all good . Their sauces are also very good and compliment the flavors of the tacos. This is a real deal Mom and Pop trailer with great food and fair prices...you will be happy you came.

Amazing  Abuela Taco  full of flavors  Burrito is so good got my husband quiet until he finish eating. At the end he say  this is the best burrito ever eat in my life . So friendly people and great prices
had to wait 45 minutes. was adv will take 25 minutes. food was salty and oily. had the al pastor tacos. gas station taco place is way better. will never go to Granny s ever

So good  Just got back from having two amazing tacos and I m in food coma heaven. The guisada taco was chicken  So no guilt on my low cholesterol diet. The corn tortillas and salsa are home made. And the proprietor is super friendly  They were quick  which was great because I was hungry.   Also  several picnic tables with umbrellas for shade were clean and on a comfortable patio area.

Wow. Where to start - hands down  some of the best tacos I ve ever tasted. The tortillas are so fresh  the meat so tender and flavorful  all ingredients cooked to perfection. The mole sauce is outstanding  the owners are nice  and the salsas are fresh and delicious. It doesn t get much better than this folks
Favorite tacos in Austin. Consistent- fresh- delicious- clean  amp  friendly. Gold star award for Granny s Tacos

Amazing food  genuine people. Warm smiles  warm conversation  and warm fresh tortillas. As an longtime Austin resident  we take BBQ and tacos very passionately here. The owners of Granny s put current taco contenders to shame. A new face to streets of Austin  Granny s creations are incredibly fresh and of high quality. Their corn tortillas are inexplicably delicious  fresh and light  and yet could almost be confused with flour. If you re looking for a menu recommendation  heads towards the chicken mole. A professional mix of grilled chicken  peppers  and mole sauce  so that neither flavor over compensates the others. Migas are your next stop  a packed breakfast blend which mixes perfectly with one of their three homemade salsas.   In summary  please don t visit this taco wunderkind mom n pop food truck...   Cause then I ll have to wait longer for my tacos.
I have heard of these tacos finally made time to stop and this place was so good. i recommend if you haven t tried it you should and especially with the the corn tortilla.Yum i cant wait to go back.

Best tacos I had in Austin   My favorites were the ranchero and the green chilaquile tacos.  We had the mole as well  which was also very good  I just tend to like green sauces better.  The man was very kind  but just FYI the food takes a while  so don t go when you re short on time.  We went at an off time post-lunch  so we were the only ones there  and it probably took 30 minutes between when my food was ready  and my friends  food.  I had breakfast tacos from Veracruz the next day  and they paled compared to Granny s
Downright delicious  traditional  homemade tacos. Absolutely must try. I had the veggie and chilaquiles w mole tacos two weeks ago and am still thinking about them. Mmmm

This place screams nostalgia for me through its food. The Rico taco took me back to my grandmother s kitchen. It is  by far  the best mole that I ve had outside of a relative s house. The rice inside the taco even had a slight lime flavor to it  which is how I prefer to eat my Mexican rice. Their al pastor  and the pork inside the Abuela taco truly taste like home. Even their green salsa tastes like the salsas that I grew up with. To those who cook here  you re doing amazing work. Don t ever stop.

Armando s back. He took a leave of absence and had some wonky hours  but he told me this morning he s 8 to 3 Monday through Saturday  with some occasional weirdness for hours on Saturday  as I understood it .  I had a chorizo egg and cheese taco this time. Hell yes  my man. Trounces the other nuclear-punk chorizo taco I reviewed from a place up on Sixth. A FedEx guy walked up  looked at the menu and walked away like a chump. No idea what he s missing.  Such glowing prose  why 3 stars  Because I can.  Food s good. Eat it. Food s cheap. Buy it.  They also moved so no longer hidden by some wonky barbershop trailer. Now next to the brotastic hammock shop I refuse to name  at the corner of the alley and Navasoder.
The only taco that is on par with Granny s is the suadero taco at Suerte. Delicious  friendly service  inexpensive  and right down the street from where I live  I will be making this a regular stop.

Incredible tacos   The chorizo is delicious  high quality tortilla  salsa was just right. To top it off the tacos are well priced too  My new favorite taco place east austin. Oh and the music is great too
Get the chilaquiles tacos with green sauce. On occasion  I ask them to make me a breakfast burrito with eggs and bacon. Yum  amp  yum.

MOLE CHILAQUILES TACO.   These tacos are amazing       The people working there are so friendly and the tacos are truly fantastic.  I love that the breakfast tacos have many vegetable options and the tortillas are perfect.   I hope granny s is successful.

I had the shrimp quesadilla  which was hugeeee and greasy and perfect. My boyfriend had two veggie breakfast tacos  one with eggs and one with beans  he liked the bean one better. Delicious  fresh salsas  I took extra to go   Well cared for  casual covered seating area. Looking forward to eating my leftovers and coming back again

First off  such amazingly nice people running and cooking so already off the bat you know it s made with love  which truly does matter. Loved each taco more than the last. I would eat one and be like  this one is my favorite  then go to the next one and say  no  this one is my favorite   etc. So delicious. Go eat and enjoy  D

Stone cold legit. A taco truck on a terraced lot with umbrellas and benches and run by a great Mexican couple  who couldn t be nicer . The tacos are fresh and the tortillas are handmade. Had the carne asada  al pastor  and the  Rico Taco   mole  rice and beans . To die for-- especially Rico Taco. Do yourself a favor and go try the best tacos in Austin  TX

Delicious and always fresh tasting. Granny s has some of the best weekday breakfast options in Austin. Breakfast tacos and the Haley bowl are my favorites. The owners are very friendly and accommodating. Overall a pleasant dining experience every time.
Very good tacos. But torchy s prices  really   People from LA tell me food trucks with tacos average about two dollars there. What s up with the greedy prices
Best breakfast taco in Austin  Owners are very kind and helpful. Tacos are tasty  quick  and there are a lot of options. When choosing a taco stand in Austin  go here

Tremendous people making tremendous tacos. Both the green and red chilaquiles tacos cannot be missed. Hands down the best chilaquiles experience in town. Affordable  delicious and it will feel good to support the business of these wonderful people.
This is all about authenticity and straight up deliciousness.  Give yourself a bit of time as this is not fast food but so worth the brief wait.  Gracias abuelita
Best of the best. Don t be fooled by the little ol truck on the outside. This place is bursting with amazing flavors and options. It s my go to
The Chilaquiles taco is delicious and unique. I m telling you  Chilaquiles with Red sauce is amazing. But everything is great. Probably my favorite taco place in Austin.
Great place for breakfast  really nice help I had the potatoes  egg and cheese tacos twice

Loved the freshly made tacos from this place  My favorite was the broccoli and egg taco but we also ordered the chorizo  potato and egg  bacon and egg and potato and egg. This place did not disappoint

Such delicious tacos  Simple menu and everything is so fresh. Definitely get corn tortillas  they re homemade. We tried the Abuela  Carne Guisada and chicken fajita. Also we re treated to fresh watermelon juice   So so good

Delicious tacos with unique combinations. I shared and the people who got the extra tacos told me they were the best they had eaten since forever. If you want nopales  chorizo  and homemade tortillas  this is the place

This place has a solid 5 stars  and by god they ve earned it. I went to give it a trial run and got a breakfast taco  pastor taco  and chicken taco. Each was some of the best I ve had in my 13 years in Texas. So good I bought another breakfast taco and a burrito. The burrito was as big as a Chipotle burrito. Still killed all of it and regretted nothing. I almost don t want to write this review because it ll tell more and more people about it and it ll make the lines longer  but I think this secret won t last long anyway. 6 stars if I could.

Wow  I have ate alot of tacos in Austin. I was at the coffee shop rivelry and doing work. The truck is tight next door. So I looked on Yelp. Saw that they recommend the mole chiaquilles taco. I ordered it. One of the best 3.00 taco I have had in Austin. It could be because I love mole. So if you get a chance try it out. Was not to busy at 130 pm.

Best tacos ever   These are so delicious because everything is homemade right on the spot.. just like it you had a Mexican abuela  The meats are so flavorful with fresh toppings  amazing sauces  and perfect hand made tortillas. Tacos just don t get better than these  The owner and his family are really nice and accommodating and give great recommendations too
I m not a big egg fan but this was the best I ever ate. The broccoli egg and cheese taco was AMAZING
Awesome taco truck on the east side. Only open from 7 AM -3 PM.   Tried 3 different tacos and they were fantastic. A little surprised they were served on flour tortillas.

It s a cool spot  the tacos were ok  took a little long but the locals seem to like the owner. He s a hard working man  and he was very customer service friendly. As far as flavor it was just decent  it did the job for a breakfast taco

So Pueblo Viejo is good for street tacos  but this little place tucked in next to Vintage Heart Coffee is AMAZING. Get the Carne Asada tacos and the Veggie Tacos with refried beans. Absolutely awesome. Plus they are open at hours when most trucks are closed. We visited at 3 00 on a Tuesday and they were more than happy to make us delicious food. The truck is run by a husband and wife team who are just awesome. So good. We ll most certainly be back.
Freaking delicious  Authentic flavors. Outstanding chorizo in their dishes. Homemade tortillas. The chilaquiles breakfast tacos are to die for   I got the green
Amazing. I got the chilequiles tacos with green sauce and they were excellent. Everything was fresh. Salsa was spicy and flavorful. This place is awesome.

The best tacos in Austin. Cactus breakfast taco is the best  Never thought I d like broccoli in a taco  but I do here. Also  the mole is out of this world  Can t go wrong with anything you order here. Guac and chips - muah
Wow.  What a great breakfast burrito.  Mom and pap vender were very pleasant and the tacos are on point   You gotta try the hot sauce.  I ll be back when I come Austin

My husband and I tried this taco truck today on a whim  and we were so happy we did. My husband asked the teen taking our order if they had a basic steak taco  and the guy turned to the woman cooking and said   Grandma  do we have a regular steak taco   All the feels. I thought it was adorable and wanted so badly for the tacos to be awesome so we could come back and support a family business....they did not disappoint   Fresh  loaded  delicious  The sauces are fantastic also. We got the chorizo taco and fajita steak taco and I m hooked. It s also conveniently located next to our favorite morning coffee spot  Vintage Heart .  Oh yeah  it s pretty cheap too... Cheap and free are my favorite words -

Just had some breakfast tacos at Granny s. I m just visiting from MSP but the chorizo egg cheese tacos were absolutely killer. Perfectly spiced  although I did add a little salsa from the lunch bucket. Very inexpensive and delicious. My wife had spinach egg cheese tacos and she too was knocked out. Any chance you guys could open a food truck in the Twin Cities  Please
We tried it based on searching by rating on yelp  and it was delicious and had super friendly owners. We will definitely be back  Tacos are big  both flour and corn tortillas are so good.

Hubby and I scootered over here this morning. This may be the best breakfast taco I ve had. I got the potato  chorizo  egg  amp  cheese. It s absolutely delicious. And for the price- they are filled up. Also tried the cactus egg  amp  cheese - it was interesting but good. We will definitely be back. Highly recommended.

Overall I ve been disappointed with the Mexican food in austin but granny s hits the mark   I highly recommend the chilaquiles tacos  mole or red sauce - both are excellent  and the breakfast taco with broccoli was very good.  I also highly recommend their salsas  lots of flavor but not too spicy.    Only complaint is the breakfast taco with lots of different veggies  it had lots of grilled green peppers which I wasnt crazy about but everything else is excellent.

Very good   I was debating between a four and a five.  We had breakfast tacos and some normal meat tacos.  I really liked breakfast tacos.   I personally thought the meat tacos were good  but a bit greasy  not too bad   but my partner thought they were amazing  and thought that was what made them so good.  They all had generous toppings.  The wait was a bit long  but still reasonable.  They guy in the trailer was super nice and even specially thanked up for coming by after we were done.

Best Breakfast tacos I have ever eaten. Ever. In any city. In any country. Made by anybody s grandmother or otherwise. Best. And the owner is the nicest dude in the world if you sit and chat with him a little bit  I got a chance to because I was the only one there on a cold weekday morning.  But when word gets out  this thing place is going to be packed like Franklin s. They have a really welcoming little courtyard with about five picnic tables  big green shrub. Little succulent plants everywhere. Just the coolest  man.
Do yourself a favor and just try it.. super seasoned to perfection.. customer service was also A1

Had high expectations going in  but left disappointed. Granny s has a great selection but the wait is incredibly long for how few ingredients are in each taco. The tacos are good but nothing special  you can find much better at most gas station parking lot taco trucks.
Quality of the food is really good. They should hire an assistant to speed up the process. That was my only complaint. Breakfast tacos on point

Very high quality   I ordered the chicken quesadilla and it was amazing.  Great flavors  chicken was cooked perfectly and not to mention it was huge   So nice and friendly too.  I ll definitely be back.

The best tacos we had in Austin. Worth the wait and the drive. My husband had the La Gringa  which was huge and delicious  and the potato  chorizo  egg and cheese taco. I had the ranchero and chilaquiles taco. Both were great but the chilaquiles with mole was the star. Soooooo good.
Some cons  sometimes the wait can be long  so steer clear if you see lots of people waiting.

Great little truck. Really warm people serving delicious food. My first visit included two tacos al pastor and one carne asada. The al pastor was good--not my ideal  but solid--but the carne asada was great.  Will definitely be coming back here regularly.

Great Tacos  Overloaded Breakfast Tacos.... mine with eggs  refried beans   amp  bacon  and the second with Chorizo  beans   amp  egg.   Super friendly Granny at the window who was eager to please. I love Austin and food trucks  This is an Authentic Mexican food truck with tacos made with the love. This place holds up to the select few that I frequent. This will now be on my weekly rotation. Love  love  love  Granny and her Tacos

Convinced six of my classmates to come here based on the good reviews  and it made our day. Best taco I ve had in a long time. Get the Abuela and the Mole Chilaquiles Taco  All my buddies were happy with the Abuela  the Chilaquiles  and the Gringa.  Those of us who chose corn tortillas were super impressed. Only drawback was it took a while to cook  but in her defense  Abuela had around 20 tacos to cook for all of us  I am gonna come back in sweat pants and eat until I bust.
This taco stand is worth the walk if you are staying near the convention center. Breakfast tacos are just amazing- and the fresh salsa kept in the cooler on the side of the truck is a great touch.

Came to Austin on vacation and was brought here by some family because they talked it up and it did not disappoint  The great smells hit you as soon as you walk up. Home made tortillas and salsas were the icing one the proverbial taco cake. Definitely try the chilaquiles tacos
The best breakfast tacos I ve ever had   We walked all the way from downtown because of all these great reviews and they re completely true. Such a nice couple and REALLY good tacos.
One of the best tacos in Austin. Can t go wrong with the Chilaquil taco with green sauce one of my favorites. Excellent customer service
The Greatest Tacos I ve had    Great Customer service    Made me drive back for another Chilaquiles Taco   If Your In Austin I Recommend You Stop By
This place is the real deal for Pastor Tacos.  They re the best I ve had in Texas.   I think they re only open during lunch hours though  so plan ahead.

Ran by a friendly couple  Granny s Taco serves delicious Mexican food for reasonable prices. They even have mole  a kind of brown sauce that s difficult to find even in Austin s expansive taco scene. My favorite thing to get is the chilaquiles taco with mole  There s outdoors seating and some convenient parking next to it. The wait time is a little long  but you can chill at the nearby Vintage Hearts Coffee Shop while waiting

I had two tacos here for the first time today and was beyond impressed. I grew up in Southern California and visited family in Mexico every year so I know authentic tacos and ingredients when I taste them. I m a corn over flour guy till I die so if you re one of those Tex mex chuy s dumpster divers you might not appreciate the lack of quesooo on these incredible tacos. First one I had the pleasure of eating was the chilaquiles taco with mole  onion  chicken  and Mexican cheese on a homemade corn tortilla. 5 stars. One of those tacos that s so good it brings back childhood memories and all the sights and sounds that come along with it.  The next is the Abuela Taco with shredded pork  adobo sauce  pico  and avocado. Similar to an al pastor but way better than any al pastor taco I ve ever had. 5 stars. They ve barely been open a year and this place is currently the best kept secret in austin. Come here now before you have to wait forever to snag a taste of this gift from the taco gods.
Great bean breakfast taco and the man working the window was very nice. Thanks for making our morning delicious.
Heard about it while in Kerrville at the Folk Festival. Live in Austin  so I had to... Man    Been coming since. 10 10

This place was amazing. I had a cactus taco and a couple of beef tacos. They were fresh and the salsa in the bucket was also fresh and tasty. There was a small but nice eating area set up with picnic tables. I went around 11am to beat a crowd and it was steady traffic but not overwhelming.
Great  big tacos at a reasonable place  The authenticity is refreshing
This place is unbelievable. Highly recommend that you visit this while in Austin. Best breakfast tacos I ve ever had
Thank you. Just thank you. Worth every penny. Just don t plan to do anything else that day as wait times are a little excessive. Properly worth it though.

HOLY CRAP. GO GO GO GO GO. If you re contemplating eating here. Just go and do it. I ordered 2 Ranchero Tacos and I m still dreaming of them. Boyfriend ordered a burrito and a Mexican Coke. It was so delicious. I wanna set up a tent right outside of the food truck. Quick drive from downtown Austin  totally worth it. Perfect food amount to hen go tubing down the river.
Awesome tacos. Everything tastes fresh and is done right. Pretty sure they gone make their tortillas too  Skip torchys  come here for authentic
Tacos are so delicious and fresh. The service is really quick and the outdoor patio is shaded so it s not too hot when there s a breeze. I ordered the abuela and Rico taco. Highly recommended
Just had their Migas tacos  best Migas tacos in town. The green jalape o sauce with it is majestic. Very fresh  tasty with the uncommon sour cream in their also. Love it
Delicious  I had the La Gringo with Pastor. Wow  If you have the chance you should check it out.

Perfect breakfast taco experience--get the habanero salsa. Best breakfast tacos in Austin  Turkey sausage and chorizo tacos are both AMAZING. Would eat here for LITERALLY every breakfast if possible. Also maybe lunch and dinner.

This taco truck was out of this world   LOVED it   The carne guisada was particularly delicious. Also  their salsas are so good   Just the right amount of spice in the red and green ones. I ll be back again soon for sure
Seriously the best breakfast tacos in Austin. I ve been here a few times and I keep going back. Home made everything  kind service and funky location. I highly recommend
Our favorite taco spot in Austin--with Vintage Heart aka Revival Coffee  Vintage Heart forever  right next door what could be better  The quesadillas here are also super tasty.
Excellent    I had 3 el pastor tacos and they were so delicious  also they are a pretty big size  I could have gone with only two but am not sad about having 3  The owners are super nice too

So nice you should hit it twice  for breakfast and dinner . Delicious  hand made corn tortillas and scrumptious fillings. We had the mole  sausage with egg  and a vegetarian taco. All were great. Very sweet husband and wife team makes tipping a no brainer. Definitely sample this fare. With love  from Philly.
Food was fresh and delicious. The owner was super cool and excited about life. Those are the type of people I want to support. Granny s Tacos FTW

We went for breakfast on Saturday morning and would have gone again on Sunday had they been open. The chicken mole breakfast taco was my favorite of all the tacos we ate over a 4 day period in Austin. LOVED IT SO MUCH    I wish I had eaten 2  and am sad that I won t be back for who knows how long. This is definitely my recommendation in the future to any friends and family headed to Austin for Food Truck tacos  or any breakfast taco... YUMMY
AWESOME TACOS. Had the potato  chorizo  egg  amp  cheese  highly recommend. Adorable clean

The tacos here are so good and they are stuffed with food. You really only need two tacos at a time  though I wish I was able to stuff in more. There is a delightful crunch in the Chilaquiles from the chips they add that makes it one of the best tacos I have ever had.
Hidden gem. Grab a coffee from Vintage Heart and walk next door for some tacos. Medium-large serving  fresh ingredients  and excellent value.

An underrated gem. Probably the best tacos I ve had in Austin  and I ve tried a lot of those places in the top 10 lists  most of them are just okay  or are very American . Their red chilaquiles are AMAZING. Would dine again 10 10
Excellent breakfast tacos. Friendly service  and convenient parking make this place a go-to
Yummy  Worth the wait. I happily ate my entire 8 buck chicken quesadilla. Salsa  Avocado and tons of flavor. Filling. A solid lunch. Nice people. Habla espanol. GVM
Best freaking tacos in Austin  I am a taco fanatic and granny s taco is easily one of the best tacos I have ever had  Armando is awesome and the tacos are good  what more could you ask for
Really good tacos  stopped while on road trip and very happy with the great food they have at Granny s Tacos

I was skeptical because i had to wait a long time for someone to take my order and once that happened  it still took 30 minutes. But i brought it home and WOW. We had the chilaquilas taco  a burrito and a quesadilla and we were super impressed. Just amazing
Best taco I ever had  I wish I could fit in one more trip there  but they close at 3 on Fridays.
Descent breakfast tacos.  Had the bacon and egg  and spinach and egg.  Large portions.  Great corn tortillas.  Self-serve salsas weren t labeled.  One I grabbed was too hot  and one was too mild.
I am speechless. This place is so underrated you have to give it a try  food is affordable and made with a lot of flavor and love
Easily the best taco truck I ve seen since sineloa in Oakland. The chilaquile taco with mole sauce is to die for. I also had the asada burrito it was jus as spectacular

Granny s Tacos  OMG - I ve been a loyal fan upon my first bite of that fateful chilalique taco with mole sauce. Although these tacos aren t yet the talk of the town  they are certainly jaw-droppingly mouth-watering and buzz-worthy  Their tacos are served fresh and you can taste the authentic love that went into making them... from the homemade corn tortillas  awesome array of veggies  yes  add that cactus or broccoli to your taco    and the salsas made with the perfect consistency and degree of spicy- orange-red habanero  lime green salsa verde  etc...Not to mention their MOLE sauce again... AH. the tacos are so special you can t resist licking your fingers after eating them with your hands. And  its a family-run joint. You can catch Granny s son eating a taco with his kids on a rainy day. And Granny and Armando are so in love  its inspiring to watch them alchemize their romance into taco making- the overall experience is uplifting. I know you guys might think I m weird. But I am weird. I love Granny.
10 10 would recommend. Come here if you re looking for bangin  tacos and a chill outside atmosphere.

In a city where tacos are plentiful  this taco truck makes a name for itself  The food is friendly  tasty  feels authentically  homemade and worth the price of roughly about  3 bucks a taco. The tacos are filling too  This is my first time trying this taco truck and I will certainly be back very soon WITH friends.

The best breakfast tacos in East Austin. The people here are super friendly. I m glad more people haven t found this place because it s not usually crowded but it s DELICIOUS  My new favorite spot for breakfast.
Best tacos eveeeerrrr. This place is amazing. Huge servings. Huge flavor. Great prices. Best food truck in Austin
Great tacos and very nice staff. Would visit again
Amazing amazing amazing. I ve lived in and out of Austin for twenty years  and these may be the best tacos I ve had yet - and the salsa is just as good. Go visit.

This is my FAVORITE taco truck in all of Austin. And as a long time Taco Deli fan  this is a big deal. We ve been working next to Granny s for two weeks now and I think I ve had a taco every day. Maria and Hernando make delicious tacos every time - they are kind  genuine  and generous - big portions  always made to order. My favorite is the migas  broccoli y juevo  y chilaquiles con salsa verde. I can t recommend this place more  And the tortillas are so  so delicious.

OMG    You will not regret it. seriously delicious and most tasteful mexican food. The people are very courteous and give great service. I ve visited tons of trailers in Austin and this is thus far the best I ve had. NOT tex-mex is authentic Mexican flavor.

I get the Don Juan with extra tortillas and no bacon  Reasonably priced.   The queso is very runny and too expensive for what it tastes like. Unfortunately  the free salsa is also very runny. Usually  queso and salsa are my favorite things but no bueno at this place.
SO GOOD SO MANY OPTIONS  GREAT PORTIONS    As busy as they were we still got in and ate in a timely manner. Great job to the staff   10 10 recommend

Texas is known for their breakfast tacos  Juan is one of the top spots to get them.  Large restaurant. Super packed at 9 am on Saturday. Wait was about 15 minutes at this time.  Private parking lot  was full.   Friendly service. Ordered to go. Food took a bit to come out.  Don Juan El Taco Grande -  6.95 - HUGE  Probably 3 4 of a normal burrito in size. Lots of potatoes and super heavy. I could not finish mines. One and done for me  2 would have put me to sleep. Barbacoa -  4.50 - Meat was good and flavorful. No other toppings. I put my Don Juan and mixed it in to make a more loaded taco.

This place is good but I was expecting a little better considering there s always a line out the door  I had my hopes up for some really good Mexican food and I honestly thought it was just decent. We got an order of queso  large  which was really good and definitely too big for our party of 4. Their house salsa is much spicier than the average so be careful of that. I ordered chicken flautas which were tasty but nothing that wowed me. My friends chicken tacos were sad looking and very mediocre. I ve heard the breakfast tacos are what people go for so maybe we just got the wrong things  Anyway... queso is a must and flautas were good if you find yourself here
This place is just alright. I feel like it was a bit overpriced too  two plates and 1 soda for almost  40. The food wasn t nasty  but it was really plain.

Yeah. OK. We ve been here several times. Food is great. Service is great. Everything is great.   Juan just refuse to believe my red haired Irish man speaks fluent Tejano.   It would be entertaining if it didn t add 20 minutes to checkout.  Gingers beware. Juan may have a fetish...

The hype is worth it  Super cute local taco spot that s perfect for breakfast brunch. When we went they had a special on mimosas  so it was the perfect Sunday morning brunch  Definitely get the breakfast special with potatoes - just be warned  the portions are huge  Go hungry or you ll have leftovers.

For a Saturday lunch we waited in a long line as expected. The wait was maybe 30 minutes thanks in part to plenty of seating. Food while good is nothing I d crave or go out of my way for. Liked their chips  complimentary with spicy salsa.    Humungous portions. Think Cheesecake Factory. My Chicken quesadilla was stuffed  easily two meals. Good shredded chicken to cheese ratio  easily two meals for me. The cilantro added freshness and lightened the food. I ve had better guacamole.  My friends enjoyed their food. Vegetarians have options here.  Prices are on par for the area.  Would go somewhere else for lighter Mexican but glad I ate here.
Juan in a million   This place is open early    Everything is bigger in Texas     Portions is great      We order the Don Juan- El Taco Grande   Over all 5 stars

Authentic and delicious breakfast Tex Mex tacos. It was our last day in Austin and I m happy to have enjoyed my last meal at Juan in a Million. There was a 15 min wait around noon on a weekday. The employees are quick and friendly - we even got to meet Juan who is a gem   My friend and I shared the Don Juan tacos and together  we ate around 3 4 of it  D. It s huge and very shareable. I loved the flavors of the bacon  cheese  potato  and eggs - a perfect breakfast combo  The horchata is HUGE and soooo refreshing with coconut milk

Everytime I ve tried to come here  the wait time has always been too long for me to wait which means that this place is super popular. This time though  the wait was only 25min on a Sunday morning around 10 30am  Hooray  My entire party of 10 all ordered the Don Juan   6.75  which is one of their most popular menu items. It comes with a giant mixture of cheese  potatoes  eggs  and bacon on a tortilla. I m not sure exactly what other ingredients they put in to make it so good  but it doesn t taste like your typical breakfast taco.  I would order a few extra tortillas for  0.20 each to make smaller tacos. I also got a horchata   2.90  which was very refreshing.   This place has unbeatable value- a lot of us didn t finish our meal and had to take leftovers home. They also provide complimentary chips and salsa

Delicious spot for breakfast tacos  Just be warned - the portion sizes of the food is pretty big  so plan accordingly lol. You definitely get bang for your buck here though   Each table gets a basket of chips and salsa  so that was nice to munch on while we decided what to order. I ordered the Don Juan el taco grande and chorizo with egg breakfast taco.   Once my plate arrived I was surprised at how big the Don Juan was  It was piled on with the egg cheese potato bacon mixture and came with a side of 3 extra tortillas. This was delicious but way too much food for me haha  I could only eat about half of it. I also really enjoyed the chorizo taco  the meat was flavorful and mixed well with the egg and cheese.   If I were to do it over  I d probably get the Don Juan to share with the table and then order a couple other breakfast items to try. But this is a great spot for a tasty Tex Mex breakfast

Juan In A Million is a favorite place of mine ever since I was little. My family owned TexMex restaurants in Austin and always served chips and hot sauce at every table. This day and age  other TexMex restaurants throughout Austin either charge for chips and hot sauce  don t serve before a certain time or charge you when ask for an extra plate..  Not Juan. He keeps in old school and that s why this is my favorite TexMex place.  Hot sauce - SPICY  someone must be mad at someone back in the kitchen   Ha   So good  you just can t stop eating it. Just trying not to get full and save room for the Don Juan.  In an area where the cultural has shifted  it s good to see Juan In A Million sticking around.  As always. Great breakfast and impeccable service

Came from California and didn t understand what the hype was about breakfast tacos but Juan in a million has converted me    We got the taco grande and shared with my friend. Yum   We got a side of carne guisada - good   Wait time was 30min on a Sunday around noon. Line moves fast  food comes out even faster

Wow   I understand why people are willing to wait to get these tacos. We weren t even hungry but after hearing how we must try this place  since we traveling from CA- we did. We did the famous breakfast taco.  8. You get A LOT of food for this  One taco . They suggested to buy a couple more tortillas  glad we did. We were about to make 3 breakfast tacos out of this. Enough for 2 people.   Service was very pleasant. The ladies at the front shared more areas to check out  we re patient with us s as we were looking around inside to.   Lots of seating. Food was delivered fast and hot. We took it to go for a walk around Lady Lake and ate it about an hour later- still warm and delicious

AMAZING breakfast tacos-- the steak in the fajita tacos were so tender and juicy and the chorizo potato combination was soooo good. Disappointed by their guac-- which was literally just mashed avocados with nothing else in it  but the tacos were too good for me to give this place less than 5 stars.

One of the cool things about Juan In a Million is it looks like it expanded into neighboring space when it became available. That s why there are random rooms and nonsensical seating in some spots.  It s not a bad thing. In fact  I think it adds to the charm.  Anyway  I stared at my menu for about ten minutes because I wasn t sure what I wanted. Finally  I asked my waitress what she would suggest.  CON QUESO BREAKFAST.  She didn t blink. Then she asked   How do you want your eggs    Over easy.   It s one of the best breakfast meals I ve eaten.  I highly recommend.

This place was awesome and exactly what I expected  Cheap  good Mexican food abundant. They have a large sized patio you can sit on and enjoy the day  good weather permitting.   We ordered the Horchata which was extremely generous in portion size  enough for 2 people to split easily . It was very tasty and sweet. They had other options for aguas frescas too.   I ordered the con queso breakfast which had  eggs  cheese  beans  rice and carne guisada. It was so delicious and filling. The meat was very tender and everything had plenty of flavor. My boyfriend got the chicken enchiladas  which he had no complaints about either.  Definitely would return here for some great Mexican food

Never had an authentic Tex Mex breakfast before  so this was a treat for sure.   Parking is pretty spacious here  but this is a popular spot so you might want to get here early. If you can t  no worries though. Inside is a lot larger than it looks on the outside. There s tons of seating in multiple rooms. It s very well-staffed and everyone who works here is super nice   It s open for breakfast and lunch  but breakfast is where its at. Breakfast tacos are there specialty. And what s even better  It s super cheap here  Everything is affordable and you will not feel cheated here.   It was my first time here  so the waitress said I should try the Don Juan El Taco Grande. I know it says taco  but this is a giant meal in itself. So  I d recommend just ordering one as each taco actually comes with three large tortillas and a mountain of eggs  bacon  cheese  and potato. Very hearty dish  although to be honest I think they put too much potato and not enough egg. The accompanying salsa was very good.  Overall  really nice place for some Tex Mex breakfast. Go here for sure

Inexpensive place to grab brunch and I must say it was quite delicious. The only thing I wish was that they give you a little bit more meat but the eggs were cooked perfectly. The tortillas are fresh and seem homemade while the service is quick and efficient. come try out this location institution for yourselves

After constantly hearing all these rave reviews about this place  I finally had a chance to go downtown and try it. This restaurant is in the quickly gentrifying East Austin right next to La BBQ. Upon arriving  we were told the wait would be around 30-45 minutes. We ended up waiting around 20-25 minutes.  I ordered the small menudo and the Don Juan Taco Grande  both are on their recommended  and my friend ordered the Don Juan Taco Grande and another taco.  The menudo could be skipped and was not the great. The Don Juan was effectively 4 tacos worth of food. My friends other taco never arrived which was actually a godsend since we were already super stuffed from just the Don Juan Taco   6.95 . The price of the Don Juan Taco CANNOT be beat

Very quick  amp  very polite people  this was my first time visiting and now they have found a loyal customer. I will be there at least twice a week. They make sure that the restaurant is the cleanest and most presentable. The food is amazing  hot well cooked  and they have a variety of tacos and other great things to choose from.
This place is a must have when we go to Austin  Try their carne guisada with QUESO instead of just cheese... you re welcome

If your looking for the no frills taco spot known for huge portions and their very own taco challenge you have come to the right spot. This place definitely gets busy and I believe they do not do reservations so come early.   They have a taco challenge for the famous Don Juan which is one single taco that is one pound. Currently the record is 13.5 Don Juan s  held by a female  and the male contender is topped at 9.5 Don Juan s. The food comes out super fast as well. My Don Juan was pretty tasty  is it something I d come weekly to get...probably not. I think we had better breakfast tacos elsewhere.   The tres leches was good  not my favorite but still pretty solid. The service was also solid especially with the constant flow of customers. I d definitely recommend at least coming here once to give it a whirl  especially if you are a tourist.

Good food at great prices. The portion sizes are quite large for the price you pay  so based on value for money  alone  I d give five stars. Overall  the food doesn t blow me away  though. It s good  but you probably wouldn t choose this place simply based on the quality of the food.

Always love bringing people here. Solid breakfast options that will make you so full you ll want to roll out of the place. Friendly service  spicy salsa  and generally just a fun place to go with a group. Try the migas plate with cheese

This is THE spot. Feels like home  the food is just so yummmmmmyyyy yummm yummmmmm. I m new here to Austin and this is now my comfort place. U will prolly see me eating here I usually take a booth they comfy. THEY MAKE THEIR FOOD WITH LOVE  you can taste it. MUCHAS gracias. I love this place. U should love it too. You re welcome  Xoxo  Gossip girl

I don t understand why this spot isn t 5 out of 5 stars     Great food   The Don Juan breakfast taco grande was epic     The service was unbelievable     We will return    Came all the way from Phoenix to try their breakfast taco and they did not disappoint     This should be a Austin icon

Great breakfast tacos    Came here at 11am on tuesday and there was no wait. There are complimentary chips and salsa. I got don juan el grande tacos and they were SO good. Theres So much filling in the taco so they recommend getting 2 extra flour tortillas.

My friend and I had a big day ahead and decided to start our breakfast out right with some good food from Juan in a Million. We ordered their popular Don Juan El Taco Grande...which was indeed grande.  Filled with eggs  potatoes  bacon  and cheese  it was the perfect breakfast taco. I got a side of sour cream as well.   Lots of seating and their Horchata tasted great

First time visitor here- I came here straight from the airport with a friend after seeing the high number of reviews for this place.  We waited around 20 minutes for a table of two  which wasn t bad. We were sat a table with complimentary chips and salsa already on the table. Much appreciated this  as we were starving by the time we landed. If you love spice  this salsa is right up your alley   I ordered the beef enchiladas for myself and had no regrets. The sauce and cheese on the enchiladas paired perfectly with everything. My dish also came with a side of corn tortillas which was nice to eat with the refried beans and rice. Would highly recommend

Ok  so the name doesn t instill thoughts of  authentic Mexican   then getting there from I35 to restaurant was through a pretty rough area. It was one of two places I mapped on Yelp  I thought maybe I should have tried the other.  There was a line of people waiting to be seated  we got on the list and was asked for inside or outside seating  it was a nice warm morning so we did outside and no wait. Outside isn t really outside  it s a covered enclosed patio with fans and very comfortable. The service was very good  the breakfast was even better. I got a classic egg with papas and beans with good homemade tortillas. The salsa was tasty and a nice little bit of spice. My wife got the breakfast tacos  she ordered two and it was plenty. The tacos were full size  filled with meat  beans  potatoes and again the salsa was very good.  Overall  it s a place we would go back to for a good authentic meal.  Parking  they had plenty in back and there is some street parking. The place was busy so be prepared for a possible wait.

Absolutely amazing service and even better food.  I ordered 70 breakfast tacos for our firm this morning and like most large orders I place I have to worry about hiccups of some kind. Not today  everything went smoothly  the tacos were hot when they arrived and each labeled correctly  most importantly delicious and on time. We will be ordering our breakfast tacos from here from now on. The only small complaint I have is that I had to place two separate orders on grub hub because they have a limit on how much you can order on one placed order. But in the end I received everything I needed to put smiles on the faces of my peers. Thanks Juan in a Million

Went to Juan in a million after wanting to go to this place the last time I was in Austin. I ended up getting the don taco grande and it was absolutely delicious. This is literally such a huge taco and is filled with eggs cheese potatoes and bacon. Ever bite is absolutely divine and I couldn t stop eating. This taco was big though so was able to take like half to go since there was so much food. Loved this and would totally go back

Literally the best breakfast tacos anywhere. FOR OVER 20 YEARS     This is my go to spot every time I come back to Austin. Discovered it while in college. Love this place. AND Mr. Juan still shakes hands

I did not want to wait an hour in line for a table  so I ordered my tacos to-go. I feel like I saved so much time and avoided the extra frills involved in getting a table. I placed my order  was able to pay with Apple Pay  and got my food in less than 15 minutes  They were so crowded on a Sunday morning - both indoor and outdoor tables were full. They have a parking lot in the back.  I d be lying if I said I didn t just come here because I love the pun in their name.  I ve also heard so much about the Don Juan taco  and it definitely lived up to its hype. At  6.75  it is massive. The cheese doesn t even fit inside the tortilla. I m pretty sure I took a couple of bites and didn t even look like I did any damage. I really enjoyed the migas taco  3.95 with cheese. Their salsa is great. I m not sure if I d come back for the Don Juan  but the migas was for sure something I d come back for.

Second time at the place. It s been years. I ordered  Don Juan Taco Grande  make sure you get extra tortillas.   My Friend ordered Migas Taco with cheese and a Beef Fajita Taco. My friends ordered the enchilada plate and a carne asada taco.   All these items were too notch  Still is the best in Austin hands down  Authentic taste  amp  excellent value for your money    A perfect spot for breakfast tacos in east Austin and more. Nice outdoor patio and comfy indoors. I definitely recommend this restaurant  I need to come more often

Open since 1980  Juan in A Million is a bit of a hole in the wall. I had seen Juan in A Million on the TV show  Man Vs. Food  but wasn t really expecting much. The dining area is much larger than I was expecting. They have multiple rooms with multiple tables  including a covered patio.  There was no wait for breakfast on a Monday morning. We were seated  given some chips and salsa  and the menu. Chips and salsa tasted fresh and homemade. Good low level spice on the salsa too. Still wasn t expecting much looking at the menu. We placed our orders and the food arrived soon after  less than 10 minutes. Excellent service.   Figured I would order the Don Juan El Taco Grande since I had seen it on TV. Per the menu  it s a secret combination of potato  egg  bacon and cheese in a deliciously hot tortilla. It s also ginormous. The waitress offered me extra tortillas  and one Don Juan was enough to make four huge tacos. It s also surprisingly delicious despite the common ingredients. Makes me wonder how I can make it for myself at home.   I also tried a barbacoa taco because I wanted to try something more Mexican. Best barbacoa I have ever had. It was fall apart tender  extremely juicy  rich  and flavorful.   If I had a choice between barbacoa from Juan in a Million and some brisket from Franklin BBQ  I would choose the barbacoa  based on flavor alone.  It s also ludicrously cheap. A huge breakfast for two was about  15.   5 stars.  1200th Review
You will leave feeling FULL and Satisfied    Order the Juan in a Million grande for the ultimate breakfast taco experience in AUSTIN
Water coming out of the sink is 50000 degrees and burnt my hand to a crisp  idk how that s even legal.

Juan in A million is one of Austin s top staples and for good reason. The food is great and definitely home styled cooking. The owner himself is usually there and is very friendly. The day we went they were extremely busy  which they usually are   and yet the service was great. They really appreciate their customers. I would recommend not going on to empty of a stomach because the wait is usually 30-60 mins.

The reviews are accurate. I was looking for something that would be open early on a Saturday morning and close to downtown. This popped up and the website looked good so I figured why not. There was a bit of a wait which told me the secret about this place was out already but we only has to wait 20 minutes. The food came out quick and was hardy. I couldn t even finish all my food but I kept trying cause it was so good.
AMAZING FOOD   I love the tacos and the staff is super friendly. Will be back soon

I have been going here for 20 plus years since I worked downtown as a courier.  I used to go there every Friday back then.   They are one of the only places that makes their salsa close to how hot my mother-in-law used to make. Their food is great as well as their service.  We drive from Georgetown now to go eat there on the weekends because the food is so good.  I only wish there was one closer to us now. We drove there during the Covid-19 pandemic and would get food to eat in our truck because there food is that good  amp  worth the drive

It was a cold morning in Austin. And I still went there for a breakfast taco to go  The barbacoa was bout good as hell. The other tacos were good too. What I like most is that the tacos aren t skimpy. They actually put enough food in there were 2 of them will sit right with you. Depends on how big you are as a human too lol They do have indoor seating as well. I might have to go in there and sit down one day. If you visit Austin you need to try. It is a staple for Austin

This OG Austin eatery gives me a lot of nostalgia. I used to come here in college and several years later  this place is still as busy as ever. The owner and all the employees are exceptionally nice. My favorite item on the menu is the Don Juan. You practically get five whole tacos out of this monstrous plate of bacon  cheese  egg  and potatoes. Their tortillas are very well made. For  6.75  it s a steal  I had to talk my partner out of ordering one for himself because there was no way he would finish it. We were full sharing one. If any of my friends are in town visiting  Juan in a Million would definitely be a place where I d bring them.
Would not even allow us in because we have a service dog. Rude  And unbelievable in this day and age.

I have been wanting to come here forever  but just kept putting it off. I am so glad we finally came for brunch and enjoyed an Austin gem  which such great service  food  and personality  I was immediately making a mental list of who I wanted to bring here next and came super close to buying a shirt on my way out. I was SOLD. BEST REFRIED BEANS IVE HAD IN THE CITY. MAYBE ANY CITY. The food is just your Mexican good delicious food  but those beans.... They take the cake. I might even put them on cake.

Definitely a five star breakfast spot. Friendly and quick service and delicious fresh food  Don Juan el taco grande is a must order  We ordered two extra tortillas with it. Huevos a la Mexicana is also amazing  Portions are huge  I will say the guacamole was very bland and overpriced  but the other prices were fair. We will definitely be returning for breakfast while in Austin

A real Austin gem   The location was easy to find  and there was a parking lot in the back. We were immediately warmly greeted by the owner who was both friendly and charismatic. It genuinely felt as if I had entered a friend s home.   The free salsa was too spicy for the tortilla chips but perfect to put on the Don Juan El Taco Grande  The Don Juan El Taco Grande without bacon was mediocre and had too much cheese. It came with two additional tortillas and had a large portion of filling.   However  the horchata was sweet  milky  and delightfully light  The cup was also the ideal size to share with a significant other. My boyfriend ordered the Huevos a La Mexicana and remarked that it reminded him of his grandmother s recipe    There were beautifully painted murals and vivid colorful walls throughout the restaurant. The plants and flowers were alive and thriving. You could easily tell that a lot of love and hard work had been put into the restaurant.  Additionally  there was plenty of shade to sit outside on a hot summer day. The only main feedback I have is that it would be nice if there was free wifi there.
Great food and excellent service. I had the Don Juan El Taco Grande and it was a huge portion for  6.50. Plus it is amazing   Lots of flavor. Their salsa is delicious too

Kinda overrated. Came because of man vs food and we were in the area. The salsa was good and the tacos had good flavor. Meat was soft but not a fan of the texture of it. Was expecting more from it but eh
Great and cheap place for Mexican food. They give big portions and the staff are very friendly and attentive. The food was good  my favorite breakfast taco that I got was chorizo and bacon.

W came here early Saturday morning because everyone said we have to try it  And obviously we have to come to Juan in a million  The service was good no complaints and they were very prompt with the order and we received our food pretty fast. We ordered two Don Juan it was pretty good. My bf loved it I thought it was a bit dry but not bad. The serving is quite big  My bf just finished his and I got like 1 3 in haha. The horchata was amazing so fresh I drank 2 maybe that s why I couldn t finish my giant taco lol.  Anyway not bad at all maybe I should ve tried something else but would definitely come back to try something else

Great bang for your buck for breakfast tacos. A generous portion of egg  potato   bacon and cheese served with 3 tortillas will leave you full and ready to conquer your day. Plus they offer chips and salsa so it s a win-win. The service is quick and friendly so you can t go wrong with breakfast from Juan in a Million

At first I was going to go by this place is because I am from Mexico so it s hard to find good tacos. But it is one of austins staples and certainly worth a try. I will say that the Menudo and Barbacoa is so good here. They are totally worth going to and getting every now and then it is a great place. And a fun atmosphere.

First time here we went on a Sunday morning for breakfast. There was no wait so we were seated right away. Service was super quick and friendly. There are so many option on the menu so we went with a platter and two tacos. Everything was AMAZING. I can t wait to come back and try lunch
It was a very underwhelming experience. I love all kinds of cuisines  but this was at best a mediocre lunch a buddy of mine and I had. Not terrible but not good either.

I can t believe it took me four years to finally come to Juan in a Million  but I definitely saved one of Austin s treasures for last. This place doesn t have any frills and doesn t seem like much on first glance  but everything is incredible. Service is great  which surprised me because I didn t think anyone would come to our table more than once. However  our food  drinks  chip refills  and check came promptly. Servers are really nice and helpful. Get their most popular item because it s a lot of food and great value too. Their horchata is one of the best in Austin and it s also a huge cup too. Their salsa and chips are great  and my friends who are big fans of salsa love this place.   I highly recommend  Anytime I crave breakfast tacos I will be coming here.

Juan s  Does not disappoint with the spicy spicy salsa and ever crispy chips. I can t think of anything I ve eaten here that I didn t like  although I do stick to non meat items. The cheese enchiladas are simply fantastic  old style Tex-Mex and yummy. The migas with cheese rock.

This is a local hidden gem. Not from Austin but I m glad we found this place. Definitely a local s secret. Restaurant was busy but service was on top of everything. Daily lunch specials were priced well  portions were perfect and everything was delicious. Everyone in the restaurant seemed to be pleased with the food and service.

I never thought I liked breakfast tacos until I had these. The bacon egg and cheese taco is LIFE CHANGING. So  so  so  so good. Bacon is large and crisp  egg fluffy  tortilla so soft. The potato and egg is also phenomenal.

Cute little taco spot in Austin.  There s no seating in the restaurant at the moment but they do have an outdoor patio.  Our waitress was very patient and friendly.  We enjoyed our food  which tasted home cooked.  I would definitely come back here.

We came here based on a recommendation from a friend. It s a pretty nice hole-in-the-wall spot and was pretty packed on a Saturday morning. The food was definitely a lot better than what I was expecting. We ordered the con queso breakfasts and the Don Juan el taco grande. The portions were huge  especially the Don Juan special which was stacked for only  6.75. Definitely recommended

Okay  so we were visiting Austin from San Antonio for a conference and I was told this was a must try    The sweet tea was really good  the wait wasn t that bad for having a long line  about 30 mins . I appreciate the staff - my hardworking gente getting things done but the food wasn t standout for me. I got the chicken enchiladas with tomatillo sauce. Ehhhh.   Also  I don t think the tortillas were real guys. They tasted smelt like they had a shelf life of 2 years. I m from San Antonio where the tortillas are fresh  fluffy  soft and omg.  but once I got them served to me  in a little piece of foil  because they were that small  it was endgame for me.   Just take my review with a grain of salt because I do feel like if you ve never been it s good to try and you be the judge if it s worth the hype or not. For me  it s a  definitely not.  Meh.    update - despite what the owner s comment says  no they were not homemade tortillas.
A family restaurant. The food was excellent. My husband had the huevos machacados and I had the Con queso breakfast. Everything is homemade  best white corn tortillas. We will be back  for sure.

Inexpensive place to grab brunch and I must say it was quite delicious. The only thing I wish was that they give you a little bit more meat but the eggs were cooked perfectly. The tortillas are fresh and seem homemade while the service is quick and efficient. come try out this location institution for yourselves

Dang this place is so value it s crazy. I could have easily got 2 meals out of this. The Don Juan provides sooo much food I was so in shock. Definitely the place to go in Austin  I would recommend getting at least 2 tortillas extra though  only 20 cents each

I know this is a popular place based on its history and TV appearances. The restaurant has a nice ambiance  menu is well-priced  and the staff is friendly. However  growing up in the RGV and knowing Tex Mex  I can tell you the food is not good. The tortillas are store bought and flavorless. The chips look like they are Doritos bought at the grocery store. My carne guisada plate had more lettuce and beans than beef. Nice place but below average food.

Still a solid Austin breakfast   Friendly service.   The recommended Don Juan El Taco Grande was perfect and huge. Ask for a few extra tortillas and you have 3 tacos easy.   Chips and salsa - the salsa had great flavor and is hot which is not always easily achieved.  Horchata was also huge  delicious and refreshing.  Husband had a barbacoa and a miga taco with no complaints. He admitted to liking them both    He s not a huge breakfast taco fan...don t get me started lol
