One of the few things that hasn t change about Austin is how good the Don Juan breakfast taco is. I would eat here everyday if I could. Praise the Lord and pass the tacos

I am from LA on my first visit to Austin  TX and based upon the recommendation of one of my very close friends who is originally from Austin  my friend and I decided to visit JIAM. The service was great  the food was great  the grande breakfast taco outstanding--but for a popular breakfast restaurant I have to mention that the coffee was just terrible  like dishwater. Granted the restaurant ended up not charging us for it  but it still it took away from the otherwise wonderful experience  because this day and age  I think most customers in a major city expect decent coffee. I am writing this review with the hope that the management of the restaurant reset and upgrades is coffee

Old Austin Establishments  need to keep their game strong if they re going to stay in business. Juan in a Million didn t give me my money s worth and didn t offer to make things right.   I came in with one thing on my mind  queso and eggs. Things started off wrong when I asked for water with no ice and the server came back with a glass of ice water. It s not like she had other distractions between when I ordered it and when she brought it out. It was immediate. She just didn t listen. It was past their lunch rush. But that s just water. Not a deal breaker. Their Con Queso Breakfast seemed like what I was craving  but not all of it. I wasn t feeling the meat and potatoes that came with it. I asked the server if I could sub these things for extra eggs and queso. She said I could. However  when the meal came out it sure looked like the normal size serving of eggs and queso. When she brought me my ticket to pay  it just said no cg  carne guisada  or potatoes  no note to the kitchen about extra anything else. When I brought this up  I was told they don t do substitutions. That would have been fine  if they told me that in the beginning. I would have ordered the full meal as is. Instead they just gave me an empty apology and I left with only half the food I paid for. Communication  folks  You failed.   Also  the food was meh. The queso was more like a combination of something between queso and ranchero sauce. The tortillas were dry.   Not coming back in a million years.

I enjoyed the vibe of the place. The staff was attentive and sweet and the service overall was great. It was super packed on Saturday  so be prepared to wait  I don t remember if they do reservations . The chips were good and the salsa was pretty good  so enjoy  Do yourself and get the horchata. It s unbelievable and  even with ice  there s a lot that s served  so it might even be good for two to sip.  The Caldo de Res was an extremely pleasant sopa and it made me think that if my grandma was an abuelita  she might be able to make something so hearty and loving  I felt loved consuming it . The tortillas are also good and yummy even on their own. Now  the Don Juan is giant and unsurprisingly filling with a great combo of filling. My only knock is that it s oily and feels very fatty  understandable  there s a decent amount of cheese in there . If you understand that going in  it s fun   I d come back here and try their other breakfast tacos. Judging from the quality of the food  I would definitely recommend this as a spot to get breakfast
Home cooking. Good prices. We came late and the Don Juan was not as fresh as it was in the past.

The breakfast taco portion was very filling. Overall great bang for your buck. I personally love my burritos with a lot of sauce and when the food came I asked for some ketchup and hot sauce. A long time passed and she walked by our table like she had forgot and then I went to ask another waitress. In short  by the time I got the sauces the eggs were cold. Very disappointed
Barbacoa tacos best I ve ever had. Staff was super friendly. The area of town is kind of rough and sketchy.

This place is now added to my Austin favorites list. It was Saturday around 1 20. There was no line  we got a table right away.   They took our drink order and delivered chips and salsa pretty quickly. I had a water and horchata  highly recommend the horchata- comes in a huge cup and it taste good   The chips were crispy and the salsa was so good  I could eat it everyday.  We ordered queso breakfast and the Don Juan taco with a barbacoa taco  the barbacoa taco needs to get the awesome salsa over it  So good  so good     I can t wait to go back.

Drove into Austin on a MONDAY to find this gem was open. Typically on Mondays  you will not find your family owned mexican food establishments open in Austin  ie...amayas  enchiladas y mas etc  My MIL was in town from Kansas so this was a treat and a all around score  She got the enchilada plate  one cheese  one beef . I got the taco plate thinking the waitress had agreed with me that they make their own taco shells  or fry their own. which they do not. I ended up using my MIL corn tortillas and dumped my second taco into it and then made a taco salad out of the remainder of my plate. The salsa was perfect and spicy.  Downfall  their hours are now 7am-2pm everyday  but my question is why is there a dinner section on the menu when lunch is as far as you can possibly order  I had called in advance prior to driving from Georgetown bc all listings say they are still open until 3pm.  Cesar Chavez is turning into a nasty area and really deters anyone from wanting to go venture on the east side of austin when this is the authentic food and appeal mostly everyone is drawn to except for the blocks upon blocks of tents and hounding of panhandlers.  Honestly I wish I could make it down to the restaurant to try breakfast bc I ve heard it s great and I failed to read on the virtual menu if it s served all day. perhaps another day  most of all it was great food. thanks from my tastebuds

Recommendation  Not necessarily worth the wait or hype  but still good and large portions.  I had higher expectations because of the line outside and the previous reviews. I got the Don Juan which seemed like their most popular item and it was just a solid breakfast taco. Salsa was good  potatoes and tortilla were fluffy  eggs were light  bacon was a little soggy  cheese wasn t melted  altogether decent but nothing amazing. I will say it is dense and heavy and very filling.  Ordered  Don Juan El Taco Grande  Price    7

We were told this place would meet our expectations for a good breakfast but warned that it s popular and might be busy  I said I m down  Green flags for me    The wait was only 10 min but were called back within 5 min. Food was quickly brought out and sooo good. I got the steak breakfast . Meat was tender and the beans were my favorite. They tasted fresh and were so flavorful.

Welll 2 stars or 3    It s been around a while and is quite the locals  find. That being said  in a town with more taco spots than Manhattan has Starbucks  it has some tough competition to fend off.   The positive  The taco was huge  with a lot of stuffing.  The negative  The flavors were just not there - migas was bland  meats were way too salty  and the salsa tasted ketchupy.   I had expected more from this self-proclaimed  authentic  place.

My friends and I stopped here for brunch on a suggestion from our Lyft driver. It did not disappoint  This local staple has been making delicious Mexican food since the 1980s    I had a great mimosa for  2.50 and the Don Juan El taco grande. This is huge  Definitely enough to share with at least one person. It s a yummy scramble of potato  egg  bacon and cheese with a side of fresh tortillas  They also have free chips and salsa -- even for breakfast. I would recommend getting here early because they always have a wait. I would definitely like to check this out in a return trip to Austin.

One of my very favorite places to get breakfast  The Taco Grande is my go-to and the salsa has the perfect amount of heat  I ve introduced this place to many friends and they all agree that it is worth the wait. It s very busy but I ve yet to wait more than 25mins.

If you re a first timer here and don t know what to get.. get the Don Juan el Taco Grande  There s a big box drawn around it for a reason    I thought there was no way that ONE taco could fill me up... but boy was I wrong. This taco is HUGE  and they really fill it up with eggs  bacon  potato and cheese  The ingredients might sound simple  but it s so savory and delicious  Suggestion  Ask for an extra flour tortilla  or 2 . There s THAT much filling that you can make multiple smaller tacos with the extra tortilla. The prices here are just right too. This gigantic breakfast taco is  6.50  If I m ever back in the area  I already know I ll be stopping by again

An Austin classic that s definitely worth a visit  From the shaded patio seating and the vibrantly colored floors  to the hole in the wall vibes and neighborhood location  this place screams Austin.  The Don Juan is a massive  6 plate of breakfast taco goodness that s hard to not enjoy. It has all the essential ingredients  bacon  eggs  cheese  and potatoes  and combines them in a massive serving. It s a hearty meal alone  but we especially enjoyed the tortillas that came with. They re soft with the perfect amount of chew  which fit perfectly with the fluffy eggs. Our group of 3 even struggled to finish it  Whether as a nice brunch or hangover cure  it s a definitely worth a visit

Juan In A Million is a must-go-to spot in Austin  Believe the Hype. The wait seems to be longer on Sundays but it s not too bad and definitely worth it. All the employees are very sweet and welcoming. You get different areas you can sit at like inside  or the outside covered patio.  I ordered the most popular dish  Don Juan El Taco Grande and it was so delicious  To drink I ordered a mimosa and it didn t disappoint at all

Wow  this place had an unbelievable amount of reviews. It was time we checked it out. We brought some friends who were in from out of town and hankering for Tex Mex. I would definitely give it a solid four stars. Very tasty traditional Tex Mex  Large servings and lots to choose from. When our Minnesota friends ask for Mexican food I am sure this is what they are interested in.

Visiting from San Antonio  I have never seen anything like this place. When you have over 100 people eating at one location and about 50 of them are waiting in line to just get in or place an order you know what to expect.  I personally met Juan and I can not say enough about him  He is the true definition of  if you want something done right do it yourself  mentality. The way he handles every customer as a usual and a friend makes me feel so welcomed that I didn t want to leave. The way he transitions from greeting customers  to taking orders  to the registers is completely unmatched by any means. Most people complain about having to do someone else s job  this guy thrives and Excels from this. Now for the food part  we ll if you haven t seen the 5 stars  then let me tell you   The best breakfast spot you can find as an outsider coming in. You will be full and not know what to do with the left overs. Absolutely great place  great energy  and unmatched customer service. If you can find somewhere else that matches or even competes to this In Austin   let me know   I really wish my phone hadn t lost all my pictures  I could of had plenty of photos for you guys  but please take my word for it

Cute little joint  super friendly staff. Walked about 1.3 m  from my hotel. They must be short staffed  the first dining room was closed so there was a wait. I opted for a to go order instead. Beef flautas  no rice  guacamole  amp  sour cream on the side. Packaged well for my walk back  but 2 very tiny flautas for  12.50. Will try something else next time
The Tex Mex diner of your dreams. Seriously I was dream of their carne guisada breakfast.
The food and the service were awesome. The staff was very pleasant and attentive  pricing was very moderate as well.

Same great food  same fast friendly service since the first time I walked thru the doors in 1983. Now I can t come to Austin without making a trip to Don Juan s for breakfast tacos  and an enchilada plate.   And as always I took extras to go   Mmmmmwah  So delicious.   Juan in a Million family  I m so grateful you made it thru the pandemic and are still serving Austin with the same greatness since I first walked in 39 years ago   Juan I understand you still greet people with the same spirit if hospitality. Maybe I ll see you in person next time I roll thru

Just two words folks  Don Juan. Yeah you know what I m talkin  about. The Don Juan  Do you understand now   Okay maybe you don t so I ll explain. That s the name of dish you must get when you re here for breakfast. Their menu even has it enclosed in a box by itself and labeled recommended. If that doesn t get you to order it then I don t know what will. After having it  they re obviously right.  So now that you re curious  what is it  The full name is Don Juan El Taco Grande. The menu states it s a secret combination of bacon  eggs  potatoes  and cheese on a hot flour tortilla. Take a look at my picture and notice the portion size. It s freakin  ginormous  As you can see  the one single tortilla it comes with by default doesn t even come close to being enough to close it up. Therefore  you need two extra tortillas and the servers will recommend this when you order. And thus  you re able to create 3 tacos with this single dish. And the great thing about all of this  It cost only  6.50 for all this food. If that s not a good deal then I don t know what is. You leave super full and satisfied. And it tastes just as good as it sounds. Any time you have bacon  eggs  potatoes  and cheese all mixed together you just know it s gonna be fabulous. Oh yeah  they also included free chips and salsa to start off with while you wait for your food. The salsa was spicccccccccyyy  Wooooo  But it was oh so good  I put some of that salsa on my Don Juan and that s just next level  baby   Overall  come on over and get you some Don Juan for breakfast people  At the price point  it s a steal and you won t be disappointed

So we came here because of the amount of reviews it had and here s what I thought...Well with all the reviews I expected much more. Now I m not saying this place wasn t good it just wasn t what I expected maybe overhyped  If you want a burrito don t come here. What Mexican restaurant doesn t have burritos  Oh this Juan. I had Don Juan el taco grande  special which was good and filling. The amount of food you get for  7 bucks is ALOT. Get the queso with your chips and salsa  salsa is hot btw . The taco salad is literally a shell  meat lettuce some cheese and a package of ranch. Not the best IMO. You have to dress it up yourself. The price here is great and the quality of the food is excellent but nothing that makes this place stand out which is why I gave it 4 stars.   Would come back if I m looking for a cheap quick bite   JK pro tip  get extra sides and stuff to use on your food. Taco servings are massive so you can easily share.

Located close to downtown Austin  the restaurant looks like a two houses that were joined together. Looks like a small hole in the wall but the menu looked like some authentic Tex Mex. we came in during breakfast hours  and I got the Juan Grande Burrito for about  8. Definitely a really good deal. It s huge and basically like a breakfast burrito. It had some pretty good spices to it as well. I wouldn t say it s the best breakfast burrito I ve ever had but for the value and portion size - I definitely feel like it s worth it. The wait staff were incredibly friendly and chips and salsa that came with the meal were tasty. Nothing to write home to mama about but none the less worth checking out if you are looking for some good Tex Mex.

10 30am Sunday  BUSY  HOUR LONG WAIT  Parking is shared with the block. There are a couple of spots directly in front of the restaurant if you re lucky  Atmosphere- mom  amp  pop hole in the wall vibe Service- confusing yet helpful Price-     Experience  Austin is so progressive when it comes to technology in my opinion. This restaurant uses pen and paper for their waiting list. Then  they have a worker tell out your name. This isn t a big deal if you re close by. I mention because most of the restaurants I visited in Austin have digital waiting lists or buzzers. They do have contactless payment  NFC  Apple Pay  Google Pay  etc...   The reason I said service was confusing yet helpful is because you are sat by one person  and then another person will ask you for your drink orders. Followed by a completely different person who will come and ask you for your food order. Once that food is ready another server will bring it to your table. Then periodically through your meal different servers will check on you. I enjoyed the attention but I wasn t sure who to ask for refills. I m used to a certain way  but the way they do it here is different. It s not bad  just different. I think that s the reason we weren t attended to after being sat for about 5-7 minutes.  My food was good. I m not a food connoisseur. So do With that information as you will.  It s rated well  food is good in my opinion  but nothing stood out. If you re in the area  stop by.   I m used to music  dancing  singing  excitement. That s not the vibe here. It s a safe pick for brunch
One word  Overrated      a lot of hype for average Tasting Mexican Food . The Breakfast tacos were bland tasting . I did enjoy the authentic old area and building of the location.

I travelled to Austin to visit family last month and knew I had to come to Juan In A Million. I ve heard so many good things and let me tell you - the hype is real.   My family and I each ordered the Don Juan El Taco Grande per many suggestions from family and Yelp reviewers. This is a MUST order as it s easily one of the best meals I ve ever had. I could travel to Austin right now and go back just thinking about it    The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming. Juan In A Million is a must if you re in town

The Don Juan breakfast taco is huge and tastes amazing. You can tell this is a true mom and pop type of restaurant. Everything is very homemade and the restaurant itself is comfortable. Can t recommend Juan in a million enough.

1st of all THE NAME is too cute not to come see what this is about  Omgeeeeeee this place did not disappoint  I love the family feel when you enter and is welcomed by Mr Juan himself   The line was pretty long and had people waiting outside. Unfortunately we waited outside for about 20 minutes thinking it was the line To put our names down. So don t wait outside unless you already put your name on the list. When your table is available they will call  your name.   We sat outside ate chips and Salsa .... boy oh boy their salsa was delicious but super spicy  Grab-your water quick  haha  their queso with ground meat was delicious not too thick and not too watery. We had the Don Juan Taco El Grande with extra corn tortilla  they gave 2 extra tortillas   amp  added refried beans. So it comes with a flour tortilla caked with Eggs  chorizo   smoked  bacon  amp  shredded cheese . I literally made 4 corn tortilla-tacos with enough left over for a 5th... I will come back for Juan in a Million again.

I ve heard many things about the famous Don Juan El Grande Taco but unfortunately  it did not live up to the hype. Don t get me wrong - it s a ton of food and definitely a great deal but I didn t think it was anything special. If you re looking for an affordable meal  this taco is for you. However  if you re looking for great tasting tacos... maybe not the spot.   Still  the service was great and they had complimentary chips   salsa for dine-in customers.

I have been coming to Juan In A Million for years.  It s my go to breakfast spot after a crazy night on Dirty Sixth.  It was featured on the Travel Channel many years ago and it still is a popular spot.  Parking isn t the greatest and you can expect a long wait on the weekends.  The staff is friendly and the owner is always around greeting his customers.    The restaurant itself is super tiny and most likely you are going to be seated in the back area which consists of a big patio.  With the pandemic  the inside is closed for dine in.  They will seat you outside which is not ideal in the summer.  Each table seems to be right under big industrial fans which makes for a very unpleasant dining experience.  Chips  napkins and little kids were flying everywhere   I also do not like getting canned drinks because they too fly around and also you are charged for each one.    Their Don Juan El Taco Grande is one of their main draws. It s  one  taco  but it can be made into atleast 4 or 5 filling tacos.  It is filled with eggs  potatoes  bacon and cheese. Their cheese is super salty  so keep that in mind. All together this meal is filling and tasty and you will not leave hungry. It s not the fanciest food but it gets the job done.   Overall this place is ok in my book. I feel like it s lost it s magic to me as I get older. I m sure I ll be back eventually  but I gotta check out the rest of Austin s awesome food scene first.

Came here on the recommendation of a friend. This place is a dive  but the food is excellent. The burritos are massive - one probably is the equivalent of 3 regular sized burritos because they stuff them so full  amp  give you extra tortillas. I wish we had known before hand  because we ended up wasting food.  The place was full  but they were fast  amp  efficient.  We sat on the patio  amp  it was cold outside  but they had heaters that worked nicely.  Didn t get to see Juan  but that s ok.  All in all def a good meal  amp  would go back when we re in Austin again.

This was my first time at Juan in a Million and I really liked it. The chicken enchilada are so good. The verdes sauce is some of the best I ve had. We also had the guacamole  which was really good. Service was great.   The only reason I m giving 4 stars is because of having to wait outside. It was really uncomfortable waiting for about 30 minutes outside in the heat. I recognize that there s not much Juan can do about that  but I probably won t be back until the weather is cooler. Most of the seating is on the patio  but we requested inside  where there are only  5 available tables due to Covid. It s purely my preference  but I prefer a restaurant where I don t have to wait outside.

Overall great experience  delicious food and very affordable  You will not leave here hungry. Fresh chips and salsa were delivered to our table as soon as we sat down. We were craving breakfast tacos and we got the best  Inside seating was limited due to Covid but the outdoor patio is covered and perfectly nice.  The Don Juan Taco Grande is no joke  You will definitely need the extra taco shells and I recommend putting a little of their homemade hot sauce on it.

Such a charming patio for breakfast. We ordered the specialty breakfast taco which was a combo of bacon  eggs  potatoes. It was very yummy and enough to make 3 tacos  The flour tortillas are fresh and delish. The wonderful waitstaff kept our coffee cups filled

What is up with all of the negativity towards the tortillas  I ve heard nothing but good things about this place but it seems like lately there has been a lot of issues with the tortillas   Like the owner said though  talk to the server  don t get into a mood and post about it online..  Probably why your marriage didn t work out  lol jk but it helps big time when you use your words

No matter the time of day  you get chips and salsa. I m not going to argue with that.   They have a lot of different rooms  and I was taken into one that only had 2 other people in it  while others were half full...seemed odd and made me feel like they wanted my solo dining self in and out  I had the potato taco and a bean taco. Both were good  but plain.   If you plan to pay by card  be prepared to do quick math when you pay as you will have to tell them the amount you want to tip.

Oh lordy it took me three years to get my ass to Juan in a Million and I finally do it in the middle of a pandemic.  What pandemic  Juan in a Million s business seems to be getting along quite fine  at least on the weekend. I m not quite ready for dine-in so I ordered take out and it took 30 mins to get my food  so order ahead if you can    So for my first visit  there will be more    I obviously needed to get the Don Juan giant taco. Drove it home so it was sitting in the bag for 15 mins but dannnng it was still so good      The potatoes are mushy and almost creamy  in a good way  and mixed together with the bacon and egg. If you like all your ingredients separate  this isn t for you. I can appreciate individual pieces but I also LOVE the mashy-mixy where you get everything in each bite.  And then the melty American cheese brings it all together. I can appreciate American cheese with the right uses  and this is the right uses. Non-traditional  Yes. But heckin tasty  Hell yes.   And you know what else is non-traditional  The need to eat this taco with a fork. Some reviewers call for asking for an extra flour tortilla. I m kind of glad I didn t because I m now lying on my couch too full my move as it is  even without eating an extra tortilla.
Juans for the win  Delish breakfast again. Good service and didn t have to wait to long. Long standing established restaurant here in Austin  A must visit. Kids and friends will love it

This place was amazing. The best barbacoa and menudo I ve ever had. My husband had the queso eggs and loved them. The portion sizes are huge. The prices are very decent. The staff was super nice and accommodating. We re obsessed. Would come back again when we re in Austin for sure.

Even though it was a bit hot outside  the fans but he outside area kept it really cool. I had the steak which was really good. The flautas are also recommended  Staff is very attentive and honestly- I didn t expect the owner to great us- it was great. Made us feel at home

The. Most. Amazing. Breakfast Tacos. Ever. A friend at work bought us some tacos one morning and they were the best breakfast tacos that I have ever tasted. Really delicious. Pro tip  cheese is extra and you should add it

Delicious  quick and plentiful breakfast.  The Don Juan taco is huge and incredibly filling.  The con queso breakfast had great flavor and was served with a side of tortillas so you can build your own breakfast tacos.  The staff were very friendly and prompt.   If we are ever back in Austin we will definitely be back.
Be ready for a wait.  The food was traditional no frills breakfast options.  Service was decent  but everyone was quite busy.

The only reason I didn t give 5 stars was when we were sent to find our own table the only ones they had were in a questionable area  We gave it a chance our waitress was very nice and the breakfast burrito was amazing Don juan el taco grande it s only 6.50 it s huge if they offer you another tortilla take it you will need it  The only thing that made us really lose our appetite was the man brought us orange juice he wasn t carrying it on a tray  He reached in his pocket and pulled it out it just felt dirty  But overall the staff and the food were amazing

We were in town for a visit and wanted something different than the chain restaurants.  This place was amazing   Great service  wonderful food   amp  reasonable prices.  I got the queso breakfast and loved it. I feel like you can tell alot about a Mexican restaurant by their chips and hot sauce... theirs did not disappoint   We will definitely be back

This review is really hard for me because I used to eat here all of the time  but the prices have gotten out of control. I used to split the Don Juan doe  3.75 and it is now  6.75. I would also get a single enchilada for  2.75. It was small but it tastes good. It is now  3.75 per enchilada. Pretty much everything is  1 to  1.50 more for no apparent reason. This place is just for visitors now.
Great brunch in Austin. The atmosphere is great and the food will put a smile on your face.
Great tacos  Happening place  Fresh food  Handmade tortillas  Very busy but they were quick with the food.
Incredible service  Even better taste   I crushed the don jaun and added steak instead of bacon   My wife loved the Don Juan also. Great atmosphere and helpful staff
Food is ok. I waited 20 minutes for my food and when it came it was cold. It looked like it was the waiter s first day on the job. I had to remind him that we were waiting for our food.

Timing is key when you want to come here for breakfast  as we did. Got there about 9 45 and got seated right away. 10 minutes later there was a line and people waiting outside for a table. But it is worth the wait.  Great wait staff  very friendly  The food  great stuff and considering how busy they were it did not take a terrible long time. Boy the wait staff must put on miles a day   The food was very tasty and filling. I would definitely go back here. I would love to try it for lunch.

Juan in a Million has been around since before I moved to Austin in 2003 and I m an Original Gangster.  It has expanded since then obvs but I m not sure I like every single thing.  It s kind of one-note with the Don Juan taco really being the only thing that ruled about their food  no offense-they really made a funn taco salad when I asked to substitute potatoes and beans for chicken  but yeah not anything to be wildly writing great Yelp reviews of.  The Sanctuary building across the street made me think Jaun in A Million might be good..like helping women out of abusive relationships    My good pal Kim Kugler wanted to bring her dog Bella to brunch with us but the manager said she had to be able to perform at least two tasks that regular dogs can t and since she could only perform one task  she wasn t allowed so we ate brunch at Gabriela s    Meow.

Juan in a Million is the social fabric that keeps Austin warm.  As soon as you arrive Juan in a million  you are greeted by a bunch of smiles and hard working people ready to be of service.  You are greeted like if you are part of the family and the first thing a family does is feed you.   If you are in the mood for quality breakfast tacos burritos  I highly recommend Juan in a million.  If you are overwhelmed by the choices on the menu  just order the  Don Juan - El Taco Grande.  According to their Menu   It s a secret combination of potato  eggs  bacon  and cheese in a delicious hot tortilla.   My recommendation for you is to come hungry and be ready for a nap.  The portions are hearty and the tastes is great.  I usually avoid places with crowds but Juan in a Million has a very efficient serving system and they get patrons in and out.  The food is legit and the dinning experience is memorable.  Yelp tip   The early bird catches the breakfast burrito without the crowds.

Love this place  I came here with my cousins who are not from Texas and we had heard nothing but great things about this place and they were impressed. Breakfast tacos are a must and now my cousins understand why  haha. There s plenty of seating  great for group gatherings. Absolutely loved the horchata from here  so delicious  The food is delicious - and there s a lot of it too  Definitely a must try place in Austin  TX.

I think their selling point was big portion for a low price. It is perfect if you are local and want a big  good breakfast that doesn t break the bank  but I do not know if I would recommend it for tourists  especially if you are short on time and can only make it to so many places on your trip .   The service was great. We came on a Friday morning and had no wait. We were greeted right away and the server was very friendly and patient. Loved the diner  your neighborhood cafe environment here.  I got the con queso breakfast plate - it was about  10  but came with a lot of food. The plate came with refried beans  queso  breakfast potato  2 eggs  some kind of stewed beef  and 2 flour tortilla on the side. This one was a bit messy to eat but the general flavor was good. Again  it was A LOT OF food  so please come hungry.   He got the Don Juan which is egg  cheese  potato  and bacon on a big flour tortilla. Again  a lot of food  but not something you can t  is too difficult to make at home  but for about  7  it was definitely a good deal     Overall  I would prefer to check out other places when I m in Austin next  but definitely check it out if you have a lot of time in Austin and  or local

Stopped in for the first time this week for lunch while working in the area.  What a great place. Enchiladas with tomatillo sauce was the best I ve had.  Service was super fast the air conditioning was perfect.  Wait staff awesome.  Price was reasonable and left big tip.   Will go again.
A timeless classic. Irresistible breakfast tacos. Spicy salsa. Silky queso. And an incredibly hard working staff. An absolute must try.
The food is amazing and the prices are just as good. The service was good and Juan greets you at the door friendly as if he s known you all of his life

Juan is very popular in Austin  and the wait definitely proved this  My party waited 30 min to be seated and probably another 30 till be placed our order. They serve  2.50 mimosas saturdays and sundays which were great  and we got their famous Don Juan taco which was pretty good  The taco is HUGE  so if you get it be sure to order more tortillas to make it into a couple of smaller tacos. I m sure Juan is better on other days with quicker service  but the long wait was it s only fault for me.

We were visiting Austin and heard it was a must to try out breakfast tacos. I let Yelp help me out and as usual  it was the right move.   Our party ordered breakfast tacos and coffee. I wasn t sure why my server asked me if I wanted extra tortillas  until my order arrived. The breakfast taco was huge. It was hot and tasted excellent with the house sauce. Everyone in my party was happy with our decision to eat at Juan s.  Here it comes...I hate that Yelp doesn t let me give half stars. Juan s is a solid 4.5 for me. Our coffee and meals were great  however  our service was a little slow and it took way too long to get more coffee. That said  our server was nice and helpful when we placed our orders. They appeared to have too many tables to juggle and may have needed help  or someone filling coffee.  I d definitely give Juan in a Million another try when I return to Austin.

I seen this place on an episode of Man vs. Food a few years back and knew I had to visit one day.  I know I m late to the party but I m not a local.  Better late than never  right   I purposely didn t eat the free breakfast at my hotel just so i would be hungry for one of those Don Juan grande breakfast tacos and was thinking I could eat maybe two of them.  Boy  was I wrong.   I ordered one Don Juan grande breakfast taco with extra tortillas.  I also got free chips and salsa.  The spicy salsa matched well with the taco.  The taco was predominantly potatoes.  It also had bacon  eggs and cheese mixed in.  This taco is huge and weighs at least 1 lb. each.  The potato mixture could have used more seasoning but I just added more salsa to it.  I should have asked if they have a green salsa as that would have matched well too  plus I m a big fan of salsa verde.  I think I ate only half the taco.  The taco won.  It is very filling to say the least.  I would rate my food as a 3-3.5  but will round up to 4  as the staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The place is spacious and lit well.
The staff is very nice and comfortable to joke around with. Food is also great  I alway get the Don Juan
It was worth the wait.  The food and staff were so nice     You are so good   Food was on point   Nothing negative to say about them  Thanks

Really wanted to love this place  waited about 40 minutes for our table  sat down and got our drinks  but when it went downhill was that we waited over 20 minutes for anyone to come serve us. No one came to take our order  refill our drinks or check on us. I understand we are in a labor shortage but we literally had to flag down someone to take our order. Service was terrible. We will never be back.   This will make or break a establishment  it all comes down to service.

Juan you really outdid yourself this time I must say. Mark the reviewer checking in to tell you that this place is amazing. Food is very tasty and plentiful and it s all at a cheap price. For the Don Juan and horchata  I paid  10  not including tip . It comes with some chips that have the texture of Doritos and some spicy red salsa. The horchata is on the better end of horchata I ve had but I ve never had a bad horchata tbh. It s everything you need from horchata  cinnamon  milk  creamy  sweet  refreshing  ice cold. The Don Juan is the most popular thing here and for good reason. The portion size is insane and you should always get the extra tortillas when offered since one tortilla can t hold all of the big toppings. It s some special mixture of eggs  potatoes  cheese  and bacon and it just tastes better than any breakfast taco I can make. The ingredients are in a very nice ratio and nothing is overwhelming powerful. There might be other breakfast places with higher quality ingredients that taste more fresh but nothing can beat the portion sizes. For the cost  there are no complaints and everything is delicious. Customer service was great and quick and efficient. Parking spots are limited so try and come when it s less busy.
Excellent. My family loves this place and we have the same outstanding experience each time we eat here when we visit austin.

How to describe this place   well it was definitely not authentic and service was not the best   waitress needed to be flagged down a couple times to just get coffee refills and sugar. To my surprise nothing special and when we got our bill we were outraged overpriced for beef    lettuce and eggs. Definitely not worth the buck

Came here for the first time and definitely was unexpected  the place looks small but was pretty spacious and had lots of seating outside and inside and all kinds. Do not be fooled by the menus and all of its different prices  the ones in store and online and at the table have all different prices.  Regardless  this place is overpriced.

Tourist review from LA    Must order   Queso  It s a cute little hole in the wall.  I ordered the chicken enchilada and queso.  The salsa and queso are so good.  The salsa has a great kick to it and the queso has a runny smooth texture.  I filled up on these     The enchiladas are a little disappointing.  The green sauce was flavorless and the chicken was dry.    I would not come back but if I do... QUESO AND SALSA
One of the best Mexican restaurants in Austin   The owner still works here. The service is very fast and the food is definitely worth it

This place is THE BOMB  I highly recommend this place to everyone and I always bring my friends here from out of town whenever they re visiting. Service is phenomenal and everyone is so kind. Also   1.50 mimosas on Saturday s and Sunday s. Need I say more    The salsa is AMAZING  It is definitely on the spicier side  but it is so fresh and beautifully compliments any dish. I ordered the con queso breakfast and my brother ordered the steak breakfast. We were not disappointed. Portions are definitely generous and prices are unmatched.   I would also love to give a shout-out to these guys for taking COVID seriously and implementing masks and social distancing while dining at their establishment. As a nurse  I truly appreciated this. I ve seen many restaurants ignore the mask mandates and social distancing throughout the pandemic  so this was a refreshing sight to see. You guys will always have my business

Stopped by for breakfast with the family. Was relatively busy but we were seated right away. It seemed like we were forgotten about for awhile  as we weren t approached by a waitress for around 20 minutes. But once she came  she was very apologetic and food arrived quickly after we ordered.   The breakfast was very good  but quite heavy. If you want breakfast tacos  they are quite large so you really only need two. The beans are also delicious.   If you re looking for a tasty and authentic breakfast  I would recommend

This place is an Austin staple and for good reason. Let me start with the food... For my meal I had the Don Juan and a Bacon and Egg taco and they were both fantastic  The Don Juan was huge  In fact  I made 5 tacos out of it which is a lot of food for such a good price.  By far  the biggest plus of this place is the price. Here the prices are crazy cheap for the large portion of food that you are getting and the service is really quick    I will be back in the future for sure.  2 Pro-Tips  Try the corn tortillas and come hungry

Doesn t look like much when I first saw it  I m not even a big fan of most taco places but I think this is some of the best Mexican food I ve had. There was a line out of the door but it went by fairly quickly. I ordered the Don Juan and it was super worth for  6.25. The plate comes full of their egg  potato  bacon  cheese mixture and you can add on tortillas if you need more. The filling is so good and even though it looks like they just put everything in a pot and mixed it  it tastes so good. Overall  would definitely come back again  only complaint is the line.
Went here for breakfast on a girls trip to Austin - soooo yummy  I always judge a Mexican place by their chips  amp  salsa. Let s just say Juan In a Million did not disappoint

We don t travel to Austin much  but I can guarantee we will stop here the next time we are in town  Not only is the food amazing  but the owner is one of the nicest guys  You can see he takes real pride in his business. While we were eating I saw several people compliment the food and you can tell he took each of those compliments to heart  I am super picky on menudo  it has to be just right  and let me tell you this ranked 2nd  under my grandma s of course .  I 100  recommend stopping by any time you are in Austin

I honestly wasn t impressed the way that I had hoped.  But then again  Cali mexican food is the best there is  Especially in the valley.  The portions were decent  the food was just decent and the salsa was too spicy for my taste buds to enjoy.  Plenty of room in the restaurant though.

This place is so OVERATED  Lol it s ok if you re not used to REAL Mexican cuisine. Tex Mex or not this place is disgusting   I ve had wayyyyy better Tex mex than this.We ordered breakfast and the beans tasted and looked like they were from a can. The potato s were either frozen or poorly cooked  Food overall had nothing authentic about it. I was clearly disappointed. Save your money and go to El Pastor in riverside for breakfast tacos

I was met by Juan at the door  exactly how I was met by Juan  years ago. That s attention to detail.   Fajitas  5-stars Chicken enchilada  5- stars Service  5-stars Price  5-stars  Beware that there may possibly be a wait outside for breakfast on the weekend -- because this place is worth it.   I ll be back.

HOLY COW this place hits the spot for a belly-warming breakfast. I came here after a long morning hike and it was exactly what I needed. I got the con queso breakfast which comes with eggs  queso  carne guisada  beans  2 tortillas  and potatoes. Everything was great  The carne guisada was so tender and flavorful and the refried beans were perfect. Usually I m pretty picky about my refried beans  but just thinking about these makes me salivate. This entire plate was just amazing and I scarfed it down. I cannot wait to go back and eat this meal again    There was about a 20 min wait for a table  but the service was pretty quick. You immediately get chips and salsa when you sit down  so that should hold you over until the meal comes. There is outdoor seating available and the tables are pretty spaced out  so they re taking COVID precautions pretty seriously.

We were visiting and apparently  this is the place to go. I mean if its good enough for Man vs. Food it should be good enough for me.   The dish pretty much everyone gets is the Don Juan  which is basically eggs  bacon  and potatoes on a tortilla. The thing is massive and costs just under  7. Honestly  if it weren t for the food challenge hype  I don t think I would have come here just for a giant breakfast taco.   There wasn t much that was special about it  and about 1 3 of the way through it got really boring   there s no stomach space to order anything else if you get the Don Juan. I did appreciate that the horchata was good  also massive and only cost  2.50   I guess in the end I had a second meal that I ended up giving to someone in need. It s a solid place if you need a meal that s easy on the wallet.

SUPER HEARTY breakfast taco that my two friends and I could not even finish. It comes with everything you could possibly want in a classic breakfast burrito  from bacon to potatoes to egg and cheese. For only  6  this taco seriously can not be beat in terms of bang for your buck. Super delicious but SO heavy  definitely something I could only have a couple bites of.
Pretty good breakfast taco selection. Some of the other spots around are better overall but this is always a crowd pleaser.

Finally got to see what the hype was all about it. Came to this place on a Sunday  there was a decent wait. The service was amazing  however the food was just average  ordered ribeye dinner and chicken beef fajitas . The beef fajitas were pretty good  but I wouldn t recommend the chicken fajitas or ribeye dish. Next time we will have to try their breakfast dishes - since that s what they are known for. I can see why people enjoy coming here though - the atmosphere  very reasonable prices  and customer service is great

The Breakfast Special is a must-have. Despite its simplicity  I found it very satisfying. The tortillas are thick and chewy  a classic combo with potatoes and beans.   Management has moved seating outside and the foldable tables that account for Covid take me back to the backyard meals of my youth  minus the blaring ranchera music and stumbling drunk uncles .   You d be foolish not to go.

Absolutely amazing breakfast taco  I bet you can t eat two of them.  Came here with family while I was on vacation and I know I will definitely come here every time I visit from now on. Huge portion for a great price  The food was absolutely perfect  Definitely a MUST try
Wow the breakfast taco was huge  Seriously took 2 bites and I was full. It s a hot spot here in Austin for breakfast tacos  You definitely won t be disappointed if you came

This restaurant is pretty good  I came in for breakfast on a weekday. The service was quick. The dish was average. Really like how spaced out the tables are on the inside. Their patio is pretty cool and has a good view of Cesar Chavez - I ll definitely be sitting out there when it warms up.

Although named Juan in a Million  this place is really just a 3 out of 5.  My first stop in Texas to grab some authentic Tex-Mex. Juan in a Million had a sizeable parking lot and plenty of seating both in and outdoor. That is about the only above average thing the had to offer.  The tacos I ordered were virtually indistinguishable from some I would get a Mexican restaurant in Virginia. The queso was uninspired and the rest of the food I can only describe as mediocre. While none of it was bad by any stretch of the imagination  it really did not live up to the hype.  If you are hungry and in the area I would recommend it but don t go out of your way.

Dined in today. Noticed immediately that the two patrons near us were talking about us. Talking about loving Trump  hating protestors  disrespected the staff etc. The typical racist shit. I was furious and couldn t eat  so we took it to go but before doing so my partner paid for their food and tipped the VERY calm and professional waitresses 40 bucks. We will be back as often as possible.   Who orders enchiladas without sauce

My friends and I came here to try their food since I d heard this is an Austin thing to do  We ordered our own foods and i got 2 tacos. The waitresses gave us red and green salsa and chips while we waited for our food. The red salsa was so addictingly spicy  My friends couldnt handle it. The chips were delicious    It took awhile for our food to come out which was alittle disappointing because they weren t crazy busy. The waitresses still had time to stand and talk amongst each other and with another guest sitting at a nearby table. Once our food came out   everything was delicious    Service was mediocre  nothing astounding. I would probably be willing to try this place again just to try something else on their menu. And definitely go back to eat that salsa again
Stopped in for breakfast on a girls trip in Austin. The Don Juan Taco Grande was SO good- and a huge portion.  Nothing fancy here  but good fast service.
We came for the big boy taco  The Don Juan. It didnt blow my mind  but it was decent. Needs more bacon IMO. They have the good kind of tortilla chips. Pricing was great. We will be back
Good TexMex. Spicy Salsa. Not the best chips. Typical Mexican food. Flautas are ordinary as is the rice and beans. Was seated quickly
Soooo good. Went for a family trip to Texas to visit our son and ended up eating breakfast here every morning. Good and service was great

I m fro LA and visited Austin with my friends and was STOCKED to try this place   I kept hying my friends up about it and when it was finally go time- we were very disappointed. The service was amazing and Juan  the owner was friendly. We just didn t have a taste for the food.  Queso  This was SUPER running. Is it meant to be that way  We were all really shocked because of the consistency. The flavor was decent but it didn t wow us- barely touched it.  Caldo De Res- I really enjoyed it. 2 of us ordered it and slurped it up. This was definetly our favorite dish.  Tacos- My fiance ordered 6 different tacos. They were HUGE but out of 6  he only liked one- which might ve been the Al Pastor.  Breakfast Special- Ordered by the rest of us and was barely touched. The taste wasn t memorable and dare I say that it was bland  compare to the other things we ve tasted in LA.  Maybe we ordered the wrong things and should ve asked for recommendations  I ll give it another try  if i visit again  because I REALLY wanted to like it. Their Micheladas were good tho

We stayed at the most perfect place in the most perfect location while in Austin. Juan in a Million was around the corner from us. I saw the reviews while looking for a close place for breakfast. This joint came up and we thought  why not.  They have a lot of indoor and  outdoor   under a pavilion it looked like  seating. We got there and it was about a 15 minute wait. With the line out the door I was expecting longer. I was pleasantly surprised because the wait was faster than 15 minutes.  The server sat us down and brought us a complementary basket of chips and homemade salsa. I was delighted and was hungry so I dug in. WRONG idea. That salsa was hot as heck. So  so  so spicy. I was not expecting that at all. When I realized I went in slower not scooping big chips full if salsa. Once that was realized I was good.  I ordered the one breakfast that was the Don Juan  El Taco Grande. I got it with corn tortillas. It was so big we could have just shared that    The food was so good. I went through most of the tacos and took the rest home. Man  if I was a local I would be back more often   I m happy I found it and I m happier we came

Chips were crispy and fresh  salsa was spicy. Horchata was huge and def worth it. Chalupa is a pretty big portion but not super amazing. All in all good bang for the buck and the atmosphere. Outdoor dining only so wouldn t go on a really hot day.
Juan is so nice and runs a great restaurant  the food is so good . The waitstaff is top notch   I really enjoy the ambiance and everything this place has to offer.

Must go place in Austin  Great food  super large portions for the price  spacious restaurant and great service. I got the Don Juan taco grande and it was only  6.25 and I couldn t finish all the food  a huge plate of eggs  cheese  potatoes  and bacon with two tortillas on the side  It was delicious and just what I needed after a night out  Our food came with large portions of chips and salsa which is what I always want. My friends got the chorizo con huevos and the con queso breakfast plate which were also delicious. This is a popular place so we had to wait outside for a while but there is lot of space inside. Definitely recommend especially for the price
The wait staff was very attentive  we were seated very quickly  and our food came out promptly on a Sunday afternoon visit. I got the chalupas and iced tea. It was nothing fancy  but still tasty.
Amazing everything. Fast friendly service. Excellent Tex-Mex food. One of Austin s landmark restaurants. Try the Don Juan taco.

I ve been wanting to come here for soo long and we finally did. My wife and I where not disappointed. We waited for about 20 mins and they welcomed us was very friendly. Their customer service was awesome and the food was very delicious. Thanks to the staff and to Juan we will be back.
Loved this place   The owner was amazing  hilarious  and super sweet. Best of all  the portions are absolutely humongous and delicious  We will definitely be back next time we re in town.

Not a bad place at all. Super wallet friendly and doesn t taste bad either. The Don Juan was huge and definitely shareable. I think the only problem I had with it was how big it was. The first taco was amazing but by the time I got to the third one  it began to taste the same hahah so next time I ll share with a friend. Also I wish there was a little less potato and a bit more eggs but it was still tasty nonetheless.   Oh and Juan is suuuuper friendly  he really makes you feel welcomed so that s bonus points there. There is a bit of a wait so be ready for that but it s worth it

Great service and super yummy tacos. We had the chicken tacos and the beef tacos and they were both delicious  We went back the next morning for the breakfast tacos. I got the bacon  egg and cheese breakfast taco and it was literally the BEST BREAKFAST TACO I d ever had  It had this really unique smoky flavor that I can t really put into words  but you just have to try it  I can t wait to go back to Austin so that I could have that bad boy again
Poor service and staff very rude...waitress never came back with my drink or sugar for coffee  had to ask another waitress...waitress completely ignored me twice...horrible service  do not recommend

Depends when you go but sometimes there s a huge wait to get inside and understandably so  Their Don Juan has been featured many times and it s so good. You get so much food for so little - with eggs  cheese  potato  and bacon  You can make minimum 3 tacos out of it. You ll have to come try it out yourself. The horchata is also a big size and so tasty. I never try anything else when I come because I know I ll leave satisfied if I order these. Only complaint is the back building smells a bit and it was very evident when we were seated there.

I ve been told I should eat Tex Mex because why not  We were in Texas after all. So  consider this an obligatory meal more than anything.   We were brightly greeted by the owner himself as he said  Welcome  come on in  . He shook our hands before asking us how many were in our party. Talk about warm hospitality. From that and the servers calling customers by name  I instantly knew they were not just famous to visitors but to locals as well.    6 for a behemoth of a dish called DON JUAN TACO EL GRANDE is the most popular thing on the menu. It s a mixture of potato  egg  bacon  and cheese on a tortilla that could easily feed two mouths. Make sure to add guac for that extra something  something. If you ask me  I think the price is what makes this special  otherwise  everything about it is pedestrian. By a mile  I preferred the CHORIZO w  EGG TACO   2.69  when it came to flavor. While they had unlimited chips and salsa on the house  we also ordered their QUESO which turned out to be really tasty but very watery.   Not my best meal on this trip but I guess you can say I had Tex Mex while in Austin..

This place is SO GOOD. I got the migas with cheese  which also came with a huge portion of home fries and refried beans. The migas were so cheesy and comforting  and the refried beans were some of the best I ve had. The rest of my table got the Don Juan  which was absolutely massive but tasty- definitely heavy on the potatoes  though. I preferred the migas  but you really can t beat the price of the Don Juan   6 for a small mountain of food .   Your food also comes with fresh chips and salsa- the salsa is a great addition to anything else on the table  I really liked it on top of the migas . The drinks are surprisingly good  too  I really liked the coffee  and do NOT miss the fantastic horchata. Everything is so reasonably priced  the portions are large  and the service is really nice. Definitely worth the wait

One of the first spots I heard I had to hit in Austin  this amazingly named joint has appeared on television shows with its divey and lively character in a humbly large interior  but I can t say I felt any of the magic. I got three different breakfast tacos  no migas though  and all were decent but nothing great or extraordinary. Just good and simple. Chips and salsa were fine. If this was a lowkey local spot I m sure I d hit it for decent Mexican but wasn t finding anything worthy of the reputation here and the line is too long for me to really feel like coming back. Maybe a local can tell me what I missed here or if it truly is just a tourist one-and-done spot with better options elsewhere  Tyson s anyone  .  Still  loved coming here for the experience and nothing was bad in the slightest. After you eat you pay up front  so don t feel bad if a waitress doesn t come around to collect your money after you get the check.

This place is deserved for its hype and always busy. Very unassuming place on a small road  but it s huge and always full. Being greeted and taken t your table by the very sociable and loving owner was a treat. Good fresh chips and tasty salsa was enjoyed. Of course I had the Don Juan El Grande taco which was simple and so tasty  but to me the star was the beef enchiladas. So staty  also tex-mexish. Loved its sauce. Will visit again and again.

The wait was only 10 minutes on a weekday lunch. Service was very prompt. Got our chips and salsa very quickly. Food took longer to come out. I ordered the Don Juan which is enough to make more than 5 tacos. Kinda of plain to me. It s just impressive how much filling they give you. It s great at its price point but flavor wise was just ok. Maybe it needed more seasoning  I got bored of it pretty quickly. Definitely get this to share since the portion was so big. My friends enjoyed their meal. The soul was hearty and came loaded with toppings. A pretty good place to share some hangover breakfast tacos with friends

Juan in a million is like a place you have to try for some real cheap breakfast Mexican tacos. They are famous for this one massive plate of scrambled eggs  potatoes  bacon with tortillas. I got that and 2 Barbacoa tacos and shared with a friend. We put some of the barbacoa meat in the tortilla with the egg potato bacon mix and it was amazing. Made like 5 to 6 tacos. They also give chips and salsa which was good too. It was so filling  it kept us full for a long time.  There is parking at the back of the restaurant and lots of seating in the resturant
One of the few restaurants open for dine in Memorial Weekend 2020.  Great brunch place

This place is an Austin classic  The portion size is huge  I ordered two tortillas on the side when I should have ordered three tortillas instead. The Don Juan taco grande was around  6.25 but like one of their tacos was like 4 tacos for me. My friends and I had to Togo the rest home. It had potatoes  eggs  bacon  and cheese. Next time I would just split a plate with someone. Their salsa is spicyyyyy but that s how I like it. I love this place   Follow me on insta  eatwithlilz   eatwithlilz

Decided to give this place a try after reading some of these raging reviews. Do not be fooled.   Austin has so many great authentic Mexican eateries - this is not one of them.   The  complimentary  chips and salsa taste like something I can get from the grocery store. Neither the flour or corn tortillas are freshly made.   I ordered the Huevos Rancheros off the breakfast menu. The salsa was cold and the potatoes are probably frozen-bought.   Decided to give this review 3 stars because the service was pretty great.  I won t be coming back to Juan in a Million.

Don Juan plate is big enough for two to share - just add 5 tortillas. Be sure to split the last one as it s the tortilla that takes on the flavor of the big ol pile of filling. Most people get one to themselves to take more home.  Friendly service and an East Austin landmark. Locals frequent here.

Tex Mex breakfast  I never even thought of having breakfast tacos until i heard of this joint. we came early so there was no wait  Free chips and spicyyy salsa while you wait don juan el grande taco  they sure do have a tasty mixture of meat and potatoes. It seemed more like a breakfastplate than a taco  this thing is huge  You really could share with someone else migas taco with cheese  more like a breakfast taco to me  i liked the egg mixture  Their flour tortillas are huge so this taco alone was enough for me  NOTE  they drop the check at your table but you pay at the front register

I ve been coming here for more than 20 years. Not as much lately as I used to but I did go this morning and it was wonderful  To the friendly staff and the owner  applause  applause .  You made another satisfying start to my day

This place is honestly the best. The staff is super friendly  and on the off chance that you meet Juan himself  be sure to give him a good hard handshake   But he ll probably beat you to it   The Don Juan is a humongous taco - it s basically a burrito filling inside of a taco tortilla  and it is SO good. I know it looks like a mess in my pictures  but it s god potatoes  bacon  cheese  and some other great stuff my mind can t even process because it s busy sending me orders to keep eating. What my friends and I like to do is order the Don Juan and some tortillas on the side  then split the filling between the extra tortillas. One Don Juan comes out to 4-5 tacos if you do it right.  Comes with tortilla chips and salsa. Beware of the salsa if you re not great with spicy food.

An Austin tradition   A quick and easy tex-mex breakfast for your daily Austinite or traveling tourist in the East Austin area.  Come for the Don Juan to get the best value for your morning afternoon. Make sure to get a couple extra tortillas for your mountain of eggs  potatoes  and cheese. Complimentary chips and salsa is spicy   Staff is friendly and space is homey. Take a scooter to see other parts of East Austin.

Why haven t I eaten here before   That s what I asked myself after having brunch at Juan in a Million last week. When I walked in  I was greeted by a gentleman  maybe Juan    and he was so friendly and welcoming. My friends had a table on the patio so he showed me the way.   Everything on the menu sounded so good. I decided to do the con queso breakfast  eggs  carne guisada  refried bean  potatoes  two flour tortillas . I was feeling gluttonous so I added a side of bacon lol. It was sooooo good  The portions are generous and it held me over for most of the day. I love a good Tex Mex breakfast.   We tried the tres leches cake. The cake itself was good  the icing was okay. It would have been fine without the icing because the cake was moist  the milk dripped out when we dug our fork into it .   Parking wasn t an issue  but it was a Monday afternoon. I imagine it could be difficult on weekends. I can t believe it s taken me so long to eat at Juan in a Million. It s one of those Austin staples that I hope never goes away  It reminds me of the Austin I grew up in.

I really wanted to like this place but the food was So Disappointing  We had the Go-to Juan Taco- although the taco itself looked awesome it was very bland. The eggs and the papas had no taste. It s so hard to get those two simple things wrong. I worry they re just trying to run a fast production  get you in and out  that the food is suffering. Don t get me wrong I appreciate a business that has operations down to a T  but you should never sacrifice quality. Coffee tasted as if the grounds were used for multiple carafes. Beans were the only thing that had good flavor.

An Austin Staple   If you looking for the best bang for your buck  Don Juan plate  is the way to go. With the amount of tacos you can make with it  it s worth the price.   I love how they give you complimentary chips and salsa. The tortilla chips are very fresh. It came out warm and crispy. The salsa is deliciously spicy. If you can t handle the heat  their guacamole is definitely worth.   The staffs are very hospitable. Although the restaurant looks packed and looks like they have a long wait  stick around because they seat you pretty fast. Worth the wait

The food was AMAZING    First off the service was superb  our waitress was on top of it  She was very efficient  and friendly. We were given salsa and chips to start  and the salsa was SO good  I ordered the breakfast tacos potato egg  and added cheese  my boyfriend had the con queso breakfast. They were both great and served to us within 5 minutes of ordering. All the ingredients were fresh and at perfect temperature. If you re ever in Austin and looking for an authentic Mexican restaurant stop by this place. It is a hidden gem.

Lunch on a weekday. Fajitas and tacos.   Service was fast. Greeted immediately  sat and drinks served within minutes. Everyone was friendly. Small inside but it wasn t too crowded at 11am. Chips and spicy salsa served quickly and order promptly taken.   As far as customer service  this place is top notch. No complaints about that  Food was okay. I expected more since I ve heard so many good things and I m probably unfairly comparing it to what I m used to getting in S Texas. My fajitas did not come out on a hot comal. They just came plated. Flavor was okay. Husband s tacos were very good. Food was hot  amp  fresh. Prices were a bit higher than I m used to. Expect  10  each.   Overall  I may go back to try breakfast just because the customer service was great. I want to like this place

This place lived up to the hype    So delicious.  We stopped in this morning and ordered the Don Juan with four extra tortillas  it comes with only one  and it was more than enough for to share. We loved that the salsa was spicy and it was a great addition to the tacos as well.   I ve been to a number of breakfast taco places around town lately  but none have seasoned their food as well as Juan in a Million. The eggs were fluffy  it was savory from the bacon  and the potatoes were hearty and filling. The extra tortillas were just enough -- when the plate came  I was worried it wouldn t be enough food  but it was perfect.   Service was a bit lacking absent even though it wasn t super busy  but it was no big deal. I ll be back soon to try the horchata  Super affordable  delicious  and we love supporting local businesses

This is THE Tex Mex we were looking for when we were visiting Austin. Super authentic  affordable  and flavorful Mexican food. We started with chips salsa  and queso. Beware the salsa is spicy  But the queso might have been the best we ve ever had  and we eat a lot of queso . Nothing like how it s made in Florida. I got two chalupas and added ground beef and quac. The other person I was with ordered the Carne Guisada  which was immediately devoured. This place has a long history - open since 1980. Definitely a place to grab some good  hearty Mexican food

This place was full of amazing food and hospitality. My friends and I were leaving Austin when we tried it out and let s just say that I regret that we didn t go there on out first day visiting. Everyone was so nice and treated customers like family. What stood out to me the most was Juan walking around and checking on his guests. That says a lot about an owner. The cashier greeted with the most welcoming smile and asked how was the food afterwards. I plan to visit Austin again and this restaurant will definitely be on my list.

This was recommended by a friend  and WOW was the food delicious  Our group enjoyed menudo  caldo de res  Don Juan el taco grande  Machacado con huevo AND topped it all of with  1.50 mimosas since it was Sunday  Will definitely go back next time we re in Austin
Back to 5 stars.  Get the El Taco Grande and ask for chorizo instead of sausage. Amazing

I m from the valley  5 hours south of Austin by the border. So my standards are very high when it comes to Mexican food. This place hit all the right spots  The barbacoa was clean and the serving was big and they were even kind enough to serve my menudo with ONLY hominy after asking because I don t really care for the meat that menudo comes with  personal preference . 10 10

This is one of our favorite places to get brunch  The Don Juan is one of the best breakfast tacos out there in Austin  and it s legendary for a reason. It is stuffed with eggs  potatoes  cheese  bacon  all wrapped in a warm flour tortilla. The salsa is the perfect amount of spiciness to top onto the taco. Ordering extra tortillas is recommended for all the scraps that fall off too. The kitchen is always very efficient and we never have to wait long for food. Even though the line looks long on weekends  things move quickly.  Definitely try this place when you are visiting Austin and want to try a spot that does breakfast tacos the right way.

This place is really good   The service is excellent and food is good     Authentic home made food except the tortilla  felt like store bought . Our group had breakfast items  lunch items as well as dinner items  yes they close   3 pm but do serve dinner items .  Was able to meet Mr. Juan when we were leaving.

While visiting Austin  I m happy that I had the opportunity to visit this place. The chips and salsa are amazing  Beware  the salsa is spicy but worth the burn  I ordered chicken flautas and they were absolutely delicious

When I told my boyfriend that I wanted to visit Austin. He agreed under the one condition that we try Juan In A Million. That might be one of the best ideas he s ever had.  When we got there at 12 10 pm on a Sunday and there were a lot of people waiting outside. Don t be confused by the line that is formed because there is no line. Just walk in and put your name down and they ll call you in. When we came in  the owner  I think  informed us that the wait will be around 15 minutes. Really not bad for a Sunday afternoon   We were seated in the covered area outside. Thank god they have fans out there  The waitress was very nice and fast-paced. My boyfriend got the Don Juan taco and I got the Con Queso Breakfast Plate. The Don Juan really is as huge as they say  It was bigger than the plate  Our waitress recommended for my boyfriend to order extra tortillas and he was glad he did because he got 3 tacos out of that plate. My Con Queso Breakfast was good  but nothing too exciting. It was a mix of eggs  beans  carne guisada  and lots of Queso. The menu labeled it as one of the favorites so I tried it out. It was good  but I kinda wish I got something else.  We also ordered a side of Queso to eat with the chips and that was delicious as well. Their complimentary salsa was great but super spicy  I eat tons of spice and even I thought it was hot. Oh and get the lemonade  It s super refreshing for a sunny day   Overall  we were happy with the experience and we will be back the next time we re in Austin. The service  food  and atmosphere was great and we were satisfied with our trip.  Get the Don Juan taco for sure  cause it truly is JUAN IN A MILLION.

Not impressed. Don t waste your time in line or your money for bellow average food. Service was OK. Hot sauce was good but the migas and Don Juan were cold  over cooked  disappointing and not worth the price. After 32 years we will not return.

In the 1960s  Juan In A Million would be basic. In millennial obsessed hipster East Austin  it s a legend. Its fluorescent light is now the subject of millions of Instagram photos  which I fell prey.  It s a diner with no thrills....at all. You sit in old  dirty booths  but people love it. The moment you sit down  one of the servers quickly comes to start the process of moving you in and out.   Minutes later I was eating a plate of machacado con huevo. Each piece of this dish was slopped onto the plate  but together it was a decent breakfast. The server kept my mug filled with the worst coffee I had in ATX.  Despite all of this  the experience was one my millennial spirit craved. No thrills  1960s  diner food. I paid up front and left satisfied.

Very bad service. When we ordered we asked for tres leches with our order and the waitress said she would check and never came back only to deliver our food and immediately run off. She never came back again only to just to leave the check on the table say nothing and leave. Very disappointed in this place

This Tex Mex restaurant is not only delicious  but amazing friendly as well. You could feel it the moment you walk in. On the last day of my trip to Austin  my group decided to get breakfast before we checked out of our Airbnb. One of our drivers recommended this place to us because it was near where we stayed and it as an Austin favorite.   Right when we opened the doors to go in  the owner greeted everyone with a smile and handshake. It was an amazing feeling because not too many owners greet all their customers and he was so enthusiastic about it too. We arrived around noon and the place was pretty packed. The menu had your typical Tex Mex dishes but we wanted some breakfast. Two of my friends ordered the Don Juan and I ordered the Migas. The dishes came out pretty quick. All our dishes came with two flour tortillas. The food was awesome and just what we wanted. My eggs were perfectly seasoned and scrambled. The onions and tomatoes were refreshing and provided a balance to the savoriness of the eggs and cheese. The dish also came with a side of refried beans and potatoes. After a few bites I was stuffed but I kept eating because it was so good.   At the end of the meal  everyone was in food coma. We had smiles on our faces even though we were all uncomfortably stuffed. This is a great spot if you love breakfast and Mexican food.

Stumbled upon Juan In A Million because we saw the SUPER long line outside of it. Thank goodness because this place is great    The tables turnover pretty quickly so we didn t wait more than 5 mins  and we quickly just ordered whatever was recommended sounded good. We ordered the Don Juan Breakfast Taco which is HUGE. It can easily feed 2 people. I need to figure out how they make it because it is that good. We also got a barbacoa taco and it was SOOO flavorful and delicious. They were super generous in their meat portion too.   I wish I had more time in Austin to go back while I was there  but until next time

It just depends on what you re looking for in Juan in a Million. If you re looking for authentic Mexican food  this is probably not high in your standards. However  this place won me over with the cheap prices and vibes.   We came here for Saturday brunch and was met with a 20-minute wait which went by really fast. We got lucky and was able to sit in the main restaurant in the corner booth. The servers were all busy but were very attentive. We proceeded to fill our stomachs with the unnecessary chips and salsa. The heat of the salsa took me off guard. My mouth was on fire but in a good way    4 5  QUESO  Not sure how much it was but it came in a small bowl. The salsa came in a bigger bowl. It had a very buttery taste. My friend loved it so much she said she would bathe in it.   4 5   DON JUAN EL TACO GRANDE  Definitely a sharing portion but I conquered it all by myself. I opted to not get extra tortillas. I just ate it with a fork.    You have to pour the salsa and queso over this and just eat it. It s pretty amazing     5 5  HORCHATA  I highly recommend  It was the best horchata I ve ever had. For only  2 it came in a cup bigger than my water. I drank as much as I could and still had a full cup to go. I would probably get this every time I go to Juan in a Million.   My friend said her Rib Steak Breakfast was mediocre and my other friend had the barbacoa taco and wasn t a fan. Not sure how they would rate this place but for me it was a 5 out of 5.

The owner came over and personally greeted me while I was admiring the picture of him with Adam Richman. He cares about the customers  best service you could ask for. Also  the breakfast taco special was soo good   Great experience
Great food  specially breakfast tacos   great portions and some of the fairest prices in town. Plus Don Juan is always there with the biggest smile on his face and always makes you feel like family

When first arrived to Austin  we had to stop at Juan in a Million for their famous breakfast   We had a big party and they accommodated us and took really good care of our table   I had the following   DON JUAN EL TACO GRANDE - A secret combination of potato  egg  bacon and cheese in a deliciously hot tortilla - this is a huge portion   So come hungry  because this deliciously well seasoned dish will fill you up   Great place to fuel up for a breakfast

This place really impressed me  so much my friends and I went three times.  Each time the food was awesome  the staff were friendly and attentive.     My favorite part is the owner stands at the front and greets everyone with a solid handshake and a hug.  He is upbeat  super friendly  and will make your shitty day immediately better.  His attitude is infectious.     I tried three different meals that were all delicious.   My friends all stayed with the same meal and said each time was Super good.    This place is an absolute must try when you are in Austin.

Pretty darn good  Food was yummy and horchata was huge. I give it four stars for what it is. This is not a brunch spot and it s not trying to be. Beer and margs are available but wouldn t drink those with breakfast.   We ordered the Don Juan and it created about 3 tacos so keep that in mind. Order it with extra tortillas.   The guac was yummy and simple. Salsa is hot  Prices are low. Horchata was only  2.25 for a massive glass    My brother got the Con Queso meal and ate the entire thing. Overall  we only waited 20 mins on a Saturday at 11 30am.  If you are looking for cheap and yummy authentic Mexican breakfast food  hit up Juan in a Million.

I really enjoyed my meal here. I had the beef fajita plate. Everything was seasoned to perfection. The salsa is super spicy....great for me because I love spicy food. I got here at about 11 am on a Saturday. There was about a 20 minute wait but we ll worth it. The service was not great but they were very busy.

Great place for quality tex-mex at reasonable prices.
