On this particular visit I got breakfast tacos which felt very ample in size  super cheesy  and packed with fillings such as eggs and cheese  potato egg and cheese  and a chorizo variety. Have been for lunch before in the past and it was good as well. As soon as you sit down you get chips and salsa. Service is pretty quick no matter when you go.

One of my favorite places on earth  Juan In A Million is in the Holly neighborhood  about 1.7 miles from downtown Austin. There are a few parking options out front on Cesar Chavez  and they have a lot at the back. Credit cards are accepted.   Food  You can t go wrong with much here. Tacos and the huevos rancheros are what we typically order. The ranchero sauce has a little heat to it  refried beans are perfectly refried      Service  Attentive  and drinks get refilled often. Food comes out quickly  even when they are packed.   Cost  Three tacos  a huevos rancheros with a side of bacon  two sweet teas ran us  32 after tax.   Overall  A must try when in Austin. Weekend mornings are busier  but the line moves quickly.

The wait is worth the food and the service. We maybe had 3 different waitresses. They were all friendly and fast. I went for breakfast  and it which was great. They seem to have an overall fantastic menu
Nothing better than a GIANT breakfast taco. Tip for new costumers  their salsa is really good but each bite comes with a KICK
So freaking good and so affordable  Cute patio seating  Get there early to beat the crowd.

I love the authenticity of this place  It s also deceivingly big inside  There are sooo many seating options inside and even an outdoor covered area  This place is on the Austin Bucket List and after living here for 4 years  I finally decided to try it.   Pros   - Pretty cheap  you can get a huge cup of Horchata for  2.50. And it s super refreshing and delicious  - Endless amount of delicious chips and salsa that actually has a kick to it - HUGE portions  I ordered the Don Juan Taco - It s basically eggs  potato  bacon  and hella cheese served on top of a tortilla. You need about 4 tortillas to finish it all.  ask for extra tortillas  - I asked for salsa  and they gave me some green salsa that was super delicious  ask for it if you like spice - Every employee was super friendly and helpful  Cons   - You have to pay your ticket at the register which took longer than the wait to get a table - This was kind of inconvenient - There are many seating options  but if you sit in the entrance near the door  you are pretty crammed in there and you have people hovering over you waiting in line at the register so that can get annoying too  Overall  this place is a gem and everyone loves it for a reason
So much food  So good. The salsa was super hot tho  Beware  1.50 mimosa on Sunday  Yum yum

I cannot for the life of me understand how a Mexican restaurant like this one can have 4 stars.   First off- how can you claim you with a straight face to make your tortillas fresh and homemade on the premises and turn around and serve crappy store bought chips AND taco shells   Shameful.  The retried beans were without flavor at all- unless you consider a burnt smoke taste to be a flavoring.  The guacamole lacked any salt or flavor  disappointing and bland.  My tacos actually had American cheese on them  it should be real cheese.   I was hoping for a tasty homemade experience here at Juan s but was instead was treated to lunch at the Tia s house that the whole familia knows can t cook.

After hearing so many things about Juan in a Million  my boyfriend and I had to try it out for ourselves.   We showed up at about 9am on Labor Day  a Monday  and there was not parking left on the street or in their lot. We found some street parking a little far  on a not so good looking street. Once we got inside there was no wait  we were seated right away and taken care of by a very friendly waitress.  We got free chips and salsa before our meal. The salsa had great flavor but was WAY to spicy for both of us  and we can usually handle any salsas .  My boyfriend and I both ordered the Con Queso Breakfast  mine without meat . We both agreed it was delicious and enjoyed most of our plates.  We did enjoy our food but would keep driving by if we saw the normal crowd waiting outside.
The Don Juan was delicious  We ordered takeout from inside and ate it at home. The inside was cute and employees were very nice

Juan in a Million has it right with the name as a play on  one in a million.  Truly  this is a special place. Be careful with this establishment because the rare combination of deliciousness  affordability  and good service will have you addicted after the first crunch of a tortilla chip.  Juan in a Million boasts a humble  homey interior which represents the treatment and feelings you will get from eating there  loving  Mexican home cooked goodness. I will go to no other place for tacos after discovering Juan in a Million. The tortilla chips are tasty  warm  and perfectly crunchy. Pair them with the always perfectly done guacamole  or with the standard hot sauce if you re not looking to splurge on some fancy guac.  Order a taco and feel a sense of happiness when the generous portion sizes match the generous taste. The simple shredded chicken taco boasts the most flavorful and voluptuous chicken portion. I personally also love the Machacado. My husband always goes for the legendary Don Juan  which is a divine combination of bacon  potato  egg  and cheese on a taco.  This place is friendly to vegans as well. Just not friendly to dogs. Bring your vegan friends but don t bring your friends who take their dogs everywhere. Although they have an indoor patio  no dogs are allowed.  There is nothing that I d change about Juan in a Million. Thus  I give 5 stars for this perfect establishment.

Just moved to ATX and we knew that Juan in a Million was going to be our first stop  We loved the Don Juan  I added pico  my mother in law added salsa and my husband ate it as is for the perfect breakfast for everyone  Can t wait to go back   We got it to go  thank you to those working and keeping us all going during the pandemic   frontlines

Delicious  hole-in-the-wall   grandma s cooking  type of place.   EVERYTHING IS TO DIE FOR   I will admit I came because it was on Man Vs. Food way back in the day--it did not disappoint   Everyone in your party will find something to enjoy from their menu.  INSANELY crowded at times  but well worth the wait.

This place gives you the best bang for your buck. Everything is extremely cheap and it s all really delicious. All the food tastes fresh and the service is really quick.  The Don Juan breakfast taco is probably their best deal. For around  6  you get a giant serving of eggs  bacon  potatoes  and cheese  plus 3 tortillas to eat it all with. It is super filling and if you eat one  you will probably be full until dinner.   If you want something a bit more authentic  they also have Mexican options. If you want to try something different  their machacado is eggs scrambled with dried beef  onions  tomatoes  and peppers and it is delicious. If you want something simple  try the nopalitos  scrambled eggs with cactus strips. If you don t feel like eggs  their barbacoa is delicious. And of course if you come here  you have to get the horchata  a sweet cinnamon drink  to wash all of the food down.
This place is just a go to spot for some Mexican food. Oh man the food was amazing. Each bite was a bite with incredible flavor. This place is a must visit in the ATX. Let s just say it HITS

After 8 years away from Austin  I am glad to see Juan In A Million has stayed consistently delicious. Coming into this place brings me back to my college years of being able to get delicious and huge tacos as a great place. The breakfast tacos are still huge  location is still the same  And most importantly  Juan is still there with a smile. The breakfast tacos are huge  enough to share between two girls. Definitely a place to go every time I visit

Simply  WOW      We were heading to the airport and decided it would be best to eat before we hit the airport as last time we ate there we saw a roach walking across the food at the bbq place  yuck    Juan s is maybe a 10-12 min drive to from the airport.  Anyway  this place looks like it could be a  shit hole  but I swear  it isn t   The food is f n on point   I m not much for eggs but good lord  the Don Juan El Taco Grande was amazing    I was going to order some beef tacos but at the last minute decided I d try what they are famous for.  It was the perfect amount of cheese  potato  egg and bacon.  I added guacamole and that was like the icing on the cake     You add a little of their fresh made hot sauce that comes with the chips and you will be one happy camper   I ordered the extra tortillas but truly they were not necessary.  I couldn t even eat the one it came with.  The taco is huge     Seriously  the balance of each item in this  taco  is perfect.  It s not overly eggy or bacony  yeah  it s a word in our home .  My husband who isn t a huge fan of Mexican food like I am even said his chicken quesadilla was awesome.  Joanna was out waitress and couldn t be any friendlier.  Everyone from the time we walked in till we walked out was friendly.  Next trip to Austin  we will stop by Juan s as soon as we land

Our son brought us here and what a diamond in the ruff. If your in a hurry this is not the place. Lots of folks waiting to taste this delicious Mexican food. The owner shook our  hands as soon as we walked in to be seated. We had the queso breakfast and chorizo breakfast. Yummy we will be back next time we are on the area

My son and I visited the last time I was in town and we experienced the Don Juan  Wow. The secret recipe is super duper. I brought my wife this time around and we expanded our horizons with the chicken entire and menudo. Breakfast lunch and dinner entrees are all hits. There is a good chance we will return before we roll out of town tomorrow.

This places rocks and I would put it in one of the best breakfasts I ve ever had  Service was great  portions were huge  great Tex mex  and then...We let Juan. This guy is so genuine and kind and made our time even more enjoyable. He knows how to treat people and I really think they ve nailed down how to make people feel when they come into your restaurant. Hope this place feels as good as we did

I ve been coming here since I was a kid  amp  it s still my favorite breakfast taco in town. Even their cheese is phenomenal. The call ahead ordering is always so easy  amp  convenient when I don t have the time or patience to wait in the  well deserved  line.
Good service  good chips and salsa. Breakfast tacos were just okay and I had expected better flavor. Price was very inexpensive.

I have been to this place two times and sadly both times was a disappointment. I order a guacamole taco and a carne guisada taco. The taco s came without any salsa  and the tortillas were out of the fridge. I don t mean room temperature  I mean they were COLD as when you take them out of the fridge. Also  do not expect any side like lettuce or pico to add to your taco. That is a separate order.  Their enchiladas are made with yellow cheese  which is ok for Tex-Mex  but I did not expect it form this restaurant since it doesn t say they are Tex-Mex. I don t mind eating Tex-Mex  but not went I am not expecting it.

The best breakfast tacos I ve ever had  I was in Austin for the weekend and had these for breakfast both mornings we were here. Went for El taco Grande the first morning and diversified with some of the other breakfast tacos the second day  including the machacado  migos  and chorizo with potato. All were delicious  but I have to say I preferred the variety and flavors of the smaller breakfast tacos in contrast to the grande which potato  egg  bacon  and cheese. The Grande is a fork and knife taco that s about the size of a burrito and largely tastes of cheese  potato and bacon. My favorite were the migos  which had depth from the eggs  which had just the right amount of browning  and the onion. The machacado was a little juicier  probably because there are no chips like in he migos to soak up the extra moisture  with tomatoes and savory strings of beef throughout.  This place is a huge contrast to the other restaurant we went to for dinner  the Odd duck. One is old and the other is new. One features food that is trustworthy and classic  while the other capriciously plays with what is trendy and seasonal. One you can show up to in the clothes you rolled out of bed with  while the other requires you to make yourself presentable to others in the restaurant.  I ll say this in my review of the Odd duck as well  but for me  Juan in a million is the kind of restaurant I prefer. The waitresses remembered us from the day before and were super friendly  the food tasted like a warm hug  and overall  I just felt cared for. This is a restaurant that understands what it means to feed its customers rather than simply put on a show of culinary prowess. The odd duck in contrast comes across as trendy  pretentious  and indulgent.  I ll take substance over style  any day. A well deserved 5 stars.

Definitely get the Migas if you want cheesy goodness. I think Torchy s is a little better in terms of flavor  but when it comes to eating the Migas  they re pretty comparable.   The Carne Guisada doesn t come with much else besides gravy and meat. It s kind of boring.   Don Juan was pretty huge so be prepared  I think it could fill 3 people s stomachs  It s very potatoey so it s kind of up to you what you want. I prefer a lot of cheese so I d go with the Migas.

Hello Austin   I have been coming to Just In a million for what seems my whole life. Back in the days I use to come as a kid with my parents and share a Don Juan taco with my mother. Now we try to go every opportunity we can since I live in San Antonio now.  We always get a Don Juan taco and a Sweet Tea. With extra tortillas. Always friendly staff  always accommodating. Nothing bad to say.. A true Austin gem.

They could spit in my food and I ll still give them 5 stars. The owner gives the crispest handshake in the nation and treats you like royalty. The food could have very well been terrible but it didn t matter if it was because the service is so good. To correct the last statement  the food was amazing and I haven t been this excited about anything since I found out IPhones don t get viruses.

Just get one taco  Holy Hell you get a ton of food  very fast and very friendly service. This place would easily be 5 stars if they had homemade tortillas. Menudo was really good as well  if you are in Austin it s definitely worth it

Visiting Austin and was told that Juan in a Million is a must   The portions here are huge. They even have a eating contest for the most Don Juan  the signature taco dish.  I was full from eating half of one Don Juan.  The chips and salsa were really good  watch out for the spice   This place is great for families  breakfast  lunch  and dinner.  Friendly atmosphere.  It s an Austin staple

You know we had to try this place if it was featured on Man vs. Food  This was our second time having brunch here while in Austin and it was just as good as the first   Parking isn t that great  but the food makes the circle around worth it  Do what we did and drop the passenger off in the front to put your names down so by the time one of you finds a spot  the table will be ready    there may be a line when you get there  but their fast service makes the line go by so quick. We had a party of 7 the second time around and it only took us 20 minutes to get seated.  His - the Don Juan which is the dish featured on Man vs. Food and the challenge was to eat 8 Don Juan  tacos   I put quotes around tacos because you can get at least 3 decent sized breakfast tacos from one Don Juan plate and could essentially make 2 chipotle sized burritos  Not only is this plate massive and flavorful but it s crazy cheap  Adding the spicy salsa that they serve with the chips creates the perfect flavor profile for this meal.  Hers - the Con Queso Breakfast with 2 over-medium eggs. Not your typical Tex Mex breakfast and and definitely not as massive as the Don Juan but still met my breakfast needs  Queso just makes every food taste great  The carne guisada was very tender and had the same consistency as a pot roast. The breakfast potatoes were great. If you can get the potatoes  carne guisada  egg  and queso all on your fork  you ll have the perfect bite   If you re looking for an inexpensive place in Austin to have a tasty home cooked Tex Mex breakfast  this is the spot  You won t regret it
Excellent food  Came from California to try this place out and it was so worth it.  The food tasted like my moms home cooked meals.  The service was excellent as well.
Tortillas are definitely not made daily. They taste like the ones at taco cabana. Food was horrible. Huevos rancheros sauce was like store bought picante sauce. No  just no

This is my second time visiting here. First time was 5 years ago. I remember the portions being huge and they didn t disappoint. For three people we should have ordered 2 meals  maybe even only 1   Our eggs  bacon  cheese  potato mixture came out a little cold but the tortillas were super hot. It would have been nice if the food was a little warmer but at less than  6 for a mountain of food  who can really complain. Chips and salsa are served at all times  even in the morning.   Get here before 10am if you don t want to wait for a table.  Juan in a million is a great place for a cheap breakfast  or brunch  they do serve alcohol .

What s not to love about a place with a pun-ny name   My friend and I stumbled across Juan in a Million Restaurant while staying at an AirBnB nearby in East Austin. We were looking for a good spot to grab breakfast before hitting the road. With so many reviews  we had to give it a try.   There was a steady flow of customers but plenty of seating  so we were seated right away. The service is fast and the food comes out quick and piping hot. I ordered the chorizo con Huevos and my friend got the Huevos Rancheros. We both absolutely loved our dishes. The portions are huge and the prices are cheap. I also ordered a glass of Horchata - sweet  delicious  and refreshing. It was literally the largest glass of Horchata I had ever seen in my entire life.   Their breakfast tacos looked amazing as well - we simply just didn t have room for more food.

I don t know who Juan is  but I know he can make one hell of a breakfast burrito. Work brought these in and I was a bit suspect. Boy was I wrong  these are some of the best burritos I have had.   Cheers
This cute little hidden gem  The wait was about 20 minutes but so worth it. Socially distanced with covid.  Tacos are huge  Salsa is hot  Coffee was delicious. Definitely recommend

First of all  I love the name of this place. Their food is actually pretty damn good. My wife and I shared a Don Juan El Taco Grande which is a  secret combination of potato  egg  bacon and cheese in a deliciously hot tortilla. We also got a small Menudo. The Don Juan El Taco Grande would ve been enough for both of us. It was so hearty and filling its the perfect hangover and sober food. The Menudo was great as well. If I am ever back in Austin  this will be my first stop for sure.

We were on the hunt for the best migas in Austin  we decided to try Jaun s. We were seated immediately  our server greeted as soon as we sat down. We ordered the migas and burritos and washed them down with lots of mimosas  Delicious    And the owner was there handing out hugs as you paid  so sweet  Don t let the neighborhood or the bars on the windows detour you from stopping in the delish little dive.

I ve heard of Juan in a Million from a friend  being kinda new to Austin  I know I had to try this place  So on a very gloomy Saturday morning  my friend and I made our way to Juan in a Million. My friend ordered a refried bean and egg taco  while I ordered the Don Juan Grande. First  their refried bean was great  It was the right kind of mushy and it went perfectly with their egg and cheese. The tortilla was fresh and hand made   The Don Juan Grande was enough food for two people I recommend getting more tortilla to share with someone else. The meal also came with chips and salsa. The chips we had were kinda stale but the salsa was great  spicest salsa I have ever had
Honestly not worth an hour wait. I was disappointed to see the breakfast tacos on flour tortillas. Flavors of everything were OK... but nothing special. I can make these breakfast tacos at home..

Man this place is busy. We decided to try because who doesn t love a good breakfast taco  Especially one that is so highly rated. I will say although they were busy the service never lagged. I was able to try a couple of breakfast tacos and all were good. They weren t the best i ever jad in my life but they were good. I really enjoyed the manager coming around asking us about our visit. I would say try this place. Don t let the lines scare ya its worth a shot...
Fabulous food fast and more importantly very friendly great service. I can t believe I waited so long to try them

Juan in a Million is such a great place for a filling and tasty breakfast.  The place is always busy and there is always someone to greet you.  Quick service and great food.  I ve always gotten the Don Juan and never disappointed.   Be ready for a food coma after that plate.

Solid family run Mexican joint near East Sixth. Large venue that is perfect for breakfast or lunch  breakfast tacos  enchiladas  etc . We came here twice on our recent trip to Austin and enjoyed it. Chips  amp  spicy salsa for the table. The chicken enchiladas were delicious  as was the combo breakfast taco that has bacon  egg  and cheese. Reasonably priced. Will definitely return

Heard to try this place out as a true Austin landmark.  Got to the location and was able to find a parking spot in the back.  There are limited number of spots that they share with another shopping center  but there are spots on the street too.  Looked like there was a long line  but hostess said less than 7 minutes.  Within 5 minutes we were seated in a room with a wide range of people.  Even though it was crowded  it didn t feel that way.  Food - My wife got the Don Juan- El Taco Grande and I got the CON QUESO BREAKFAST.  The breakfast plate was a good combination and the wife enjoyed the queso with their flavorful chips  but I enjoyed the chips with their spicy salsa that burns after 4-5 chips in and stays with you while you wait for your food.  Highly recommend the salsa for the Don Juan because it does not have much flavor.  They should have an option to add a meat to this dish  but for less than  6 and their homemade salsa  it is enough to feed 2 people with the extra tortillas.  Service - Spot on waitress that filled our waters  which is good due to the spicy salsa.  Feels like a tight space  but not bad inside.  Cashier and hostess both were nice and courteous.    Overall - Highly recommended place to get some good East Austin Mexican food to soak up a night on 6th Street.

During my short trip in Austin this was on my list  amp  we saved for the last day man it did not disappoint  Staff was great even during a busy lunch hour the owner greeted me so friendly  amp  the food is amazing  my party of four ordered different plates  amp  all were good  Chips  amp  salsa were delicious  The only thing I regret was not going sooner during my trip so I can eat another meal here

I ordered the Don Juan at the suggestion of my cousin who said it was enough food for us to split.  Well  I didn t believe her so I ordered my own plate and good gawd  this is a LOT of FOOD    It come s with two tortillas but it s so much food that you may have to request extra tortillas if you want to eat it  taco style .  The food tasted OK  but I was very surprised at the temperature of the food only being luke warm.  We arrived well after the brunch crowd had cleared out and had no wait getting a table so I was surprised that the food didn t come out piping hot seeing how they weren t busy  but what that tells me is that it was not cooked to order  they just had it sitting around in mass quantities to put on a plate when ordered.   IF  I were to go back to this place  I would try something different and I would ask ahead if the food is made to order and explain the reason for my question. The chips and hot sauce are OK.

I was very excited to come here after recognizing it from tv. I decided to make it our first stop right after our early flight  since it seemed to be on the way leaving the airport.  Only about 15 min from airport  if you re wondering  And close to downtown.    At 11 30 on Friday  we were sat immediately. But not before being greeted by the MAN. I had actually totally forgotten about his tradition of greeting everyone at the door  but as soon as I saw his smiling face I remembered. It was everything.   Our server was very quick and polite  like the others I observed. You are not getting overly familiar service  with the staff asking how your day was and if you ve ever been there before. They re getting your drinks  your order  and delivering your food. But they re doing it quickly and with a smile.   The food  I knew they were famous for breakfast tacos and that they served breakfast all day. So I was really surprised that no one around us ordered them  Made me second guess our choice  but I think they were all locals and had already had them.  My guy ordered the famous Don Juan. You ve probably already read the reviews and seen the pictures. It s really that good. I went rogue last min and got the chorizo con huevos plate. Came with potatoes and refried beans and tortillas. Really good  My favorite style  classic  and exactly what I was looking for. The only star I docked is because it didn t come out hot. His Don Juan was amazing. But my surprise fav taco was actually his last min addition of a carne guisado. It was kind of like Mexican stewed beef - super tender and in a bit of gravy. Amazing. Next time I would totally get the breakfast platter that had that as the protein.   Lots of seating inside so wait shouldn t be a problem. Decent amount of parking but would def be an issue during busy times.   Highly recommend

I was in Austin for one day and was recommended to check this place out  Maybe it was hyped up to much but the breakfast tacos were just okay and the service was unfortunately lacking. They were packed though  so my experience could have been an outlier.

This is my second time here and the last time it was crazy packed  the line was wrapped around the building I m not sure if they expanded it but we had no wait this time around.   We came for their breakfast and I ordered huevos with a side of nopales  cactus  and the hubby ordered the Don Juan El Taco Grande. My food was good  a little bland and definitely need some salt. I was fine with that because I like to add my own salt. The hubby s food was so huge  you can order more tortilla and maybe feed 2-3 more people. His was really good.   The service is great  very attentive and always checked on us. The prices are also very reasonable and a lot of people come here so that says a lot about this place.   PS don t forget to ask for salsa verde. It s more mild than the red one they provide for chips.

Unpretentious  mom-and-pop shop tacos that I would definitely recommend to anyone who s looking for something  austinite . Soft flour tortillas that holds well  with warm savory potatoes and cheese - what more can you ask for from a taco brunch place  There are a lot of variations on the menu - but not all are amazing. They re known for their breakfast plates and their enchiladas  available only after 11 . I appreciate that their prices are constantly reasonable  especially for their portions  one plate feeds two   The only drawback is that it s so noisy and squeezy in there  you enjoy the food more than you can enjoy the company of your peers. One thing to note  lines start getting long once it hits 10am  so if you don t like to wait  definitely be an early bird   Parking is also limited behind their shop

We ve come here a handful of times now and it s always so very fulfilling - both the service and the food are great  the portions are huge  and prices are very good.  We usually get the Don Juan - El Taco Grande as well as the Breakfast Special. We also usually end up leaving with leftovers  But yes the food is very tasty and fresh  nothing is stale or greasy or anything. And the service is always friendly  not just from the waiter but often from the owner.   Be aware it gets very busy on weekends  You ll be fine if you arrive by 9 though. Great horchata as well

10 10 service and delicious breakfast tacos  Shout out to the ladies at the door who provided spectacular service while taking down names for tables  managing takeout orders  and answering calls. When I visited this past weekend  they weren t allowing indoor seating but instead had covered outdoor seating. I placed a to-go order on a Saturday morning and it was ready in 15 minutes. My top 2 tacos are the sausage  amp  egg and bacon  amp  egg. Migas is also a great option if you want to change it up and don t want anything as salty. Two tacos was enough to fill me up. Always an Austin staple

First off this place ruined my plans. I was supposed to try different breakfast taco places in one morning. But I did not realize the Don Juan was so huge. For  6 I was thinking not that much food but it filled my plate.  My only experience with breakfast tacos is taco Bell so I am a newbie to this.  It was very filling  good food  good service  and cheap.  I did not expect a basket of chips but there it was. I did not finish and I was stuffed.

Juan In A Million is a good restaurant. I ordered the Don Juan which was good. You definitely get your bang for your buck cause the portions are really big. You need to get extra tortillas with this dish because the amount of eggs  bacon  potatoes  and cheese you get is way too much for one tortilla. Extra tortillas are 20 cents each though which surprised me since usually I can get more for free. The taste of the dish was average  but it was what I expected so I was satisfied.   Overall the place was good but nothing special.

Heard this spot was top notch in regards to both service as well as food  so had to head over first thing Saturday morning to avoid huge lines. Nonetheless  fairly hefty line around the corner to earn a seat at this spot. We left our name for 5 people and were surprisingly seated in about 15 minutes.  Juan was in the house and gave everyone a firm handshake. Love the enthusiasm. To start off we got free chips and salsa for the table  which they filled up for free later on . Solid starter and the salsa had a good kick. For my main course  ordered the Machacado Con Huevo   9  - a scrambled omelet with dried beef mixed in. Interesting combo of flavors  though the beef was tougher than I expected. Potatoes and beans it came with are your regular fare  fine with hot sauce . Also ordered the Horchata   2   nice cinnamon milky flavor that went well with the chips  not the eggs .  Considering the crowds  the service wasn t too slow. I did find the food satusfying but don t think it s worth waiting in line.

During our trip to Austin I had heard great things about this place so we gave it a try. The breakfast tacos are loaded I got the chorizo  egg and added potatoes it was really good  They provide a green salsa which is spicer then the one given with chips. Service is super fast we were in and out within 30 min to continue are venture through city

Juan in a Million is a great spot in the Riverside area - meals are affordable and great quality. I ve tried the beef tacos and chicken enchiladas - both are a great option  particularly the enchiladas    Pros   - Portions are large  - Prices are low - Lunch specials are especially well priced - Food has great flavor - Staff is kind enough to work with you if you need to make modifications to your meal. Margaritas are well priced.   Cons   - The margarita is just okay in my opinion  though the price is very low which is nice.   5.95 for a margarita  I also wish there was a little more consistency in the way drinks are made - the amount of alcohol that s in each drink seems to vary dramatically between margaritas.   10 10 would recommend you try it out   Would only recommend margaritas if you re in need of a drink

Don t really have anything good to say about the food  especially not the Don Juan. It tastes like someone mixed stuffing with eggs and piles it on an underwhelming tortilla. The chorizo and egg was much better and is what I would probably order if I for some reason went back.

This place had great reviews and we were celebrating my moms birthday and all the locals raves this place. Parking is spotty and spaces are tight even for a small car  to be expected  it s Austin. The wait wasn t too bad but the customer service is what drove me to write this review. We told the waitress to onions in the food  guess what she put onions. Minus a star. The gentleman bringing the drinks forgot my soda  canned by the way  he said...  You drink water then...  minus a star. When the food came the carne guisada was decent and the barbacoa was good but the horrible package tortillas was the worst part of the food. When they dropped of my plates I asked her why are they store bought... she said  that s what we have. I said for a place called  Juan in a million  I would think you would keep it authentic. She rolled her eyes and said ohh well and then walked away. Minus a star. The only part I didn t understand is why we had to sit outside when there was plenty of seating inside in the ac. I guess our skin color didn t allow us to be seated inside cause the ac rooms were filled with white people.   Overall the food was decent  service was horrible and ethics were questionable. Wouldn t eat here again for rubber tortillas and rude staff.

This place was right around the corner from our airbnb so we came by for breakfast before getting started for the day. I m between leaving 3 and 4 stars for this one. The portions are huge and the prices are not  which is awesome  especially as a visitor from LA  The food though is lackluster in my opinion.  I ordered the Don Juan and chicken enchiladas. I was able to make my way through some of the don juan filling and force down one of the enchiladas while it was still warm and saved the rest. The don juan breakfast taco is more than enough if you re looking for a cheap filling meal  but flavor wise  It s nothing special. It s at least 80  potatoes  that might even be a modest assumption   which are cheap by nature  so I feel that it s appropriately priced at just under  7. It tasted pretty good when hot and fresh  but as a leftover  it felt like I was shoving plain potatoes down my throat  and I was a bit drunk where anything would have tasted good. The enchiladas were okay  chile verde sauce  chicken  and cheese  what more could you expect . I appreciated the scoop of sour cream on them. The plate came with plenty of rice and bean filler  so would definitely be super filling as a standalone plate.

We joined some friends here on a Saturday around 1pm and had a 25 min wait. Not bad  for how many people were standing outside. Once inside  we were welcomed by friendly staff  promptly brought our margaritas  could have been a bit more potent  and chips and salsa. We ordered their queso  which was delicious  and their most popular breakfast item  the Don Juan  and oh my goodness is it a lot of food.. But so delicious  We also had migas  would pass next time  the tortilla chips in it weren t that good and it wasn t traditional migas IMHO  and the chorizo y potato taco  also delicious. The real star was the Don Juan  though. So cheesy  eggy  sausage-y  bacon-y  oh that bacon was so good    fluffy  gooey  and flavorful. Can you tell I liked it  I wasn t sure the tortilla or chips were homemade  but I stand corrected from Juan himself who wrote me a message to inform me they are  Thanks Juan

First time in Austin and I was advised I HAD to have breakfast tacos. Breakfast... and tacos  I m there  I ordered the Don Juan with nopalitos and holy moly it was delicious     Staff was extremely attentive and kind  They bring chips that are fresh with a really yummy salsa. The Don Juan had bacon  egg  potato and cheese on a corn tortilla.  I subbed flour  Being from CA I can easily eat 5 tacos so ordering one was a little interesting. IT WAS HUGE  I was only able to eat half. SOOO GOOD. Definitely recommend   Awesome little spot and I will be returning if I come back.

I got to give it to Juan....he had a secret formula and it worked for him. As you walk in Juan the owner is the first person you see and he will greet you with the biggest handshake and hug you will ever get at a restaurant. Once you are seated there is no secret as you will order the famous Don Juan Taco....  I have eaten so many potato  bacon  egg and cheese tacos but this one is the king of them all. Biting into the Don Juan Taco takes you to another realm of food paradise. Now it is not the best decor but you got to give credit where credit is due as he proudly displays all his awards for recognition from all over the food industry. Like I said earlier he must be doing something right.......

Was in Austin for a bachelor party. We took scooters down to Juan in a million with our crew and enjoyed a variety of different dishes. Extremely friendly staff and tasty food. We ordered breakfast tacos and all the breakfast plates. The salsa  was spicy  which is not a restaurant s typical first option. Nonetheless it was very tasty. We also enjoyed the queso and guacamole on the side. Would recommend going back a few times to try the different plates.

The quintessential hungover breakfast taco place  in my opinion . What do I want when I m hungover  One mound of egg  cheese  bacon  and potato please  Juan in a Million delivers this good service time and time again when I come Saturday for brunch.  To be honest  I have yet to try anything else on their menu because all of my friends told me that I would regret not just getting the Don Juan. So I can t speak for the not breakfast tacos part of the menu.  Why is Juan in a Million great  - The quantity of food - Seriously  the quantity of food  - The fillingness of the food  Why is Juan in a Million not so great  - The salsa they provide is not quite good - In my opinion  overly spicy without much salsa flavor. Kinda like sticking your mouth into pepper without the tasty tomato part - The wait time - The service at times is scattered - Parking can be annoying  I think this is a great place if you just want to eat a ton  If you re looking for classic Mexican tacos with better service  there are better places in the taco capital of the South  East Austin.

This is an austin staple. Pure austin style tacos with an old school atmosphere. The tacos here are so bomb. I had the grande taco  pictured below  and believe me it s ALOT OF FOOD. Basically a whole breakfast plate on a tortilla. Speaking of tortillas - was a bit sad they weren t homemade but overall still an amazing taco. I also snagged the barbacoa taco and it was so juicy. Cooked so well. Very happy I came here and will always be returning

Don Juan. El Taco Grande.   How do I describe this meal   The first words that pop into my head are  Massive  Imposing  amp  Delicious    A meal and restaurant that happens to have my namesake has to be good  right   This could ve easily fed my wife and I but I thought I could manage it alone. I was wrong. It s a massive breakfast taco that you ll need at least 2-3 extra tacos to polish off. While we were there in an unassuming restaurant I saw they had a challenge and naturally I wondered if I could do it. Low and behold the challenge was what I had ordered  the record  9  Yeah  won t be breaking that anytime soon. Austin was an amazing experience filled with amazing food and I can t wait to share more plates I had while there.

This place is packed every time I go  That is always a good sign  The ambiance is nothing special or fancy  but the food is great  and that s all that matters  . I usually get breakfast tacos to-go  bc I am not patient enough deal with the crowd  They have great prices and fast service  This past time I got egg with cactus. It was delicious  They are not skimpy with their egg or cactus  my taco was loaded  Their tortillas are fluffy and buttery  the eggs and cactus were seasoned and salted nicely  and the salsa gave them a nice kick  They are only  2 and worth every penny   Whenever we are in Austin we always stop at Juan In A Million

Got the Don Juan taco and my bf got the chicken enchiladas special that comes with iced tea on Mondays   The Don Juan was a bit disappointing  came out cold and kinda one dimensional tasting. Based on the owner s response to another review about it being a little cold  I asked them to heat it up and it tasted a little better.  The chicken enchiladas were pretty yummy. My favorite was the rice that came with it  had a lemony-lime taste to it.   Queso was pretty good - much better than Chipotle  I don t really like the Chipotle queso. Pass on the pico de Gallo though  too much cilantro.  All in all  decent food and good service.

We had came here on a Thursday at 2pm thinking that it would be pretty dead since it was about to close and it was a weekday. To my pleasant surprise  the place was packed. Right when you sit down you get served a bowl of tortilla chips and some spicy salsa. I had ordered the beef fajitas which was very tasty and came with rice beans and 2 flour and corn tortillas. My partner had ordered the chicken enchiladas. The chicken enchiladas was very hearty but a bit heavy for my taste. The beef fajitas was just perfect for my tastes. The beef was season well and it was fun preparing your own tacos. The best part of this place is that the prices are very reasonable for the amount of food you get. Definitely would come back.

Amazing local flavor that lives up to its epic name.  Plus some of the friendliest faces in town.   We all left with a hug and a handshake from the jovial gent at the door    Breakfast tacos lived up to all expectations - and served all day  hooray   It s no wonder you see them coming out of the kitchen in droves.  We also happened to be there on the enchilada special day - similarly delicious  cheesy goodness.  And the guac.  Oh the guac.   I was tempted to just eat it up with a fork.   It s no wonder people are lined up out front to get this taco goodness.  Juan in a Million is truly one in a million.  We ll be back  without question.

4.75  One of my first visit in Austin.  FOOD   I love the serving of free chip and salsa because these fill you up itself and they re free. The salsa is more on the spicy side for those people with sensitive stomach. I have been getting Don Juan tacos which is covered with potato  cheese  meat and idek. This is really good with the salsa they give you and it will fill you up real fast. It s fairly cheap and if you want  you can order more tortilla on side.  SERVICE   I love the service here especially when the owner gives you a firm handshake.  ATMOSPHERE    SURROUNDING   This place keeps the East Austin unique

Awesome Tex-Mex Brunch spot   What to get  Don Juan el Taco Grande  5.95. Incredibly filling and large enough to share  I would definitely recommend ordering this with extra tortillas and guac.   The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful when ordering.  It took a little bit of time to get seated and to get our food  but it was more than worth it

TLDR  This is a family-owned cute Mexican place that is worth visiting while you are in Austin. Food was good and portions were generous. Juan was there and he does have a firm handshake. Unsure if it s worth coming back to though.  Things I liked  - I tried a couple of their breakfast tacos - they are really tasty and again  the portions are very generous. I was not able to finish all my food - pay attention to how much you order so you don t over do it -  As soon as you enter the restaurant  Juan greeted us with a wonderful firm handshake. I liked that  but I can also see how this may make some people uncomfortable.  - The service is fast and you pay up front when you are done. If you are looking for a quick bite  this place delivers. I think our total time at the restaurant was maybe 30 minutes  Things I did not like  - This place has a really nice family-owned diner theme  but for some reason I felt it was a bit too dingy and dirty. I like the idea of having a casual vibe  but I found that the tables are too cramped and there is way too much decor  sometimes  less is more  - The food was good  but it was not great. I m not sure what s missing from it. Perhaps it s the presentation. Perhaps it s the flavors. I don t really know but it could use some revamping. - The menu can also use some work. I m always apprehensive of menus that seem to long and too wordy. Perhaps simplify the menu and add more pictures and descriptions  - I appreciate the fast-paced nature of the place  but I would caution against making customers feel rushed.   Overall  this is a good place that could use some tweaking  but overall a good place to get a bite

Good place for chorizo tacos. The salsa could be better though. It s a little more expensive than other places. Customer service was great though.  Shady characters in this area of town.   Just remember  the more dangerous the area the better the tacos
You can t go wrong with the Don Juan  amp  horchata. This place is always a must stop for us.

What a find     the service and food was amazing.  the breakfast tacos were so good. I had the huevos rancheros and they were perfect.  Warning  the salsa with the chips is  muy caliente.   My only comment is that the tortillas were a bit  lardy.   Maybe they were machine made  but not enough to tarnish the overall experience.  Definitely worth the stop.  Update  forgot to add snap of Huevos Rancheros

Have been going to Juan in a Million for years - there s usually a line  at least when I go and I never  ever leave hungry. I like to order their Don Juan- El Taco Grande and a Chicken Taco with a side of rice and beans. And if you want something different  order their Caldo De Res with extra beef  yum  best dish at any Tex Mex place in Austin    Take a few minutes to check out their decor and pictures on the walls  lots of great Austin history in this place  48  years of feeding Austinites and lucky visitors  not very many restaurants here have been here that long  so kudos to this place. Getting hungry right now  maybe breakfast or lunch tomorrow...hmmm

Wow  what amazing food  We came here for breakfast and though there was a ton of people waiting and the situation was pretty chaotic  the staff was awesome and the wait wasn t long at all. We tried the horchata  so good  And the chorizo con huevos and queso breakfast. We loved the food and will definitely be back

Everything is bigger in Austin  They re drinks are bigger  The water and horchata came in super large cups. I think they re 32 oz  I couldn t finish them.   I ordered the Con Queso Breakfast and my husband ordered the Don Juan El Taco Grande  The staff is great  It just feels like you re at their home serving you breakfast tacos  The dishes are extra large in size    I had to take mine to go because I couldn t finish it  I recommend  Come and eat and enjoy  We didn t wait to long to get a seat

We love Juan in a Million. If we are in Austin  we go. If we are passing through Austin   we go. I pick and try everyone s stuff at the table and have never had anything bad from there. But I get the Don Juan. Every time. Best thing ever. And the chips and salsa at breakfast time  Spicy  And drool worthy. Some of the best salsa I ve ever had.   We ll be coming through Austin at breakfast time in a couple weeks. Guess where we ll be stopping  For some Juan in a Million  I look forward to it as much as my trips

Trust me  you want to go here just to meet Juan  Juan can turn around your darkest day and put a smile on your face. Where else can you go where the owner personally greets you at the door and gives you all of his incredible energy.  Food wise  my plate was a little bit bland  but it s affordable and JUAN    Get there now and see Juan

There s very little I can write about Juan in a Million that hasn t been written already. So I m keeping this one quick and dirty.  Juan was there giving high-fives  handshakes  and bro hugs to everyone that walked in or out of the door and I thought that was an amazing and fun touch.  Service is very fast. And the food is very good. But be ready for a wait   It s CHEAP. The  6 Don Juan El Taco Grande is giant. Get 2-3 extra tortillas. That ll be enough. But...you re gonna want more. The ladyfriend and I each ordered a Don Juan plus a chorizo and potato and my god we couldn t finish everything. Oh also there s chips and salsa with everything.  These are quick and dirty burritos that just...don t taste quick and dirty. They re delicious  they re inexpensive  and Juan in a Million is a wonderful experience and it s absolutely delicious.   Just remember  there s gonna be a wait  and your eyes WILL be better than your stomach. Go  go now.

The wait was minimal and the food is tasty.  We got there about 11 00 on a Sunday and people were waiting around.  After checking in we got our table within 15 minutes.  Ordered and food arrived within 10 minutes.  The Don Juan is a lot of food but worth it.  I got extra tortillas and shared some of the goodness with my wife.  If you have time get some of the queso. It s thin but very flavorful and adds even more flavor to the tacos.    Couple things to know.  If you want quiet  this is not the ideal place.  If you want a secluded corner to have that conversation  probably not the place.  Many of the tables are seated family style and you will be sitting very close to your neighbor.  Too bad you can t get everyone to share.  Don said hello to us and made sure we were taken care of and the wait staff was extremely friendly and on their game.  Another good one for a meal in Austin

Disclaimer  When they say everything is bigger in Texas  they are right...soooo much food.  This place was a 12 minute walk from my air B amp B and was one of the places my SO wanted to try. We are the Bay Area  but he REALLY wanted to try tex-mex. The breakfast plate sounded tasty  but as we were on a trip the portion was HUGE. We opted for some tacos  beans  rice and soup. The soup was perfect morning breakfast and the chorizo with potato taco was delicious. The egg and bacon  and egg and sausage  was a little underwhelming  as the egg was over cooked. The side of bean and rice were tasty as the beans had lard in them and the rice was cooked properly.  Overall  next time the soup and one taco should be enough as they might as well be little burritos.
Huge horchatas. The menudo had too much hominy  which i wasn t a fan of... the chips and salsa  delicious

This restaurant was very disappointing for a multitude of reasons. First  we waited a half hour for a table even though the restaurant had 10 open tables. Then I got a hot mug of water down coffee  with the complimentary chips and salsa. The salsa was actually the highlight  as the ensemble of tacos and huevos rancheros was bland and soggy. What made it worse was the lack of service  as the wait staff was inattentive and standoffish. Definitely not worth the hype unless you re into feeling disappointed and slightly bloated.

Great food - not so great service.  Ordered the queso  guacamole  chicken enchiladas  cheese enchiladas  and beef fajitas.  Loved the queso dip  The guacamole tased fresh AF.  The chicken enchiladas were good  but not great. The chicken on the inside of the enchilada was a little dry - maybe a little more sauce would have helped push this over the edge.  The cheese enchiladas were delicious. Highly recommend.  The beef fajitas were so so tasty. The meat was just falling apart and was quite flavorful. I really enjoyed the rice on the side and the beans. My husband preferred the refried  but I liked the regular beans.  The food was so good and was quite quick  once we ordered  but the service was really substandard. We were put in a back corner - so maybe it was out of sight out of mind - but it took so long for us to be greeted. Then a long time for our order to be taken. Then we had to repeatedly request drinks etc.. It took a long time to get the check and even longer to get our card back after paying. With all of that said  the food was worth it and I would def return.  3.5 rounded up to 4

I really hate giving a bad review. Specially to an establishment that seems to have a pretty cool Owner.  But to my despair I was shocked that the flour tortillas where not homemade. I say this from experience from going to other restaurants and seeing the tortillas being hand made.  I was not a fan of the tortillas.  I ordered three different sets of tacos. The portion is nice  however the Potatos w Chorizo was extremely salty. I also ordered a Barbacoa  and added bacon and beans. The bacon was extremely salty too  I was very saddened. Perhaps they might have added a little too much salt that day.  But to end this on a good note  the taco that I did not have a problem with was the Carne Guisada  Beef Stew Cubes . Now that one was perfect  despite the tortilla of course lol. But that s my review. If anyone does order the potato with chorizo or bacon  make sure to let the waiter or waitress know. I let our waitress know about the taste of the tacos after my fiancee and I were done. I simply made a comment  more like a  heads up . Hoping that I could prevent any other customer from having the same incident  but she responded with  you can go ahead and tell the cook yourself. I was shocked lol.  I mean I told her to tell the cook because in the end she works for the guy lol. So I thought it would be best coming from an employee. But oh well. Also  I was going to buy a mimosa  but my goodness   6     no way jose lol  The reason I say for the customer to tell the waitress or waiter  is because she said you should of let me know ahead of time. But I m always afraid that my food will have spit on it from an upset waiter waitress who ve had enough dealing with customers. I ve had waitresses and waiters give me an eye roll or snatch the plate from my hands. Sorry for being a little precarious.
Food was great not too much spice. Prices were reasonable and service was excellent. Going back to try lunch or dinner. This was my first visit.

Was worried the wait would be extensive but timed it just right as a crowd began forming outside as we left. Was still feeling the night out before  my appetite was at an all time high. This forced me to order two main dishes to manage this hunger. The service was rather hands off and it did take awhile to get the food  but boy was it worth the wait. The Don Juan Taco is a must try. Very hearty and filling with a great amount of flavor. The con queso breakfast was good but was ordered for my 2nd stomach which I didn t have that day. The atmosphere was unique  one worth taking a picture in. Best part of our visit was giving Juan himself a big handshake and hug on the way out

A long time favorite of Austinites and those who are visiting. Always busy  always fast service  and the owner is always there with a smile and a handshake. The Don Juan is a must  just be sure to bring your appetite and well priced . If less hungry  try any of their other breakfast items. If you love the busy  unpretentious Austin s East side  this place is a must for a breakfast stop.

It was pretty packed for a Thursday morning. We ordered the Don Juan taco   enough to make 4 tacos  huge and yummy. Menudo... The tripe was very soft but I thought it didn t have enough taste. The Don Juan queso was so so. If I come back I will probably just order the taco. Service was good. They have a parking lot in the back.

It was fantastic place too eat   We got in pretty easily  very busy place  Very worth too eat there. The prices are great   The service was nice   I love the environment   Can t wait to go back again when I get a chance

I m sad to write this review. There was so much hype about this place. I left the restaurant disappointed and unimpressed.  Sunday morning I called the resistant around 8 30 to see if we can get an RSVP. The friendly employee told me that they don t take RVSP  it s a first come  first serve basis. Which is fine. She graciously advised me to come soon because the place was filling up fast. Wow  I thought  that s early. We got to the restaurant within 10 minutes or so. No lines yet  but the place was pretty much packed already. We were seated near the register. It was a busy location. Great for people watching  but not much elbow room. The staff were really nice and greeted everyone with a smile. There was certainly a lot of stress in the air. It was a good stress  business is good. The employees were on the go  left and right.  The menu isn t anything different  it was pretty much an authentic spot. We ordered a breakfast chorizo. I thought it was rolled into a burrito already but it was just open face egg chorizo with 2 tortillas and country potatoes. It was lacking flavor. I was expecting flavor  if not amazing  at least some flavor. Needless to say  my first visit to his highly acclaimed restaurant was a disappointment.

Was told this place had good migas so couldn t wait to try it out.  I found the migas to be ok  not great.  Just didn t have the range of flavor I enjoy so much.   I do have to admit my expectations are high.   I always do favors for my sister in law so she will fix me migas  -    I hesitated to state this as it could be construed all wrong.  So  good not great.

You know when you go to a restaurant during your travels and have such an awesome experience to return years later and not  Fortunately  this is not the case. I haven t been back in Austin for six years  so when I came back our here I insisted we go to Juan in a Million for Migas. As delicious as they were all those years ago  they still are. Hospitality is excellent too
Amazing Joint   migas  cerveza  amp  chorizo.... what more can you ask for at 9 30 am  This is A Must Try

I happened to be next to Juan in a Million after my audition. I checked and found an old expired Groupon that I had never used.  This place has the hottest hot sauce that I have had in a long while. My mouth was on fire but I just could not stop eating it. I ordered a chicken and a beef fajita ala carte. They were huge stuffed with meat  cheese  lettuce and tomato. A steal for  6.50 total. I proceeded to get stuffed on those tacos.  Great staff  Good food  Cold AC

I was in Austin for business and after our meeting my bosses wanted to stop and get lunch before we headed to the airport.  They ate here the night before and raved about it and wanted to come back.  I love Mexican food so who was I to say no.  The name itself gets your curiosity going.  When we drive up the parking lot is packed.  That was a good sign.  The place was a little run downed  but for me that s where you find the best food.  So I m all in on this place.  I ordered the chicken flautas.  It came with sour cream  guac and rice and beans.  To me  this place was just okay.  The flautas were taquito size and the chicken was good but didn t have great flavor.  The chips and salsa were just okay.  Chips were NOT homemade.  The salsa was pretty good.    Overall  having such great Mexican food places here I ve definitely had better.  Like other Yelpers have said  they ve seen this place on TV shows and I came in with higher expectations.  Austin is a great city with great food choices.  This place wasn t bad.  It just wasn t one of the better places I ve eaten Mexican food.  I don t think I d go back since there are so many places to try.
Juan s is just classic. Big nice burritos and tacos. Beans and rice. Good salsa and chips and drinks so big you could swim in the cup     Nice staff and quick service

To be honest with you  I am writing this review because of my endless love for the Don Juan  and the many number of times it has satisfied my stomach  put me in a good food coma  and nap almost the whole afternoon away. Praise God for this wonderful place in Austin  TX   What else can I say  The Don Juan with extra tortillas and chorizo is always my go-to  While there are many other authentic mexican dishes there  the Don Juan never breaks your wallet  and it s wonderful mixture of ingredients makes me come back here time and time again   The wait can get long  but everybody knows about this place  so be prepared ahead of time to have everyone there and present so you can be seated.  My friends and family love Mexican food  so if it s not tacos  it s Juan in a Million  mic drop  Thanks for reading

We were in town  amp  wanted breakfast tacos to satisfy our craving. Being from the RGV we knew nothing would compare to our tacos but decided to try something new. This place was delicious  amp  literally had our mouth watering for more  even on a full stomach. Totes recommend Juan in a Million. We had the Don Juan Taco that I swear fed two. Definitely will be our go to each  amp  every time we re in town visiting.
I always get the Don Juan to share between two people. You can get as many tortillas as you want with it    There has always been a wait when I go during peak times  but it moves quickly.

I don t get it.... just was not good as advertised.  They put so much cheese on everything.. it s like what is the point. We ordered a bunch of things and from the reviews below I expected much better..

I love Mexican food but i don t know of any Mexican restaurants where I am from in Florida that has Mexican breakfast food. I love Texas and love that there are so many places that serve Tex-Mex all the time including breakfast.  I knew i had to pick a place to get my Mexican breakfast fix and a bunch of people have recommended Juan In A Million.  We sat down and the first thing they serve us is chips and salsa and its literally 10 in the morning.   I had to start with my coffee just to wake up but then I moved up to a bloody Mary and they sure know how to make a good one.   My friends know that I have BIG EYES. I was super hungry and I just had  to order the Don Juan El Taco Grande. This is HUGE... it has scrambled eggs with potato  bacon and cheese serve on top of a hot  corn tortilla. I also ordered one more corn tortilla on the side. I have to emphasize this dish was huge and I literally could not finish this dish. I was so full and loved every bit that I took. It was so big that my boyfriend couldn t even finish it  even though he finishes everything I leave over usually .  If you are very in Austin and want some good and cheap Mexican breakfast you need to try this place. They are super friendly and the food comes out right away.

This place was amazing   When you walk in  the owner shakes your hand.  After you are done with your meal  he shakes your hand again  Not only their service was amazing  their food was too. I had two tacos.  They are Texas big and delish   Keep it up

When you see a long line  what are your first thoughts   Damn I ain t waiting is this long ass line  OR  I m so hungry and I drove to too many other places that had long ass lines as well. Might as well stay.   Look  the line may be long but sooooo worth it. Line goes really quick. Make sure you put your name on that list  Otherwise you d really be waiting.   Don Juan is where to go. Cheap. HUGE portion. I made the mistake of getting another small taco.   Service is pretty solid. Salsa is spicy.

This place was a lot more hype than taste. The dishes were basic and easily replicated at home. I found nothing that made then deserving of the long wait and accolades on the wall. The service was great but food was meh. I ll stay home for this type of food.

These four stars are more for quantity than quality. I ordered one Don Juan  Barbacoa  and Carne Guisado taco  thinking it d be just enough to make me full.   BUT NO  it was not enough. IT WAS WAAAAY MORE than enough  which is a good thing.   And I had to essentially put more than half of my food in a take-out box and reheat it the next morning in a styrofoam box  I know  dangerous waters  using the smallest microwave I ve ever seen  in the smallest RV camper AirBnB could offer.   I can t say anything was delicious  but there were a bajillion carbs  calories  and grams of protein.
20 minute wait for a table  quick service with drinks chips  long wait for food but it s a busy place. Decent food with big portions.

BLUF  Super filling  tasty breakfast tacos and Mexican food with extremely welcoming staff    This restaurant is one of my favorite go to s in Austin when I m in town. It s definitely made waves in the social media scene and yea the rumors are true - the owner does meet you personally at the door  one firm handshake at a time  You re seated quickly  but sometimes in the morning you can be in for a little wait. You re given some complimentary chips and salsa  definitely has a little kick to it.   The go to order here is the Don Juan El Taco Grande - a marvelous concoction of eggs  potatoes  bacon  cheese  and tortilla. My girlfriend and I shared this  but let s face it  if you try hard enough you can finish all yourself  And you definitely can t beat the price of only  6-7 for the amount of food you get.   If you re looking for a cheap TexMex breakfast in Austin  this is the place to go for the most bang for your buck  Looking forward to coming back again when I m in town

Hands down one of the best place for breakfast tacos in Austin. I usually get the migas and add chorizo to it. The servings are so big that I can usually make two meals from it. The food is fresh  delicious and authentic. The place is usually packed  but it s worth the wait if you re really wanting some authentic Tex-Mex food. The salsa is also good  and they always get my order right. Love this place--I ve been going for years when I visit Austin  and I will continue to do so.

I was debating whether or not to give Juan in a Million a visit. It looked overrated since being featured on Travel Channel. However  it was that Man v. Food episode that convinced me to come. Well  it convinced my friend to go which in turn convinced me to go.   We arrived before noon and there was a 15 minute wait. The time passed by quickly and we were immediately seated. You get the family-run  tex-mex diner feel. They brought us a fresh batch of chips and salsa. We ordered the Don Juan El Taco Grande  go figure  and a small guac to share and I got a horchata   2 . Most people seem to order another tortilla but we were fine with one.   People are not kidding when they say it s HUGE. No wonder it was featured on Man v. Food. We just ate it like a scramble with the guac  chips  and salsa. The salsa was tasty and provided a nice kick. After we ate enough  we ate it just like it should be eaten - a taco. Essentially it s two meals in one and feeds two hungry people just fine. The horchata was good and also enough for two people. I ended up taking the rest to go and it filled up an entire to-go cup.   Overall  Juan in a Million is a good place for a no-frills  comforting breakfast. The portions and value alone will keep you coming

Tried this place before leaving Austin and it was delicious. I passed here the day before and saw a line outside.   I went around 9 am on a Sunday and it was not busy yet  so the service was quick. I ordered the Don Juan el Taco Grande and it was definitely huge. Big enough for 2 people to split. It comes with additional tortillas since it is so huge  My only complaint is that I wish there was more bacon. I added the complimentary salsa  and ordered a side of queso.  My parents ordered the Con Queso breakfast and Chorizo Con Huevo.   If I return  I would definitely order the grande taco again. It was only  5 and definitely worth it. I believe I set my expectations too high as it was just an average breakfast taco but the size and price is what makes this place enticing.

Highly recommend the breakfast tacos  Kinda a hole in the wall place but we ordered ours to-go. Lots of options  excellent flavor and good size. We each had 2 and were full for several hours. The migas breakfast taco is the one to get
Best Guac We have ever had    Incredible service  food was out in no time  The quesadilla was also super crispy and delicious  Will definitely be coming back

This was a cool little place  Don Juan El Taco Grande which is basically a crazy big breakfast pancake with cheese  potatoes  and meat  I can see why this is a big staple in Austin  Now the wait  that was unpleasant but my bf really liked this place  I thought it was alright  I would come again but it wouldn t be my first choice.
Very overrated based on all of the recommendations we were given. Just average breakfast food  though the chorizo was very good.

This little hole in the wall is not only an Austin classic  but the Juan taco has been my favorite since I was a kid.  I get three solid tacos out of it. I m pretty sure this place has been around since before I was born.    Most will complain about the long lines and terrible parking  but come mid day during the week day.  You d avoid most of that.  The coffee is good and so is the staff.  You will feel rushed if you dine in. Don t come if you plan on solicalizing and hanging around.  If you re looking for fancy  don t come here.  If you re looking for a place to hang with friends  don t come here.  Come here to enjoy a part of Austin  it s history  good staff and good Mexican food.  Come here if you re okay with being in and about in about 30 minutes.  They re good about to-go orders also.  You can cut the long lines then.   BTW  the salsa is a little spicy for my blood.  I d tweak that a little.  I couldn t enjoy it.  Otherwise  I m a fan and enjoy the experience overtime.

This place may seem like a hole in the wall place for out of towners but locals love this place especially for breakfast.  We love the Machacado and Don Juan Grande.  The tortilla is homemade.  Potatoes  bacon and beef are nicely seasoned to blend with other ingredients.  I think you ll like whatever they have in the menu.  They offer large portions so you will not leave hungry.  They are very efficient with service.  Today  we got there before the mass of people so we had no wait time.  They have a small parking lot for tiny cars.  There is street parking too.  Couple years ago they were ranked the  1 place for breakfast in Austin.  They are in my top 8 places for breakfast in Austin for sure.

The ambiance here was lovely and the wait time was not long at all even for a big crowd. There were just a few disappointments we had with ordering vegetarian meals. They told us the fajitas no matter what could not be made vegetarian  but they finally figured out something else for us which worked. I had 2 different breakfast tacos which were reasonable  nothing too special. I wasn t a fan of the horchata because it was SO sweet. It just tasted like milk with cinnamon and sugar which was pretty mediocre. Overall an okay restaurant  probably won t go out of my way to come here again.

Took my mom and sister here before she had to take her plane out of town and had some breakfast  it was yummy  Anything smothered in queso is a winner in my book. This place is also huge  the seating went on forever it seemed like. I brought the little one and I was still able to maneuver the stroller around and park it at the table with no fuss. Service was friendly and efficient and it was very cheap  a real staple in Austin and I can see why it is so popular.

The portions are so big  but they do give you to-go boxes if you need. and trust me you need it.  insert Spongebob reference here . Their Horchata is really good and contrasts the heaviness of the food you re eating. I do have to admit  their salsa and queso are way too thin. It drips like water. They don t have any hot sauce which sucks cause the food makes your mouth feel very dry. The salsa is not spicy enough for me so a variety of salsas or something would have been nice.

A must stop if you re in Austin    Great service and staff  Upon entering we were promptly greeted with a smile. We were seated immediately in a cozy part of the restaurant. Very warm home feeling. The smell of food in the air just like moms or grandmothers cooking.  Server was polite and brought us chips and salsa which I was delicious   We ordered some breakfast tacos and some coffees and a hot chocolate milk. Coffees were flavorful and my daughter enjoyed her hot chocolate.  Tacos were exquisitely delicious. After we ate our tacos we ordered another one just to top it off.  All the service and food was excellent. Thanks for a wonderful experience Juan in Million    This was our first time here and won t be our last    Definitely recommended and definitely a Texas Treasure
Great service. Wonderfully friendly staff. And the refried beans are made with bacon fat  Delish.

I really miss this place. Especially  the Don Juan  especially.   I ll be making a trip back to ATX soon and this will be the first breakfast spot that I hit up. 24-Hour Diner  at 6th and N. Lamar will be  2.

I m not going to lie  my friends and I only came here at first for the name.   The food was amazing  We had 4 girls  and shared the chicken enchiladas  the Don Juan  and the breakfast special  with the queso   and a side of extra tortillas. Everything was so good. I would honestly recommend everything that we tried. The free salsa that they give in the beginning has a really nice kick  and is necessary for the food to balance out all the heaviness of it.   Would definitely come back
Good tacos and breakfast plates  Always a go to in austin for breakfast    Well you can eat breakfast tacos anytime of the day really

Traveled to Austin for 4th of July weekend 2019. I saw Juan in a Million on Man vs Food many years ago and promised to try it if I ever had a chance to. I kept my promise and I wasn t sorry. The breakfast taco was BOMB  So simple  yet so good. One taco is enough  I could not imagine eating more. The best part was it was priced at under  6  I also tried the horchata  so rich and creamy. I read on Yelp that it gets pretty crowded and parking is hard to find so we took an Uber from our hotel and were seated right away. This was definitely one of my favorite meals in Austin.
Hits the spot. Make sure to get the Don Juan taco  It s a beast      Message for Don Juan...please get some Cholula hot sauce for these breakfast tacos

I m glad my friends invited me to Saturday brunch here. The parking made it look like a madhouse  but the wait wasn t that long and we were seated in a good section.  The place is weirdly set up with lots of sections that don t really go together . Our server was very attentive considering the crowd and the size of our party. I ordered the breakfast taco. It was huge  Literally enough to make 6 tacos. Lol  It was pretty tasty. The hardest part was getting out. We had to line up at the cash register to pay on the way out. This is a BAD idea considering the crowd. This just makes a huge juggernaut at the door with people trying to enter and pay. I m not sure when I ll be back since this place is so far into central Austin  but if I m ever on that side I ll stop by.
Quick  and portion are great  Stick to the breakfast tacos. You can t go wrong with those

Two words  Don Juan. Wait  three words. Don Juan   horchata   Everything here is authentic and DELICIOUS  FILLING  AND I COULD EAT IT ALL DAY. I actually do eat it all day because there s always enough for at least 2  meals.   I wouldn t call this your traditional  breakfast taco  place  but it s definitely my favorite place to come in Austin for a tex-mex breakfast.   The only reason it s not 5 stars is because the service has been extremely SLOW the last few times I ve been here  within a 3 month span . It s hard to be forgiving of that when they roll out endless Don Juans  bc that s what everyone gets... they also used to give at least 3 tortillas with each order. I guess people never finished their tortillas because they only give out 1 tortilla now. Another small tidbit - a side of guac here is  5.75  which is a bit much for me   Lastly  there s ALWAYS a wait unless you come after 1 30pm  in my experience . Regardless  I m gonna keep coming back for that Don Juan   OH  ALSO.  For some reason I want to comment on the bathroom   bathroom is super clean. Wouldn t really expect it looking at the outside but yep  clean

After 4.5 years of living in Austin  I decided this morning I d finally try Juan In A Million. I went around 7 15  no line  and was greeted warmly by the host. I ordered and had my taco in hand in less than 3 minutes. Probably the best breakfast taco I ve had in Austin and I can confidently say I ve been missing out. One taco  if ordered right  will be perfect and fill you up  I would highly recommend this spot.

Waited 25-30 minutes to get into this place for a late breakfast around 11am.  I was expecting really good Mexican food  but the food I got didn t suit my Baja California style taste buds.   I found it quite bland  and the atmosphere left much to be desired as well.    Not sure how this place gets 4 stars...... maybe  TexMex  taste buds are massively different from those of us who grew up on the border of Tijuana.

The Don Juan Taco Grande was delicious    i couldn t finish it because it was so huge. The price is  6.25 and they will charge extra for a couple of tortillas  i think  1 . I will come again when I am in Austin  Wish we have Juan in a Million in Dallas

If you re looking for a hearty filling breakfast  look no further because Juan In A Million can definitely provide that for you. The Don Juan is a large taco topped with a mountain of potato  egg  bacon and cheese. It s enough to make about two to three extra tacos if you order extra tortillas. It s your typical breakfast taco  but the sheer size will definitely fill you and it s really great for the price. I had the barbacoa taco with onions and cilantro also . It s your typical barbacoa filled with flavor and juice dripped down from the taco. Overall  it s a great place to get a breakfast fix.

Ok wow   First time here and this food is authentic and delicious. I had the chicken enchiladas which were phenomenal and husband had some type of tacos. Both of us were super impressed with the fast service and amazingly tasty food. This could easily become my new favorite Mexican restaurant. Yummmmnm

This place was recommended to us by a friend. We currently live in San Antonio.   This place was amazing  Great service walking in. We were seated immediately.   I ordered the Don Juan taco grande  And my husband got a beef fajita taco and a bacon been and cheese.   We got chips and salsa and queso.   The chips were amazing  light airy crispy  the salsa was the perfect blended salsa with a bit of bite on the back.  The queso would be our only complaint which we can t even really call a complaint about our meal. It tasted amazing but was very thin. I think we felt worse about getting it all over the table then anything.   I did not expect that Don Juan taco to be as large as it was.
