I got an extra two tortillas on the side and still needed and extra 2-3 to finish the meal. Needless to say we took it to go. It was the perfect blend of well cooked potatoes  crispy bacon  great egg and cheese. Topped the tacos with extra queso and salsa. They were amazing. If my body could ve eaten more I would of finished the plate.   My husbands tacos  The beef fajita- the beef was tender  lettuce and tomatoes were fresh and crisp  also topped with cheese.   His bacon been and cheese Salty  but in the right way. It was the perfect salt level for the amount of bacon that was chunked in the taco. The bacon was extremely crispy just the way it should be when topped with salsa and other ingredients. No one likes floppy soggy bacon....   I would highly recommend this place to anyone in the area or who lives here and hasn t had the pleasure. We will most defiantly be back.   Thank you for opening such an amazing restaurant family owned is the way to go.   Support your locals people.

This place is fine. It s a classic spot in Austin and has a lot of credit especially since the Man v Food episode forever ago. But honestly  it s subpar Mexican. The food is edible and not gross  but there are just honestly so many other more put together places in town that can offer you an amazing Mexican or tex-mex experience. The food is fairly bland and feels pushed through quickly and without any care. But that s also what you should expect for an older spot that hasn t evolved very much. Paper tickets handwritten out  space feels a little worn with time.

Huge huge restaurant but you can guarantee there will be a wait weekend mornings. Food is pretty large in portions and reasonably priced. Very much a hot spot for locals and has had a lot of well known people eat here. Food was good  taste homemade and coffee was fresh  Service was a little slow but I think that s due to the weekend crowd.

Wow   This place is amazing  cheap and super delicious.  I came here for breakfast and ordered the Don Juan El Taco Grande.  The flavors were incredible and saboroso.  It was more food than I could eat and it was served with chips and salsa.  The salsa had a good bite and great flavor.  I washed it down with a bottle of Mexican Coke.  The service was great and the vibe was real low key.  Definitely a place to stop by if you are close to San Antonio.  You won t be disappointed.

This place never disappoints   Food portions are HUGE and flavorful. I so far have only had their breakfast taco s and each one has been a new favorite. Great customer service very friendly and sweet. I honestly can t wait to go back

Literally the best breakfast tacos I ve ever had    I got the chorizo scramble with potatoes and beans. So much flavor and it came with tortilla wraps so I could make my own breakfast tacos. My husband got their speciality breakfast tacos that has bacon and eggs. His was really good as well. The server was nice and Juan was standing in the front of the restaurant greeting people. Very friendly establishment with a great menu and delicious food   You have to try this place when in town

Authentic from the food to decor to friendly  amp  attentive staff.   Hot  robust coffee - refilled on point. The smell of cinnamon from the horchata filled the air as we sat at our table  so we had to order one. It did not disappoint and the fact that it was practically 32oz of it was a bonus     Free crispy  airy  hot chips and spicy flavorful salsa to start. Normally chips and salsa isn t worth the calories to me  but these met the mark  I got the red menudo  which was fantastic. Tender tripe  not chewy or fatty. Tasty broth and all the fixins. The beans - creamy  amp  super flavorful  you could taste the bacon fat permeating throughout. Stuffed in a warm fresh flour tortilla...mmmm....  Awesome find.

A must go place for any breakfast taco lover.  I have had the Don juan and know that you will be full for the entire day after eating one.  This trip I played it safe and just ordered the regular chorizo and egg breakfast taco. It was very good and snaking on chips and salsa while you wait is always a plus.    I loved that the owner was there and my friend got see why he has the best handshake

Man v Food brought me here. Stopped in while I was in town and was not disappointed. I got the Dur n Juan el Taco Grande and when I tell you it was good  I m not lying  Big portions and it was sooo flavorful. Will definitely be back when in the Austin area.

I hate to be so critical about Juan In A  Million but I just had so much expectations for it.  I ve never been to a restaurant that was featured on the food network and be so disappointed. To begin with I cannot deal with the fact that the Don Juan is considered a Mexican breakfast taco when the tortilla does not taste homemade. It literally taste like I went to Kroger and bought a pack of mission tortillas.  I am from Houston and can tell you that a great breakfast taco is all about the homemade tortilla. The filling was a bit bland as well.  The taco yes it is huge so please order 2 extra tortillas so that you can manage to eat the filling.  We shared 1 taco and it was enough for both of us.  Do not be fooled by the demand  the long lines all the hype will only leave you disappointed.  This place is great for a beginner to the mexican food scene.  I would not recommend this place to those that truly know what a great breakfast taco taste like.

We were looking for a great breakfast brunch place and after reading the reviews we knew that Juan In A Million was the place to go.   The atmosphere was great  we did not wait long and were seated right away. The server was very attentive and friendly.  The food is definitely five-star quality  the portions are certainly worth the price  My only problem was that both of their iconic dishes  the Don Juan and con queso are comprised of 80-90  potato filler. If the dishes had less potato and adequate amounts of meat egg  they would have been amazing. The experience was watered down by obnoxious amounts of potato.

Solid cheap dirty ol  tex-mex. The don juan was a good bet and so was the chorizo scramble. They were both tasty and super filling. The salsa for the table was spicy as hell  just the way I like it. Try it out for a quick breakfast but don t expect to find anything healthy

This is my first time visiting this restaurant and it is delicious  cheap. We went on a Monday around 9 30 so there was no wait. There were complimentary chips and salsa. Personally I thought there was a lot of food. I got two tacos  chorizo with potato and chorizo with refried beans both on corn tortillas. The servers were nice and willing to answer all my questions. I would definitely go again.

The don t Big Juan is a massive breakfast burrito that packs value and flavor. I was impressed with the freshness of the eggs and the mouthfeel of the potatoes.  The major draw if the dish was it s epic size and fillingness.   If you are super hungry and in the mood for a nice tasty and filling meal  but don t need a complex flavor profile  this is an excellent choice.

Very good Menudo  Flavorful for sure but I was disappointed there wasn t much homey. The flour tortillas were not tasty  they didn t taste homemade. Also I wish they came in a tortilla warmer instead of parchment paper. The tortillas didn t stay warm through out the meal.  The overall experience was great  service and all. I do think the restaurant was a little hyped up compare to what was brought to the table.

Tried this infamous hotspot for the first time. Came on a Wednesday and it was busy  We didn t wait long for a table. Owner was nice and inviting    Got the Don Juan taco grande  huge portion  and fajita taco also delicious  Chips and salsa for starters and the salsa is spicy  fresh and amazing   Great place to take out of towners   Huge portions for cheap

This was one of our must-do stops during our visit in Austin and can I just say WOAH  this place is...Juan in a Million  Everything really is bigger in Texas   See what I did there  Yeah  I m not proud of those either.   The breakfast tacos here are definitely the thing to get. The Don Juan especially is MASSIVE. It s easily the contents of four breakfast tacos on one tortilla. I would absolutely recommend getting extra tortillas on the side. You ll need them. The Don Juan has scrambled eggs  chopped potatoes  bacon  and plenty of cheese inside. Plus  you can get some salsa on the side to add in. I like that you can go the  build your own  taco route here because there s just so much food. And needless to say  it is all delicious.  On top of just how tasty and huge it is  the Don Juan is only  6. That is a steal in any economy  The service is quick here and honestly it s my favorite breakfast taco I ve had in Austin and anywhere ever.

We ordered    - Don Juan - HUGEEE and delicious  - chicken enchiladas - SOOO good. I was addicted to their side of rice too.   We used the complementary salsa to add a little kick to our Don Juan tacos and it enhanced the flavor.   Fast service here

I ve heard such wonderful things about this place and since we were in the area  we decided to give it a try. The parking situation isn t great if you aren t used to going anywhere authentic  in other words  NOT some chain restaurant . There s parking in the back and on the street. We were seated as soon as we walked in. There are still least three separate dining rooms from what I saw  which was way more than it looks from the street   I ordered the Don Juan- El Taco Grande  a secret combination of potato  egg  bacon and cheese in a deliciously hot tortilla  but with sausage instead of bacon. I read a lot of reviews about this place and this was the one thing everyone said to try.  Make sure to ask for at least 3 extra tortillas. This meal became my brunch and then my breakfast the next day because there was SO MUCH  It was amazing and you get so much for what you pay. Also  we had chips and hot sauce  or salsa  depends where you re from  which was very spicy but delicious.  The staff was also very friendly  which is a huge plus.  We will definitely be back but bringing additional friends so they can try this place out. Thanks so much

Suuuch a bummer. Maybe I ordered the wrong tacos  but this was overhyped and underwhelming.   Came here after working up an appetite at Austin Bouldering Project  and was amped because of all the tacos I d had in Austin so far were amazing  and people were hyping this place up to be  much  better.  Line moved quickly  and I ended up getting some breakfast tacos  barbacoa  and a chicken  amp  rice taco. Tortillas were okay  the barbacoa taco wasn t that flavorful  and the other tacos were just bland as well.   If I had to come back  I d definitely get the Don Juan  as that s what half of our table ordered and they re regulars. But even then  they did say that it wasn t even  the best   just   the best bang for your buck .  Parking was easy to find even with a bunch of people outside though
Best breakfast brunch spot in Austin  hands down  This is a must when in town. My personal favorite is con queso breakfast but they are also known for their breakfast tacos.

Definitely good bang for your buck here. There are a decent amount of breakfast taco varieties. We got the El Grande taco which was good. There is a large amount of filling so recommend getting the extra tortilla with it. We also got the nachos sans beans and added sour cream and pico de gallo. Again  the portion size was huge- only downside was the mountain of cilantro underneath the sour cream that I wasn t aware of. Not the prettiest place to eat but service was good and food does the job.

The breakfast burrito is big enough to feed two very hungry adult and we had to ask for 5 extra tortillas and be sure that you do   The complementary chip and salsa were amazing  the chips reminded me of naked Doritos and the salsa were spicy  be careful  it will creeps up
Skip the fajita tacos and get the carne guisada. One of the best carne guisada tacos I ve had in Austin. Simple but delicious
I heard amazing reviews about this place... I got a breakfast burrito and I just felt like it was okay. The line was crazy so we placed a order to go.
Best breakfast tacos  Ask for extra tortillas and add guac to your Don Juan. Hidden gem in East Austin.

Great Service  Average Food  I ve gone here a couple times for Sunday brunch. Parking is always a small challenge  but nothing to fuss about in relation to Austin  downtown parking. The service is great here  Your drinks are never less than half full  and there are always plenty of waiters around to grab anything you might need.  I gave this restaurant an average rating because I don t think the food is extraordinary compared to other Mexican food around Austin. The food leaves you feeling a little queasy because it is smothered in whatever sauce or cheese comes with the dish you ordered. I don t think the food is bad by any means  I just think there are a lot of other options for better Mexican food around Austin and especially on the East Side

I love this place because it embodies Texas in a restaurant. Awesome tacos. Great price. Portions the size of Texas.  Quick  amazing service and even if there does seem to be a lot of people waiting  it goes super fast because of the size of the sheer restaurant  main area  covered patio area  another small building attached .  Since it s usually busy  you have to flag the servers down to get anything extra you need like water or napkins  but definitely understandable since they have to run between kitchen and tables.   The water cups are giant. I love getting their horchatas  also giant  and the Don Juan is their ultimate giant food popular item on the menu  You can tell them how many tortillas you want  because let me tell you  3 is NOT enough   and there s no additional cost.

The staff here is so friendly and welcoming that you feel right at home  This is a hearty restaurant and by that I mean  you get more than a bang for your buck  you get a mound of food that will never disappear. The Don Juan taco is a gigantic beast and can definitely be shared between two people. I liked the migas taco more than the Don Juan but no matter what taco you get  you definitely need to buy extra tortillas to catch all the leftover filling. Although you get generous portions  the flavors aren t memorable. With so many amazing taco joints in the city  I won t be coming back to this one anytime soon.

This spot was pretty good  nothing special. It was very overcrowded so it seems that it s very popular in the area  the staff is wonderful and they are taking COVID seriously but i ve had better overall food.

Wow. It took me nearly twenty years of living in Austin to come here  but I finally made it   I came with a friend on a Saturday morning. It was crowded but not enough that we weren t seated right away in between two parties. Our server was very tentative given how busy the space was.   The coffee was piping hot  but had lots of flavor once it cooled down. My friend got the massive Don Juan breakfast taco platter and wow... it s HUGE  Definitely worth the price if you wanted to split it between two people or have leftovers.   I had the migas  which were okay. A bit too much cheese and not enough flavor overall  but not bad.   Next time I ll definitely want to try classic breakfast tacos.

An Austin classic....has to be checked off your go-to list.  El Taco Grande...it is just that...grande  Huge  An enormous amount of tasty food for  6.  Honestly you could easily make 4 to 5 good size breakfast tacos out of just one.  We also tried the migas  very tasty.  Our wait was maybe 2 minutes on a busy Saturday morning around 10am....but by the time we left....lots and lots of folks in line outside.  Service was friendly and quick...did not get a chance to shake the owners hand....another tradition...didn t see him there....lots of pictures with him and famous folks around plus a mash up of mexican   southwestern and was that really two Japanese statues in the back    Bottom line  just go....and be hungry....

Our party of 5 here arrived here hungover AF on seis de mayo. I m pretty sure my friend threw up in the bathroom twice from all the whisky shots we drank the night before.   We were greeted by a very patient and understanding woman who gave us menus and much needed water. We took a seat at a table outside at around 2pm to a half empty restaurant.   While we were deciding what to order  we each had modelo beers. The server dropped off a bowl of nachos with the best salsa verde I ve ever had in my entire life.   Maybe I m over exaggerating because it was our first meal of the day but I ve had Tex-Mex food all over the world from the most obvious places  Mexico  to the most obscure places  china  and this was THE BEST  THE GREATEST OF ALL TIME  GOAT .   I ordered the breakfast taco and brisket nachos. The breakfast taco was ok and very delicious but the real MVP was the brisket nachos. Regarding portions  the brisket nachos alone could ve been my entire meal.   We ended up with may more food than we could have finished and ended up packing half of it.   The restaurant itself was very clean and very cheap. Bonus points for the witty name.
Staff was very friendly. Came on a Saturday morning and we waited around 20 minutes before being seated. Food was okay - very filling.

Juan in a million is a well know hole in the wall that is a staple of Austin cuisine. I have been here several times with my girlfriend and it has never disappointed. Every time I am here I order Horchata. I have ordered bean and cheese and bacon  egg  and cheeses tacos.  The negatives  The tables are a bit crowded in the building that is much larger than it looks on the outside. The entrance gets a bit crowded as people are coming in and out and trying to pay.  The positives  The food is freaking amazing. The portions are very large for the price you pay. The horchata is sweet and cinnamon filled deliciousness. The tacos are fat and filled on Burrito sized tortillas.

Handshake with Juan  Check   Big plate of Don Juan  Check   Endless chips and salsa  Check   Finally got to check this place off my to-do list  along with some of other great highlights   The Don Juan is so filling and will satisfy your carb and cheese cravings. It s even great as leftovers. Overall  the food is pretty good with huge portions  especially for the price. Can t wait to come back to try the chorizo

I was the first one there after arriving at 645am. I wanted to taste the hype of the  Don Juan.  I mean it was like every other breakfast taco I ve ever had. It was just average and wasn t worth the hype. You get a ton of breakfast taco but honestly  you could save yourself a trip. If there isn t a line  grab a taco. If there is  skip this place.

We are back for another visit at JIAM. This time around we brought our three month old son. He was fussy most the time but the staff and the other patrons didn t seem to mind. The food was great as always along with the atmosphere. The bonus was being able to say hello to Juan. Hadn t seen him in a while but it s always a pleasure seeing him. Anytime we are nearby this is our choice for dining.

My first full meal in Austin  Texas and everything really  was bigger in Texas    I opted for the egg hash brown scramble with bacon  and it came with a tortilla. You should defInitely request an extra tortilla because the one tortilla cannot possibly support all the food in its own. I felt really bad because I barely made a dent in my meal  but I tried my hardest and got my participation medal. The food was pretty standard and nothing too amazing  but it hit the  spot and was a great hearty meal. There was more than enough food to split between two people if you know what you re getting into beforehand  The service was a little slow  but the restaurant is kind of big and it seemed like there was only server in our room  which was fairly big. The coffee kept coming though  which was nice since the waitress was a little slow. Definitely an Institution in Austin and you should go for breakfast tacos

There is a reason why people are willing to wait on such a long line to eat here. It s an Austin staple  and if you go on a weekday you can get a table immediately with an added bonus of the best handshake given to you by the owner of the restaurant.  I ve been here several times now  and my go to is the Don Juan taco with a side of beans and a coffee. The taco isn t really a taco since the serving is so big  There is a tortilla laid flat on a plate with tons of egg on top. Depending on how much you want to eat and how you want to eat it you will either need extra tortillas or a to go box.
Came here after a red eye flight so i was def a little grumpy  but the food and service was good so that made everything better haha. We got the huevos rancheros  don juan  and machacado con huevos

We were in the mood for breakfast taco  s so we decided to give Juan a try. When we arrived their was a line out the door  but were able to be seated quickly. The atmosphere is plain and the restaurant is cut up with one room for inside dinning in the main building then you go outside for more seating and then onto a second building for more indoor seating. The employees were very friendly and accommodating.   Our server recommended we order their Don Juan El Taco Grande for breakfast. So we took her up on that and also ordered a side of beans. She brought us a basket of chips and a side of salsa  the chips were stail and I could not taste any other ingredients in the salsa because it was so damn spicy. So our large legendary taco plate arrive  s with a side of tortillas and for the  5.65 looks well worth it. But at first bite what a big letdown. It was a big pile of potatoes  cheese very little bacon and hardly any egg. Just a bunch of filler with no thriller. Their was no seasoning on that as well as the beans. Not really sure what the hype is here.

We were looking forward to eating here as it was highly rated. All of us were pretty disappointment with it.  We were a group of 8 and seated outside. It was very warm and somewhat uncomfortable.  I think the restaurant should put some fans or something so it would be a better experience for the guest.    Ordered the Don Juan Taco with a horchata.  Everything is truly bigger in Texas. I love horchata  but I couldn t even finish this. It was probably one of the better horchatas I ve had  but definitely recommend sharing. The Taco was so underwhelming. It wasn t anything special and I don t know why it s such a big deal other than its size. I m quality of quantity for sure.   Overall  we all were disappointment with this place and felt pretty gross after. I should also mention the the service was pretty bad. It took a long time for our food to come out  service was slow  no utensils until minute after our food was served  one of our friend s order had been forgotten  and the cashier was very rude. Would I go back  Eh  I ll pass.
Such a delicious breakfast spot  and the covid precautions made my group feel comfortable  Will continue to eat at this Austin token many more times
Went this restaurant with friends.  It was great experiences.  Food was great and staffs are very friendly.  Will come back next time in Austin.

- do not bring in outside food or drinks  they will take it from you and hold it hostage at the front of the restaurant  Order the horchata  it was the biggest serving I ve ever had and one of the better horchatas I ve found in the states. The mahacado con huevo is a must  my friend ordered chorizo and it tasted like chorizo  my dish tasted unlike anything I ve ever had before.  Also  the inside is huge. They probably had about 30-40 people waiting outside for brunch on Saturday and we were told it d be a 15-20 minute wait. Amazing.
Oldie but goodie. They have great breakfast tacos and if you go for lunch  they have some of the best chicken enchiladas with green sauce. Usually has adequate parking.

The name is extremely catchy  I will give them that  But the food  not so much... we saw the reviews  a few people we know had said to go and try it  and we got pulled in by the fun name...  We went for breakfast and ordered a LOT on the menu to try different items. Everything we ordered had zero flavor and felt like we were eating retried beans out of a can.. maybe it was breakfast and what we got  but it was not good. The presentation is also below par...  The ambiance is not great  the service is not great  the wait time is extremely long for what you are getting  we live in a city with hundreds of food trucks that serve WAY better breakfast tacos   and the food is bland.  I would say if you are thinking about going here because if he clever name  don t.. if you were recommended by someone you know and trust  then go for it. I will go again someday to test it out and see  but it will be a while as there are way to many other great places to try in the city.

Juan In A Million would have gotten more stars because the migas taco was very good.  Loved it.  But the Don Juan El Grande Taco was not.  The description of the taco was misleading  and honestly kinda funny.  Eggs  They should not be added in the item description since you really could not find any eggs in the taco.   And   ...in a delicious hot tortilla.   You barely could even see the tortilla.  We had no idea that this taco was so gigantic that 3-4 people could eat one.  I don t know but I ve even many  many a taco over my lifetime  and breakfast tacos should be normal size so that maybe you could have a couple of different ones.  And there s no photo to let you know how friggin  huge this pile was.

The food was decent  atmosphere was okay and service was good. It took a long time for our meals to come but the owner s daughter frequented our table giving us an update on the food. Just odd that tables that came after us got their food well before us.  The salsa tasted weird so they got us new salsa and that was just mediocre.  The tacos were HUGE  definitely shareable. I got the taco salad  it was decent but I ve had better.   We sat outside  if you have an option  choose inside- it felt like we were in a hut in the back as the fans didn t work well. It was so hot by the time our ice waters sat on the table for a few minutes  the ice had melted.

This is a hole in the wall  gem of a restaurant  in a dive-y part of town that seems like it s going through some gentrification.  Either way  get in and get in early if you want some real  down-home Mexican food.  Our first visit  the place was pretty packed for 940am but we were quickly ushered to a seat while our waitress took our drink order.  Topochico for me and a Mexican coke for my hubby  also regular waters too.  She asked us immediately if we knew what we wanted  which we did not  so she zoomed away to another table.  All of the food flying out of the kitchen was covered with cheese  heaping helpings on a plate and it was pure comfort food.  My hubby got two breakfast tacos  yum  on what appeared to be homemade tortillas.  I felt lucky to be able to get the beef soup  caldo de res  with a side of Mexican rice for breakfast.  It came with two corn tortillas which I did not touch.  The soup was so delicious  the meat was a little tough but I just put that to the side.  I was really after the loads of veggies and broth.  I added in the perfectly cooked and seasoned rice.  I would order the bowl next time   Go ahead  get some  just wear some stretchy pants

I have never had Tex-Mex food so I was super excited to try when visiting Austin. Found this place on yelp because of the great review. We came when they open so it was not super crowded. This place is massive and they even have huge patio seating. As for food  I got their famous Don Juan EL Taco Grande. It was amazing  The potato  egg and bacon def make me filling and there is so much flavor in the taco with only  5.95. You can def share one with another person. I also love how they give a free basket of tortilla chips before the meal. People here were also super welcoming and friendly. I would def come back here when I visit Austin

Just left this place  we were seated and the drinks were brought. Then the waitress proceeded to ignore us and see to every other table but ours. There were no less than 4 other waitresses standing around doing nothing but watching the happenings on the floor. When we finally got tired of waiting and after we complained we decided to take our business elsewhere and we were still charged for the tea and coffee. This used to be a great customer service based business who if something went wrong it was made right  It s true what they say you go to an east side business  you get east side service

I stopped into this place right after a red eye flight from D.C. Needless to say  food was very much needed after a turbulent flight. Juan in a Million is a no-frills restaurant that serves good Mexican style food. They are known for their breakfast  brunch   so I decided to try the Migas  and they were great  The only downside was there was a little bit of a wait because it s not very large  but I didn t mind waiting a little bit. If you re looking for some solid food  check this place out. The portions are satisfying  and the food is good.

Well  we found our Austin breakfast spot  We visit Austin occasionally and love discovering the local restaurants. I have two hungry teenage boys who couldn t even finish their tacos. They are amazing - better than any we ve had. The chips are awesome too. We will definitely be coming back

Just like most  I wanted to visit this place due to it being on Man vs Food.   The place is pretty run down  service was almost non existent  and the food was okay. The one thing I do have to point out is that their chips and salsa were really good. Other than that  the tacos  fajitas  and enchiladas were whatever. None of the food was bad at all  but there wasn t anything that blew me away. There are so many Mexican restaurants to compete with  and you really have to be something special to stick out. Having a spot on a TV show won t save you for long if you choose to half ass what you should be passionate about.  There are dozens of other Mexican food joints located in Austin that do everything better.

Hmmm.... I was trying to understand what the 5 stars were all about and I think I know. The staff is super friendly  the portions are huge and the food is cheap.  Unfortunately  I was really disappointed by the taste. The tortillas were not grilled   cooked and since they were full of too many ingredients  the taco was breaking while I was eating. It was also difficult to appreciate the different elements within the taco.   Yelpers  it is important that you stop categorizing or calling Tex-mex restaurants Mexican because these are two very different types of food. With all due respect to Mr Juan  indistinctly throwing ingredients in a raw wheat tortilla is not Mexican. Mexican cuisine is elaborate  which is why it is considered intangible world heritage by UNESCO.

I love this place  You have to try it at least once if you are in Austin  I have tried other things on the menu but pretty much this sells it for me  A combo of bacon  eggs  and cheese  Super delicious and did I mention it s pretty cheap  I believe all you need is  5.95   tax and it will get you this delicacy   It could feed two or 3 depending how hungry you are  It will for sure feed one   You can free chips and salsa as well no matter what hour of the day it is  staff is always friendly quick and welcoming place looks a bit run down but is kept clean. Will keep coming back for years to come

Bla...the beginning of my review....nd...surely the end. I added salt and the taste just got tiring. So there you have it. The famous Juan in a million is all about size that makes people rate it so high. But for a real connoisseur of Mexican food  this is far from the experience you will want to remember.  The tortillas taste factory made. The Don Juan looks really dry. I didn t taste it but those at my table that did  weren t impressed with the exception of a 15 year old boy who would literally eat anything.  But if you want the experience of going somewhere in Austin that Adam Rich of Man vs Food tried a challenge  then come waste your money here. I m off to salt lick where I m hoping this trail Adam left picks up allot better and tastier.   It was nice to see the owner in person.  Hola and Prosper.
Best breakfast tacos I ve had in a minute.. hubby and I went earlier this week and loved their chorizo and been with cheese tacos
As good as advertised  For only  5.95  you can t beat it  Good ole home fashioned cooking. The salsa was great  Guacamole was great  Definitely coming back again one day when I m vacationing again

We went here last minute because our original breakfast spot didn t work out. So glad we did  Be warned- THESE BREAKFAST TACOS ARE HUGE. I got three thinking that they were going to be normal street tacos. I could barely finish them. They stuffed them full and all three tacos were so flavorful. I wish we lived in Austin so we could come here at least once a week. The service was also great even though they were busy. Our coffee and waters were always full and so were our chips and salsa. Would highly recommend

Awesome spot     Visited Austin for the weekend and was looking for a spot to stop for some Mexican food for lunch. Really glad we stopped here   Was greeted by Juan immediately when we walked in as he shook our hand and made us feel like we were regulars. He was the sweetest   Service was great and food was out of this world     Best chicken enchiladas and the refried beans had so much flavor  it tasted like they used smoked beans . Highly recommend and next time we are in town we will be stopping back here for sure
They prorated tax per entree and it was confusing. Also more Tex-Mex than authentic Mexican

Gotta stop here for breakfast every time I m in Austin or passing through. Their menudo is delicious and micheladas on point. Breakfast tacos could use a little more seasoning but I guess everyone has their preference in this area. They always have a wait but I ve never waited longer than 20 mins. Aside from that service is always A .

I ve lived in East Austin for two years now  and I finally decided to pay Juan in a Million a visit  however  I was disappointed. I got the bean and cheese breakfast taco  but the tortilla did not appear to be house made and the frijoles did not taste good. The salsa wasn t good  just picante. The horchata I ordered tasted like the Klass powder horchata. I won t be coming back or recommending this place to friends.

My first stop after arriving in Austin. Ordered the Don Juan El Taco Grande and the Con Queso Breakfast. The Con Queso breakfast was delicious. The Don Juan El Taco was dry. Wished I had ordered queso all over that taco. The place was really busy but it s really big with 3 separate seating areas  so we got seated quickly.

I feel like we may have ordered wrong. We got a few items off the breakfast menu instead of the Don Juan Taco  next time  . I got one of the breakfast plates with eggs and beans and tortillas. The most memorable item was definitely the refried beans - they were smoky with a meaty aftertaste  Everything else was fine.

This is a hopping  busy place and the proprietor does his best to greet everyone entering and leaving his place.  I think I made a bad choice in just ordering the taco dinner and it was nothing special.  I wish now I had gone for breakfast and tried one of the dishes that gets rave reviews here.  I will try again to give the place another chance.  It wasn t bad  but it didn t make me long to return.

I came here for the first time while visiting Austin a few days back. I ve heard all of my friends rave about it and so I needed to try this place out   Atmosphere  it s a very homey place - with family sized tables and an outside patio. It can seat 2 people to even a party of 12  which was how big my group of people turned out to be. It was a bit hot outside but the patio was cool and not humid.   Food  Even though we went for breakfast  chips and salsa were served almost immediately. The salsa was SPICY. It s not your usual spicy - it comes later and gradually increases as you consume one after another. I ordered the Don Juan  their breakfast special that consists of eggs  bacon and potatoes along with a few extra tortillas. When I say this  I am not exaggerating - the Don Juan was HUGE    Good thing I decided to share with my friend because I would have not been able to finish it. Even between the two of us  we couldn t finish it. The egg  sausage and potato mixture has a nice balance - it s not too salty and one flavor doesn t overcome the other. At such a low price  you re definitely getting your money s worth. Will be back later if I ever come to Austin again

Everything I was expecting Eastside hospitality and excellent food  Fresh  delicious with a smile and great service  Breakfast or lunch  brunch you can t go wrong. Nothing frilly just a good home feeling relax and get your grub on place  All the staff made you feel at home. Will return my sons loved it

I understand this is an East Austin staple but the food is not good quality. The eggs tasted like they were cooked in bacon grease  like everything is cooked on the same griddle and not cleaned. The guacamole was pretty flavorless and I needed to add salt and pepper to it. My friends and I felt sick after eating here. It just seemed like not good quality ingredients and it was pretty boring taste wise. The staff was nice though and it was cheap.

3.5 stars  really. Plenty to like here.   I hear that Juan likes to greet the customers and walks around chatting them up. Ya gotta appreciate that. He must take Mondays off though which is fine  cuz I wouldn t trade that for a weekend-style wait time.   The atmosphere here is nice  I enjoyed eating in the screened porch area  and the service is very friendly.  My main beef is that here s nothing special about the food  bottled o.j. from concentrate  non-dairy creamer  machine diced potatoes  diner quality coffee...  That s reflected in a slightly lower price point however  so you do pay for what you get.
This place was recommended as a cheap eat in Austin.  It was absolutely amazing   Beware....the Don Juan can feed 2-3 people

Juan In A Million is an Austin classic and it s been featured on Man vs. Food on the Travel Channel. You cannot come here without ordering the Don Juan el taco grande   It is a HUGE breakfast taco that is a combo of potato  egg  bacon and cheese. It comes with one tortilla but you can ask for extra to make some more tacos. The Don Juan is only  5 and some change and will make you at least 3 normal sized tacos  Also the salsa here is really good and actually spicy. Come here for cheap  amp  delicious food  big portions  and always friendly service

Whether you live in Austin or just visiting  if you ve never been to Juan In A Million  you need to do so  I recommend the Juan In a Million which is such a huge portion. It s a great place to start your day    I will say if you go during prime breakfast brunch times  then you will have to wait. There isn t enough seating for the amount of people that come to this restaurant at one time so it will be a bit cramped. Parking may be hard too but they have a parking lot behind the restaurant and there is street parking  but those are obviously first come  first serve.   This place is popular and it s a great price for the portion. I do hope they can expand their restaurant but other than that I do appreciate the authenticity of the place. Even though they ve become super popular  they still keep it very simple.

When you re in Austin for work and have just enough time for a quick meal on the way to the airport  Juan s is a perfect stop. Juan met us at the door with a warm smile  radiating warmth and welcome on an otherwise dreary rainy cold Austin Monday. He asked us whether we were coming or going  we weren t the only diners with suitcases . Going  we replied - back to California - he shook our hands and ushered us into the cozy restaurant. He then handed us off to a server who led us through a covered outdoor area with folding tables and chairs and heat lamps. We entered a separate indoor area with a two top and plenty of room adjacent for our two carry on wheeled suitcases.  The decor is basic but cheery - brightly colored walls and  White trim. The menus laminated with both photos and full descriptions. We were quickly served corn chips and a spicy red salsa - delicious with a bit of kick. The chips were more substantial than those I ve had elsewhere in Austin  lightly salted and addictive.  I ordered a sweet tea and my colleague a coffee.  I decided on the  CON QUESO BREAKFAST   Two eggs served any style with queso  carne guisada  refried beans  potatoes and two flour tortillas  I had scrambled .  Truth booth - there was a photo of this dish  which I partially selected because of the queso and after I googled what carne guidada was  a traditional Puerto Rican dish of stewed beef   I also ordered a side of guacamole - which was creamy and delicious and quite substantial.  My colleague had the migas with scrambled eggs and no beans  we were told the beans were cooked with bacon  which was a dietary no-go for her .  The food came quickly and was delicious and filling. We both only ate half of our meals. I really wanted to bring my leftovers for the flight but decided against it  Juan s seems best hot and fresh  I ll be dreaming about the fresh corn tortillas .  Juan bid us farewell - and safe travels to California - as we waited in line to pay at the register at the exit.  Overall  we were very happy with our strategic Austin pit stop before heading to the airport.   My friend who used to live in Austin says it was a locals breakfast haven - especially good after a night of drinking. I would go just for the warm welcome   amp  chips amp  guacamole  amp  queso  amp  tortillas .   If you re partial to a locals experience  this is the place to go. Breakfast brunch seems most popular

This is one of my favorite brunch spots in Austin    The food is PHENOMENAL and the friendly staff always makes it a wonderful experience.  Don t be turned off by the appearance outside - it s definitely more on the  Hole In The Wall  types of places.   This is one of the spots where all of the celebrities congressman athletes come through whenever they visit Austin.  You ll love it

Juan In A Million is basically breakfast taco heaven. The menu is full of mouthwatering breakfast taco options but  this being my first visit to the restaurant  I had to order their legendary Don Juan El Taco Grande. The mound of food was massive. A mixture of fluffy scrambled eggs  crispy bacon  soft potato  and cheddar cheese sat on top of flour tortillas. The combination of food was perfect  flavorful  filling  and inexpensive. Overall  Juan In A Million is a must visit when in Austin.

The Juan Taco  5 5   This is my advice  Come with a friend  come hungry and grab the Juan taco to share as well as some queso dip. Its that simple  The eggs were so well spiced  I couldnt quite figure it out  The spice blend was something I have never tasted before and the bacon was super crispy. I would definitely come back

Came in from Houston and found this little gem. We were here for 4 days and had breakfast there TWICE  The carne guisda is sooooo good   I had the con queso breakfast both times because it was just THAT good. The queso is pretty average but the carne quisada is perfect. We were pleasantly surprised that they provided fresh chips and salsa for our breakfast... the refried beans were another star of the show  very fresh and delicious.  We will be back

This is a classic neighborhood Mexican restaurant - the checks are written out versus having an electronic system  but they are on top of their games. There is seating inside as well as out on the patio on picnic tables.  We came as a group of 12. They were able to seat us within minutes and gave us our own private area  which was great. The service was fantastic and our waitress was on top of her game. Drinks came quickly.  We ordered queso and guac for the table - neither are anything to write home about  but still good. The fajitas looked great - you tell them how many you want and they come out already prepared. The quesadillas and burritos come with a boiled chicken  but you can request fajita chicken and I would very much suggest doing that.

We normally really enjoy this place but we went for breakfast today and sat on tha patio while a bird few around and trying to get out. On customer tried to open the patio door so it could get out and one of the waitresses told her to stop. The waitress also said it s been suck in there since yesterday. Why wouldn t you call pest control. Bird literally hit someone trying to leave. Disgusting.

The definition of Tex Mex comfort food....heaven on a plate. They have the most delicious queso in existence...and I didn t know eggs could taste that good. I love the Con Queso Breakfast  my wife loves the Don Juan and their menudo. Chips are yummy bright yellow  with super spicy salsa. ....As a vegetarian  I have to make some  allowances  to eat here  since it seems everything is flavored with bacon or lard  but  uhh..  chows down   Juan in a Million gets quite crowded on peak hour  so I recommend coming off-peak if you can or calling in a to-go order.   The service is so-so  and the place itself is pretty humble looking  but the food makes it worth it.

This was the worst food we had in Austin. if you come to Austin  you ll see right away that it is the land of the fancy food truck and there is crafted gourmet food on every corner. I think this restaurant got buzz on a TV show a while back  and it has a catchy name  but I could barely eat my breakfast taco. It was loaded with too much bacon  who k ew that could be a thing  and cold cheese. I would totally skip it this downer and go to Veracruz instead.

If you want breakfast tacos that s quick  very filling and delicious  this is the place to come  The owners and staff are really nice and Juan Sr really does have one of the best hand shakes ever  If you re in the Austin area this is a good go to place

Diet Coke in a can rather than fountain  Sorry  this matters to me  this is a place that charges for refills and serves you out of a can  not cool.  The food is good  why ruin the experience with cheapness. Ordered Juevos Rancheros. Diced potatoes  over easy eggs  refried beans  two tortillas. We also ordered the Don Juan Taco Grande.  They asked if we wanted extra tortillas with that and we said  no   mistake. Ask for extra tortillas  at least three. It comes with one tortilla that is laid got on the plate and a huge mound of filling covers it  impossible to use that tortilla without first eating three quarters of the filing with a fork. So unless you plan on eating it with a fork  get at least three extra tortillas.  This is not a fancy place. It is homey  straight up food. And it s good.

It s been 3-4 years since I came here  but it s always busy and good time when we do come. It was a quick 15 minute wait  but always worth it. I got the do Juan taco grande  his famous breakfast taco  and it was so delicious  My plate was so full and they give so much food  it looked like I didn t even touch my plate. You get more than you think and it s reasonably priced at  6.95  A very great deal  I will come back every time I m here  I also met Juan again lol
Good food  friendly service  shockingly short wait for 10a.m on a Sunday. Party of 3 took less than 5 minutes. Tons of food comes with the meal  all of which was delicious. The Don Juan was delicious

It s practically criminal that neither of us had ever been here. What kind of Austinites are we   We changed that on Saturday.  We got to Juan In A Million pretty early  and after some initial confusion about where we were going to be sat  we had such a fun time here. The coffee is regular and strong  and the food is greasy and breakfast-perfect. We initially thought we had it in us to do the Don Juan challenge as a family  but ended up chickening out and getting it as a single portion. It was nice and filling  but we loved the migas we also ordered more and there were plenty of leftovers to bring home. Our daughter enjoyed her scrambled eggs and walking around the place like a little baby boss.  All in all  a great Austin institution that we re happy has survived east side gentrification. We ll be back  and will have to start bringing more of our guests here as well.

Here we go    1. Get here early.  crowds form around 9 on the weekends   2. Order the Don Juan with 2 extra tortillas 3. And maybe a breakfast beer  4. Eat all of it  or at least try to   5. Be happy and have a nice day. Because you just had one of the best darn breakfasts in Austin for under  5  pending breakfast beer selection  and it was served by people who are kind  attentive  and enjoy what they do.   Short review - one of the best breakfast options  both for quality and price  in Austin hands down. Enjoy

For my 500th review  ... this place really is  juan  in a million     COMP - Tortilla  amp  salsa   even at 8am in the morning...  amazing crispy chips though   And that salsa is one hot motherf    r     GET - Breakfast migas   came to Austin. Heard about migas everywhere  a must have   Braised chicken   tortilla strips   cheese  all wrapped in tortillas.  Yums     YES - Fast  friendly service   YES - THREE separate dining areas.  I felt like the waitress put us in the best indoor dining option  clean  well-ventilated  quiet.   YES - Inexpensive and delicious Tex-Mex cuisine    WOA  - Free parking lot out front - Joint looks like a liquor store from the outside   But full-on dining feel once inside

The awesome thing about Juan In A Million is that the owner is usually on hand to greet his clients in person. This totally sends me back to the 70s when Matt would greet his clients at the old downtown Matt s El Rancho.  For us  it s just a short walk  which is very nice.   The food is good solid  Tex Mex  but nothing really stands out for me. Good salsa  ok beans.   But somehow the Juan has tapped into the Hipster clientele. The long lines seem to put off our old timey neighbors who often wonder aloud how on earth the place got so popular.   Mostly they don t believe anyone would stand in line for those beans   Another really great thing about Juan s is they host meetings for local Hispanic business association-- which is a great service to the community  It might actually make up for some of the ugly scooters their hipster clients leave strewn about the sidewalks.   Overall  we re glad to see a locally grown business do so well and visit now and then when there are no lines snaking down the sidewalk or scooters to dodge.

My family and I took a day-trip to Austin for New Years Day 2018. Someone had seen Juan In A Million on TV for their monster taco  or something  that you have to eat in under a certain amount of time to get a T-shirt  or something.    Basically  it seemed like a neat addition to Austin worth checking out if you re in the neighborhood  and that s exactly what we did. At first  we considered just driving by and looking at the outside. But there was a large crowd of people pouring into the door  so we figured it must be good. We parked  in whatever little spots were left  and joined the crowd.  There was a hostess with the magical wait list in her hand standing at the front door. She saw us approach from the street  but she did not greet us  despite making direct eye contact with me. Instead  she shut the door in our faces and went back inside. We went in and decided that if she couldn t give us the time of day  their servers probably wouldn t either. We decided to take our tacos to go.   I saw  Juan  behind the counter. He seemed like a nice enough man but he was obviously busy and didn t notice his hostesses being indifferent towards the guests. My family placed their to go order  and I asked one of the girls where the restroom was. She waved her hand in the general direction of the back room and said  oh  it s that way.  Again  the indifference was painful.   I went to the restroom  but it was in use. They have exactly one bathroom for each gender. There was one hostess  and another female employee standing outside the restroom near this sink and they were both on their phones talking about how they hated how busy it was  and that they just wanted to go home. The hostess took the restroom when it was free  phone in hand. It s ashamed she didn t offer the only free restroom to a customer  but maybe that s my personal opinion.   On another note  while I was waiting for my turn in the restroom  another hostess forced my family to wait outside in the 30  weather for their to go order despite there being plenty of room to wait inside. That s also a little rude.   Anyhow  we left  and I was glad. No one told us goodbye. They just handed us our to go food  said  The salsas are in the bag  and walked off.   The salsas were  in fact  in the bag. The food was pretty good. I had the quesadillas which came with a generous amount of guac and sour cream. The fajita inside the quesadilla  however  was extremely chewy and hard to swallow.   Would I go back  Maybe  probably  nah.

My love for this place knows no bounds   I will celebrate being their 800th review thus   This has been our go-to morning after Saturday breakfast place for quite some time.   I first learned of this place as a runner for a local law firm  but never experienced the beauty that is the Don Juan until after I moved.  A pilgrimage takes place regularly when I am back in town.  Order this sucker with guac  you ll thank me later  as well as two extra tortillas.  Trust  this one taco is a beast and those extra tortillas will be needed.  The chips are fresh and the salsa is good and spicy.  If you re lucky the owner will be around to share his legendary handshake with you and what else can I say that hasn t already been covered in the other 799 reviews   Sure  the wait can be long thanks to its TV appearances as well as its great food  but trust me  you will not leave disappointed my friends.  Or hungry for that matter.

First time visit to Juan in a Million  and I m a fan.  I ordered the Don Juan thinking it was going to be some piddly little taco.  It was huge  and covered in cheese.  I had to stop halfway through just to let my food settle.  My only reason for giving 4 stars was because the line wrapped around the building and it took 30 minutes to get seated.  Otherwise a great experience.

Oh man  so happy to return to this awesome mainstay. It truly is Juan in the million. Very well managed  fresh  lovely guacamole- decent flautas  Even Martha Stewart has been there.  If you visit Austin - check it out to see what old Austin is about.
Unfortunately I d had high hopes for this place. The food was pretty bland. Not much flavor at all. It was luke warm too  prefacing I did use Uber eats delivery . Price point is reasonable.

Long wait in the rain but totally worth it. Make sure to ask for extra tortillas for this taco - it easily fit into three other tortillas to make extra tacos  I was stuffed by the time I left  all for under  7.

I m going to give 3.5 stars. Juan in a Million seems to be on the ever long lists of places to try in Austin. We got there around 9 30 a.m. on a Saturday and there wasn t a wait. The longer we were there  a line had started to form. Service was good and quick. The salsa was good and spicy. The queso was subpar but tasted better by adding their salsa into it. The refried beans were my favorite. The breakfast tacos were good but the tortillas didn t taste like they were homemade. I tried a bite of my friend s Huevos Rancheros and it was good. Bottom line  will I go back  Yes. Will I wait in a long line  No.

Great service for how busy they were. We arrived at peak hours but people were rotating out so quick couldn t even noticed  wait time was only 10-12 min. Food was great I got the chorizo and egg came with beans and tortillas  and I ordered a side of bacon  very authentic Tex Mex reminded me of my moms cooking. If I wasn t so hungover I would have gotten the signature taco  it s a massive breakfast taco that s pretty much 4 tacos in one. WARNING salsa is HOT  I know first rule of salsa or hot sauce don t believe anyone until you try it  but as a frequent hot sauce eater and Hispanic...it s freakin hot. Our waitress said  pensa que estaban nojadas   I think they were mad  it s Mexican folklore that when a person is mad or upset the salsa they make will be super spicy. Parking is scares and it s in a rough part of town that s being gentrified. I see a lot of that in Austin.
Place was packed when we came here. Barely any parking but food is soo good. Came out very quick not a long wait at all. Perfect food for a hangover
This place is definitely lover hyped. Their tacos and burritos are basic. The Don Juan was not even good which is what they re known for. You can find better food elsewhere

This is a cool divey place with great food. I love the fact that they ve attached a couple of homes together with a large patio cover to create a groovy one-of-a-kind Austintateous Mexi-CAN restaurant. I suggest the beef and chicken fajitas because they are really tasty and cooked to perfection. Chips and hot sauce  great hot sauce too  abound and the service was spot on.

Ahh I love this place  Austin wouldn t be the same without it   I always come on Saturday mornings after crew practice. The go-to for value is the Don Juan which is a HEAP of potatoes  eggs  cheese  and bacon  and you can order extra tortillas.   The horchata is the huge and definitely one of the best I ve ever had in my life.  The caldo de res is super yummy and feels like home  super good on a colder day or sick day.  This place is always really busy but all the servers are so nice

Food is great and their portions are pretty big and decent. The place is kinda small  but the service was great and they re pretty quick. They do get busy  so be sure to get there early especially if you have a big party.

Outside looks like a whole in the wall. Nothing wrong with that. I had the don juan taco it was hot and fresh. Definetly order extra tortillas. Which brings me to the tortillas are not homemade but they are hot. It was a little pricey compared to other places. The service was great and very attentive.

Juan in a Million is one in a million when it comes to experience. You re always greeted by the owner  maybe Juan  and you ll never leave with an empty stomach. People line up down the street to get a chance to taste the food here and it s well worth the visit.   I m not a big fan of the food  it s a tad overrated  but it comes in huge piles and the prices are reasonable. Honestly the real reason you should go is to her a handshake from the man himself

Our experience originally was pleasant. We were greeted by a very friendly staff and the service and food was great. The reason I am leaving only one star is the following day after our visit we parked in the back parking lot and started to explore the area.  We were parked maybe 20 minutes and came back to a boot on our vehicle.  The man who worked for the towing company was extremely rude and told us we parked in the lot where if you leave the premises you get a boot tow and explained that Juan in a million restaurant contract them out to do this. The ONLY sign that said no parking and leaving the area is small and only at one entrance to the lot making it almost impossible to see or notice   BE CAREFUL WHEN PARKING IN THE AREA- it cost us  150 to get the boot removed. Sadly  we will not return to the area

This place is worth the hype  Came here on a Sunday afternoon and the place was packed  but we were able to be seated right away. There s also a large parking lot out back which was a huge plus. They brought out chips and salsa  be warned the salsa is spicy    promptly and all of the staff were very friendly. I ended up getting the Don Juan without bacon  and it was excellent. I d recommend adding a tiny bit of the salsa if you want extra spice  but by itself it is excellent. The portions are also very large.   Overall  it s a great Austin staple with good food and friendly staff. Highly recommend

This review is for breakfast tacos only  Man  the owner makes this place so much better  He treats everyone like you are part of the family. The tacos are PACKED full of breakfast food. I can only eat one  but I don t have the biggest stomach. Great service  great food. 5 Stars

But really...  Where else can you go in Austin that is authentic Mexican  has very affordable and delicious food  AMAZING Horchatas  friendly staff  friendly owner  and is close proximity to downtown    Not much places. Is it touristy  Sure. But it s a great spot and I think everyone should check it out    The Don Juan taco  a big glass of horchata  and chips  amp  guacamole are my go-to items.
Get the don Juan. As a smaller person  it was big enough for 2 meals. You can order to-go or dine in.

In terms of value  this place isn t bad... a super filling Don Juan can leave your stomach packed for lunch and pre-packed for dinner. If Don Juan is the only thing you d get at this restaurant and if you don t mind the lines  the rating would be higher.  But if you want to explore the other aspects of the menu and take into consideration wait times and service  then the rating begins to slip. I ordered the beef fajitas with a side of potatoes today  and the food was good but not swooooon-worthy. The beef was cooked well but didn t have much flavor. It wasn t until I mixed it with the refried beans  guacamole  and potatoes in the tortilla that the flavors started kicking in  but honestly  it was pretty yummy.   The main reason why Juan gets 3 stars from my ballot is the service and wait time. I came with a party of 15  and it took us around 20-30 minutes to get seated even though a  there were many open tables and b  I had told them that the party was willing to split up to expedite the seating process. Ok  so a 20-30 minute wait isn t too bad when your company is A ... but what about waiters charging you for a mistake they made when they took the order   What happened was we ordered 14 Don Juans even though we had 15 people. The waiter  assuming everyone wanted a Don Juan  put down 15. And when we were paying  he and the cashier wouldn t let us leave until we paid for the unpurchased 15th  even though everyone in our party clearly reiterated his her order. A restaurant should prioritize customer experience over a measly profit  and Juan In A Million failed to do so today. I m open to coming back again  but this experience was a let-down for something I d been looking forward to for a while.
Don Juan. Literally that s it... side of beans and Mexican coke if you re feeling fancy. Soo good.

It s a must visit place in Austin because Man vs. Food did a challenge here. I ve met the owner and his son a while back  and they were really nice. This is popular hole in the wall place not just because of MvF  but also b c the food is pretty legit for the value.    The  Don Juan  breakfast taco is the best thing here. It s loaded with potato  bacon  egg  and cheese. I m not a fan of potato  but still enjoyed it very much. The flour tortillas are great. The portion is huge for less than  5. It comes with extra tortillas so you can make a butt load of tacos from one taco. The salsa is so spicy that it burns so good.

Food was deeeeee-lish  Also the line was out the damn door  but literally only had to wait about 15-20 mins for a table  That is pretty awesome considering there was about 5-7 parties waiting. I ordered the con queso breakfast and it was yum  My partner order then famous Don Juan El Taco Grande and it was gigantic   If you are visiting Austin Tx I suggest checking this little place out.

There is just so much food for so cheap  The food itself wasn t mind blowing but they were good. If you are the type of person who likes the food to be separated neatly and not mushed into one big thing  then this place will likely turn you off because plating things neatly is not something this type of place will do. We had the migas and the Don Juan breakfast tacos. The added sausage to the migas helped the taste in my opinion and the husband said the salsa that came with the chips for free at the table helped make the breakfast tacos less boring. The portion is ridiculously large  deceiving when you see the plate . Both of us barely ate half of what we ordered  I have no idea how someone can eat the entire plate   but you can always take leftovers home with you.  The queso was too runny  but the salsa that came with the chips for free at our table was awesome albeit hot  and no warnings  so eat at your own risk     The restaurant had plenty of seating-we were initially worried that there would be lots of waiting around since it seems popular with the locals but they seated us no problem  they had three distinct seating areas throughout what I guess is a converted house . Try it out  it s plenty cheap and you won t come out hungry

I can t even wait to leave the restaurant first before I write this review. Service is fantastic and our server is very attentive. Food was great  although my chicken fajita was a bit dry. Refried bean was delish  I wanted to give 4 1 2 star because of the fajita but the service we had today was so good that made up for it.

Does not live up to the hype  My wife and  I went here after readIng reviews such as   top 50 in the USA . What a disappointment  under  seasoned  sloppy Tex Mex that wouldn t make it  onto the top 50 breakfast tacos in Austin  100  would not recommend. Also  we did not have our hands shaken by Juan as promised in all of the hype

The owner gives the most welcoming handshakes. Careful  it will catch you off guard if you re not careful  The Don Juan is amazing. A pile of bacon  eggs  and cheese. I usually ask for 3 extra tortillas and I can get 4 tacos out of all the fixin s. The lemonade is fresh squeezed every day and doesn t disappoint and the margaritas are delicious. The staff is very welcoming and kind. You feel like your at home when you come here.

If I had been Yelping when I was a college freshman  this would be the easiest 5 to review in my life. Unfortunately  I think for me that the magic is gone from Juan in a Million.  Of course the Don Juan is worth it - it s an absurdly large amount of food for  5. I was able to get 4 hefty flour tacos from a single plate  and I could feel my stomach rebelling from the amount of food I put in it.  I don t know if it s because the potatoes are in big chunks in comparison to the other main ingredients  cheese  eggs  bacon   but it sort of felt like it was mostly a potato and cheese taco with some eggs and bacon.  Also  the salsa here is no joke. I m pretty sure the salsa is blended and not cut by hand because of how watery it is  and it s ridiculously spicy. I like a tolerable yet spicy heat in certain foods  and this is off the charts bad. It cuts pretty well through the heaviness of the tacos  though.  Still  it s fun to come here and eat one of the most famous dishes in Austin - although I really can t believe who on earth would eat 8 plates of the Don Juan for funsies. I would rather pay an extra couple of bucks for a better breakfast taco elsewhere  though.

I recently moved to Austin from San Diego  CA and have been in search for tacos that would fulfill my cravings. Juan in a million is definitely Juan in a million. I came here with my boyfriend around noon on a Thursday  and the place was buzzing. We were greeted by Juan himself  and we loved his enthusiasm. He really takes care of you and makes you feel welcome just like family. There was a good amount of people waiting outside  but it only took like 15 minutes max for us to get seated. We ordered the Don Juan El Taco Grande  a must try   a chorizo and potato taco  barbacoa taco  sausage and egg taco  and chips with chile con queso  also a must try . The Don Juan is gigantic  We loved all the tacos and even had leftovers. I believe it cost about  19. Not expensive at all especially for the quantity of food. Overall  safe to say I will be coming here often. Juan in a Million is an Austin staple.

After spending a few days in Austin  I ve came to realize the huge obsession of the breakfast taco. Out of the few breakfast tacos that I ve tried in Austin this is by far my favorite. I came in on an a Sunday morning around 10am and I got a table right away. I ordered the Don Juan breakfast taco with an extra tortilla. Chips and salsa were brought out first  always a good start. Salsa had a really nice spice to it which I love. Then  taco came out. This taco is freakin HUGE  The amount of filling in this can literally make about 3-4 tacos. The filling of egg  cheese  potato  and bacon was really flavorful and super filling. I would totally come back for one of these breakfast tacos when in Austin.

We stopped here for breakfast before a hike on a winter day and  despite plenty of space inside  the harsh ladies insisted that we sit outside on the  heated  patio. The heater was concentrated in one section only. And the patio was cold.   I ordered the migas platter with shredded cheese  an extra  1 . The plate arrived smothered with disgusting  queso  sauce. That s not cheese  The migas where hard cooked scrambled eggs with tomato and a few bits of tortilla. Served with regrows beans  which were good  and fried potatoes  nothing special .   Can t recommend this place in a city filled with excellent choices.
Yep. Come here. Hangover cure of the century. Order the Don Juan with 3 extra tortillas-- Bloody Mary was straight to the point and solid.  Hi Joe

Sadly this review is due to the poor service I received. I walked in with 30 min to spare until closing around 2 30pm. We were not well received  welcomed by numerous dirty looks from most of wait staff. We were then rushed to a table.  There were three of us dining and in an attempt to rush to get our drink orders  the server only took 2 3 drink orders  and completely ignored my friend. When I ordered coffee  I was told that they might already be out because they were closing soon. WOW  You are not closed yet  so make me a fresh pot asshole  right   Then when she brought us our coffee  she only brought 2 3 coffees  again ignoring the fact that there were three of us.  Everything seemed to be a chore for our server. Her energy and behavior was very off putting.  We received no refills on drinks or salsa. The food was meh...Seriously felt very unwelcome here. We were not even the last group to come in and be served. Numerous people walked in after us  Very unprofessional. I waited tables for years and its server 101 that you seat people  serve them and do so with respect until the very last minute if you mean to retain customers.   Sorry Juan  very disappointed.

what a fun place to go  as a college student . They give you massive portions for really cheap prices. Food is delicious  comes out piping hot. Staff always friendly. Their salsa is really really good  a bit spicy but that s perfect. Get the don juan in the morning  take a nap  and then go out and explore austin. Definitely an experience.

We drove from Houston To Austin and researched top Tex-Mex restaurants and the best rating was for Juan in a Million. I ll start w the positives - the chicken enchiladas  Monterey Jack quesadilla and Fajita soft taco were absolutely delicious w tender meat  tons of cheese and fresh bright vegetables.  The waitress was very warm and friendly and walked us to our table immediately upon entering the restaurant.  That being said  we were not impressed w our bland and boring Margie and Bloody Mary - lacking in flavor and aesthetic appeal. The chips in our basket were obviously from the bottom of the bag  small and broken  so I had to request a basket w actual chips instead of crumbs. Our table was over what looked like a puddle originating from a crack in the tile. The ceiling is filthy  there were napkins  chips  garbage all over the floor. The bathroom is scary and looked like it belonged in the bag of a gas station in the middle of nowhere. There was no music  no Tex-mex  no ambience and quite frankly I was afraid to touch anything really....So  the overall feeling was one of disappointment for the overall environment  but with a feeling of appreciation for their delicious food.

I ve been hearing great things about this place for years now and it lived up to the hype.  A modest  small neighborhood Tex mex restaurant  unassuming with a simple but well executed menu.  The Don Juan was enormous  I made 4 tacos out of it  all delicious.  I have no idea how Man vs Food ate 4 Don Juan s    But the star of the show for me was the menudo  which I rarely order  but perfect for a cold rainy day.  This Holy Grail for Tex Mex should be on every foodie bucket list

Juan s is worth a visit for the history and for the experience. You ll want to get there early to score a seat  but even if you have to wait  the owner  Juan   stands at the door and greets everyone with such veracity that it s hard to be upset.   I feel bad saying that these are not my favorite migas or breakfast tacos in town  as though admitting that equates to blasphemy against some part of Austin itself  but I m truly partial to Jo s and feel that I must be up front about it here. The migas taco was very good  the guacamole taco is hilarious  as it is just guacamole  albeit  delicious guacamole  in a soft tortilla. All orders  even breakfast  are served with fresh chips and spicy salsa. The coffee is terrible  but cheap  so you can take it or leave it. The seating area is actually five different seating areas all united under a cloth roof  so you might end up sitting  inside    outside   or in a separate  dining  room.   Juan s is an adventure worth having  but in a city full of options for migas and tacos  it didn t blow me away.

4.5 5  Heard about this place from our Uber driver who was born and raised in Austin. It s true the Don Juan taco was way more than enough for my fianc  and I. With the chips  salsa and queso we still had a mount of delicious stuffing left  Don t forget to get extra tortillas on the side. Total just  13 and we were so full.   Took away0.5  Star for dirty utensils. Other than that good stuff

My boyfriend and I went out of the way to get some breakfast tacos from Juan In A Million.   This is definitely a place where you could just drive by and easily miss it. That being said  around 11 30 am - 12 pm  the line does get bumping outside and draws a crowd. We arrived on a Saturday morning at about 10 30 am and only had to wait for about 10 minutes.   This place is deceivingly big -- There is actually another room that is part of the restaurant in the back that has AC and can seat about another 6-8 tables. This area is where we sat and was actually much less crowded than the first part of the restaurant that you walk into when being seated.   My boyfriend went for the Don Juan  he had 3 tortillas with it  and was able to finish most -- I was impressed  I had one bite and loved the taste of it  too. I had one breakfast taco with chorizo  egg and cheese and then a Miga. The waitress said this was very popular for a breakfast taco and although I do not remember everything in it   it was some sort of combination of egg  cheese  onion  tomato  I do remember that it was very good.   The wait staff is a little slow  so don t come here for a quick bite if you are in a rush. But they are friendly and bring you out a bowl of chips salsa upon your arrival and continuously re-fill your coffee while dining.

Beware  On Sunday  my friend and I ate breakfast here around 11 am. After we paid  we took her leftovers to my car so we could walk down the block and see a little of the neighborhood.   We were gone for maybe five minutes. When we got back to our car  they d placed a parking boot on my tire.   Juan in a Million boots its own customers cars via its private parking police. Then charges them  150 to get it removed.   The guy who removed the boot explained   We watched y all come back to your car  put your leftovers inside  and then walk away. You left the property so we booted you.   Which means they were staked out  watching us. Instead of saying   Hey  don t walk away or we will have to boot your car   they just let us walk right by. They WANTED that  150. Badly.   I like the crappy food here. But I ll never go back. Because they re more interested in screwing over their customers for a few bucks than being good hosts.   Super gross.

The service was great we meet Juan and the staff and we felt welcomed as soon as we entered. The rice was really good. Savory and served warm like it should be. The margarita wasn t as strong as I d like it to be. They said I had to buy a shot  Like what  I ve never heard that before but it was good nonetheless. Ps no burritos -

The review were so overrated. We were visiting from NY figuring out if we should move to Austin and heard about the place online and tv. But it was disappointing. The service was disappointing. The food was basically things I can make at home. The one major dish they have that tasted very good was their retried beans. I have never had refr es beans like that before and they were delicious. But that s about it. Not going back.

Service was nice and servers are friendly  They give too much of food in a plate that one can eat. I could only eat little than a half of my plate .  I ordered there breakfast taco option of egg and bacon in taco. Was decent enough - had very high expectations

Average tasting tacos  average size at an above average price.  This is not a place that I am dying to go back to.  Not terrible but not great.  Also about half of the taco filling that the pictures show.

This place was amazing. During our trip to Austin  Texas we visited this place a few times. They are known for their breakfast tacos and we got a few each time. We tried several and they were all so good. For this location parking was pretty easy  but it does get pretty packed in the morning.  Over the course of several days we were able to try the migas taco  Jess special  the vaquero  Frontera fandido  and akaushi picadilla  amp  eggs. My favorite was the akaushi breakfast taco. It has some ground beef eggs salsa and cilantro. All these tacos go great with their many salsas. And that is just one more thing that I love about this place. The salsas were all fantastic also.

My only complaint is they didn t keep the curbside pickup parking spots. Loved the convenience of popping by while not having to get out of the car when out and about   When I m looking for a quick taco option that never lets down  I like to stop at Taco Deli. It s affordable  the establishment is clean and staff very nice. I ve never had any issues with my food coming from this Tacodeli.   All good things

This is one busy Taco Deli location. However  the staff is always super friendly. I also love how easy it is to do online ordering. When things get busy  the order might not be ready  but the staff always checked where my order were. I appreciate the small gesture.  My go-to order is just breakfast tacos.
