Place was super busy on a Saturday night. You can make a reservation so def do that. The food was really good  Service was spot on too  The employees have good attitudes and great customer service. The margaritas looked so good but I didn t get one this time.

As good as any Mexican food you re gonna get  The mole was outstanding. My son had a burrito and absolutely loved it. My wife had a veggie plate and said it was delicious. We ll be back again  and again.

Much overdue review for ElDorado. I really love this cute  low key spot. It reminds me of old Austin  not sure if I should say that or not  but it s the truth. Amazing service every time we ve visited. I even used them in May for pick up catering for my father s birthday. As a beef enchilada connoisseur  he was delighted and thoroughly enjoyed his birthday lunch and the sides  rice  black beans and grilled veggies . 2 weeks ago I visited with my bestie-- She loved her chicken tostadas and Paloma. I tried a new dish for me  the burrito. This was some of the most flavorful carnitas I ve tasted in a while. So. Good. The mango margaritas were equally enjoyable. See y all soon ElDorado

Food  5 5 El Dorado is such a hidden gem that serves up the best Tex-Mex in Austin. Although it is slightly more expensive compared to other Austin Tex-Mex staples  El Dorado follows up with better food to scale. The El Dorado burrito  Supa Queso  and Chicken enchiladas were stellar. CANNOT WAIT TO COME BACK   Service  5 5 WOW  just WOW  The staff here is so friendly and welcoming. Even when having to wait for a table  the hostess directed us to the bar to order margaritas. One of the managers continued to check in on us while we waited for a table with a huge smile on his face as he welcomed other guests. Other restaurants need to take note because El Dorado staff is TOP TIER   Environment  5 5 El Dorado is very clean and fits the Tex-Mex vibe that others aspire to replicate. The location is tucked away in a strip mall  but don t let that fool you
Excellent food. Can t believe I waited for an hour and 20 mins  but worth it. Wish they would expand to a larger location or further north.

Updating because we still love this place  and even more so. It s my husband s go-to for his birthday and promotions. I ordered the Las Cruces Banado burrito plate and it was  chef s kiss . Officially a new favorite for both of us   Amazing even as take-out.
Our favorite neighborhood restaurant  Food  service  margaritas  ambiance...all top notch and worth the wait. I almost don t want them to get too much more popular -- they re just THAT good

Really great Mexican food in town   I was in town with a friend and grabbed dinner here on a Wednesday night. They were able to seat us quickly and very courteous. The staff was personable and upbeat which made for a fun experience.  The food - so yummy  I got tacos and my friend got the burrito. Large portions and very tasty. We also got margaritas which were out of this world   Highly suggest a visit here

My former boss raved about this place for a long a   time  and finally he took me there for lunch and I fell in love with this gem hidden inside this strip center.   They offer several salsa options and my personal favorite that I recommend to everyone is their salsa x. It has a unique Smokey flavor and reminds me of my moms chutney  so perhaps I m biased but everyone s loved it. Definitely has a good kick without it being overwhelming.  Their crispy beef tacos are the best in town.   Their cabo salad with the sherry vinaigrette is satisfying and has a good flavor  amp  texture balance.   The thunder Rosa taco is SPICY. That pepper is no joke so I recommend just taking it out if you can t handle spice.   I ve ordered catering from here and was impressed how all the food was packaged and the quality of it.   My only cons are the enchiladas suiza is well made but personally it was a bit too tangy for my taste and the balance wasn t there and the margs could be stronger but that s it.  Highly highly recommend if you re in the area and  supportlocal

Ordered the chilaquiles rojas and it was SO good  Definitely would come back again and order it again   Also ordered two of the breakfast tacos. They were also good  but comparing it to the chilaquiles  it just didn t compare.   Their house made salsas are also on point  Definitely order some of them as they have a great variety.   The staff was extremely friendly  quick  and very helpful  Would definitely recommend checking this place out and will definitely go back again and again.

This may be my absolute fave Mexican spot in all of Austin. Tucked away in a strip center off Anderson Mill  this colorful spot offers fast  friendly service and the food is always fresh and prepared perfectly. On a recent visit we tried the enormous burrito and the carnitas with the freshest  hot  tortillas. The Carnitas Cubanos were savory and had a satisfying crispness to them. Paired with a generous side salad and black beans  it was a large enough portion for two. The salsa packs a punch and is tangy  spicy and savory. If Taco Deli Dona sauce and Roja sauce had a love child  this would be it. Apparently the owner once worked at TD  which is why their masked potatoes are similar but BETTER. The entrees come with several choices for side dishes and the menu is varied. This is always on the map for me when I m north of the river.

Literally the BEST service I ve had here in Austin.   Joel  who is the owner  was so accommodating and he even gave me suggestions for other restaurants to try in town   Their Supa Chalupa was absolutely one of the best tacos I ve had hands down

I struggled to like my meal here. As a lifelong Tex-Mex fan I wanted to. I found it from a great review in an Austin Best Of list. A lot of people clearly love it. I have the X salsa  the guacamole  and the standard enchiladas with chicken  rice and beans. Best was the guacamole  but even that was a bit creamy for my taste. The thin and light texture chips had some kind of dusting of seasoning  which is an immediate negative for me. The salsa made them worse and I immediately knew I was in trouble. Wrong choice of salsa  average guacamole  chips I wouldn t eat over a salad. And the enchiladas looked great but were a mashed up and uninspired taste. I just couldn t pick out the flavors. Seemed more new style than old  and I m clearly an old style pardner.

Recently came here for the first time and I am now a regular. I was looking for a Mexican style breakfast place exactly like this and my expectations were matched and even exceeded. The Chilaquiles  Freddie s Plate  and the potato croquettes were all amazing. I also tried a watermelon Fresca which was so fresh and delicious. I also love that they have so many salsa options for you to choose from rather than just one house salsa. I am fan for life

Oh how happy I am that your doors are open again for dining in.  While to-go carried me through my enchilada cravings  it s just never as good as getting those piping hot plates of yum placed in front of me amidst the buzz of people and chatter.   Never had a bad experience here   Service  drinks  food have been on point. It s a unique menu and I m grateful for it. In a city with Tex-Mex galore  the lean towards interior Mexican is worth its weight in mole.   The Sandinista is innocent looking but beware merriment will ensue   .  Even without a reso  get your name added to the walk in list  order a libation  go outside and enjoy some convo with the locals.

I found this little gem to be a very charming family friendly restaurant with great service and excellent food. Everyone was friendly and helpful and everything we ordered was delicious. They also have a bevy of salsa choices  of which the smoky creamy medium and the scorpion are both delicious. Will be trying the avocado salsa next time. Onto my favorites   THE SUPA QUESO. I mean yes it s hard to mess up cheese  but seriously I could not stop myself from eating it. Note to self  combining beans and guacamole with queso is the way to go.  THE SUPA CHUPA. Oh man  I ate this thing in about 30 seconds  granted I was racing my toddler before she started throwing a tantrum but still. The carnitas were perfectly crispy without being dried out and whatever the smoky sauce is paired perfectly with the meat.  Overall  a very enjoyable dinner. We will definitely be back  PS I love the dog tables.

Eldorado Caf  came through for me on their website s description of itself as Mexican inspired comfort food.  Founders Joe and Joanna Fried with their chefs Esme Tejeda and Rene and engaging wait staff delivered one of the most memorable culinary experiences in a very unassuming shopping center on Anderson Lane.  Worth the one hour trip to dine inside this restaurant with an eclectic  funky  interior d cor and  life is back to normal  vibe.     Eldorado Caf  provides their creative culinary brilliance with dine-in  curb-side  or catering options spanning a spectrum from Pequenos  appetizers   stews  distinctive enchiladas  tacos  burritos  salads and bowls for both carnivores and vegans. Open for breakfast  lunch  and dinner  be sure to book a reservation.    While executing to perfection on classic Mexican options  Eldorado Caf  is anything but classic with its inclusion of cross ethnic inspired ingredients  spices  and meats  and mushrooms   including ancho  roasted green chiles  Cuban Mojo  Chimichurri   and my personal favorite  a delectable Mole that reminded me of Fonda San Miguel back in the 2000 s.   I will not be referring to this establishment as a Mexican restaurant and those reviewers looking for the large oval piping hot plate of melted cheddar cheese over greasy enchiladas and refried beans  should go elsewhere.   Let s get started.  Firstly  the wait staff including my waitress and every hard-working employee providing services  thank you line cooks   hats off  for a terrific customer oriented delivery.  Second  while I m not a cocktail reviewer  their  creative  cocktails were a bonus and not an expectation  allowing the infusion of what they refer to as twists including watermelon  highly recommended   and scorpio  very hot  to top shelf tequilas Margaritas.  Starters included the Eldorado Salsa Sampler  a selection of amazingly prepared salsas from mild  avocado  to the El Scorpio  did I mention very hot  diablo    the Honolulu Pork Mini Tacos  essentially carnitas on soft yellow tortillas with a unique pineapple Jicama slaw  w  pickled onions   and the Eldorado Queso  a creamy white queso studded with dark green peppers.  With the freshest homemade chips  all above are highly recommended.  For mid-plates  I had the Thunder Rosa Taco on flour which you cannot go wrong with seasoned bacon  sirloin  chiles  and onions and the popular Guaco Taco  essentially a huge guacamole  refried black beans  and fresh pico  without the overly added red onions  on a surprisingly thin crispy hard shell.  Nirvana struck when the Mole Enchiladas arrived  which in my opinion deserves a special name such as Immortal or Heavenly Enchiladas.  I understand not everyone likes Moles  but with the laborious cooking process  and when done correctly  the sauce is nothing less than a silky  rich  chocolate  savory sauce that will leave you speechless.  With enough mole to blend with the studded rice and refried black beans  w  some awesome crumbled white cheese - cotjita    I cleaned this plate. Highly recommend.   One request  a Seafood or shrimp Enchilada please  Del Mar.    Thank you employees and owners for this dining experience. I ll be back to try the other 95  of the menu. Thanks for adding to the Austin culinary community.

I love their chicken Vera Cruz. It s both creamy and tangy without being heavy. Eldorado  locally owned  is such an asset to our neighborhood. Wonderful selection of what I d call  slightly healthier  Mexican food  without losing the essence of the original dishes. Their salsas are a must. They re not complimentary  but they are a good value for the quality and experience. They must use top-notch ingredients in all their dishes. I ve never ordered anything I wasn t impressed with

Eldorado is a hidden gem. Flavors are multi dimensional and the salsa is better than anything at Taco Deli. Check out the papas rellenas  basically fried goat cheese balls with dipping salsa.   Pro tip - order their breakfast tacos online... they re cheap and the best ones in town.

BEST BREAKFAST IN AUSTIN   I ll love someone to message me and let me try and find a better spot. I can t believe I just now stumbled upon this gem. I was tempted not to leave a review because I m selfish and want it to myself lol.   Service         Amazing  I spoke to managers and staff and everyone was freindly and prompt  Kara at the bar is bomb  She can make a mean Michelada.  Drinks     Kara put a little extra spicy twist on my Michelada.  They have their own blend of mix here and it is unique as ever and oh so amazing.   Food      I had the Machacado plate. It s freaking to die for   Best Machacado I ve ever eaten and I m a way Texas Mexico Texan. Seriously I wouldn t change a thing.   Come try this place I guarantee you won t be disappointed in the food unless your taste buds are broken.   I ve heard they have a crazy crowd on weekends so make reservations

Consistently very good food  excellent  service and well organized.  Always a contender for my lunch business when in North Austin.  If I didn t live so far away  it would be on my dinner radar as well

Was looking for a good Mexican restaurant and this one is conveniently located right next to mopac  I had their Joel s happy plate which was a good mix of enchiladas and sides  I love that they put a fried egg on top. Something else I thought was neat is that they let you choose what kind of salsa you get served as a complementary starter. No gate keeping those who can t handle their spice here. I brought some Mexican friends and they loved their tortilla soups even if it isn t the typical way it is served. The service was quick and kind  I could see them delivering take out to the cars outside the whole time so clearly they are popular. The interior dining room isn t too large and so sometimes it s necessary to have to wait for a table but it is well worth it.
Amazing food  Catered our daughters birthday with them and all of our guests loved it
Absolutely fantastic in every sense  The food is so good. We didn t have a single mediocre thing. Chips are fresh  salsas are different and unique  and the plates are a great size. A  all day

The food was way better than expected. I am usually hesitant on tex-mex but I was quite surprised. The medium-salsa they provided was so flavorful and addicting. The rice was flavorless  though. Only reason I give four stars instead of five is because the mole sauce was insanely sweet for me. I love mole and this was a bit too sweet. I still ended up finishing my plate because it grew on me. The margarita and Paloma was up to standard without anything being too much or too little. I ll definitely return.

I m not sure I get it. Sure  El Dorado has decent Mexican food. So does about 75  of the Tex mex joints in this city. Why are people so obsessed with this spot. I mean forget eating here without a reservation- even for lunch. Again  this place is good. Tacos are solid  etc. but it is not anywhere near the hype.

Very much enjoyed the chef owner s interpretation of Tex-Mex Mexican food.  The Joel s Happy Plate was full of flavor  the corn tortillas used were excellent and the jicama slaw was a nice touch that makes the meal feel more healthy and well-rounded.

Absolutely worth the wait. All of the food at Eldorado is fresh  tasty  and the service is amazing. It is slightly expensive  but I ve never left spending that amount of money and feeling like I didn t get what I paid for. I ve had a lot of the menu and everything from the salsas to the salads to the tacos to the enchiladas are amazing. I think the only thing that isn t my favorite is their guacamole is pretty salty -- so it s great on food but not so great alone. I think my server who I ve had the most is Jen  They are top notch and honestly all the service I ve had is great. Get a reservation and you get to skip the ALWAYS long line. It s worth any wait though.

In short   Service  4stars Quality  amp  taste 3.5 stars Quantity for the price  2stars  you have to stuff yourself with some chips or appetizer before entrees  to fill your tummy  as there entrees portions are more like tapas small plate portions.  We had made a reservations  so got seated as soon we walked in  ordered Enchiladas suizas  shaunna wanna taco salad  kids cheese enchiladas.  Chips and salsa  chips were warm  salsa was good  the orange one  light green is there spicy one  other than spicy ness it doesn t have any other flavors. I personally don t eat much chips  it s none to very less  and wait for the main dish  but here is a tip  in eldorarado  I d suggest eat the chips  as there entrees don t fill your tummy    Enchilada suizas  sauce has a very sharp sourness and it s overwhelming and you don t taste anything else other than sour taste  it s 2 or 3 tiny enchiladas  rice and beans that came with it was good.  Shaunna wanna taco salad  in description it says so much  but all we got was very little lettuce mix with sour cream  avocados and chicken  not even some black beans in it  but the grilled chicken was very good  but way too skimpy for the price  taco shell was good too  light and crisp.  Kids cheese enchiladas  my kid asked if he can get a chicken enchiladas and our server said yes but dint mention the  2 up charge and we don t mind paying  but it s a single  literally finger sized   length wise  2 fingers width wise  enchiladas filled with cheese and chicken  I don t think they had used even a single nugget sized chicken in it  and it was drenched with too much cheese  my kid who like cheese  couldn t eat that much    Overall  personally I always prefer quality over quantity  but at the same time  there entrees whatever we ordered were  14   tips and taxes  for that price I expect I should feel full  not stuffed nor leftovers to take home  just full.

Place is cute inside   but as for the food it was overpriced  flavorless and small portions.  Moreover   our server had a very snarky attitude which I did not care for in the slightest.  I ve had their food catered several times and it was excellent and good portions for a group of 10.  This experience dining in was not in any way enjoyable.

Eldorado Cafe has quickly become my favorite restaurants in Austin. I think they have some of the best enchiladas and margaritas I have ever had. While it may not be  traditional  Mexican  and items like fajitas are not on the menu  I still consider it one of the best causal Mexican restaurants in Austin. If you haven t been before  I recommend tying the salsa sampler to get the lay of the land ... they have a ton of options. My favorite enchiladas are the Enchiladas Suizas  and the house margarita is fantastic. I ve recommended this place to numerous people  and all have come back with positive reviews. I always try and make a reservation on Resy  especially on Friday and Saturday nights. Check it out  you won t be disappointed

This place really checked off all of the boxes of delicious tasting food  The salsa sampler  least spicy on the left to most spicy on the right   I highly recommend. Our favorite was the left three  in picture . We ordered the Enchiladas Suizas  chicken with fried egg  beef .

This place was so good.  I was in town for an evening and needed some Mexican food  I hit the jackpot  I got the Chile con carne enchiladas  they were amazing   The salsa collection was amazing. The owner was so very kind. He checked on our table and we chatted a little bit. He was very kind. Stop in this place. You will be so glad you did

We just had the most amazing meal and margs at Eldorado Cafe   The chips were fresh  the five salsa options were flavorful and layered  and our meal was outstanding  Our margs were made fresh and tasted delicious  Hope to be back in the near future and would recommend to all of our friends  Thanks Eldorado Cafe

Great service and out of sight Tex mex cuisine. I had enchiladas suiza and my son had a queso burrito. Also had a cocktail. As out of towners half hour wait was nothing were we are from especially without a reservation. Food was really good and well priced.

The food and drinks are very tasty. There is often a long wait. Quality of service has varied significantly across multiple visits  but that might be more about the Great Resignation Realization than about this operation in particular. Shout out to the short rib salpicon  all the enchiladas  margaritas  and the peach bourbon smash.
This place was amazing. From the food  the service  and the ambiance nothing short of great   The manager even went around and asked everyone how they were liking their visit. Very nice
Veggie Burrito Supreme   as a bowl. Tasted great  loved the chips and salsa as well. Service was great all the employees were friendly
Low-key funky Austin with some of the best Mexican food you can find. Unassuming little dive shopping center. Get there early for the best Migas I ve ever had.  SWOON

El Dorado Cafe is a definite favorite  Best friendliest service. Amazing innovative and fresh food that I think of as Aus-Mex. IMHO they have the best house margaritas in town. Reasonable prices  giant portions and careful preparation  add in the friendly crew and good vibe  I d come here every week if I could

The food is great  served by cool people. I ve been numerous times  at breakfast  lunch  and supper. Last Wednesday I had a Taco Bowl with carne guisada and squash on the side  yum yum yum  Love this place

I ve heard from many people this place is great. I ve only tried it through delivery but man  was it delicious  Huevos Rancheros is one of my favorite dishes anywhere and this dish did not disappoint at Eldorado. I would love to actually go to the location and check out the food fresh out of the kitchen as it was a little cold with delivery  which happens with a lot of deliveries . Thanks Eldorado and see you at your restaurant.

I went to lunch here with one of my friends from college. The margaritas were pretty good  but not exceptional.  The chips and salsa were very good  I liked that their hot salsa was actually spicy  They had a lot of nice options for vegetarians  so that was much appreciated I had the cheese enchiladas with mole. The food was good  but I ve had better mole. I will return  but I ll try a different dish next time. No complaints about the service. They weren t exceptionally friendly  but they did their job and provided good service. The restaurant was very clean.

Visiting friends in Austin and had a chance to eat at El Dorado. Unbelievable food. The carnitas Cubano is sooo good and the salsa sampler is a treat  Just great service and delicious food. Stop by if you are passing though.

This is the best food that I ve ever put in my face.  Not totally true  I ve spent time in France and well cheese.  I get the same thing  carnitas  and it s heavenly. My only complaint is that I wish they had a bigger space to reduce the wait. But it s worth the wait regardless. The margaritas help to pass the time. And the staff is so nice. I love this place. Don t go here. I

I m not a big fan of Tex Mex  but if it s something you crave  you should definitely give it a try  The queso and chips are pretty darn good  Enchilada are cheesy and veggies are crisp  They have have a great drink menu and the staff is always great  Lines can be long so come prepared.
Fantastic neighborhood Tex-Mex  friendly and wonderful staff.  Sometimes have to wait  but it s fun talking with other patrons. Highly recommend.

I love this place the food here is so unique and flavorful . Seriously I ve been taking all my friends here for brunch and everyone love it here . I love the colorful decor   the waitstaff are all so kind and nice . I will be coming back soon   I would of taking pictures but I devour everything soo fast . Another reason to come back .  I love the Joel s enchiladas plate and the tio white potatoes and the nomad plate

What a lovely place with great food and great service. The owner himself was making rounds and stopped to meet us  which was incredibly kind. Our two waitresses were enthusiastic and rolled with the punches as our group had 5 kids who were all over the place   Moving to the food  we are vegetarian and they had soo many options  The food was all fresh and tasty  and they had a good variety of sauces as well   Thanks for the awesome experience and wish you lots of success

Favorite Mexican restaurant.  Very consistency good food.  The owner always stops by to say hello.  The margaritas are nice. The crispy tacos are the best. I wish I could give them 5 stars. The wait staff and bartenders are always attentive.

Wow- I can t say enough.   I wanted to try this place a while back because I had heard good things  but I went on  a day when they are closed.  My husband and I stopped in today.   He mostly wanted to sit at the bar- which is closed due to Covid and we almost left.  I said- no way   we are here  I ve been wanting to try this place.  We were not starved but I wanted to at least try their salsa .  We had the medium red salsa and also the Green verde avocado - both were so good with warm authentic chips.   Very fresh.  The menu looked so good  we both felt like we needed to order something else.   We landed on a taco   la carte but both of us decided to order the same one- the Thunder Rosa taco.  All I can say is OMG-   I m a hard critic- and this is so well done.    I can t wait to go back

This place is amazing  I love their dishes  Although I haven t had much Tex-Mex foods before  but the enchilada verde and the carne guisada are really tasty  I ordered the tomato pinto bean  sorry I can t remember its proper name  and roasted veggies as sides  and I really love the veggies in the meals. Also pls do order the chips and salsa X  I m not a fan for chips and salsa  but their salsa X is too tasty to miss it.   Also the curbside pickup is pretty safe  you wait in the car and they would put the food on the chair in front of your car and leave  and you can take your order then.
Favorite Austin restaurant. I have never had anything which wasn t amazing.  Margaritas are second to none.  Avocado salsa is the best.  Mojo pollo   Staff is always helpful and on-top of everything.

WOW... Extremely happy with this place. New to texas and have been searching for good mexican food.. HMMMmmmm.. Staff is great  the owner leads by example and.. the FOOD is GREAT    Id recommend to EVERYONE..

In short  the food was great and they have a great system for takeout during covid   We placed an order online  pulled up to the carryout parking spot  texted them  and within a minute they brought out our food   As for the food  the two entrees  sirloin tampique o and enchiladas verdes were good and flavorful. Though I still feel like I m searching austin for my favorite enchiladas. Each was just enough for one person  no leftovers .  The crispy tacos were a good snack to add on to the meal. My favorite dish was actually the papas rellenas  which were fried perfectly and just melt in your mouth  I highly recommend these.  I ll be back to try some other dishes in the future for sure.

Joel and his team have something pretty amazing. The service is top notch  the food is all amazing and the drinks... Casa Amigos on the tequilita menu. If you know  you know. It s all great. If you are in north central and northwest Austin and you have not been  RUN    Of there is a wait  get on the list and order a margarita  it s more than worth whatever the wait is. Hats off to El Dorado Cafe   Get the Salsa X

I am a teacher so breakfast out is a rare treat that I like to indulge in the summer. I d planned to check out several places  one a week or so  but after stopping back at Eldorado Cafe the first week  I have been here every Wednesday so far. Everything is fresh and delicious from the migas plate  to tacos to chilaquiles to build-your-own-bowl to agua fresca  lemonade  yum . I m trying to think of something different for tomorrow  but I am dying to try the biscuits...
Oh that potato bean taco is something  And their salsa sauces are the best  Outside tables allow for safer dining options. Pleasant staff interactions too.
Very delicious   I might be basic but the cheese enchiladas hit the spot. Also really good chips and salsa.

We love coming here  The chips and salsa are yummy and their carnitas cubanos is to die for. It s almost  20  but comes with two sides. I order it with their no hater tater  cheesy mashed potatoes  and las calabasas  a variety of roasted squash . Highly recommend that combo  I would absolutely recommend making a reservation. Even with a reservation you ll still likely need to wait. Space is definitely tight. I would call this a  kid friendly  place but you can definitely bring the whole fam and be fine. Gets a little loud and doesn t have much space to wait for a table inside. Overall  definitely go  and definitely make a reservation.

Huge fans  This was our first time here  I know  where have we been    and we loved it  First off  our server Dez  was the sweetest person ever. She and everyone on staff were incredibly helpful and attentive. The food was some of the best Mexican food we ve had in Austin - and the ambiance was super laid back and just overall lovely. Prices were reasonable too  Just a perfect spot all around

My favorite restaurant in Austin  hands down  The food is fantastic  and Joel  Eric  and the staff always make me feel welcome. It s one of my favorite places to take out-of-town guests  and they re never disappointed. Do yourself a favor and check out Eldorado  but you better make a reservation...the food and service are so stellar there s often a wait.

This is one of the best Mexican food places in the entire city of Austin and man that is one bold statement to make.  El Dorado has existed in north Austin for the past 4 years off the intersection of W Anderson ln   Shoal Creek  right off the mopac exit .  This place gets so busy it is online reservations except for the few walkups accepted  so be advised.    Consider Eldorado a upscale fusion style Mexican food place.  They have typical items such as enchiladas  different tacos  quesadillas and tostadas.  This place excels in their specialty dishes.  The Carnitas Cubanos is my favorite  also the shiny ribs  papas rellenos and many others.  You are going to sit looking at the menu a solid 5min before you are able to come with a decision.  They have a variety of 5 different salsa you can order along with queso or guacamole.  They even serve flan or mini donuts for dessert if you are still hungry.  Margaritas are strong and they have a very cool bar drink menu.  They also have an awesome weekend brunch menu.    The service is very friendly and on top of everything.  The restaurant only has roughly 15 tables  but does well with the space provided.  You will likely see Joel walking around who pretty much runs the place  such a friendly person to meet with.  This place is always packed because it is so good  so like I said  make a reservation.  If you want unique tasting Mexican food to try out  then this place is your winner.

I go to the Eldorado Cafe literally every Friday. It is amazing. I can t tell you how many Eldorado stickers I ve stuck onto all all of my belongings. I normally get the cheese enchiladas with beef and a side of rice. The nachos and quesadillas are really good too. They have great service and deliver your food really fast. If you live in Austin or you re visiting  I d definitely consider stopping by Eldorado.

Pro  Found this location on Happy Cow.  Food is good here. Pretty busy in-dining room on the Friday I went. Very limited choices on menu for vegan but the veganchilada was great.   Con  Not allowed to sit outside and use the  tables chairs to eat my to-go order as I had walked there. I was taking Covid precautions. I saw no staff or customers in restaurant doing so.
I love this place. The curly haired guy at the front desk needs to get off his phone and actually remember to be polite to people. Rolling your eyes is a visible action.

Absolutely delicious breakfast tacos  I gobbled up the Big Papa  crispy yet creamy papa rellena...like a potato croquette  two big slices of bacon  gooey egg  cheese  and the Matt s Everything taco  go look at the description in the menus  there s too many things to list .   Every component is of very high quality  well seasoned and cooked well. The quality of the bacon especially stood out -- decently thick without being chewy  crisp  not stringy fat  and great smoky flavor that comes through. Not greasy either.   Love the 3 potato hash they have in the tacos too -- I wouldn t have thought that sweet potato was something I would care for but it worked as part of everything else  a little sweetness to balance the salt .  Then after I finished my tacos  I went straight back into buy an 8oz container of Salsa X  cos it s so good I need it in my fridge.   Can t wait to come back and try their breakfast plates and the lunch dinner options

Oh my stars  how have I been in Austin all this time and just now dining at Eldorado Cafe    Well  for one...it s somewhat hidden  so thanks yelp for bringing it to my attention     I popped on their website and it encouraged me to make a reservation  glad I did   They were quite busy on a random Wednesday night   They have the tables nice and spread out...don t know if that s all the time or just because of COVID  whatever  it was nice.  We were greeted by several hosts that were all lovely.  Taken to our seat and out came the most informed  lovely  friendly wait person I ve ever had the pleasure of visiting with.  They talked to us about their favorites from drinks to apps  entrees to desserts   All three of us had EXCELLENT drinks.  They didn t have the exact drink a friend wanted...server said  how about you try this....  And my friend LOVED it     Onto our food...they have BOMB queso  so happy we tried that as well.  I ordered just two crispy tacos  I know I m boring  but I know what I like and they were excellent     Believe it or not  more people can screw up something so simple    My husband had some enchiladas.  I fail at remembering the type  but I m thinking it was something with a cream sauce.  I took one bite and while he LOVED them  I will say  if you have a sensitive stomach  they re rich LOL...look out. Our friend had the tater tot bowl and our server advised to put mushrooms in it.  She said it was absolutely amazing.  We were going to go without dessert  but my husband spotted these cinnamon donuts on the menu...holy heavenly bliss.  It came with four small donuts in the order and they were warm on top of that.....ahhhhhhh  the angels sang from above with each bite.  Ten outta ten Eldorado   Y all are rockstars and totally deserve the cult level following you have.  Where do I sign up to become a member of this fan club   We WILL be back

Yum   Enchiladas are so good I keep ordering them instead of branching out haha. Food and drinks are consistently good  even when ordering to go   Also love their mashed potatoes and mojo veggies on the side - so delicious and a nice change from standard rice and beans.  They also have a variety of salsas  which is nice if your family has different spice or flavor preferences  and they re good as well

This review is long overdue. Been coming here for 3 years now and absolutely love everything about it. From their food and drinks to their staff  it s always a great experience. Their meats  especially their carnitas  are quality and they have the best breakfast taco in Texas. The BIG Papas is unreal   My wife and I have probably had 100 by now between the both of us. My last visit I asked to turn their tater tot bowl into a burrito and added my own modifications. Our server was all about it and after I got it  almost every server came to our table to check it out. Possibly a new menu item Joel

I was in at least 7 months before we finally tried and my god I don t know what we were waiting for   I think I was there 4 times in the first couple weeks after my first visit.  The team there is amazing - everyone is on it - my servers are always awesome. The food is fantastic.  The enchilada suizas were my fav - so good - perfect green sauce flavor and melty yummy cheese. Was so surprised how good the veggies sides were too - the squash with pepitas I think it was so flavorful and tasting once I had it sort of mushy the other a little hard  veggie bites  and I liked both.   The hot green salsa is excellent and I don t know what they put in their rice and beans to make them so damn flavorful - gold maybe  My gosh they are so simple and so good.  Their queso is a thin runny queso that I spilled on the table and myself  thin isn t really my fav style queso but it has good flavor .  We had short ribs and mashed potatoes first trip too - unreal    I was all about those suizas until I went for the la cruces banado on night - my god the pork and pepper and onions with the green Chile sauce  It was so gd delicious    Haven t been for breakfast yet which I know is a mistake will do that next. Go see them  If you can t get a resy table go and get in the list for a table they are fast and it s worth the wait.

amazing service  aggressively mediocre food. not a single drop of seasoning  not sure the cook knows where the salt resides. the vibe of the restaurant is quite nice  highly recommend the goat cheese dip but that is IT.

We had a reservation and went to dine-in on Sunday as a late Mother s Day dinner for myself  my kids  and my mom. Y ALL  I was blown away. Your location is easy to find. You folks are friendly. The interior is beautiful and I love the artwork. Jennifer K rocked our socks as our server. The best part was the darn food  It was delivered promptly  hot  and it was delicious. We were so happy with the whole meal. We even got some things to go. The house margaritas were bomb.  I had the enchiladas verdes with chicken and added a fried egg. Mom had the same minus the egg. Yum  My son had the Joel s plate and he loved it. My daughter had the kid s chicken breast and enjoyed it. They have Maine Root sodas  our favorite.   I hope everyone checks this place out. Everything about the visit just felt right.

We went for lunch and the food was AMAZING  My husband had the Dart Bowl enchiladas and I had the suiza enchiladas. All of the ingredients are fresh and the flavor was wonderful. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable. We met the owner who genuinely makes you feel special. I will definitely be back and will tell all of my friends and family about this hidden gem. Ona side note  I have celiac disease and am a vegetarian- they  have many GF and Veg options.

A staple to visit every time I m in Austin. One of my favorite restaurants ever. I have celiac disease and it s great to know what dishes I can safely eat  they even have cross contamination labeled on the menu . Knowledgeable employees and delicious food. I would 10 10 recommend the supa chalupa
I live In chicago now  but each time I go home  this is an absolute for me. The salsas.....the drinks.....the staff. All amazing
Came in on Saturday evening. Unable to sit at bar. Table was ready in under 10 min. Get the joes happy plate sooo yummy

Breaks my heart to come in here and throw down a five star review  because I don t want more people to keep coming here and making it even busier than it already is. But here we are     This is a fantastic establishment. Service is always great. The food is always fresh  perfectly seasoned  perfectly cooked. They get a crispy  tasty browning  that s  maillard  to you foodies  on their chicken that I haven t seen in any other restaurant  and I wish I knew how they did it. Their menu options are excellent... go ahead - look at the menu. Look at the food photos here on Yelp. This review practically writes itself.  They do curbside and the food is great as takeout  in case you were wondering.

Eldorado Cafe offers a unique eating experience. There flavors stand alone amongst other place we have visited. Service is outstanding  along with the food. This was the first time for lunch and it didn t disappoint at all. The Salsa sampler is a must in our book. There is something for everyone. Along with some queso  it was off to a good start.... Wife went with Beef Enchiladas  double rice. Sauce was rich in flavor  rice was light and fluffy. I went the route of the Enchiladas Verde with Chicken. The sauce is just amazing. Tender Chicken  Killer Black Beans and do yourself a favor and take a look at the other side dishes they offer...I went the Las Calabasas...One of the best side dishes I have ever had...Finally something different  I will say that Eldorado is on the higher side    ....But  you absolutely get what you pay for. I wouldnt hesitate to go back again...and we will for sure....It would be hard to pick between the breakfast or the Lunch menu....Both are Great

Perfect spot for lunch  Service is always quick and super friendly. The food and house margaritas never disappoint. Taj n on the rim for house margaritas are a must  I tried most of the dishes but my favorite dish is the Enchiladas Classicas.

Eldorado is a great place. Tonight the staff was amazing and the food and drinks were great. I had food at the bar and takeout for my husband.  The manager even checked in on me and he handled everything inside the restaurant and out. Thank you again for being great

How have I not left a review here yet  Like it s the best little mom and pop Mexican restaurant around  Salsas are amazing and it s my favorite place for good enchiladas. Great atmosphere and drinks all around.
Mexican-ish comfort food with many unique dishes. They never disappoint  from shiny ribs to Joel s happy plate  and their margs are perfection.

This place is consistently amazing  The food is always perfect  and I mean always. I ve eaten inside a minimum of 40 times  and have picked up curbside a handful of times  and it s always accurate  fresh and delicious.  On top of the incredible food they treat you like family  in a good way   and they care about people  animals  and their community.

Came by for lunch and everything was delicious  We ordered the Enchiladas Verde with mushrooms. Would highly recommend the enchilada plates. Also shared the tater tot taco and a mojito. So glad we gave this place a try

All those stars are right. We were told there d be a 10 minute wait  and it was 8 minutes. The staff were quick  friendly and didn t even blink when we used the paper menu and not a phone for ordering. The chips and salsa came quickly with our drinks  non alcoholic. I only like Coronas in frosted glasses when I m in a Mexican restaurant   but I did have a Mexican sugar free Coke and the flavor was new and very refreshing. Food came promptly and was very tasty. Mine was accompanied by 3 steamed corn tortillas rolled in foil  and they were delicious. We were asked if we needed anything more a couple of times during the meal. It is a fine restaurant with pleasant staff  and we ll be back.

Outstanding breakfast place. If you are in the mood for some unique and delicious Mexican food  this place is it.   Menu is diverse. You ll find some traditional Mexican favorites as well as unique and flavorful adaptations.   The Red chilaquiles were amazing. Tender chunks of carnitas in a delicious sauce draped over some fresh tortilla prices with a fried egg on top. Yummy.   The tacos were equally outstanding. Lots of different options to choose from. We really enjoyed the Izzy and Matt s taco. Fresh tortillas. Simply delicious.   Service was fast and friendly.
Get the salsa x  Best authentic Mexican food in town. EVERYTHING is fresh. Ingredients are thought out. Atmosphere is colorful and fun.

We just ordered lunch over the phone.   Super nice Lady named Ella answered.  Her immediate and sincere kindness was infectious      We had no idea what to order so we asked her if she had any  healthy  suggestions... she recommended     Romaine Wedge with grilled chicken and black pepper goat cheese    Carne Guisada Taco Bowl with Romaine   Totally went with it.  Asked her a few questions  she remained insanely patient the entire time.  She said our order be ready in 15 minutes.  I pulled up curbside pickup in exactly 15 minutes.  Texted in my parking space   and within seconds  a chipperly young lady delivered.  I rolled down my window  I had a feeling... so I asked - it was Ella.  I m sort of familiar with the restaurant industry  employees come and go.  Good people are hard to find and even harder to keep.  Who ever is responsible for hiring Ella  good job   Hopefully you will be able to keep her for a while   She s a darn good human being and without any doubt an exceptional employee.  We will be back.  Almost just because of Ella...   and the food    She deserves 6 Stars
Update  tried the Philly cheese steak torta  and was not too impressed. The steak is cut too thick. Everything else in the previous review still stands.
Excellent food  attentive staff  amp  reasonable prices.  Some of the best Mexican food I ve had in the Austin area.

Amazing. The food was delicious  the atmosphere was fun and lively  and Joel  the owner  and Kelsey  our server  were so friendly  attentive  accommodating  and just great people. We had a blast and will definitely be back

First time here came for Saturday mid morning brunch.This place was great the service  the atmosphere and food made it a great dining experience. We ordered mainly for the breakfast menu- the food was well prepared and delicious. We ordered the Huevos Texicans -Nomad Plate  Gloria sChilaquiles Eldorito Pie and a homemade buttermilk biscuit. Plus beer and other adult beverages all were well prepared and very delicious. With the wonderful atmosphere and great service and outstanding food I recommend you give it a try and I hope to return soon to try some more of the delicious offerings from the extended menu.

Great food and drinks  excellent and friendly service  be prepared to wait but worth it.  Details We go to El Dorado at least every other week. It s become our neighborhood Mexican restaurant and we are lucky to have it  Joel  the owner  is usually around and chatting with everybody. All of the staff is really friendly. It s always packed. Expect an hour wait minimum on weekends. Luckily  the wait goes fast because their bar drinks are excellent.   All of the food is excellent. Not typical Tex Mex but a nice blend of Mexican with a twist. We ve pretty much eaten and drank our way through the menu so I ll list a few of my favorites.  Thunder Rosa Taco - love  love  love this taco  Also my son s go-to taco. Named after a local female wrestler. What s not to like about a taco with steak and bacon  I like it on corn tortillas. Caution  The roasted pepper on this taco is scorching   El Sin Nombre - basically a margarita but made with mezcal. Nice and smoky but watch out  it s strong.  El Guaco Taco - when you want something smaller. It s a crispy taco with black beans and guac. Delicious.  Enchiladas Verdes - all the enchiladas are good  nice sauces and not loaded with cheese. Verde with chicken is my recent fav. I always opt for the lados  optional sides for an extra  1  over the standard excellent rice and beans.  Mojo Veg - this is one of the lados. Tasty mix of garlicky  saut ed veggies.  Simple greens with  Pepper Goat Cheese Dressing - also a lado. Sounds weird to get a salad with Mexican food but I like the cool freshness and the goat cheese dressing is great.  Salsa X - interesting  moderately spicy salsa. Great with chips and on pretty much anything else   I ll stop there. It s all good

This is the one  y all. Best Mexican food in Austin. And that s coming from a native Austinite who F N LOVES Mexican food  sorry Fonda  you re still my  2 .  Small place that fills up quick - make a res if you don t like waiting. Third visit yesterday  and all 3 knocked it out of the park. Creative menu  perfectly prepared - haven t tried anything that we haven t loved. And you can t have a badass plate of carnitas without a proper margarita  and these guys do not disappoint. Top shelf  El Silencio mezcal  done right. Get 3. Get an Uber. Do what you gotta. All the stars.
Very friendly   Food delicious.. 4 of us gas something different and everyone happy ... tortilla chips the best ever     And margaritas yummy too

I wish I could give 6 stars.  Excellent food.  Warm and welcoming staff.   A little skinny on the healthy desert menu.  Sorry guys  the donuts are just not woking.    I d recommend jicama drizzled with pomegranate molasses.  It s awesome and would fit the culinary theme.
One of my favorite places to Austin. Spectacular food - great staff and always wonderful service. You can not go wrong here.

I expected good  solid Tex-Mex  and this was a step above that. The service was excellent as well  our server was friendly  informative  and attentive but not intrusive  and the food came very quickly even though the place was packed. Best Tex-Mex place I ve been to on the north side  for sure.
One of my favorite restaurants in the city   Their house margs are to die for and they even have some vegan options

Eldorado Cafe is a great find. The food is wonderful. The service is beyond any I have experienced. Eldorado cafe is a true local restaurant. They even have vegan dishes so the menu has been created with all tastes in mind. Eldorado cafe is conveniently located right off Mopac. Great for a meal break while driving through Austin.  I cannot wait to go back.

Soooo good  Came here for breakfast and their salsa game is on fire  They really take their salsa seriously. I had the eggs Mexicano and my partner the eggs with shredded beef. It was so delicious we forgot to take pictures to post here. Service is great also  we will definitely be back

First take out since the onset of the pandemic. Very efficient ordering and curbside pickup.   Unfortunately chicken enchiladas and mojo chicken were not up to standards we experienced pre-covid while dining in -person. Portions small for price  especially mojo chicken -- skimpy little pieces of chopped chicken.  16.95    But the most off-putting aspect was the person who took my order over the phone. I felt bullied into agreeing to a 15  tip. I know it has been tough on the restaurant industry. But why is it a norm now to expect a tip for no service  food untasted  and payment in advance    Unlikely to return.

This place doesn t look a lot from outside  but the food is delicious and its clean inside. I m a vegetarian  and I got the enchiladas classicas and I wasn t disappointed. The ancho chile sauce was a little sweet not spicy at all. I like more spice so I added the hot sauces to spice up the enchilada. We also ordered the guacamole which a little limey but I like tang. My drink was pretty boozy but I like my drinks a little stiff. Overall great place would come back again. The staff was wonderful and friendly. I loved the hot sauce so much they even offered to box some of it for me to take home.
Literally everything is good. Breakfast  enchiladas  chicken fried steaks  nothing I ve tried is disappointing
The food there is like candy. Amazing. So good. Took me by surprise. So many choices  traditional and also items on the menu with some great adaptations and twists. Again  really really really goo.

Excellent find  Food was great  The owner was running the place  everything was very well organized. We sat at the bar  they had awesome drinks  Not being from Austin the owner gave us a list of places to try while we were there. I will definitely come back anytime I m in Austin..
Excellent food and drink and great service  I ve never had a bad meal here and the margaritas are wonderful. I also love the 5 dip sampler. Can t go wrong

As newbies to Austin  we were fortunate enough to come across the Eldorado Cafe pretty quickly. Joel and his staff are amazingly friendly  the food is down right delicious  and the service is great  It s my husband s birthday today  and we are ordering take-out from the Eldorado   It was his first pick    Here are some of our favorites  Rene s Awesome Enchiladas  my fave   Suizas Enchiladas with chicken and  Enchiladas Classicas with chicken  my husband s go-to . If you are into crazy hot sauce  not me  this is my husband   then try their El Scorpio sauce   . You have been warned on the heat level

Salsa salsa salsa   Right off the bat we tried a couple of their more mild salsas and simply fell in love. Their chips were nice and warm  too.  As far as the actual food items off the menu  I was super impressed with their staples. Their beans  potato sweet potato hash is amazing and their sauces rock. All their food seems really yummy but a bit on the salty side for me. Otherwise I have no complaint. The flavors are amazing and everything came out piping hot. This is the new hot spot and I totally get why.  Prices can be a bit on the high side but I would say for the quality and service it was still pretty good.  One tip for the wait is to go around 11-11 15 and you won t wait at all on a weekday    Parking is ample and they even have a handicap ramp right in front of their door.
There is so much Mexican in this city  but this by far tops it for me. Best chips and salsa I have ever had  The food is flavorful  amp  love the variety of options. Friendly staff too

Can I choose six stars  This is hands down our favorite restaurant in Austin. I just love hanging here. Drinks are great and they have a solid mocktail menu. Food is consistently delicious. We love all the staff and feel a great sense of community at this spot. I can t recommend it enough. My go to is the Salsa X and chicken verde enchiladas. Queso is epic as well

Good. Not great. I dont know why all the best Mexican restaurants on Yelp here in Austin are so gringo   amp  I m white.  I miss San Antonio. Since moving to Austin I ve had some serious trouble finding good Mexican restaurants.  Message me if you know the spots      Anyway  food was fresh. I got enchiladas Verdes. Verde sauce was too sour. Wasn t bad just not amazing or mind-blowing. I still ate my whole plate.  -    Now  what was great was the spicy salsa I requested. I drowned my plate in it. Yum. It was actually spicy. Yay

First off  I m not going strictly off my own food for this review as I ordered something I ve had much better elsewhere. That said  everything  other than that one thing - the queso and chips  salsa  and a few bites from my wife s plate  were pretty spectacular. My wife had two cocktails and I  a black cherry soda. As a nice ending to our meal  I ordered their Sopapilla Cheesecake  and holy crap  it was totally  amazeballs     This place is almost always packed and wait times can be long  but after finally trying it  I can personally attest to any wait being well worth it.   Price wise  it s not Chuy s cheap  but not quite as pricy as say Fonda San Miguel. The Eldorado Caf  hovers somewhere in between. For two of us with an appetizer  two cocktails  a soda  two entree s and dessert  the bill came to  72 plus tip. Not what I was expecting to pay for a regular meal out but again  glad I tried it. I did leave stuffed which is far more than I can say for a local sushi place that I left hungry after shelling out a couple hundred clams. So even though they re a little higher than the millions of other Tex-Mex Spanish Mexican food joints in Austin  I still give Eldorado a strong   rating

Yeah babe  any night any day  in the mornin in the late  say the word  and I m on my way.  Rollin eyes in the back of my head  making my toes curl- Yeah  you got that yummy-yum  that yummy-yum  that yummy yummy    Listen  sometimes the Biebs gets it right and when it comes to El Dorado   Baby  you got that yummy yummy     I never thought love could feel this strong so fast.  We barely know each other but it all happened so fast.  I ve heard of your reputation  after all- you get around.  I guess the intrigue finally brought me in and yes  you are worth the wait lines. I m not even jealous with how much attention you get.  I m just so in love with you.  El Dordado  you make the Tex Mex name so proud.  Your enchiladas give me life.  I ll always be there for you.  Forever yours  Joy
Great service and food  Everyone was friendly and attentive  felt like a great place to hang out.

Because the ownership invited me and in adherence to her own wishes  I am now fully publicly  announcing for anybody who cares to hear that I WILL NOT be back to Eldo-ripoff cafe  refer to my original post  I had a terrible meal  and the price was way too high for the swill they served me. I will let everybody who cares to  know exactly what my beef is  now that you ve challenged and insulted me. Good job using your words. El Dorado  1 LLC  Aust n  took 1 million dollars in forgivable PPP loans in 2020 and 2021  and the management  wants to blame their exorbitant prices on COVID expenses. Please. It s all public record. So no.

This place is just the best. Great food and awesome people. We have yet to try something that we don t like. Also  they have done a great job of taking care of their people and their customers throughout the pandemic - no easy task  but very appreciated  We will continue to be regulars here for as long as they re around.   Here s a few of our favorites from the years that we ve been eating here  -Salsas  Avocado  Salsa X  Verde -Apps Small Plates  Queso  Honolulu Pork Tacos  Papas Rellenas  Supa Chalupa -Breakfast  Izzy s Taco  Migas Taco  Big Papa Taco  Biscuit  amp  Jam  don t sleep on the jam    any of the egg plates -Lunch Dinner  Joel s Happy Plate  Carne Guisada  Enchiladas Suizas  Sides  Las Calabasas  Cheez N Rice
I cannot stop eating here  I am addicted. Hands down my favorite Mexican restaurant in Austin. Everything from the drinks to apps and food  outstanding
The food is outstanding. We always take our out-of-town guests here. I ve never been disappointed with any of their menu items.
The enchiladas was amazing and margaritas was great  all staff was friendly and restaurant was very clean

Eldorado is one of the places hitting it out of the park during the pandemic. They take safety measures seriously. Their curbside pickup is perfectly done. You park at a space with a numbered chair  let them know you re there  and they bring the food to the chair. When the employee is at a safe distance you grab your order from the chair. Brilliant. They ve also closed a couple times to assess how to operate as safely as possible and to ensure some COVID-positive employees had time to recover. They have been transparent about their approach and situations on their social media. I ll be forever loyal to this great place. So glad they re part of the neighborhood

My Freddie s Plate was a tissue paper thin egg topped with tons of cheese and the picadillo could not be found. Really  really small portions with a big price. Too many other places to go with great food  large servings and better service.  Hint  don t sit at the bar to eat.

Before heading to the airport  I had to make one last stop for breakfast in Texas. Saw the reviews on Yelp and Austin media and made a stop at Eldorado Cafe.   Easily found a parking spot in the lot of this small strip mall and although it was a Saturday morning  the wait was only 5 minutes before a table was ready.   Decor is eclectic Tex Mex with bright vivid colors on the walls and chairs ranging from turquoise to rust.   Bloody Mary-a bit spicy and practically a meal  but good Eldorado Queso-Good. Hard to find places that do queso right Huevos Rancheros-Good  but the ranchero sauce was a bit on the bland side.  Service was quick  but distracted.  I did not try their specialty items  so maybe I ordered the wrong items. Given the reviews  I probably set my expectations too high.
El Dorado has the best food around.  I prefer the carnitas but everything is delicious.  I have never had a bad meal at Eldorado whether it s take home or in restaurant.

We ordered ahead through catering for 22 people. Communication excellent. Delivery seamless. Food delicious. They had cards by each tray with ingredience which was excellent. Great experience all around
Amazing food  5 star service  a must visit in North Austin. Banado Plate  amp  Salsa X is our go-to order   The margs and queso are also top notch
Their carnitas is on point and rivals some of the best carnitas I had in Cali. Make sure to also get that with their cheesy rice.  Fresh tortillas too I mean sheesh this place is a complete gem.

Good stuff  Probably the best Mexican I have found around town. But  full disclosure  I judge Mexican food real tough.  However  you will not be disappointed if you go. Definitely a local spot and a family joint. There were 8 or 9 tables with high chairs. Staff is good and quick too   Enjoy

I LOVE THIS PLACE.   The food is ALWAYS ON POINT   The service is always good    I ordered on favor the food was fresh and delicious.   So comforting during this time.   I found a block of fresh corn in my rice.   You know how you take it off the Cobb and some kernels stay together   It made me happy   . Not only am I stuffing my face with this oooey goooey cheesy pork burrito.    I m eating FRESH veggies
Excellent food and brunch options - kid friendly  chips and salsa are must try  can we crowded on weekends so reservations recommended

I think I ve already reviewed this place. I don t care  it s so good it warrants a new note. Today I got Carnitas con Huevo breakfast taco. DELICIOUSSSSS  Fluffy eggs  juicy mexican pulled pork  avocado slices and a tangy avocado salsa to top it off. All for less than  4.

Dude. This place is the BOMB  I cannot believe I didn t find it sooner    The wait staff are all great. Their margaritas are super fresh  The watermelon is by far my favorite. And omg the food       The food is so beyond great  I highly recommend the salsa sampler. Every single salsa is amazing so it s hard to choose a favorite. But it s worth trying them all

We found this spot on a Yelp search for Mexican food at my daughter s request for her birthday.   The spot is unassuming  but worth the stop. We had to wait a short time for a table but much less than quoted at check-in.   The food was fantastic   We started with the salsa sampler and the guac. Excellent guac but couldn t suggest the salsa sampler. Two were so spicy that we wasted. The chips are off the chain. Served piping hot  worth the stop all by themselves.     We sampled enchiladas and our daughter ordered breakfast. I also had the chalupa combo. Food arrived promptly and fresh.  Everything was fabulous. We would definitely come again.

Yeah  any place that serves chips and salsa while you wait for breakfast is pretty solid in my book.  We came here on Sunday morning and not shocking  there was a wait. But we swooped in on some seats at the counter and it was smooth sailing from there. Our bartender was awesome  quick  friendly and gave us some suggestions being first timers. It all looked good and I dig that the menu doesn t give you too many things to order from. I ordered the Nomad place and it was a filling meal before we went on our hike.   Oh yeah  the free chips and salsa beforehand probably helped established a nice base in my tummy as well. Can you tell I love that they serve chips and salsa  Random but should be mandatory at more breakfast places

It doesn t work for me  a born and raised Mexican and foodie. That said  the colorful  cozy room was full of happy people devouring their not-really-Mexican food. This is truly  Hecho en Tejas  stuff. And that s okay   Hey  I like... no  make that _adore_ Americanized Chinese take-out food such as sweet and sour chicken and egg rolls  so I get that it s a matter of  what you were raised with.   We ate a wide assortment of dishes and none of them would compel me to return.   For atmosphere  the place gets an A . And the service was hyper friendly though a wee bit disorganized.

Eldorado Cafe  Where have you been all my life  I had no idea  y all. I ve passed this place SO many times and just didn t know what I was missing out on. Which was really tasty  high-quality food. I tried their salsa sampler  and it s divine. You get to try some super spicy ones  I think the yellow one was spiciest   smokey ones  and fresh ones. Worth getting it  I also got the Carnitas Cubanos with their Calabasas side. It was so fresh and different from other Mexican spots. I can t wait to explore more on their menu.

So. so. good. So. so. worth visiting. Okay  I have so much to say  where to start  Wait time  We had no wait time and were seated right away  arriving at 4pm on Thursday for happy hour  but when we left at 6 30pm  there was a line out the door and it was packed. Know what I know now  if we were forced to wait  I would have. Absolutely. Food  We ordered the Eldorado Salsa Sampler  I really liked the Salsa Fresca  Chileverda  and Salsa X  with Salsa X being the tastiest one and yes  the El Scorpio is hot and I can handle heat  and the Eldorado Queso  delicious. real. legit. queso. . I was a tad disappointed in the chips  which did not seem homemade to me  as they tasted bag-eqsue.  Also  they were sometimes too hard or stale or something  but I figured it was just a bad bag or something. We also got the margarita on happy hour and it was so good. I love that they do not put sour mix in their margs and it was genuinely just a few ingredients that made a very tasty marg. My husband ordered the Carnitas Cubanos and I ordered the Enchiladas Verde. The Carnitas Cubanos plate was amazing. Truly. Crispy  juicy  tender  crunchy  addicting  addicting  addicting. I m literally already thinking about if I were to ever go back  not in Texas anymore    that I would be ordering the carnitas. We also had one Supa Chalupa to split  which was tasty. I love tha the tostada shell was homemade and the carnitas  again  to die for. I just have to say something about the queso. I grew up in Texas and later in life  moved to a state that doesn t offer good  real queso anywhere. To eat the queso at Eldorado was a dream. It was creamy  liquidy and not too thin  thick and not too stringy  it was perfect. Service Ambiance  Kind  patient  helpful and friendly. They have a lot of salsas to try and they walked through each with our group and talked about specials and menu changes and options and more. I can imagine that they talk about these things all night long  over and over  and yet our waitress somehow made it seem as if we were the only ones who mattered and she was not tired of repeating herself. The ambiance of the restaurant feels unassuming  homey  and almost small-town  like. It s super cute. Love this place and highly recommend
Delicious food  and great service. The entire staff is so friendly and welcoming. This was my first time here and they really make every guest feel like a regular. Great spot.
My husband loves the chicken enchilada mole  It s his favorite accessible  casual go-to Mexican restaurant during COVID for take-out on a Friday night.

Great food  amp  service during pandemic   I respect their incredibly hard work to make  amp  serve takeout food during the 2020 2021 pandemic.  I m a devoted customer now  Shiny ribs - fabulous   Short Ribs Salpicon fab. too - as are all meat dishes.  Enjoy all enchiladas too    Wonderful locally owned restaurant

Another great visit to a wonderful neighborhood restaurant. The food was outstanding... I chose and you can not go wrong with their  salsa x   it is x and not 10  wonderful balance of great taste  amp  heat  and the migas plate  is still one of the best I have ever had .  Coffee was good and they kept my cup full.  The memosa hit the spot    Bottom line - great spot  wonderful fresh food. Attentive and friendly service. I will be back

Good vibes  even better food.  I ve said it before and I ll say it again. There is always something more to discover in Austin. The wife and I have an axiom   If you want incredible Mexican or Chinese food  seek out the strip mall.  It did not let us down with Eldorado Cafe.  Brunch was an absolute madhouse when we arrived at 10am. Line out the door  people waiting in the sun  anarchy in the streets  the whole nine yards. We waited 30-40 minutes  indoors  we re not heathens  before we were seated. While waiting  I remarked at how relatively quiet it was. The restaurant is essentially one large room  it was packed  and yet it was still possible to carry on a conversation.  Fresh from the gym  we were starving and went HAM on the menu  Queso  Good  but relatively unremarkable  Salsa Sampler  Salsa X was watery  I was hoping a salsa named  El Scorpio  might have some bite  but instead it was pleasantly herbaceous  Thunder Rosa Taco  Sirloin   Bacon   Jalapenos.  Easily the hottest thing we ordered. Surprisingly filling   Carnitas Cubanos  Get  em. Just do it. I could have eaten plates upon plates of these carnitas.   Honolulu Pork mini-tacos  They re small  but you get four of them. Succulent pork  nicely balanced by the pineapple slaw.   It s worth going to Eldorado on the merit of the food alone. But as we were cramming food into our maws  we noticed something odd. Every employee was smiling. And I mean every.single.one. In between frantic bouts of busting ass on a hectic Sunday morning  they were stopping to chat  embracing one another  and genuinely acting like great human beings. What  During arguably the busiest part of the weekend  Every employee looked like they loved to be there.  As we were wrapping up  a more senior employee swung by to chat us up and thank us for coming out  as it was our first time. We asked what the secret to restaurant happiness was   They just treat us like family  so we treat one another like family.    Sometimes it s just that simple.
COVID-19 Service - excellent.  Many parking stations available.  Telephone your order  pay  and pick a spot.  I ordered a crispy taco and it was ready in 5 minutes.  Taco was pretty good -

This has become my favorite spot  There s usually a slight wait but they are pretty accurate with timing. Their breakfast plates are amazing     Love their fresh chips and their salsa choices. Scorpion salsa is spicy but is my favorite  it s so tasty   They have queso with black beans  pico  and guacamole in it  hands down the best I ve had   Service is good  the manager comes over each time we re there to make sure everything is good which is a nice touch. This is easily one of my favorite brunch spots

My oh my. I ve been waiting to have dinner here for months. However  on this day I only had time to stop in for happy hour drinks and snax. Had the salsa sampler  supa queso and two happy hour crispy beef tacos. The only words i can think of right now about the food is   freaking amazing.   Our wait staff was friendly and told us the food was amazing when she greeted us. I can t wait to go back for the full dinner experience. I seriously want to try everything on the menu. Everything
We came for a late breakfast.  Didn t realize you needed a reservation for inside seating but we were able to get a table outside.  Ordered a couple of breakfast tacos and they were fantastic.
This place is amazing  Highly recommend the short rib enchiladas  margaritas  and all of the legit salsas.  Give this place a try.....you won t be disappointed.
Blown away by the place.  Went in on a whim with my wife and kids.  TOP NOTCH SERVICE  especially the head bartender.  Got to get the Salsa Sampler  guys     WOW.

I don t appreciate being called  Yelpey  when you could not deliver an app - which was pre-made and waiting in the kitchen - in over 20 minutes.  Be frank...owning a restaurant  what would you say if this happened to you

After a long  amp  full day of work  picking up dinner from one of my favorites  Eldorado Cafe ATX.  They only have pick-up  amp  delivery  amp  are considered a compliant restaurant.  They have a good ordering  amp  pick up system.  I m so glad   I can t wait   Yummm    I got a variety of tacos and the roasted potatoes  peppers   amp  onions.  I also got the 2 oz side of queso and guacamole.  Yum

Visited for my first time today--walked in and ordered takeout.  The verse enchiladas with chicken were very tasty. The potato hash and the beans  similar to charro and unexplained to me  1 extra  were extremely skimpy.  Quite disappointing. If not for the tablespoon and a half servings of the sides I would have rated my experience higher. Think too many places are using the pandemic as a lingering excuse for shorting customers on portion size. This may lead to lost business.

No  complete rip-off. Once a stellar sit-down eatery  they became greedy in CoVid times.  I wondered why my fave enchilada plate went from 15- to 30-   gosh  Know why  THEY DONT GIVE YOU ANY SALSA WITH YOUR MEAL  NOT A DROP. That is EXTRA.  Who the      buys Mexican food and then has to pay EXTRA for any salsa   No one. Not this man. 20 other Mexican eateries immediately nearby would never do something as stupid as this. They want my business  and they ll get it  as El Dorado LOST ours.   Arrogance  sheer arrogance. You get your bill  and are like  Hey  wait a minute  wth is going on here. You actually are CHARGING me for something EVERY Mexican restaurant gives away as their calling card  I will NEVER come back.
Good casual dining spot. We have been there for both lunch and dinner. Friendly staff  and good service. Food is a little different than generic Tex Mex but good nonetheless   Definitely recommend

If you love salsa and delicious Mexican food this is you re new favorite restaurant  Their salsas are awarding winning and range from mild to tipping Scoville scales. They are so great. The scorpion pepper salsa is the hottest level of heat I can handle regularly. It s straight addicting. Their menu is full of variety and some unique house specials.   The one down fall of this place is just the location. It s small which makes wait times a little long and it feels like you re on top of the other tables around you. But so worth it  Just bring a small group.

Epic  So amazing. We are in town from Southern CA  and this was some of the best Mexican food I have ever had.  I am a sucker for great Salsa and this did not disappoint. We are in town for a week and I will be making my way back again normally on vacation I won t hit a restaurant more than once  but it was this good. Service was above and beyond.

I  heart  this place   When describing it to my friends I refer to it as an upscale Taco Deli with a larger variety of options  I also  heart  Taco Deli .  Since my first visit I ve been back weekly.....my delay in writing this review might be for selfish reasons  I don t need this place to get any more popular  as it s already difficult to grab a table for dinner on a random Tuesday.  I don t often rave about chips  amp  salsa  and almost never about queso.  But both are on my  MUST  list whenever I come here.  Their salsas and the house queso are amazing   My favorite of their salsas is the spicy  creamy and dreamy Salsa X  and the citrusy fresh Avocado Salsa.  Their guacamole is also great. The corn chips are the perfect texture for scooping up all the goodness.  The enchiladas classica  verde and suizas are all great.  The beef and chicken in their dishes are high quality  as are all the other ingredients.  But what may separate them from other Tex-Mex places is their creativity with fabulous sauces and salsas.  The El Cabo salad is my go-to when I want something on the lighter side. I also love that for a modest up charge you can swap out rice and beans for more creative and tastier sides  such as the 3 Potato Hash and the La Calabasas  squash and zucchini hash w pepitas .  It should go without saying  this place also knows how to put together awesome breakfast tacos.

Went back today in-room dining for first time since pandemic. Food is better than ever. New salsas  bowls  breakfast goodness. So thankful this team made it through. Eldorado is a gem of North Central and we appreciate you all. Y all take great care of your customers and your hard work and amazing food does not go unnoticed. Thank you
Great food and friendly staff   Love the crispy tacos and nice neighborhood restaurant.

I came back for dinner and while the 1 he wait is a drag  we all enjoyed the evening.   The Shiny Ribs app was delicious.  There are 4 so good luck fighting over the last one if you are a party of 3.  We also had the Supa Queso which was delicious   but too runny.  Add depth and it would be phenomenal.  The red   roasted salsa and green medium salsas were absolutely delicious.   My papas rellenos were perfectly colored and crisp.  Use the cabbage as garnish  don t just let it act as a bed. Delicious.   My friend got the Joel and loved it.  The other gal got the short rib enchilada and said it was  good  but not great.   My paloma drink s  was delicious.  Our server was really sweet.  Cherry pie skillet was alright.  The lemon curd special dessert was GREAT.  A note to management  our table was approached  twice by who wr guessed was an owner and or GM... Introduce yourself   gentlemen   it s a bit odd to just walk up to a table without saying your name and position.   Overall   we d love to come back.

So glad I bookmarked this place a long time ago...  My mom and a friend of mine arrived around 1pm on a Saturday and the place was hopping. The 25 min wait flew by thanks to the wine shop next door  which gives out three free tastings daily.   Once seated  I asked the server if they served carne guisada  one of my favorite dishes. He said no  but brought out a sample of their carne adovado. This feels a bit sacrilegious to say but adovado is better than guisada. The owner  Joel  came over and explained that they created the adovado by combining elements of guisada and traditional Texas red chili. It is phenomenal. Even if you do not order this on your next visit  at least ask for a sample.   Also be sure to try out El Scorpio  their hottest hot sauce. TBH I didn t find it terribly hot. However  it does have a strong kick and a very unique flavor. I loved it.   Definitely going to try El Dorado s again in the future.

This is a family favorite   We ve been going ever since they opened and have never been disappointed. Whether we go for breakfast  lunch or dinner  the food is always phenomenal as are the drinks. Joel has a great team there and we recommend it to anyone who asks  and sometimes when they don t . If you haven t been  you need to check it out.

I had a lovely ladies lunch here on a Tuesday.  It was busy.  Everyone liked her food choice.  I had the chicken salad which is called El Cabo  with a side of black beans.  Salad was nice  chicken was grilled just right  moist and flavorful.  Avocado was tasty and ripe.  Chips were good.  Salsa just ok.  Service was just fine with our party of seven.    I travelled from downtown to meet friends which I wouldn t do just to Visit this restaurant again but if I was in the area and hungry  I would dine here again.  Probably a five by this local neighborhood standards  3.75 or 4.0 by Austin foodie standards.

I ll make this one short and to the point.  I have no idea why folks give this place such a high rating.
