It must be one of those  nostalgic  locations that have gone to the wayside  as many others in this town. At the time of my visit  service was horrendous. I understand that Austin has its share of sketchy folks working as waiters bartenders  etc  sadly  this place fits the stereotype. The highly processed chips did not compliment the salsa and the food was unmemorable. I was hoping the drinks were better  however the margarita I received was very unbalanced.  This was definitely a one and done.
Just say yes  I ve enjoyed breakfast  lunch  and dinner on the same day  Their takeout is easy and fast. Super friendly  great food  try ALL of the sauces.
Place was amazing  food was great and service was on point  Highly recommend trying them out.

I love tex-mex and the was amazing.  I was expecting a lot and was so impressed.  We had to wait on a weekday around 1 00 so they are busy a lot.  I LOVED their salsas--you can order a sampler platter and that was so great so try everything--I literally could not pick a favorite and asked if they sold jars of it to take on the airplane home. For the apps  we had the cheese stuffed taco thingy--I cannot remember the name but they were good. The enchilada entree  with mole  was awesome.  The veggie enchilada with potato was also great. Great margarita.    Just overall really great food  kid friendly and great service.  COME HERE      I am confused at the negative reviews but they seem to be more on service  ours was great  and on charging for salsa  you get two included .

If I were to choose a go-to Tex Mex spot  it d be here. For. Sure.   I gotta say that the Sandinista with the watermelon agua fresca is sooooo delightful and refreshing--especially on a warm summer evening    I got the enchiladas suizas and thoroughly enjoyed it. Maybe I haven t had enchiladas in a while  but woah  these were surprisingly good  The creamy salsa verde sauce with the cheese wasn t heavy at all. The flavors were definitely there  and the beef filling had wonderful spice and was really tender.   For dessert  we got the sopapilla cheesecake which was... just wow. The pastry dough had layers upon layers. You could taste the texture contrast from the crunchy exterior to the flakier middle and then the soft doughy interior and then you reach the cheesecake goodness... top it off with some cinnamon and honey... yum  Might as well top it off with some ice cream too    Totally want to come back here  And definitely for the sopapilla cheesecake

This was one of our main event brunch places before the pandemic hit in 2020 and we finally went back for the first time in a couple years. It s still good but it probably will be taken out of our roster for go-to brunch places. Why  Two reasons  1.  They no longer are open on Sundays  like  SERIOUSLY  This is my boyfriend and I s ideal day to do brunch  having a brunch place that isn t open Sundays is like having a bar that closes at 5pm  and 2.  They also without warning stopped serving breakfast items on the menu after 11am  would have been nice if their menu or website said something about this  . The food overall is still pretty good and the sauces they bring out are amazing  get the salsa X   and portions are good though the enchiladas I had were in a cream that was a bit sour for my taste. I d like to review based on the breakfast but once again I can t because I came here expecting it and then when we got our order taken at 11 15 they said they weren t serving breakfast anymore. Hopefully next time I get to try it and see if it s still good  but with their new days of operation and breakfast hours who knows when that will even be. Whatta shame
Best of the best  I would highly recommend this place for the food mainly but the ambiance is fun and funky.

Sooooooo  it s  not tex mex   but it s the ONLY PLACE YOU SHOULD EVEN PRETEND TO EAT TEX MEX      but seriously  you really must eat here. be prepared for a wait  but everything on the menu is worth it   Also  the staff are all superb
Two words. Shiny Ribs. Four more words. Honolulu Pork Mini Tacos. Want more  Carnitas Cubanos.  I m a fan and will likely increase this review to a 5 star hard-on after I ve tried more of their fare
Overwhelmingly good food  our plates were nice and hot. Everything was flavorful and tasted authentic. The owner was nice enough to come by our table and say hello too  Definitely recommend.

I hesitate to write this review  because you can still get a table most of the time  but I know that s going to change  and quickly   This place is simply wonderful   Everything on the menu is well thought out  beautifully presented and delicious. Try something new  you won t be disappointed

A new favorite  Menu had the classic TexMex dishes plus lots of new twists. We tried the short rib enchiladas and an appetizer called a pushka   sp  . Both were excellent. In addition they have a variety of salsas to choose from. My favorite was the avocado green salsa  mild . We will definitely be back

Like the atmosphere. We were seated within 5 minutes on a Saturday around 11am. Love the prices. All the food was fresh  delicious. The staff was really attentive. We had two guys besides our waiter that came by the table to ask how everything was. The salsa flight is delightful and I loved that I could easily eat keto here with their bowl options. Their mini tacos looked beautiful and although i could only eat the meat they were delightful my boyfriend said  colorful presentation too and i just effing love a mini taco. Too cute not to like. Will def be coming back. Once I m off this diet I m going to slam one of their Agua frescas  Highly recommend.

What a great place with people that really do seem trying to give you a good experience.  It s a fun looking place. Well lit  free fairly fast wifi. The portions or generous. The service is attentive and friendly. If you like tex mex and find potatoes comforting this is definitely the place for you. Potato flautas  Potato flautas  Potato flautas   Though breakfast is  officially  over at 11  there are a few breakfast items like migas and chilaquiles all day. Vegetarian  Just ask and they will try to accommodate you.  Looking for a good happy hour  Yes. The friendliness seems to spill over to the clientele. Bar seating is comfortable. Bartenders always seem friendly and working to keep everyone happy. There s outdoor seating on a nice day. Only downside  It s not a secret anymore and can get crowded.  Yes  I ll be back.

We came here around brunch time on Sunday  the wait was around 25 min which was reasonable but there was open seating at the bar with full service dining so we sat there. The bartender Arturo was our server and our dining experience was amazing  mainly because of his good service  but also because of the salsas and food being delicious overall. Prices were reasonable too. We got the migas plate as well as the barcacoa tacos and the papa rellena taco - all very flavorfull and tasty. The smoky green salsa in particular was my favorite  definitely recommend it.

Well it s great to find a new breakfast brunch spot. Plus 1 had a business lunch here and raved about it so we stopped by on a Sunday AM for brunch. I usually refuse to wait in a queue to dine especially for breakfast but I m glad we did wait the 30 minutes to be seated.   Let s fill out the template. Service was fantastic  even though they were busy as heck the servers and runners kept up. We were checked on a number of times by both our competent server and the manager. One blemish  Plus 1 s bloody was pretty darn plain  not spicy and it tasted as if they forgot to shake up the mix before pouring. But the food is the star here.   Plus 1 ordered the migas plate and she was raving about it. I ordered the Freddie plate scrambled eggs dressed up rather spicy. Our clean plates testified to the awesomeness of our food. I m not sure how they do em but their black beans are fabu  I ll probably order a double portion on my next visit.   I would be remiss if I did not mention their chips and salsa. Like the heat  Then make sure you order their spicy salsa. Their tamer version is still a tad spicy but very flavorful.  The Eldorado goes right to the top of our dining rotation

Thank you to Eldorado for your superb performance during the pandemic. Your ordering process is smooth  your pickup process is clear and very safe. We appreciate you staying with it during this difficult time
Yummy in my tummy when I need my TexMex fix. In my neighborhood too   Friendly attentive service. Prices are reasonable for meal size.  You won t leave hungry   one of my favs.

We had Gloria s Chilaquiles and Nomad Plate. Both plates were really good and filling for  8. We also had their salsa five ways. A good way to try different salsas before picking one the next time we are there.   The place was packed at 11 30 am but we were lucky we didn t have to wait.
Really great Mexican food.  Whenever the family wants to eat out and we can t decide a place this is always our fallback.  Delicious food that never disappoints.

This must be Allandale s best kept secret    We only just discovered Eldorado Caf  when they were featuring hot sauce and tacos at the Hot Sauce Festival. Since then  we ve been dying to go.   We finally made our way over on Friday night at 6pm and were shocked when they said there was an hour wait  I convinced my husband to stay and I am so glad I did.   The food was well worth the wait.   The crispy pork dish I ordered tasted like an elevated version of Sarku Japan s chicken teriyaki. That may seem like a slight to Eldorardo  but there s a reason Sarku has a mile long line every day at lunch time.   The nachos compuesto were equally as impressive  as was the margarita that I ordered.   It seems like every person we saw leaving the building was happy. That s a good sign.   Can t wait to come back

We stopped in around 12 30p on a Sunday..got sat right away.  Lindsay was our server and was amazing      The Queso was da bomb    I liked the spicy salsa  amp  the kids liked the mild one.  Enchiladas Suizas was spectacular   I went with chicken  beef  amp  cheese..chicken was my fav.  My husband got the Joel s Happy Plate and said it was delicious    Shiny Ribs as ordered by my 7yr old and she loved them.  My 10y old got the homemade biscuit with honey  amp  butter  it was huge      My 13 yr old got the enchiladas Classico  cheese .   We will definitely be back when we are on this side of town again   Yum yum

Authentic  authentic  authentic. The food here is always so fresh  delicious and semi-healthy for Mexican meals. It s a quaint spot with incredibly helpful staff. Michaela  our waitress  recommended a squash side and my aunt and I fell in love with it. The margaritas are  10 but very strong  Highly recommend.

Hidden spot in the north shoal creek area. Mexican comfort food. Their house made salsas are their signature. Will definitely be back to try more dishes.  El Scorpio  Their hottest salsa  not my thing - 5 10 Salsa Fresca  fresh and mild - 7 10 Habanero Salsa  On the hotter end  but their tastiest salsa - 9 10 Drink  Prickly Pear Margarita  not very strong but quite tasty - 8 10 Entre   Carn  Adovado  Slow cooked sirloin. Flavor here is really popping. It s almost too salty  but with the sides and condiments it s just about right. - 8.4 10  Overall  7.9 10  Follow me on IG  ahmadeats for all the food and attractions

I would give this a 4-5 normally  but their COVID policy has forced me to stop trying to go.  I ve been turned away 4 times now  because if the incredibly limited seating. If you want to go here  good luck.  It s a crap shoot.  It s a shame because I was a fan.  But There are many other choices in this town. This place needs to go back to work and open up their restaurant.  Silly.

My friends and I came here for brunch on a Sunday. The host was very surprised to hear we had a group of 10  I guess they don t normally have larger parties . They whipped us a few tables together and we were seated in a short amount of time. The restaurant was busy but we were served chips and salsa  mild and medium  and water quickly. The medium level salsa was probably the best salsa I ve ever had in a Mexican restaurant. The flavor was so unique and had a kick that was tolerable. I got the huevos rancheros that came with extra tortillas  corn or flour  of your choice. My meal was  9ish which was such a great deal considering all the food you get. It was so good and I can still conjure up the taste if I think about it now. The decor was super cute and you felt like you were in Latin America.

At first I was hesitant because my first experience was off  but I know now it was because of the stuff I picked and the waitress being new. Now that I ve been a few times I am addicted to the damn salsa    It s so good   The breakfast tacos are out of this world and so are the biscuits and gravy. I miss alborz but I wish el dorado fortune and fame
No reservations. You may wait... Have a margarita  Make a new friend  Enjoy  Life is good  Food is good

We decided that we wanted to try a new restaurant so I found this place on Yelp  checked out the menu and decided that we d go here for dinner.  They use an app  Resi  for reservations and I joined their waiting list so I thought.  Arrived and they were completely booked and I was told that the app is very misleading and that there is no actual waiting list.  I was clearly disappointed and told them so.  The manager overheard and told the hostess that he would personally wait on us but that the only table available was outside and it was hot.  We decided to take him up on his very kind offer.  We sat down and they told us that a table opened up and we could sit inside. Yay   They have lots of vegetarian options  great margaritas  delicious food and incredible service.  Everyone was super nice.  Great experience and looking forward to my next visit.  Highly recommend but please make sure you have a reservation

Stopped by for brunch with my two girls and we were pleasantly surprised by the selection of food offered. My four year old who hates beans loved the ones here  They were very good. I got the chilaquiles which were tangy and delicious. The three potato hash was also very good. The tacos are a good size. My husband is a big guy and two were able to satisfy his hunger.   I also want to thank them for being accommodating to my two daughters. I often find it hard to find places that are kid friendly. However  this establishment was child friendly and the waitress was very sweet to them.   The wait was about ten minutes on this busy Saturday morning  which was not bad when the service and the food was good. Will be back

1 30pm on a Sunday for 2- took 40 mins to get a table  but that s what we expected.   Got the SalsaX as the free table salsa. Smokey chipotle salsa  not too spicy.  Got the Supa Chalupa and the Santa Rosa taco- oh my lord they were both so good  100  worth the wait  and I ll have the exact same order next time I m here.

Stopped in here for lunch solely based on the top Yelp reviews and man  I m so glad I did. This place is too legit to quit. I was able to escape from my meetings a little early for lunch and this place was already jam-packed. I was able to get a seat at the bar and was greeted with prompt service  awesomely crunchy chips  with your choice of mild  medium  or hot salsa   and a menu that made me think I was going to have to come back again a few times to try everything that I wanted to.   I ain t scared so I went with the hot salsa. I m from NM so I figured I could take it since most place s version of  hot  is laughable to me. Well  this place delivered. It was hot but delicious. A bit of a weird color but I suspect it s because it was habaneros.   I finally settled on the carnitas plate. Oh em gee. They were tender  juicy  and had the most delicious crust with just a touch of crunch on them. They were served with an amazing salsa  guac  pickled red onions  etc. I chose the side of their version of calabacitas  I think they called them calabasas   and their green rice with the queso at the waitress s recommendation.   Have I already said OMG   Everything was to die for  fresh  and on point in terms of flavor. I cannot say enough great things about this place  it rocks.

Right offhand  Austin has about 700 places doing solid enchiladas  but only one charging  5.95 for a salsa sampler. This place. But if you go for it you probably won t be disappointed  because I think it s the best salsa in town too. I m pretty sure we re approaching first world problems here.  Eldorado Caf  is hip  amp  cool  the food is superb  and if you come here not expecting a crowd  you re delusional  What new restaurant criteria are you using these days  It s also pretty loud  amp  pricey  but if I was tasked to introduce someone to Tex-Mex tomorrow  I d bring them here - why not have it all kicked up a notch   I have only one complaint  and it s serious  If you re doing elevated Tex-Mex - my bad  I believe hipsters now call it  Lone Star Fusion  - you simply have to have a miga plate at all times. Because it s not just for breakfast anymore  especially when the ubiquitous fried egg option is offered for every other menu item. Call it something else  jack up the price or whatever  but you cannot strip the soul of Lone Star Fusion s single greatest contribution - the Miga. There will never be enough gold  even within Eldorado  to make up for that.

I have yet to find an  off time  to come to El Dorado Cafe. Every time I have visited  it has been hopping with patrons willing to wait to get a seat.  Food here is quite good and fresh.  Enchiladas suizas are served in the usual way drenched in sauce and melted cheese  served alongside black beans and rice.  Special touch at El Dorado Cafe on the enchilada plate is the crunch of fresh matchstick cut jicama and carrots.  Tortilla chicken soup is a hearty portion for an economical price for this bright and fresh meal in a bowl.  Service was everything that it needed to be.  We ve also had take-out from El Dorado.  This is a great pick-up option for me when it will be a busy evening with no time to cook.  I can place an order as I leave the office  it s ready when I get there  I pick it up on the way home and voila tasty dinner   Enchiladas are excellent options for take-out as they travel quite well.

Absolutely one of our favorite places    The food is amazing  the margaritas are delicious  And the staff is always friendly and attentive    We have been going to El Dorado since it opened  never disappointed       sometimes twice a day even     Wonderful HAPPY HOUR as well

You ll find rainbow of salsas  lively atmosphere and hearty plates at Eldorado. I have tried to dine here a few times but was to hungry for the hour wait but finally on a Sunday afternoon we scored seating.  I like variety and was pleased to see a variety of salsas to include an avocado salsa. The verde mushroom enchiladas were generously portioned and were served with a small serving of rice and black beans. The brunch looks phenomenal and I look forward to coming back to give it a try.

La La La La La Bomba  That s what I was singing on my way out of here Saturday morning. This place is a hidden gem tucked between MoPac and Anderson in quite the unassuming strip plaza. A friend and I decided to try this out for brunch and  boy  did they not disappoint.   When you walk in you get a chic  yet cozy vibe. This place is really put together nicely. There is a full bar to your left and the floor is filled with your standard dining tables chairs  although you might can snag one of the cute cafe tables with the adorable lounge chairs  It manages to capture the Mexican style  using pops of color  without overdoing it.   As we sat down  I was pleased to see the plethora of breakfast options. You could do anything from biscuits and gravy to breakfast tacos. I thought I had settled on a simple biscuit and gravy entree  until the La Bomba made it s appearance on the table next to me... my friend and I both switched our order. Fair to say it was the most solid decision I made that day. The La Bomba comes with a thick  yet fluffy  biscuit  eggs  sausage  gravy  and CHEESE  How could you go wrong   It was a lot of food so I ended up taking half of it home  but I definitely don t feel like I paid for that much food. It was a very reasonably priced meal  leaving enough room to splurge for a Mexican Coke in a bottle.   I especially recommend this for a Saturday brunch since they can be hard to come by. Pro tip  they serve breakfast until 3 all weekend    If you re in the area  hit this place up. You ll be singing the tune with me ...  La la la la la la Bomba...

I have lots of good things to say about this place. Possibly the best twist on Mexican food I ve had   We stopped by for happy hour   dinner  and started with mango margaritas. Warning  these babies are strong.   Side note  The combination of the thick glass the marg comes in  plus the ice  makes it difficult to drink. Because of that  I drank it _really_ slowly aka it actually lasted the entire meal. Probably for the best  since it was strong  but made it hard to knock down several if that s your game plan.  We ordered queso and papas rellenas for apps. The queso is bomb.  nuff said. The papas rellenas were pretty good  but certainly not authentic by any means. A lot like mozzarella fritters with some potato thrown in there.  My friends both ordered enchiladas  while I ordered the adobo chicken  along with the 3 potato hash  and veggie hash on the side. Personally I liked the enchiladas better  but the chicken was darn good as well. And the hashes were a wonderful accompaniment to an otherwise heavy meal.  To top everything off  the service was  fantastic . Our server was incredibly friendly  despite us being those annoying people who take forever to order  change our minds  etc   and several other staff  owners   stopped by to check on us   ask about our meals. This place has great food  great vibes  great margs  what more can you ask for

The boyfriend   you know what s different about this place  Every other Mexican food restaurant you go to  tastes like another place which tastes like another place. But nothing tastes like this place..   We ABSOLUTELY LOVE Eldorado Cafe. The food  the staff  the ambiance  THE SANDANISTA try it with a chili salt rim  . You can t go wrong here. Casual dinner  date night  Mother s day  brunch  any occasion   You ll come hungry and leave happy for sure   Cheers    P.S. Check out Justen s plate scraped clean on the left..I literally had to stop eating to write this review.

Another fabulous visit to ElDorado. Staff is always amazing. We brought friends tonight for their first visit. We were nervous that we talked to up too much. They LOVED the food and the whole experience. The wait is long  but that s because they are well loved. It s worth the wait. This is our 4th visit and I ll continue going back. It s comfort food with a deep interior flavor. Damn  this place is amazing    Edit  we ordered takeout the next night because it s that good. The waitress noticed us and said  you re back

I m so glad we finally got to try this fantastic cafe. My wife and I tried to visit for breakfast a few weeks ago...except it was Easter Sunday.. Whoops  So we tried again last week then had to make a return visit on Sunday because it was so delicious. The restaurant is much larger on the inside than it appears from the outside. They have a full bar and 5-6 beers on draft. Additionally  they have a happy hour margarita that is pretty dang tasty for  5.  Their salsa sampler is the way to go. Try all of their offerings. I loved their salsa verde  salsa X and El Scorpio. We also got the Supa Queso which was delicious and even better with a little bit of the salsa X added in. On my first visit  I had the enchiladas verde which were stellar. Their rice and beans are top-notch as well. Second visit  I went with the huevos rancheros which were just what the doctor ordered early on a Sunday morning. I also had to sample their sopapilla cheesecake which is an absolute must. I think it would be killer with some fresh berry compote over the top. This is now our top option when we are in this part of town.

Holy smokes. Do you guys know what you ve done  In an era where places in Austin are going out of business left and right  you ve launched a brand new Tex Mex ... oid ... concept and are melting people s faces off ... Maybe this area is really grown up enough to have kick-ass neighborhood food   The tricky bit is  you guys did it by replicating a lot of what used to make the best places in this town rad ... but which folks seem to have forgotten ...  First of all  the vibe. It is SO old school Austin. The nightly specials menu had a Les Amis reference. When Joel came by the table  we got a Mad Dog and Beans reference. We felt so at home  And it s infectious. The number of folks who chatted with us   in such a happy and friendly fashion   was just rad  It seriously reminded my wife and me of the old school  90s crowds waiting outside Kerbey on Kerbey at 2am ...  And the food - we ordered an irresponsible amount  but regretted NOTHING. So amazingly good. We shared the salsa sampler  the queso  the completely insane puzchkas  and crispy tacos.   We loved all the salsas  but the Scorpio was my fave. The Salsa X was smoky and hotter than I expected   which was great   and the wife dug the Chile Verde. The queso was also super satisfying - very well seasoned.   The puzchkas - I just ... it s like potato skins and dim sum United into something delightful and terribly forbidden and I ate way too many   The tacos were likewise delicious. They were perfect crispy beef tacos. I could have eaten 20 while gaming.   Finally  I had the short rib salpicon  and my wife had the Chicken Enchiladas Suizas. The short ribs were like the best southwest pot roast ever  and the corn tortillas TOTALLY held up to the mess. The hash and the calabasas rounded out the meal with a great roasted grilled flavor.   The enchiladas were spicy and savory and ... my wife is indicating that she s going to fail this episode of Food Network Star because she can only keep repeating  Delicious   over and over again ...  It was all great. We will be back  with our 10 year old   because yes  it s a great afor kids   and all our friends.   UPDATE - went back last Friday with our 10 year old and four of our friends. Our group of seven had a great time chilling on the patio with drinks. Given the size of the group  the wait was not bad at all  and the environment is so chill   and the El Dorado Mule so spicy and sweet   that we didn t even notice.   Our waiter Eric rocked both the service and his mustache. We ordered an irresponsible amount of food - scored the Shiny Ribs this time  which were savory-salty-sweet amazingness - and everyone loved what they got. The Chi Chi Tinga was like the best spicy bbq chicken ever.   Everyone agreed that we ll definitely come back as a group again

One of my favorite restaurants in Austin. Love their salsa  carnitas de cubanos  the steak w chimichurri  the calabazas and the charro beans  The people who own this place and who work here are so kind and friendly. I d take anyone here- a date  friends  family. Killer happy hour. I m happy to be giving them my business during the pandemic bc I want them to be around a long time. Their curbside pickup is truly hands-free and wonderfully organized.

First time in  co-worker recommended and it did not disappoint    When we arrived the wait was 40 mins but they overshot the wait  it was only maybe 20 mins.   Waitress was awesome and informative. We started w the potato sopes and it was the signal of how the rest of the meal would go.   Salsa  mild was flavorful  and chips  You can tell a lot about a place by their salsa.   Continued on w the the main dish  Joel s Happy Plate  2 Beef and 1 Cheese enchilada...tried the cheese n rice instead of the norm. Another good rec by the waitress  Camille was great    To top all off  they were out of the Sopapilla Cheesecake so we opted w the Summertime Delight...so good    The service  the cooks and the food are all worth a comeback visit and a new  go to  for Me.
Great lunch  fast  friendly service. Taco and queso were very good. Chips were fresh  not out of bag. Salsa was good. Good lunch for the price.

While I certainly adore Austin s plethora of inexpensive  often greasy Tex-Mex mainstays  every once and a while I crave some options beyond the same old refried beans and  Spanish  rice sides  or the same old chips  amp  queso  amp  salsa  one tomato red  one tomatillo green  starter. Eldorado Cafe is a good place for me to take a break from my Tex-Mex routine while still enjoying some other Latin-based flavors with a bit of spice. Plus  north side love  Don t y all know I get tired of having to drive 15 miles to downtown for everything    I love the 5 fresh salsa options  especially the extra spicy yellow El Scorpio that sort of reminds me of Tacodeli s green Do a sauce  no wonder  as one of the owners has a history with TD . Be aware that all of the salsas  and everything else  for that matter  are homemade at El Dorado  and they will charge you  5 for the pleasure of trying them all at once. Hey  it s worth it to find out which one is your favorite so you know which one to order next time you re here  Plus  you can brag that you just ate an Austin Chronicle Award Winning dish. Of course  if you re gonna have all that spicy salsa  you re going to need to cool it down with some fresh guac  and theirs is simply perfect.  A delicious hot appetizer that I haven t found on other menus around town is the papas rellenas plate. The El Dorado recipe is basically a fluffy  crispy mashed potato fritter filled with goat  amp  jack cheese - heaven in your mouth  I think you get 4 to a plate  and each one is about the size of my palm. After the salsa sampling and this  you may not have room for your entree - you ve been warned.  After all that fried goodness  my main meal is usually a  Pick 3    11  of the unique side dishes that I can t get anywhere but here  more about that in a minute   but if I ve been able to muster some willpower to limit my consumption of the starters  I like to go for Esme s Magic enchiladas  which are filled with savory mashed potatoes and topped with ancho chile sauce  shredded lettuce  purple cabbage  tomato  amp  queso fresco. It s almost a salad and I feel like I m actually eating something good for me. All of the veggie sides are tasty  but my faves are probably the Eldorado Rice  basmati with roasted green chiles  grilled corn  cilantro  amp  scallion   Las Calabasas  butternut squash  zucchini  roasted garlic  toasted pepitas  amp  basil   and the Mojo Veg  lemon garlic roasted cauliflower  carrots  peppers  amp  onions . Oh  and you can even get the rice with queso added to make  CheezNRice  if you need more variety or are missing the cheese sauce part of your food pyramid.  I ve not yet made it in for breakfast  but I like what I see on that menu  too. In addition to the usual suspects of migas and tacos  I see some biscuits  amp  gravy and a decadent maple candied bacon cinnamon roll  plus what looks like migas combined with picadillo in Freddy s Plate. And a taco that includes one of those potato fritters  Oh  I mma need to go try that real soon.  Service has been great during my lunch and dinner visits  but I will say that the place has been crowded every time I ve dined there. I d check out the Googles and see when the uncrowded sweet spot is if you don t want to wait for a table.  And I almost forgot - El Dorado is pretty kid-friendly. In the waiting area up front  they have some books  amp  toys for the kiddoes and my picky eater thought the quesadillas were great.
Great food  For some reason Yelp wants me to write more before it will post so I ll repeat myself  great food

We love Eldorado Cafe and couldn t be happier that they re right down the street. The service  amp  take out has continued to be fantastic during COVID. They re keeping our family sane while we get through all this together

Doesn t get better. The nachos with beef picadillo are so delicious that-- even though we know we should try other things-- my husband and I both order them every time. The owner is a great guy and the service is good. Salsa X is the best.
The service was exceptional.  The chips  guac and taco were really good.  Nice atmosphere.

I really wanted to try the  supa queso  and love y all. It looked delicious from everyone s pics and the rave reviews online. We came in on a Wednesday evening and the host let us know that they were booked out for the evening  but luckily he offered us take out  After checking out the menu for a few minutes  we were ready to make our order  but waited for a different employee who was on the phone. Then the original guy walked up and completely ignored us after looking RIGHT at us  without saying a word  and then another employee walked up and looked at us without saying a word  and then another... Eventually they were just having a pow-wow and ignoring us all together behind the counter  We tried to flag someone but every attempt was quite LITERALLY ignored. I m a hostess who has worked at several large and high-volume restaurants in Austin  places with 3  hour waits at brunch. I know they were trying to buy time on a super slammed night  but not even getting a  Sorry folks  I ll be with you in a few minutes  combined with watching the entire staff glance at us and refuse to acknowledge was really off putting... especially on a  busy  night. It was obvious they weren t that busy. Granted  we are two very short girls in their 20 s often mistaken for teenagers  who were in a room of middle aged folk... but still. I digress. I hate leaving bad reviews  but this left a bad taste in my mouth as someone who works in the restaurant industry herself. And I would want to know if I offended customers

Great atmosphere  waited around 15 minutes on a Sunday morning. I loved my food  left food without a huge dent in the wallet. the chips and salsa were good  left me very full before my entree came out. they charge for extra salsa. Just a solid job  nothing wrong. solid meal for a solid price. the dinner lunch entree look a big more pricey than breakfast but as far has breakfast goes this place hits the spot

Visiting from chicago with a friend who just moved to Austin. I will leave Austin with such a warm heart and full belly. Our dinner here was incredible. The food and drinks were out of this world but the friendliness of the owner and the fun and professional staff made us feel like we were family. I ve never felt so welcomed at a restaurant.   I had a watermelon margarita and sangria that were unique and delicious. We had the shiny ribs to start and I had the Carnitas Cubanos for entree. I will dream of those Carnitas. Super full we still had the chocolate mousse topped with horchata Creme. Yum    Next time I m back in Austin for work this will be my first stop

So excited that we stumbled upon this restaurant. Will definitely be back  Delicious  authentic Mexican food with a unique flare. Everything we ordered was delicious. You have your choice of mild  medium  or spicy salsa and the medium had just the right kick. We also ordered the queso and were quite pleased  we finished the entire small  The restaurant just recently won a  queso off  and after trying it  I believe the title was deserved. I also love the choices of sides. There are many different vegetable and hash options as we as your more traditional rice and beans.  We ordered chalupas  enchiladas  and carnitas  and each plate hit the spot.

Took my mom here for lunch on her birthday after reading some fellow yelpers reviews.   This place is awesome from the moment you walk in. Love the colorful decor and friendly staff.   We asked our server about some items on the menu and she was very helpful in explaining and leading us to some excellent choices.   We started with the chips and salsa. They have 5 house made salsas to choose from. We went with the chileverde which was dead center on the list for heat. I liked the flavor but it could have been hotter. We also had the queso. Nice and creamy but I really think the star of this was the chips  Nice and crispy and the perfect thickness for dipping.   Next we tried the puzchkas. 4 golden fried dumplings that were filled with a yummy filling were a nice small plate option.   Mom had the chicken enchiladas verde with rice and beans. The plate was huge with 3 enchiladas. They were flavorful and the chicken was tender with plenty of sauce.   I ordered the mojo pollo with 2 sides  3 potato hash and the calabasas. Absolutely LOVED  everything on my plate  The mojo pollo is a marinated chicken fajita type dish. The chicken was moist and the flavor marries well with the bed of grilled onions and peppers it was served on. Went for the flour tortillas instead of corn. Nice choice. The potatoes were perfect and the spice  I think cumin  was subtle yet addictive. I love squash so the calabasas caught my eye from the beginning and they did not disappoint  So yummy.   We were so stuffed  The owner  Joel  was making his rounds ensuring everyone was happy. He is so personable. We found out that he and my mom share a birthday  Not only did they bring out a special dessert but he also gave her a t-shirt. So sweet   We managed to find a little room for the delicious dessert   I d recommend this place to anyone looking for a unique take on Mexican food with a good vibe

Soooo  we roll into Austin with the rain and of course do what one does when first entering Austin. . . . eat.  Our friends take us to Eldorado Cafe  they mention something about Joel from Taco D_l_ and don t have to say anymore. We re in.  We walk in and immediately get the Austin vibe and are greeted by super friendly staff. As I walk to the table I can t help but look at all the plates of food on the tables as we walk by  it looks incredible.  We take our seats and the waitress come over  does her thing and we order a ton of food  just can t help it as it all sounds so good on paper. The drinks arrive from the bar  they are spot on. Not some watered down kids beverage but a very good balanced drink.  The food then starts to show up  it looks great. We all dig in and I am telling you this stuff is fantastic. From the guacamole to the Shiny Ribs to the Puzchkas. Everything is just dead on.  So  the short story is this place is run great  the staff is great  the food is great the atmosphere is great. Yes Joel greats everyone and makes you feel right at home. So swing by  order one of everything as you won t retr it. And yes Joel  please open a location in Houston  and the Heights would be perfect.                           So we went back for breakfast  yep it s well worth it. Everything and I mean everything was fantastic. Customer service update for you  as if it could improve  we made mention of the cinnamon rolls they used to serve and I guess removed from the menu. Well next thing you know Joel is bringing a plate of  Hungry Jacks  to the table. That s right  he went to the kitchen and whipped up something for his customer just because. So if that does not scream customer service I don t know what does.   Again an awesome place where you feel right at home. Put those  Hungry Jacks  on the menu Joel  oh please . . . .

A friend and I tried Eldorado Cafe last week and had a decent meal  with pretty good service. The place was absolutely slammed - we picked a heck of a night to try them. They had a surprise party of 22  then several other bigger parties. While those parties were finishing up when we got there  it was still a 30-45 minute wait. We decided to wait  along with several other people  and were seated in about 30. We spoke with one of the hostesses waitresses and she was really  nice..very personable and friendly.  Their space is really nice - with a mix of tables and chairs  and a decent sized waiting area inside. It is nicely decorated and has a comfortable atmosphere - and I believe I saw some big lounge type chairs in back which is pretty cool.   Once seated  our waitress was generally pretty great - although we waited quite a while for our Eldorado queso  and really didn t get enough time to enjoy it before our meals came. While we were happy to get our meals quickly  as we had been waiting a half hour to be seated  queso time is important  too. The queso and chips themselves  however  were above average  we really liked them. Their house salsa was also fantastic.  On to the food - I ordered the Carnitas Cubanos. The pork was really good - think hashbrown style... crispy grilled on both sides. While the flavor was there  this dish was in desperate need of a sauce or some cheese. Even with stellar beans and rice  it was dry and lacking. My friend ordered the Hongos and seemed fairly pleased with her meal. We topped it off with splitting the generously portioned skillet cherry pie - which was amazing.  I m giving three stars   read as 3.5  for a pretty good first experience with room for improvement. I ll definitely be coming back again and I m sure they ll improve. Thanks
Excellent food and friendly staff...usually busy no matter when you go...always a good sign.

This place is delicious. I ve lived down the street for 2 years and only recently discovered them. The Shaunna-Wanna Taco Salad with chicken and sesame dressing is absolutely amazing. The chicken is so flavorful and perfectly cooked.   I also tried the Suizas enchiladas with Mojo Veg and nearly cried at how good it was from the first bite. I wanted to stop eating 3 4 of the way cause I started teetering on the edge of uncomfortable full but it tasted so fricken good I finished my whole plate. I was absolutely stuffed with joy   Seriously how they season their food is out of this world. I ve been getting to-go since covid and I haven t been disappointed once with the quality of their food or their covid precautions.

From the drinks  to the salsas  hellloooo Salsa X    to the entrees  to the donuts.  Hands down my favorite place to pick up food when I m in the area.  Hell - I ve been known to drive from SW Austin for their food.  I literally  dream  about their carnitas Cubanos and las calabasas.  Joel s Happy Plate - Oh. So. Amazing. Also - I put salsa X on everything at home.  It s a staple.  Just go pick up something. Anything. You ll be glad you did.

We drive pretty far out of our way to come here every Saturday because their food is so good. Never had a bad dish  but after I found the Lucy s Short Rib Machacado I ll never order anything else.   Literally everything on the plate has flavor infused into it. The beans are sprinkled with green onions  the potatoes are saut ed with onions and bells peppers  and their sauces are too notch  try them all .

I ve been wanting to try this place ever since it opened.  A friend invited me to lunch so that was the opportunity.  I had enchiladas suizas with vegetables instead of rice.  I thought it was very  very good  and large portions as well.  I gave only three stars because our server wasn t friendly  and at one point seemed to be trying to get us to hurry up.  We had just finished eating when this occurred.  I want to return because the entree was so good  so am hoping for friendlier service.

Finally the skies opened up and dropped Eldorado Cafe into our  hood  An angel must have heard our cries for some delicious Mexican comfort food nearby. We had tried their tasty food at Dia s Market when they had Friday Pop-Ups and loved everything. Now  we have a full menu to select from for Breakfast  Lunch and Dinner. And a wonderful bar   I stopped by for a quick bite after my workout so I could justify the large basket of chips. These are not just any chip but chips made perfectly in the kitchen using the owner s recipe. Crunchy and flavorful with five salsas  people. Five  Each one delicious and flavorful. Do try this bargain at  5.95. And I might as well admit it  I m in love with the Salsa X  I could drink this stuff and use it as shampoo.  My lunch of three sides  Seasoned Black Beans  3 Potato Hash and Las Calabasas  was more than filling. I have a second lunch for tomorrow. Olivia  my server  was so sweet and informative as was Jessie  the GM. I am looking forward to seeing them both again  and many more tasty and delicious meals at Eldorado Cafe with family and friends. They do have a pup friendly outdoor area with a few tables.

Went here with a friend for brunch and it was meh. I had read the other reviews and knew about the charge for additional salsas and wasn t surprised when the server mentioned it and my friend I decided to pay for an extra salsa and got their smokey one and a milk green one. When the salsas arrive  I was surprised at the small size you get and also looking over at the table next to us  they had containers twice the size of ours and they were also a group of 2...I m not sure if there is large size you can order or if we were just unlucky. Moving on to the food  I got my usualy brunch dish  migas which came with bean and a potato hash. I found both the migas and the has to be bland and had to drown it in the smokey salsa to add some flavor. I would come back for the salsa but not the migas.  Service was weird. At first  they kept rushing us to order  someone stopped by to check in every other minute to see if we were ready. We came in near the end of brunch rush and there was no wait when we came so I was confused as to why they seemed to be rushing to get us to order. The weird thing was when it came to pay it took forever so no idea what was happening but it meant more time to enjoy the salsa.   Overall  would I come back  maybe  if a friend wanted to check out this place but I would not get the migas again. There are many other places that do migas better and might stick to the breaskfast taco. BUT I do RECOMMEND their SMOKEYflavored salsa was amazing and I will be getting that if I go back.

Let s begin with the positives.  The decorum was very appealing  our server was very friendly and professional  and there was plenty of ice in the margarita  oh  and the chips were good.  The first chips and salsa are complimentary  and each additional is  2  okay  if that s you way to want it.  This is NOT a Tex-Mex restaurant and the pricing proves it.  At the suggestion of our server  we ordered the  X  or something like that as our complimentary salsa.  It didn t have a lot of flavor and really lacked a pop in the spice department.  I ordered the Enchiladas Clasica with beef and my wife the Enchiladas Suiza with chicken.  Pretty straightforward stuff right   We found the sauces very thick and dry.  There was kind of a crust on the sauce.  There was not a great deal of flavor to the Clasica sauce and not very spicy at all.  My wife s Suiza was thick  flavorless and the chicken was just dry and terrible.    Oh  the comment about plenty of ice in the margarita as a positive was a joke.  There was very little margarita in the margarita.

Hour wait 6pm on a Friday night  the place is rocking.   Shinyribs are excellent  Chinese ribs with an Austin twist.   Papas rellenas are kinda oversized tater tots stuffed with cheese. I m certainly not saying that s a bad thing.  Nachos are really individually loaded and the picadillo topping is the bomb.   Great variety of salsas. Though they were all very flavorful  I kept going back and forth between the mild avocado salsa and the dangerous el scorpio.   Some nice drafts and mixed drink options as well.   Hoping they quickly expand the space. It s deservedly popular  in a part of town that has been crying out for more places just like this.

Stopped for Sunday Brunch and was thrilled to find Eldorado lived up to its rating. The menu takes some Tex-Mex favorites and elevated them subtly and successfully. Being from San Antonio I m picky of my Tex-Mex food but Eldorado is on point. I tried three different tacos and all were delicious. You must try their carnitas as they are juicy and tender.  Our server was very friendly and gave us great recommendations.  Overall  the look and the vibe are relaxed and welcoming. Can t wait to come back.

Absolutely amazing food and amazing service  Our food took a little while to come out so the waitress gave us each  5 off our check   We re not from around here but I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants some good Tex Mex.

Came for dinner one night after having this restaurant bookmarked for quite some time.  All of the food we received was PHENOMENAL. They did forget my moms nachos but it ended up being a good thing  she never would have finished them .  ALL of the food was so flavorful and fresh - truly amazing and great prices too. I ll for sure be back
Carnitas come out crispy. Add the picked onions and salsa for some good tacos. I also had the rice and beans. I would recommend the beans but nothing special about the rice.

We heard great things about Eldorado from friends who live in the area and then were able to grab breakfast one day.  Food was just perfect  I couldn t dream up anything tastier.  Everything else  service  ambiance  etc  was 5 stars as well.

I wish they allowed 10 Stars    This was by far the best dining experience my wife and I have had in years. The food was fantastic  atmosphere great  and our server  David was the best server ever   The owner  Joel came by to wish me a happy birthday and present me with a gift. My wife had the Rene s Awesome enchiladas which truly were AWESOME.  I had the Sirloin Tampiqueno and it was tender and very flavorful.  There are so many choices on the menu and we plan to be regulars here so I plan on trying everything. I saw one review where someone complained about too many veggies in the rice. SERIOUSLY     Get a life  The rice was fantastic    This is not a Maudie s Tex Mex restaurant but rather Mexican inspired food with unique recipes. I m not a margarita fan but I had TWO. It too was great  See you soon Joel and Joanna.

Loved the chips and salsa. My favorite would be their El Scorpion and their Salsa X  which we were told was their most popular . I d recommend getting the salsa sampler if you are a salsa fiend   I ordered the Freddie s plate for breakfast. It was great   My friend got the sopapilla cheesecake and it was delicious...I d recommend getting it with ice cream.

Waited an hour to even get a seat just for subpar food and service for dinner. Even middle management was rude. It is also the only Mexican restaurant I know of that charges for salsa. I brought friends and I was so embarrassed. Go to Fonda San Miguel or a taco truck or any other more authentic place. But I m used to real Mexican food and Tex mex from San Antonio  the border  El Paso  and Mexico  etc. I ve heard the brunch is good if not authentic. The service and food was so bad  I m not sure I m tempted to go back  but it seems like brunch may be better if you re interested.

We really enjoyed the lunch at Eldorado.  I had two crispy tacos  one beef  one chicken  and although a little small in size they were really tasty and the taco shell wasn t greasy like some Mexican restaurants.  I also ordered the black beans and rice on the side  which was really good also.  Their red sauce  medium hot  was delicious but not like a salsa  more like a creamy sauce.  Different than traditional salsa and it complimented the tacos nicely.  My partner got the Enchiladas Verdes with hongos  mushrooms   rice and beans.  I had a taste and definitly would order them but would go for beef or chicken  for my taste. All in all  a great experience and nice addition to the neighborhood.  I would have given 5 stars but I think the tacos could be a little bigger than what appears to be street taco size.

My wife and I have been to El Dorado Cafe multiple times now and my only complaint is how popular it is but I can understand why. The food is all excellent and the recipes are creative and unique. The owners are very hands on and it shows with the management. Training is thorough and the experience is thought out  minus the wait time - please consider a bat signal in the sky so those of us lucky enough to be nearby can come quickly .   Seriously though. We used El Dorado Cafe for an office event that we had them cater recently and I wasn t expecting much but was proved wrong again. It wasn t just a  drop off of the food and bail  experience. They actually set everything up in a thoughtful manner and the owner even came on site to oversee and double check things. This is a key differentiator and has high value to us. Our lunch for our employees felt like a managed catering event as a result of their little touches and the food was incredible. We will absolutely be using them again.

This place is nestled in a strip mall across from what used to be Satay.  It s not the easiest place to find or get to  but well worth it.  Staff seems to get along really well and it added a little levity to the environment.    This place is definitely an Austin take on Tex Mex with some great salsas to go with your chips.  Enchiladas are good  but my recommendation is to go for the guisadas.  The beef short ribs and the carnitas are both amazing.  You ll definitely not leave here feeling hungry

Came across the hidden gem recently and the wait was 45 minutes on a Saturday midday. I new  that was a good sign  so we got some chips and their incredible salsa selection and endured the wait  we were starving . During our wait a very friendly man came over and Introduced himself and later discovered that he was the owner of the restaurant. Joel was was unbelievably friendly and engaged us for at least 15 minutes. Everything we ordered was incredibly delicious and the server  was very hospitable. We will  definitely be back

I found this place through Yelp and the rating was right  it was really good   We got the tacos and enchiladas covered with their queso.  For dessert we got the cherry skillet pie which was good  although  I would not order again  but the cheesecake was soooo good and unique.  Our server was great  a younger guy super friendly   Great prices and quality ingredients.  We will add this place to our rotation

Had the best date night here    From the amazing  just my style  skinny margaritas to the great conversation with Joel the owner...epic dinner   We got to sample the ribs and the goat cheese nuggets...the salsa X flavor was my favorite with chips. Had the Hawaiian pork tacos and her tostadas looked amazing. Great night and I ll definitely go back again

So we was in the area   taking care of daily life business   and decided to stop here to get something to eat.  This food was amazing   I love   love the Beef Quesadilla with the avocado on the side   the best   I didn t have to add any salt . Lol  overall I will come again when am on this side of town   am Located in Manor tx    shadowglen  ..  Everyone was Nice and inviting . Love the Margarita as well  .

My new favorite when visiting Austin.  A casual  neighborhood eatery that really knocks it out of the park every single time     Some of my favorites   - Freddie s Plate - the picadillo is super flavorful  Also  all of their breakfast plates come with 3 Potato Hash which I LOVE  LOVE  LOVE - Rene s Awesome Enchiladas - they are  indeed  AWESOME  The beef short rib is so tender and flavorful and it is COVERED is Cheese that makes this cheese lover weep  Also  one of the best margaritas I ve ever had.

I love this place i really do the food is sooooooo good it reminds me a little in genera of magnolia cafe but done from a Michelin star chefs point of view it is a small location and i do wish they would take reservations for large partys but so damn good

Was thinking about it all week and convinced hubs to go for lunch. Tried something new  the short rib salpicon. It is AHmazing. Comes with tortillas  pickled veggies  and you choose two sides.  Get  the mojo veggies   So much flavor. I am stuffed but still thinking fondly about it. Having a feeling Eldolrado can do no wrong...

I ate lunch at Eldorado Cafe this week. Was very impressed by the quality and taste of the food. They have 4-5 different designer salsas you can have with your chips. I chose the  Salsa X.  It is some of the best mild smokey tasting salsa I have had. I highly recommend it.   I had cheese enchiladas as my main course. They were outstanding as was the rice and beans.  I wanted to but didn t try their cherry dessert made in a cast iron skillet.   I will be back.
I like the variety of salsas you can choose from. And they make a pretty mean vegan enchilada
This place is great  Probably one of the better Tex-Mex restaurants we ve been to in Austin. I always get the Uchinhon bowl and my wife loves the Carnitas Cubanos

Get the salsa sampler  I usually am a cheese or enchilada gal but their mushroom  hongos  are the best  I have yet to try their desserts. Th way have an extensive menu. If it is your first time  you have to try the cheesy rice. Yum

Eldorado Cafe is easily our favorite Mexican spot in Austin. Joel and team have built a low-key  convenient  and affordable restaurant with ridiculously high-quality food and service  as evidenced by lines out the door most evenings and weekends.  But please don t let a line or short wait deter you from grubbing down on some of the best carnitas and enchiladas - not to mention scratch-made salsas and a kick ass spicy margarita - we ve ever experienced  instead  grab a couple of  ritas at the bar  chips and salsa X  trust me  from any one of the friendly wait-staff  maybe the super queso if the mood strikes you  though don t spoil your appetite   and wait it out in style...  And when your name is called  get ready to tuck into some truly fantastic food. Whether it s your first or fortieth visit  expect a stop-by  quick chat  often in between hearty forkfuls of chow   and a handshake from Joel.  El Dorado Cafe has been a favorite since we moved to the area from the East Side about 1.5 years ago. We have taken out-of-town guests and even hosted an unofficial dinner here before our wedding. We relied on takeout while my wife was pregnant and picked up to-go our first night getting home from the hospital after our son was born  especially as my wife needed that spicy margarita  The restaurant and staff have become almost like extended family  going as far as hooking us up with an appetizer or two when the wait was longer than expected and we were 6 months pregnant.  Our favorite dishes  Carnitas Cubanos  add a fried egg  all sides are great   El Cabo salad  super queso  shiny ribs.  Bottom line  Go here and enjoy  Thanks for all you do Team El Dorado Cafe and see you again real soon
Just ate the La Bomba. It was heaven in an open faced biscuit.  Couldn t have loved it more.  Every time I ve eaten their food  I have craved it even more the next time.

Big fan of the food  staff and neighborhood vibe.  HOWEVER  last night we ordered takeout  including a to-go Margarita.  Got home  ate food  husband drinks half his  15 Margarita.  I ask him how it is.  The Margarita was ONLY mix.  He was so disappointed.   He called the restaurant this morning to let them know about the experience.  El Dorado apologized  said it was a mistake on the website and they would remove it from the website. There was no offer of making it right.  No offer of a refund for the  15 fancy lime-ade.  And no offer of a Margarita on the house when we order next time. I am still a fan   The food is too good.  But that Marg and the way the situation was handled has left a bad taste in my mouth. I d like to think my husband just talked to the wrong person...someone who did not seem to care about a regular customer s experience.

My husband and I LOVE this place  The food is not traditional Tex Mex. It is fresh and has a lot more to offer than your run of the mill Mexican place in Austin. Make sure you order the Salsa X. It s addictive  If you are a first timer make sure you get the salsa sampler. Another great appetizer choice is the Papas Rellenas.  The classic house queso is awesome and it s not your typical Velveeta mess. My husband is a vegetarian and their menu is full of items he loves. We have pretty much tried it all and loved it all. My favorite is the Enchiladas Suizas with the chicken tinga . The creamy salsa verde is delicious. The Shaunna-Wanna Taco Salad is really good and comes in a meat or meatless version. If I m not super hungry and looking for something light I go for the T House  3 Combo Chalupa. It s soooo good  For sides you will want to try the CheeznRice  and the Las Calabasas- a delicious mix of butternut squash  zucchini and roasted garlic.  The owner  Joel is always front and center and always stops by to say he is happy to see us again. The servers are all awesome  It s definitely the type of place you feel at home in. The happy hour drinks are great too  Margaritas and my favorite Sangria. Yum  Warning- this place is always busy. A wait time is just part of the magic that isn t so magical. I promise it is worth the wait  Order a drink and munch on some chips and salsa while you wait on a table. If you have a big party you should absolutely call ahead and let them know. I hope you enjoy Eldorado Cafe as much as we do.

I don t understand why this place is so popular. The sauces are  good  but not great. The rest of the food is mediocre at best. I tried this place three times to give it a fair shot. Meh. Even the margaritas are sub-par  heavy on booze  light on flavor. The atmosphere is nice.

I ordered an Enchilada plate to go. The staff was super sweet and the place was very lively. My food was pretty good for the most part but the part that dissatisfied me was that the chicken wasn t seasoned. My rice was great  the black beans were good  there was sauce for the enchiladas but it wasn t enough for the enchiladas as I d hoped. Perhaps I will order extra sauce next time.

We picked up dinner at El Dorado last night and it was delicious  We ordered the queso  El Guac tostados  las calabasas  and Joel s Happy Plate. The curbside delivery was great  I placed the order online and it gave me a precise time. We parked and followed the directions for texting. Our meal was quickly delivered and placed on a chair in front of the car by a masked employee. They walked off  we got our food. Terrifically touchless.  Update  On our order this past week  we added the  delicious pork casserole from their Take and Bake menu. Yummmy
The best Huevos Rancheros I have ever had    Really nice staff and amazing food.   I will be back
Love this place. You can get Mexican food with veggies  Great options for any dietary needs. Awesome drinks. Top-notch service. It can be busy with a significant wait at peak times.

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in town. I have a serious problem with the salsa X because I could literally eat it with a spoon. Every dish and side I ve tried there has been exceptional. The only downside is that there s always a wait because it s so good. They should really take the empty space next door and just double in size  but there would probably still be a wait.  Austin has a number of really good Mexican restaurants that would be exceptional in other cities. This place is exceptional for Austin.

So I came to place at noon on a Wednesday and this place was packed. The energy was great and everyone was having a good time. The host sat me down with a menu right away and the bartender was friendly and helpful  despite still being busy and taking to go orders. The food was amazing and tasteful. Can t wait to come back with my wife who s the foodie next time.

This place is popular. I was promptly seated on Tuesday at 8 45  but any other time expect a wait. Coming in  it strikes one that this place does not look like most other Mexican restaurants. And that s even before you consider the well-stocked bar with local booze. So  eh  what s a Mexican place like in a very white neighborhood of Central Austin  Well  the serving personnel was all very white with plenty of tattoos. That makes this hipster-Mexican   The menu had plenty of items but somehow it didn t make an impression of a lot of variety. Many beef and chicken dishes  no fish. But next time I m going to check out the Honchos  Mexican mushrooms. That ll be new to me.  Apart from a waitress who overlooked us  service was all fine. Chips are served automatically  but there is a choice of salsa  so that takes an extra trip to the kitchen before you re snacking. Our medium salsa had an interesting taste  nothing like the traditional salsa.  My Enchiladas Suizas were very tasty. I m pretty sure  creamy salsa verde  is not a traditional dish but it was good all the same. My dinner companion was less enthousiastic about her choice  which seemed more middle of the road. My rice had some pickled vegetables mixed in  which I liked  the contrast of tastes  textures  temperatures.  Despite these noted incidences of creativity  this place is nowhere near the upscale Mexican places such as Fonda San Miguel. Conclusion  medium-priced moderately creative Mexican. I may go back  but not too soon.

I wanna love this place. We wanted to return for dinner after an awesome lunch a couple weeks back. I am willing to pay the price for non-Sysco food and I am willing to wait to be seated - and coming from me  that s saying a lot  We arrived at 5 30 pm  there was a  30 to 35 minute  wait for a party of four. When we signed in with the hostess  we saw there was an 8-top and a handful of 2-tops ahead of us. We checked in regularly as we walked our kids around during the wait to make sure we didn t miss being called. Almost an hour later  we gave up  and wondered why and how a party of 4 was seated ahead of us  given the list we d seen when we began our wait. Sigh.   Before we started The Great Wait  I did look to see if it was possible to join the list online before we left home  I did not see this option  and the hostess never mentioned it. If you ve got an hour to spare  by all means  try this place. It s good. I just don t usually have an hour to spare  so I don t think I ll be back much.          Run  don t walk. I have a new favorite restaurant  and this is it. I have to admit  I was encouraged to visit the Eldorado Cafe based on raving reviews from vegetarians  when can a vegetarian ever get notable Mexican  Today we had our first visit  and the carnitas is better than homemade  as are the cocktails. It s not often I find a restaurant that makes food better than me  but here we are. Based on this near-religious experience with the carnitas  I may never order vegetarian here. It was  indeed   crispy carnitas.  The side dishes  black beans and the calabzas  were also exceptional  as were the cocktails and the service. The notes on the menu make it clear they are there to be around for the long haul  not just the Next Big Thing. Children are welcome  and I m sure my kids would dig the kids menu. But what really knocked it out of the park was the soundtrack  was it DJed by Rick McNulty   and the framed LPs on the wall - Sergio Mendes and Herb Alpert - JUST LIKE HOME.   Five stars  two thumbs up  and all the love. Thank you  Eldorado Cafe. You are really forcing me to consider moving up toward Shoal Creek. We shall return  and not a moment too soon.
Absolutely incredible place  They do contactless curbside which is really amazing during these covid times. The food is always really delicious and hits the spot. Love ordering from here.
Imaginative menu. Excellent service. I ve eaten here twice and it s more than met expectations

The choices will make you dizzy due to everything sounding amazing  Be sure to try anything that has short rib in it  because it is life changing. I m getting the shiny ribs next time  They went past me and I shed a single tear.

First time here. My friends always rave about the place so..Was seated immediately after 4p on a Saturday. Wait staff was friendly and the salsa x was so so good.  Ordered the enchiladas suizas and ate ALL of it  despite my very full belly. Will def be back

Let me say I am a regular and a happy one at that  I love love love the food here. Moreover  I love that their vegetarian options are fantastic and wonderful for all  I always start with a watermelon Margarita with chili salt and grilled panela cheese   I love the hongos in many ways and styles   It is busy  which is great  but sometimes hard to get in to  However  it is worth the wait. As it is so very lovely and tasty

We were so excited to find this place when we saw that Cabo Bob s across the street was closed on a Sunday and this place had 200  review s with 4.5 stars wow maybe we would never go across the street to Bob s again   No so fast  The wait was long so we ordered to go  which would be faster theoretically we were advised   after waiting for 30  mins we decided to get a table after all  once we were finally seated the server NEVER came to our table after delivering the order  I mean not even once  not even to refill our water glasses  Maybe they thought because we ordered to go we wouldn t tip them - but we aren t that thoughtless we fully planned to tip  and we wanted to add to our order  Finally we just left after eating.  In terms of the food the soup was pretty good and the chalupa was decent  however the potato and bean tacos were totally flavorless and really felt blah. The chances of ever coming back here is pretty low.

Absolutely love and adore this place  Not only are the managers and staff incredible  the food is also  I ordered the vegan taco and vegan enchilada- both amazing. Ordered breakfast tacos -AMAZING  This is a business I want to continue to support.

Easily one of my favorite Mexican restaurants. I m sure a lot of folks will describe the food in detail  I ll just say it s very good and go on to describe some other things.  - really good service. I got into a casual conversation standing in line at a food truck in South Austin and when the subject of Eldorado came up  they commented on the excellent management and wait staff. Turned out this person was in the food business herself and she knew about the owner and the staff he d hired. I believe it. The wait staff is outstanding.   - small but good bar. Again  service at the bar was excellent while we waited for our table. Pineapple Margaritas were excellent and strong and cheerfully and quickly served.   - waiting area is outside the front door. They provide tables and chairs and have a self-service water station to keep you cool in the Austin heat.   - excellent hot sauces. If you re a sauce person  they have 5 different ones they can bring out with your chips.   - they are doing good business. Be prepared to get there early or wait a while. We only had to wait 45 minutes at 7pm on a Saturday night - which really isn t bad - but if you re not there early  you ll definitely be waiting a while.  It s worth it though.
Fantastic Food  Great Service  Everything we ordered was delicious  The sopapilla cheesecake is incredible  Will definitely be back
D-effing-licious   The Nomad was excellent  the chilaquiles was excellent  the muffin was excellent    the music selection was excellent.

Went to this restaurant. Was told it would be a 15 min wait  was offered to sit at the bar  so I did. I wanted a beer anyways. Everyone else who was waiting got seated  except my party and I. We looked at the host and he did not acknowledge us. Everyone who came in was seated except my party  once again. I once again acknowledged the host and no answer. So I left. I m sure everyone is raving about the food  but I ll never know because I never had the chance to get seated.
Delicious enchiladas  Can t wait to come back to try breakfast as that menu looked more up my alley  but lunch was pretty dang good. Expect a little bit of a wait even on a weekday.

Delicious food  We waited for about 40 mins on a busy Sunday. Of course we went during the brunch rush but since we were just visiting and other restaurants had longer waits we gave this one a shot. We were really happy with our decision. The food was piping hot  And so delicious. Everything tasted homemade in the best possible way. My bf ordered the enchiladas souizas and I ordered the Huevos Texicanos without jalape o. His dish came with rice and after trying it I immediately had to get my own side order. I also had two different kinds of mimosas that were just okay. The grapefruit mimosa tasted like the way chapstick smells but I drank it. A mimosa is a mimosa lol. The pineapple one was a lot better.  All in all  if I m ever back in Austin I would definitely visit this place again

The menu has some unique options I wasn t expecting but was really happy to taste. I love the potato cakes and their salsas are all delicious. I also had the quesadilla  rajas con queso  and it was a perfection of flavor and just the right amount of crisp. So Freaking Good. What a great place.

Enchiladas Suiza. Yum. Yum. Yum.  If there s one thing this restaurant s menu is not  is boring. There are so many awesome  innovative twists on otherwise staple items. For instance  the Chi Chi Tinga  Tender Chicken Breast in a Red Chile Adobo Sauce  however their more standard dishes are always a winner  too  and what they may lack in innovation  they certainly make up for in taste and quality. The Enchiladas Suizas  Creamy Salsa Verde  Avocado   amp  Jack Cheese with Your Choice of Filling  Beef   Chicken   Cheese   Hongos  had an incredible flavor profile and that sauce was no joke.   If anything  you should go for the salsa sampler and margaritas. It s the perfect combo for those chips-and-salsa-with-a-margarita days  and those margs...let s just say they weren t weak  which made for an exceptionally lovely Friday dinner with kids. Oh  did I mention there was a kid area for them to semi-run free  Yup. Right by the front entrance where you wait for your table. It made for waiting on a Friday with a toddler much more bearable. That and the margarita.  I am already thinking about my next visit  and the Carnitas Cubanos   Crispy Pork Roasted in a Cuban Style Citrus Garlic Mojo is looking pretty  pretty good  in the Larry David kind of way .

For real  this restaurant is delish  I came the first time with my parents in December  mainly out of curiosity to see how they changed the inside from Alborz  sidenote  I m still mourning Alborz   and it was hopping at 3 pm on a Sunday  Let me just take a second to rave about the salsa  the El Scorpio is so delicious - if you read my other reviews  I reference the Dona sauce from Taco D and this definitely rivals it. I think the owner  Joel  used to be a chef for Taco D  I don t know  I could have my facts wrong  but either way  the El Scorpio sauce is divine. Mix it in with that queso... mmmm  mmm  good.   I got the chicken enchiladas both of the times I ve come and lemme tell ya  so good  not greasy like some other places can make it. The rice is nice and light and the refried black beans are delicious. My parents have gone and said that the quesadillas are good and my mom lately has been on the tostada kick. They ve also gotten the short ribs  lemon garlic chicken  carnitas cubanos  and the enchiladas suizas and have said all are good. It s a little pricier than some other restaurants   13 for the enchilada plate - FYI  there s not a separate lunch menu   but the ingredients are fresh and you don t feel heavy after eating nor do you smell greasy when leaving. Also  I ve left with half of my food leftover both times I ve gone.   Eldorado is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood  It has a nice  friendly vibe and the waitstaff is also generally very helpful and friendly  Probably come expecting to wait for a table  especially if you come with a larger group  but that s pretty much everywhere in Austin these days.

Great change of pace from standard Tex-Mex.  Still full of classics but all with a fresher modern feel.  Tasty brunch.  Good drinks.  Helpful friendly service.  And eighties hits playing in the background.

We stopped by here while up north after a quick Yelp search for Mexican food. I have been on a quest to find good Tex-Mex Mexican in Austin and find most places just  okay.  Despite our names vanishing from the wait list  we waited less than the quoted time  received free queso  had excellent service  and super tasty dinner  The house and sangria margaritas were very good  and the suiza chicken enchiladas were  also quite tasty. We were excited to try the Papas Rellenas having never had them before. Really good   Had a great time and will definitely be back

This place was great  Good service  unique concept of offering different types of salsas with your chips  and the food was really different than your standard Tex Mex and very tasty. We would totally eat here again

Amazing place  staff and atmosphere. My friend and I ordered the classic enchiladas but didn t like it very much. Before we could even say anything  the owner asked how our food was and quickly offered to replace it with something else. The server and bartender are amazing. Very vibrant local spot with plenty of parking. Support your local restaurants.

If you aren t coming here for the chilaquiles rojas every weekend  then you re messing up  The carnitas here are absolutely incredible  And that X salsa though  Dayummm is all I can say  I think I ve come just about every weekend for the last 2 months and I m still not sick of it.

They have a beverage that mixes horchata with cold brew coffee  and it s a definite must-order. My friend had the Chilaquiles Rojas and I had the Nomad plate. Both were excellent. She said the coffee was strong and on point. We split a biscuit with jam. The biscuits are quite large and excellent. Great service  great atmosphere  and great food.

Came here for the 1st time for lunch and it was good. Nothing that I can say was  spectacular   but it was a nice experience. Staff was friendly and accommodating for me and my son. Food was pretty good. Quesadillas were good  but could ve been better if they served Ranch dressing. Yes  they do serve salads  but no Ranch.  bummer  My son liked the black beans. All around decent spot for a bite to eat.

Amazing. Authentic. Delicious. Honestly some of the best Mexican food you can find in Austin  As a Hispanic  I grew up eating the good stuff  and Eldorado has it. My whole family loves this place. Yes it leans TexMex  but like amazingly well done.  Wish you could make reservations for parties smaller than 6

I love it.  Lately  I ve been loving less the overly-greasy  processed cheese Tex-Mex that Austin loves  but don t worry  this is just temporary ... I will get down on some Amaya s any day of the week  . Eldorado is the PERFECT solution to this for a few reasons.   First  their menu has something for everyone  including breakfast   but nothing is your plain  ole version that you might expect. For example  instead of all dishes coming with  basic rice and beans  you get to choose from a list of  7 sides  Everything we ve tried so far during three visits has been excellent.   Second  their queso and salsas are good - AND THIS IS IMPORTANT ENOUGH TO GET ITS OWN LINE  Because  Texas.   Third  their drinks are good   Fourth  the vibe is really nice. Super chill  great for families  but prob not a good choice if you re looking for somewhere fancy.
