It s Mexican food for white people with disposable income. I paid fourteen bucks for a plate with two small cheese enchiladas  some refried black beans  and white rice with stuff mixed into it. Oh  and a sprinkle of escaveche as garnish  which incidentally was the most impressive part of the dish.  I live in a major city 200 miles from Mexico. I can do much better for half the price.   PS. The staff were all friendly and very helpful.

3.75 stars Lemon chicken was tasty. Staff were very nice.  I don t know what the fuck was up with the delicious sounding tres leches peach bread pudding. Didn t eat 1 2.  Queso was like water and the chips were almost stale.  I will go back and skip the queso and try a different dessert. However  I m not sure it s worth waiting over 30 mins. It s not THAT special.

Chef Joel Fried has a wide repetoire of super creative and flawlessly executed dishes. We only tried a few items today and my favorites were pretty much all of them  papasrellenas  cheeznrice  chipsandsalsa  flautas  tacos If you are a chili head  you must try the elscorpio salsa.  The Papas Rellenas  potato and cheese cakes  are  a bite of heaven. Paired with the SalsaX they have the right amount of heat and they literally melt in your mouth  It s my new favorite place and not to mention the stellar hospitality from every staff member. Can t wait to go back again for more.   There is plenty of parking and the ambience is super fun. Best mexican food in Austin.

You must try this place  A friend told us about his  fave  Mexican cafe and that we had to try it. We are so glad we did  this has become a date night regular.   The cubanos carnitas is amazing  We go for the veggie sides that are incredible and make it slightly healthier.   Try all the salsas  they are all uniquely amazing.   The vibe is fun  the service is awesome  and the owners are cool. They even whipped up some custom concoctions when we asked if there was something not on the menu. Free of charge to boot.   Now that s service

Stopped in with the band after playing a show in Austin and was treated to an amazing meal by our friend Joey at this exceptional restaurant. Excellent food and service. From the michelada to homemade salsas to slow cooked meats  all prepared with loving care. As an added bonus the owner Joel  who himself was a touring musician  threw us some tshirts and the ever needed socks for the road. An welcoming oasis on our journey and highly recommended to locals and travelers alike. We ll be back and so should you.

Good food  great people  what more could ask for  Tried the Nomad for breakfast- delectable. If you come for dinner  look no further than the salsa sampler and the carnitas cubanas... don t tell your friends.

We went to Eldorado Cafe tonight for the soft opening and it is going to be our new favorite neighborhood restaurant   We have been going to the pop-ups that they had before they opened the brick and mortar and we are excited to see this open.    The restaurant has a warm  comfy vibe to it that we really enjoyed.   All of the staff are nice and welcoming and the service was very smooth.    We loved the freshly prepared food.  Tonight we had the Enchiladas Classica filled with cheese and they were yummy.   We have tried many items from their menu and they are all delicious.  I m a big fan of the T-house  3 Chalupa  too.   We ended the meal with a scrumptious skillet cherry pie.   They also offer a full bar and we had the watermelon margarita- very smooth.   The owners are very warm and genuine people and you can tell that they love what they are doing.    The official opening date is August 8th  so you can go check it out for yourself

Update   I ve had dinner here several times  I love the Enchiladas Suizas  Esme s Enchiladas  Tacos Salad with shredded chicken  chips with Salsa X  and the SHINY RIBS. Service is amazing and the owner is so nice. I m so happy Eldorado is walking distance from my place

What El Dorado Cafe lacks in ambiance  they more than make up for in spirit. Yes it s in a strip mall next to an unfortunate place called Water for Wine. Yes  they have some awkwardly lit tables and an eclectic mix art and a slightly too child-friendly of a waiting area that offers a view of a Mattress Firm. Ignore all of this because the food  drinks and service at El Dorado is what you re living for. It s why you came to Austin 25 years ago  it s why you stayed. Their servers are moving fast  but not so fast that they don t take a minute to say hello and owner chef Joel might just pop over to your table and check on you as well. You can talk bout music or food with him  he s down for either. But really you re here for the food and drinks.  El D. has the perfect mix of fresh flavors with their own take on modern Tex Mex. They have plenty of meat and vegetarian options. Their pork green chile plate is outstanding. The Tamale house  3 Chalupa  tasty. Even the house salad is always fresh and on point. Salsa X and El Scorpio and a Paloma will set you straight.   Part of me wants to tell you to stay far away from El Dorado because I want to keep it my neighborhood secret  but I can t - the owners and staff are just too nice and I want them to succeed  The best of the best neighborhood Mexican restaurants I ve been to in a long time. Viva El Dorado

Excellent find  Our first time to Eldorado Cafe but definitely not the last. We are from Las Cruces  NM and have been searching for great Mexican food. We found it.   We had the Tampiqueno sirloin special and Rene s special enchiladas. Both were outstanding. Joel and the staff made us feel welcomed and at home.

This place is my new favorite restaurant in Austin.  Having grown up in the RGV  I set the bar pretty high for Mexican   Tex-Mex comfort food and El Dorado passes that.  I ordered the carne guisada special they had going and it is abuelita level good.  Everything about our meal was excellent.  Service and staff are awesome too.  I ll be back for sure.
I really love this place their cases the best their service is good it s small very home feeling and their Margaritas are the best in Austin

Going for review 100   I love Eldorado Cafe and that it s walking  or that one time  stumbling  after a few margaritas  distance from home. The only downside is  I m not the only person who loves them  so there s often a wait. We have sat at the bar frequently as a result and adore the bartenders.   Crispy beef tacos are THE BEST crispy beef tacos I ve had  and I ve had a lot of them. They make the shells in house and the ingredients are all fresh.   Only Mexican joint where I ll willingly order a side salad.   Shiny ribs - chomp   T-house chalupa is da bomb   Great drinks   Great owners
Our fav tex mex restaurant in ATX. We ordered enchiladas and some Migas. Fresh. Flavorful  One piece of advice. Get the scorpion sauce. It s life changing spicy

This is actually a decent breakfast place located in a mini-mall. It s kind of hidden from view. So make sure you pay attention or just listen to what the GPS tells you. I ordered a taco but not necessarily a taco. You can actually order it as a bowl and make your own taco. I ordered a taco bowl with avocado  eggs  black beans and potatoes which turned out good. The coffee is decent. So if you are looking for a variety of breakfast places  go ahead and put Eldorado Caf  as one of them.

El Dorado Cafe is a staple in our  going out rotation . I love the Sandinista cocktail  watermellon and ginger . I also love that they have some amazing vegan and vegetarian options on the menue. The house salad with the sesame arbol dressing simple and always perfect. I sometimes pair that with some black beans and mojo veggies for a light meal. Some places offer veggie options  but you can tell their heart s not in it. Not this place. They mean it.

The Inside   The inside of the restaurant was very cute and spunky  lots of good pictures   etc on the walls  I like the colors they picked for the restaurant  The Server   the server was very nice and the service was very nice - very good  The Food    my dad ordered the Migas  He liked his  it is interesting they have queso sauce on the migas  the Potatoes was very good  I Had the Huevos Rancharos  which was very good  it was interesting as well that it has avacados  on it. it was very good as well  On a side note  2 Things we had a coupons for  5 off  it had no expiration  i think it should have a expiration date to see how effective it is especially since they are trying to promote  advertise the restaurant  and it should also say 1 per visit to get repeat customers which we are planning to come back  Second if you sell shirts  the restaurant staff should comment on the customers wearing their shirts  which I wore my Eldorado Cafe shirt and nobody commented on it   but either then that the experience was very good

I ve been searching Austin for years for a Mexican restaurant to match my old out-of-state haunts  chains like Chuy s are blah to me  and even Fonda San Miguel was a bit of a let down after the hype . Eldorado Cafe is the place that finally nailed it for me   Executive Chef Joel Fried  the man largely responsible for TacoDeli s award winning salsas   graciously blessed North Austin with what is certainly my new favorite Mexican restaurant in the city   I tried  Joel s Happy Plate   which was a tasty mix of enchiladas topped with Red Chile Sauce  Eldorado Queso  amp  Jack cheese and a Jalape o Toreado. My co-worker got the Puzchkas  bacon-filled fried dumplings  and loved them  too   Come early for lunch as word is getting out about this place and it fills up quick  but either way it s worth the wait   We ll be back

Tio White Potato  4.0  delicious but lost a point due to small portion  ordered another plate plus another egg to fill up.  All the over-easy eggs had a lot of uncooked egg white  20    completely transparent.  Note to self  La Bomba or Migas Plate next time

This place is amazing.. great food... great staff.  This place is so wonderful  we used them for catering.  They were so accommodating  they helped me figured out what works best for my event. Everything worked out perfect.  Catering manager Laura is lovely  and on point. I can t sing their praises any louder.

A down to earth no frills community Mexican caf . Yes   They serve breakfast through dinner every day  except Monday they are closed .  Came here recently for brunch. Waited 20 minutes and then was able to get a seat at the bar.  This was the lowest wait time since we have attempted to eat at this new spot.  Previously the wait times were over 45 minutes  and they don t take reservations. There is a cute little seating area available which is nice. While the space is not large  they have done a good job of creating an open seating environment that is cozy  artistic  love the diverse colors   and inviting.  This is a casual family friendly eating establishment.  The service was incredibly friendly and I felt immediately at home. They have an extensive menu of interesting items  even for breakfast.  My husband tried the Freddy s plate  and I tried the papas breakfast taco on corn.  I also had a side of fruit  and my husband snagged the last biscuit in the house as a side.  The breakfast taco was delicious.  The egg was cooked to perfection.  It is one of the best breakfast tacos I have had. The bacon was crisp and flavorful just like I like.  My husband s plate was flavorful and tasty as well.  The husband said the biscuit was good.  The fruit bowl was incredible  I have never seen such a heaping side of fruit.  It was fresh and delicious. My husband s Bloody Mary was OK and my Sandanista with fresh watermelon Aqua Fresca was sweet but refreshing.  The food is decently priced and tasty for brunch.  We will need to come back for lunch and dinner.

Salsas were great  chips were great  black bean tostadas were amazing. What I loved the most was the guy who brought the food out. Maybe a manager owner  not sure  but super friendly.   The only reason I took off a star was the young girl at counter who was trying to rush us out so the table could be used for the next party  came at 11 15 .

We had dinner at Eldorado for the first time on Tuesday night  they were slammed  and seemed completely unprepared for it . We opted to sit in the bar area where we were told that we would get full service  but everything took a while.  From there  things didn t get much better  the margarita one of us ordered was 85  ice cubes  another Yelper commented on this  so doesn t seem like much has been done about it  and didn t come out with the requested salt. We started with the supa queso  which was good but watery. Our dinner entrees were better--the enchiladas verde and one of the carnitas  guisos . The food tasted fresh and flavorful.  Our main issue with this place is value  otherwise we would have given it 4 stars. But  15 for an entree that is just plain fine but not extraordinary is ridiculous. Another pet peeve that seems to be the fashion these days is managers owners commenting on reviews with overeager  We ll work on that  Thank you so much for your feedback and it ll be better when you come back.  Obviously it s just not true  i.e. all the ice in the drinks  and it s just so stupid. If somebody doesn t have a good experience  or thinks that the value isn t there  He she will not be back  Unless you give do something to have a repeat customer  then kiss that business goodbye. Things might be busy now  but who knows how long that will last  we re not planning on going back.

We have been to Eldorado twice now and loved it both times    The food is delicious and ORIGINAL   It s not the tired old Telmex that it seems is all over Austin.  This is interesting  flavorful food prepared well at a great price.  These days it seems like you have to pay an arm and a leg to get innovative food  not here   For example - the last time we were there I got the mashed potato enchiladas   My family thought I was crazy but I thought  the food was great last time  I m just going to go out on a limb.  Delicious      How in the world do you make mashed potato enchiladas feel fresh and light       I don t know but they were      The chips are fantastic  queso is freakin  awesome  and I m only sad to say that we ve been too full to try dessert.   We will be back.  Again and again.  Keep doing what you re doing
Possibly the best food I ve ever had. Great bartenders. Great service. Great margs. Great food. I will be bringing all my friend and family here.

Great new addition to the neighborhood. Great options including good vegan ones. Next time I m going to skip the salsa sampler and go straight for the Salsa X   The staff is great with lots of them stopping by the table constantly checking to make sure everything is great.

First visit.  They officially opened four days ago.  Tex-Mex breakfast acid test.  Solid take on classic migas.  Quality ingredients prepped  amp  seasoned with a skilled  steady hand.  The saut ed papas  peppers  carrots and black bean sides were a cut above other Tex mex breakfast places versions.  Coffee was okay but not mind blowing.  Feedback is either offer or include a small container of salsa with the migas.  Shouldn t have to ask for that with migas.  El Dorado outdid themselves with the redesign of the old Alborz Persian space in the NW corner of Anderson  amp  Shoal Creek just East of Mopac.  Great eye for detail in the space.  Mutant dolphin   Check.  Comfortable 4 top tables.  I ll ask to sit at one of those crescent booths  under that lysergic dolphin for the enchilada acid test  next time to get my people watching on.  Nice  on the ball server.  Food came out fast and hot.  Competitive pricing based on the quality of the ingredients and time put into cooking them just right.

This is a cool  authentic spot in north austin. It can feel a little soulless up here  w all the standard retail chain spots close by. Ambience was def refreshing.  Food and drinks were great portions and DELICIOUS  my family of mixed plant based and carnivore folks all had no complaints  . Dranks were poppin.  Also  a huge shoutout to the great staff. Super pleasant and went out of their way to check up on us and make sure everything was still great. S o to the manager  Christie  for being especially warm.

After discovering our previous choice only did Sunday brunch  we saw Eldorado s ratings. Crazy  because we ve driven by hundreds of times but neither of us had heard of it. So... we arrived  complete party  and the  badass  manager readily seated us for Sunday dinner. Our server Christina promptly greeted us with salsa recommendations  definitely do the flight  all very unique flavors    and took drink orders. The margaritas are spot-frkn-on deLISH  Espolon traditional  prickly pear and watermelon  all perfectly mixed. Per recommendation  I ordered the carnitas. Lemme tell you   I m accustomed to getting pork that looks pulled and belongs in a sandwich. Not this time--carnitas at Eldorado are crispy and insane tasty  Yes  I d agree  best in Austin  and many other cities I ve lived . Everyone else loves their entrees. The guacamole was so good  we ended getting two large bowls  Christina offered some tasty dessert options but we were stuffed. Next time  Eldorado is our new top go-to  and there s an awesome drinking fish on the wall. This place is hella badass

We really enjoyed our meal here  We had heard great things and finally had a chance to check it out. We came here on a Friday evening around 6 30 and the wait time was about 1 hour but we were probably seated within 25 minutes.   The restaurant is in a strip mall and they did a good job of transforming the space inside. There is a small seating area in the front where people can wait  the bar was packed and is off to the side and the rest of the space is for seating.   The menu has a plethora of items and it was hard narrowing down our options. You can pick one salsa for free and we ended up with the avocado salsa  which was a bit too sour for our preference.   We ended up ordering sharing  Sticky ribs  5 5   never thought of sticky ribs as a Tex mex dish  but this was so delightful  The rib meat was super tender and it was easy to eat with a fork and knife because the meat was falling off the bone.  Fried mashed potato dish with bacon forget the real name   5 5   my favorite item of the evening  This was like a fried ravioli stuffed with the most delicious mashed potatoes I ve ever eaten. This is a must  Pork carnitas  5 5   I like for the entrees you can choose between a variety of sides. The meat was tender and flavorful and the sides we got were tasty as well. There was literally nothing left on our plate.   Overall we love this place and will be back  There are still so many items on their menu that we want to try. We appreciated how the owner came around to each table to introduce himself- it was a nice personal touch.   Summary  get the fried mashed potato bacon appetizer  no reservations  parties of 4 or less for quicker seating.

I love the food at Eldorado Cafe. I have been a customer of Eldorado at the pop-up places  they catered an event  and now as a customer in the new restaurant. The food is always served fresh hot and delicious. There are always veggie options  and the cocktails at the new location use fresh juice.

Enjoyed lunch and dinner here.  Better than the majority of Tex-Mex joints one stumbles upon.  If you enjoy legit TexMex  this place is for you. If Tawko-Bel is your idea of Messkin food  You will hate this place  avoid darkening their doorstep - go get something with baked-on Dorito crumbs.  Staff was great. Very helpful and the servers I dealt with knew the menu well.  Salsa was top shelf. All of it. Some commented that it s spicy or too hot. No way  I loved it all. Guac was excellent.  Carnitas was most excellent.  Chicken enchiladas were most excellent.  Highly recommended  unless you re that Talko-bel lover .

Can t say enough great things about this new spot  It has everything  including the TASTIEST and FRESHEST Texican food this side of anywhere  They ve been doing pop up s and catering for months and now their place is finally opening.  Expect to taste the love and joy of cooking in their special dishes  like Shiny Ribs  Torta s  Enchiladas and their cocktails are made with fresh juice  We plan to be regulars

Server was fantastic. We were a large party with half of us being kids and she was so patient and brought everything we needed  was on point. She even brought us a salsa sampler without us even asking. We will be back for sure.

Amazing food  Buckle up for flavortown. Highly recommend the cheez and rice side and sirloin tampiqueno. I m usually not huge on beans that come on the side at mexican restaurants  but the beans here were notably good. Very friendly and helpful staff who took and delivered my take out order. They had a nicely set up parking lot  no contact pick up process.
This was my first time here  The food was excellent and the service was fantastic  I ll be back... maybe for happy hour so I can enjoy a nice draft beer at the bar.
Love the decor  love the food  but the it is really loud. If you are looking for a quite cafe to enjoy coffee  maybe work a little. This place is not it.

This place hit every mark perfectly. The service was impeccable. The managers were pleasant and caring and interested in our thoughts about the place  the food was beyond anything that we see here in North Austin in the Mexican realm.   The vibe was like the old Austin that we all miss and love desperately. I will absolutely positively be going here again.   Even if I had been forced to wait for the food. It would ve been worth it.  Unlike most new hipster joints in Austin. This is the real thing.

Walked in on a bustling Tuesday at 8 and were quoted a 30 minute wait.  We actually went in expecting a longer wait  but were promptly seated after only 20 minutes.  Staff was extremely friendly and it seemed to carry over to the customers as we engaged in several conversations with the tables next to us.    The margaritas were decent but next time I ll probably try one of their other delicious looking cocktails.  The medium salsa was roasty  smoky and paired extremely well with the crispy  fresh-tasting chips.  The super kind waitress even brought us a little sample of the super hot salsa which was different but equally well done.  The menu has a lot of excellent choices.  I settled on Rene s enchiladas which were some of the best I ve had.  The filling  the sauce  mmmmmm  Rice was light and flavorful and the beans were a big hit.  My wife got the crispy tacos and boy were they crispy   Eldorado Cafe hits all the right notes.  Great service  great atmosphere  and they really care about their food and it shows.  We had a great time and can t wait to go back.

Our first time in today and we will certainly be back. Not only was the food delicious and inventive  there are A LOT of Mexican and TexMex places here   the service was superlative. We had the Papas Rellenas and Enchiladas with mushrooms and caramelized onions. Both were excellent but the Papas Rellenas stood out as exceptional. Mashed potatoes mixed with goat cheese and lightly fried on a bed of sharp purple cabbage was to. die. for.  It was a lunch date but next time we plan to explore more dishes and the dessert menu.  The wait staff was attentive but not aggressive. And our table and others shared a visit from the convivial and  easy going chef owner. We chatted about our kiddos and he let us know there is a corner with some rad kid toys for littles.  This place definitely earns all five stars
We LOVE this place  Has amazing food and great options for vegetarians. Get the queso - you won t be disappointed
The best Mexican food. Great service. Unique atmosphere. Diverse menu  with healthy options. Breakfast. I ve been all over Mexico  Texas  the Southwest. It s the best.

We have been going to the popups at Nomads and Dia s for the past year. So excited that the restaurant is finally open.  Our first visit did not disappoint  with delicious  creative  handmade food and friendly service.

The place is popular.  We waited 30 minutes.  I liked it  but only trendy beer and margarita on the rocks are available.  I d rate it higher if the beer list was longer w traditional and they had a margarita machine. I did order a mango margarita  the taste was off. I did not like it. I tasted a strawberry margarita  it was better. Maybe mango was prefab  idk.  Let me talk about the food. I ordered the chicken breast  mashed and hash. The menu stated breast so I expected a breast. It was shredded and grilled to a dry point. I see someone else noted that sauce would help  perhaps. I ate the mashed and hash  np. Someone had a taco salad and another enchiladas suizas. They said their meals were ok. I agree the comments about price point  I expected more.

The only place in Austin I want to eat hues rancheros  From the lightly fried tortilla to the perfect ranchero sauce to probably the best black beans I ve eaten. But don t forget the Bloody Mary. It s perfect  And if it s lunch or dinner you re after  try the the busted with chimichurri  It s amazing  with my beloved Veggie Moja and Cheesy Rice   Nike  a k a Do It     And not to be omitted  Chef Fried is so very attentive  hands-on  and just damn marvelous that you can understand how it is that he and his wife have assembled the best  happiest  most efficient staff I ve ever encountered.
Breakfast here is amazing. They ve got some unique breakfast plates that are different and delicious. Highly recommend.

I m just a big fan of the menu they ve put together here. The flavor is less Tex mex and more interior. The salsa choices are varied  I like the X  and the enchiladas are awesome. Suizo sauce for the win. But also the green Chile pulled pork.  This is comfort food for us.   Now if only they had a bigger seating area

Had a chalupa from their rotating menu and it was delicious  Chile con queso was also very tasty. Nice viscosity--not too thick like it was simply melted American cheese with salsa thrown in. It s clearly still American cheese  but they did it the right way and started with either a bechamel or cornstarch base and saut ed ingredients. Yum    My friend and I both ordered enchiladas  she got the suiza chicken and I had Esme s magic  which are filled with mashed potato and topped with an ancho Chile sauce. Esme s magic are a specialty they re known for.   I did not care for mine. The chile sauce was very sweet and nothing else in the enchilada was strong enough to stand up to it. My friend s chicken enchiladas were delicious   I ll definitely go back and next time if I get enchiladas I ll try Rene s  which have short rib.   Margaritas were strong and good  AC was terrible and everyone was sweating. Check this place out

I ordered a  Coke   amp  the bartender served me Main Root  without telling me. It s not the same thing. I didn t feel like trying all the salsas  so I asked which one is the most popular. She said it was the salsa X. I thought this one was pretty bland. I guess I ll try a different one next time. I thought that the mashed potatoes had too much skin in them. The crispy tacos were very tasty  but impossible to eat gracefully  so I just crumbled them up  amp  ate them with a fork like a taco salad. I hate to be such a Debbie Downer on this place. It looks like it has a lot of potential  so I will definitely give it another try.

Eldorado cafe is tucked in an out of the way strip mall right at Anderson lane and mopac. The immediate impression is that this is a very approachable and welcoming member of the  keep Austin weird  clan featuring a menu of interesting tales on classic Tex mex  off the wall decor and sweet hipster wait staff.  The food was good  particularly the avocado salsa. While nothing we had was mind blowing  the carnitas had nice caramelization while being very tender  and the mojo chicken was good and limey. The letdown was the enchilada sauce which seemed more like spicy ketchup than a chili sauce.  Overall  a great experience with good food  but probably best to stick to what they do well- carnitas and the big plates.

Sunday at 6 00PM on a 25 min wait...in a funky location in a dark strip center  I had hoped for amazing. Food was okay and service was meh...rather assumptive  like our two top should have known the ins and outs of their menu. Started with their signature queso  with guacamole  black beans  pico...good texture and mild flavors  not much Heath. Had the crispy tacos which  per the waitress  should have changed my life. May have been a lot to live up to  but they were just okay. The salsas with the chips...okay. 3-potato hash...okay. We decided to try the skillet cherry pie  as folks raved about it. The crust was chewy  and the flavor bland...no tartness or much depth  tho a very healthy portion.   All told  nothing bad about the meal  but nothing worthy of the hype imho  or inspiring a return visit. Maybe other things on the menu are better.

Thoroughly enjoyed Eldorado Cafe. I ve been here a couple times  but this time was the most exceptional. Had the Esme Enchiladas  tried all the salsas  and crushed a delightful soapapilla cheesecakes. Call out to Barry who was delightful  his words  Trust the fat man with what food is good.  And this beautiful large man sang truer than any Sunday canary.

Heave on earth.  Went to Eldorado Cafe with my boyfriend at 9p on a weekday and received fresh food and great service.    Our waiter worked really hard and was super polite.  For appetizers  we got to try two different types of salsas and also ordered a giant bowl of queso with black beans  pico and guac.  Main dishes came out and were delicious - my lettuce was actually dark green  haven t seen this before at a restaurant .  Thanks  chefs   I ate as much of my plate as I could.  I can t wait to go back and try out other options.    They can make an entree for gluten free vegans.  I ordered vegetarian food with no problems at all.

So delicious      4 of us ate here yesterday. We ordered several things to share  and I m so glad we did. If you re going to do the same  here are some things to add to your order   House salsa sampler SalsaX is so good   Shiny ribs Papas rellenas Nachos with the beef picadillo Puzchkas Las Calabasas One of the guizos  or maybe a couple  Cherry Pie  Yes  cherry pie. It s awesome. I thought I hated cherry pie. This one changed my mind.  I saw a previous review talking about the ice in the margaritas. I don t get it. My aunt ordered a margarita on the rocks. The ice in her margarita looked fine. Seriously  what s the problem   I m not an  Austin Foodie   nor do I want to be. All I know is that this food is fantastic

People rant and rave about this place... we finally went and tried it and were very underwhelmed. Maybe we got the wrong things   Not sure.. House margs were not great at all.. at the end we had just wished we went somewhere else that we knew was bomb.
Good service. Versatile menu  nice departure from the same old menu items you find everywhere. Nice ambiance.

We went back and were able to get a table around 4 pm with no wait. While the main dishes are typical tex-mex fare  the sides and the drinks make this place special. Their squash hash with butternut squash and pepitas is amazing. I could eat an entire bowl of it. Their black beans are also fantastic  they have great flavor but they don t make you feel heavy after eating it.  The cocktails  including the mezcal ones  are delicious  I definitely love their creativity with their cocktails.   I definitely go back IF there is no or minimal weight.

Yum Yum Yum  I could have drank salsa-x straight from the bowl  In fact I would have preferred that from the drink that was recommended to me by our server. I was originally going to order a regular margarita but was talked into the tamarindo drink which tasted nothing like a tamarindo and more like margarita mix that went bad. For my appetizer I ordered the papas rellenos which are nothing like you d expect. I was served medium sized fried cheese with a sweet dipping sauce. My friend ordered the quesadilla which was not bad as well. The highlight was definitely the salsa. I d like to come back and taste an entree.

drove by and noticed they were doing a soft opening over the weekend so stopped by to try them out for dinner. the service and atmosphere were great. the salsa and chip sampler was amazing  all 5 salsas were really good but the spiciest one was definitely my favorite. me and my wife both ordered chicken enchiladas and they were very good. they came with rice and black beans which were delicious also and there was definitely enough food to leave with some leftovers for lunch  me and my wife will definitely return and will be seeing if our staff would like to do our next employee dinner there.

Love it - plenty of space and seating for a Saturday.  Had the Nomad and it was delicious. Tried the salsa sampler and liked most of them but the hottest. It has a funky aftertaste.  Only thing was service was a bit slow on refills but other than that we loved it.  Not too loud or busy.  Give it a try.

Hands down my favorite Mexican restaurant in Texas. The food is amazing  servers are knowledgeable and fun to talk to. Had to wait 30 minutes for dinner  but definitely worth the wait. Their salsa is variety is impressive  and their menu is authentic and very delicious. Highly recommend

Yummy  It was an amazing experience  Amy J. was sooo patient and kind  as my son was running late.  The food was simply delicious   I had the chilaquiles and my son tried the Migas and El hombre tacos  Those tacos were gone so fast    The chilaquiles were so tasty and generously served  Taking some home for later

A place built with heart and soul that flows into their food  Start with salsa sampler. Each is unique and the flavors packed into each one are amazing. From there  you really can t go wrong. The Suiza sauce is one of my faves and the shiny ribs were also a hit. Oh  and treat yourself to queso- because everyone needs more cheese in their life  I recommend washing it down with a perfectly balanced Tamarindo  solid tequila cocktail .

Great place evidenced by a 20 minute wait on a Sunday evening but worth it. The chips had the right heft to them. Not to thin and not greasy.  The salsas were great. The entrees came out fast hot and flavorful.  Plenty of options adobo pork and pollo with salsa verde both were delicious. It was difficult to choose so a return visit is on the books. A little loud only because of all the hard surfaces and the place being packed but that won t keep you away once you try it.
One of the best Mexican meals we have ever had  including AZ NM and TX  Enchiladas and the home made sauces are superb.   Very friendly staff and the owner is another Austin gem

Been on several occasions  service and food are always amazing and prices are very reasonable. Try the selection of salsas and enjoy the laid back atmosphere. Breakfast is our favorite  best to go before 10am and avoid the crowds rush.
This food is fantastic. Tried the enchiladas suizas with chicken  the green chili pork tacos and the taco salad. All fantastic. Amazing  fresh drinks. Definitely recommend to anyone

They squeaked in with a 4-star for service  I personally won t be able to return because they don t have either of my tequila choices  I went with my staple - Suiza  Chicken  Enchiladas. They were good  nothing to write home about  but I m an enchilada snob at this point. The rice and beans were just ok for me.  Nontraditional overall  and I guess in this cuisine I m a traditionalist  I did try a non-standard tequila...and highly recommend the mango margarita  towards the bottom of the menu  couple of flavor options . Tasty - if you like mango or worth a try if the other flavors appeal to you. It was a Sunday night  - packed house of smiling faces. I really enjoyed people watching. Plenty of parking in a strip mall parking lot - that slows for dinner  at least. The best part was the service though. If you aren t in a hurry - wait to order your main course. You will have food before you know it  Expect them to check in plenty of times and always service with a smile  Enjoy

My friends  amp  I had never been here before  amp  they have been living here for 10 year  me only 2 . I m so glad we went the food was great  amp  so was the service. We went for brunch  amp  while it was a bit busy it wasn t too bad

I m not much of a fan of  New Mexico  style Mexican food  but thought I d give this a try since it s in the neighborhood.  Started with the house margarita on the rocks - excellent and had a nice kick. For my entree I ordered the  Enchiladas Classicas .  Food came quickly but when I took one bite I realized the enchiladas were covered in ancho chile sauce  which I hate.  This was completely my fault since I didn t read the menu description thoroughly.  There was no way I was going to try to send the food back since it was my mistake  but when our server asked me how my meal was I explained my dislike of ancho chile sauce  while assuring her it was nobody s fault but mine.  She immediately offered to replace my entree with something else at no charge.  I selected the nachos compuestos and they were some of the best nachos I ve ever put in my mouth   This is STELLAR customer service.  Can t wait to come back

One word  WOW  Unbelievable food  and I am tough with restaurants.  Located in a  nameless  shopping center  desolate  pretty bland outside. Then you come inside and the most amazing food experience is waiting for you.

Joel    Congrats  You and your team are doing an amazing job  Keep up the good work and don t take Yelp too seriuolsy. Some people just have nothing better to do in their life than be negative when people need to be spreading more positivty. Glad you re part of the Anderson Lane Crew

Pleasantly surprised to find this gem finally open. We had heard great reviews from a local business and couldn t wait to try it for ourselves. We were not disappointed  Both my husband and I had build your own breakfast tacos.  The fried over easy eggs were cooked to perfection with a warm runny yolk. We each picked different ingredients including tasteful black beans  crispy bacon  delightful jack cheese and avocado.  We tried the mild and the X salsa.   The latter salsa was so delicious we bought 2 containers to take home.   We will definitely come back again

Hands down the best plate of Mexican food I ve had in Austin  and I ve been here for 12 years. I had Rene s Awesome Enchiladas and I gotta say  WELL NAMED. The chips and homemade salsas are delicious  our waitress was incredibly friendly and helpful with suggestions  the owner stopped by to check in on us  and the desserts  Mexican cheesecake and lemon raspberry  were insanely good.   I expected a long wait at 11a on a Saturday but our table was ready in 15 minutes  despite the place being packed. Can t wait to go back to try the breakfast

The food here is phenomenal  and the people are amazing. The shiny ribs are quite simply a spiritual experience. Best Carnitas I ve ever had  super crispy and not fatty at all. Everything from the appetizers to the drinks was fantastic  and we will be back as many times as we can.
Always a winner  I ve had multiple experiences with them and they are definitely a favorite.

I give the above rating not only for the amazing food and bar but for the staff and the owner.  First the food...have yet to find a dish that was just average and quality is consistent. Next the people...staff is friendly and cool as s  amp     The owners makes you feel like you ve walked into his home.  Great personality and very authentic. Our go to spot when we decide not to cook at home.

Got dinner here last week and it was just delicious. Friends and I split the papas rellenas  so good  and the salsa sampler.  Listen  that salsa X just does it for me. You could pour that over a shoe and I would eat it. I hope you find a way to bottle and sell it because I want it on EVERYTHING. I want to cook with it.  Moving on  I had the crispy pork carnitas and it.was.fantastic. You want this. I had the squash and potatoes for my sides and everything was great and perfect. I don t remember what everyone else got  but all five of us were very happy with our meals. OH  AND THE SOPAPILLA CHEESECAKE. Yeah  get that. We got it to go and it was amazing even the next day.

Great experience at El Dorado.  The staff was extremely friendly  both the manager and our waitress   food was great  salsa sampler  short rib enchiladas  and Carnitas were all delicious .  This might be our new favorite Mexican in town.

This place is  simply put  amazing. They opened a couple weeks ago  and it is already one of my favorite places in Austin. The place is adorable  the staff are all friendly and attentive  and the food and drinks were perfection.  There was a wait the night we went  so we posted up at the bar with some queso and drinks. The drinks were delicious - made with fresh squeezed juice - and the queso was sublime.  When we got seated  we were treated to great service and some of the best food I have had in my life. We started with the shiny ribs  which were cooked to perfection and properly messy. My girlfriend had the Joel s Happy Plate  2 cheese enchiladas hugging a beef enchilada. While I only had a few bites  I would easily rate these the best enchiladas I have had in Austin  coming from El Paso  I feel this is high praise . I ordered the Carnitas  which were perfect - moist with the proper amount of  crunch    In short - this place is great. The ambiance was adorable  the staff  a lot of youngsters  were all exceedingly nice and attentive  there were some opening week problems  but for a place that has been packed to the gills since it opened  this is to be expected and was nothing at all out of the norm   and the food was delicious  the Scorpion salsa  which took 1st place in the Specialty Category at the Hot Sauce competition last weekend  by the way  will light you up - you have been warned

I love this place. We went last night for the first time and I hope we go back soon. The staff is great  our waiter s name was Travis and he was wonderful. We tried a variety of the salsas and they were all delicious. I don t think you can go wrong with any of their food. I had the Rene s enchiladas and they were delicious. They had really large portions  The margaritas aren t cheap but they are tasty. We had a 20 minute wait on a Thursday at 6 so be prepared for a little wait when you go. It s well worth the wait

I ve eaten here four or five times and really don t understand how they get all these great reviews. Margarita are good...but the food   Traditional TexMex it is not. The very small salad was better than the tacos or enchiladas  and that s not even TexMex.
El Dorado has fantastic food and has been very responsible in the pandemic - great social distancing has allowed me to get this great food.

We recently had Eldorado caterer a dinner for about 16 people   Our event was pushed up and their top flight team were kind enough to prep the food about an hour earlier than we had first requested.    We were very impressed with the amount of food  quality of food and everything even came with strong serving utensils.   Plates and silverware included      Our guest were absolutely in love with all the unique flavors of the meat and the green chicken chili enchiladas.    They loved that we received three different types of salsa.  Each with different heat  texture and taste.     We have had meals inside the restaurant prior to ordering this dinner - we can wait to go back now    Thanks for helping to make our dinner amazing

Amazing meal  service and atmosphere  Owner comes by and checks on each table s experience and makes great connections with patrons. Delicious  thoughtful dishes and drinks. We got the Vegan enchiladas  phenomenal  and the nachos  single masterpieces on each chip  not an mess like other places. Highly recommend

I ve been to ElDorado Cafe several times  and it s always been delicious  Tonight  we went with our big family for my daughter s last night before heading back to school. I was one of the high maintenance customers who was on a restricted diet. Joel the owner made me an amazing dinner that completely fit my dietary restrictions  and everyone s meals were perfect  I highly recommend ElDorado Cafe  You won t be disappointed
Recently took the work tribe here for National Margarita Day.  Food  drinks  and especially the service were all  outstanding.  We will be back   Heck  may go there for brunch today
The food here is great. Service was really good. I can t wait to come back.  I loved the Big Papas taco and the Migas taco. The queso was so tasty.

We recently tried this place for the first time.  It was so good   We came on a Sunday for lunch and it was crowded but they found a way to seat us as quickly as possible.  The service was great and the food was really good.  We came back a week or so later for the happy hour and we loved the margaritas and the tacos and quesadillas.  And you cannot beat their happy hour prices   Not only are the food and drinks awesome  but the service stands out.  Everyone is nice and helpful and you can tell they really enjoy working there.  The owners seem to be taking really good care of their employees  We will be back again many times and we have already been telling all of our friends and family members about it
Put this place on your to go list   Drinks-amazing  Service-amazing  Salsa-hello Heaven. As a New Mexican-hello Red Chile sauce  I will be a regular here   Chef-your Red Chile is on point

I think maybe we had too high expectations based off of all the great reviews. The service was amazing  but did not feel the food was all that great even if its not going for Tex mex or authentic Mexican. We had the enchiladas   Suizas which lacked flavor. The salsa sampler was decent. We do appreciate the great service though

Wish I could give more than 5 stars  I haven t been compelled to write a review for any restaurants in quite a while but this place went above and beyond both in quality tastiness of food AND in service. Seriously can t wait to go back. After their amazing salsa sampler  we had the short rib tacos and they were crazy good. Very affordable  very tasty  incredibly friendly and great vibe  If you re on the fence  just go ... you won t be disappointed.

Consistently great  The wait is never terrible  the food is always on point  and usually the servers are top shelf. The only weird thing that left a bad taste in my mouth was on our last visit when the hostess grabbed my son s drink out of his hand and said  you can t have this .  Literally grabbed it from him.  The drink was actually gone  it was my glass of sangria that had berries in it. My 15 year old son can absolutely have my fruit from a glass of wine  definitely not her call  and they way she did it left us flabbergasted. Especially because it was done in front of a party of 10 that included family and co workers of my husbands that I had never met.  Anyway  the food is great and this was Hopefully a one off for us. Unfortunately for the rest of the group that was their first and last impression because they were from out of town. Just a bit embarrassing
Deeeeelish and very friendly  I will definitely be back to the El Dorado caf  in the future. I think my favorite of all the items was the salsa the salsa ex is to die for.
The carnitas at this place were next level good.  The atmosphere reminded me a bit of cafe java on metric by ACC  its like cafe java with good mexican food.

There s a reason people are lining up outside even on the week nights  We finally made it in to try things out and loved everything  We tried the salsa sampler which was a conversation piece in itself because you know  these things are worth discussing as you enjoy them  Great margaritas and enchiladas  I also had a wonderful salad that I ll be thinking of in the future  Who says that about salad   That s how delicious it was  Hope to come back soon

We went to El Dorado for a late lunch yesterday. First time for us both. Several friends had highly recommended it and we were not at all disappointed. We had the salsas five ways  queso  the Thunder Rosa taco and Migas. Everything was delicious. I am not a huge fan of black beans  but I thought the beans at El Dorado were outstanding. The staff  our server AND at the register  were really great. We will be back many times   probably this week  Rated it as 4 out of 5 only because every restaurant can get even better

I should not be writing this review because I don t want the word to get out about how great Eldorado is   But I do want to share how good the food is and help my local restaurant get business.   My SO and I go here weekly and have never been disappointed. The food is super tasty and the atmosphere is super cute.  Do not let the strip mall location fool you  this is one of the best eateries in Austin. It s one of our faves for a quick dinner or a date night with drinks and dessert  the whole nine yards .   I recommend any of the quesadillas and Cubano Carnitas for dinner. Oh and for breakfast I recommend the Nomad.
Went for the first time tonight and must admit El Dorado lived up to the hype. Food was all excellent as well as the cocktails. Salsas were really great.

We loved everything we had during their soft opening   The fried potato and bacon appetizer was super yummy  as were the shiny ribs  always a favorite  and the panzenella. I actually liked it better with the cheese they use then the usual mozzarella.  The carnitas plate was great and so were the verde enchiladas. Favorite sides were the rice and the calabasas.  Can t wait to go back and try more stuff  They open with the full menu August 8th.
Eldorado Cafe. muchas gracias for Server Kiki G and all the staff with yummy food and ritas in hand.  I love the music  ZZ Top my fav  easy listening and atmosphere is lovely.
Setting - enter. 1pm. 35 minute wait. First thought - this place must be good. Holy balls  was it ever. Run  don t walk  to this place. Get the supa queso. Get the salsa x. Get lit. Let s go baby
I m adding to all the five star reviews because this place is amazing  They even have a little kids area in front. So brilliant. The food and drinks are delicious. Highly recommended

This was our first visit to ElDorado and it won t be our last. I ordered the Hongo meal with garlic mash potatoes  amp  veggies. It comes with 2 flour or corn tortillas and was fresh  amp  delicious. I was particularly pleased with the salsas. Usually a restaurant will claim their salsa is hot  but the spiciness will be nonexistent. Not so at ElDorado - the spicy salsa gripped my tongue in a vice of volcanic heat  amp  would not let go    We have plans to return and check their breakfast menu

My wife and I stopped here for breakfast and we really enjoyed it.   We ordered The Migas Plate and the The Nomad Plate- along with a biscuit and jam. I also had a cup of coffee.   The restaurant itself is clean and comfortable- I don t know how long it has been there but it looked relatively new. The decor was Austin Tex-Mex casual  and I thought it looked great.   Our waitress was quick  friendly and attentive - without being intrusive.   The food  labeled as comfort food  was fairly traditional  but with some house made flair. The breakfast potatoes were a combination of sweet and white potatoes  with onion and bell pepper strips. We both loved them. The black refried beams were tasty and the eggs themselves were also tender and fluffy.   The homemade biscuit was large and looked great  but was more like toast in consistency than a biscuit. The jam was outstanding. It had a wonderful flavor and aroma.   To top it off  the coffee was much better than typical diner coffee. Good deep flavor  not burnt  and cream  or whole milk  in a chilled stainless mini pitcher.

I ve been here 3 times in 2 months now because I can t stop thinking about the Carne Adovado. It s amazing  And the margaritas are fresh and delicious. Expect a wait as it s popular and small but I will definitely be back again and again

I went here for breakfast with friends and was most disappointed. Be prepared for tables crammed tightly together.  What really bothered me was that ALL the breakfast dishes come with beans and potatoes -- no substitutions.  I asked if there were any breakfast items that I could order a la carte  without beans and potatoes .  The response was  I can bring out your order without the sides but you re still going to pay for them.   Nearly all Mexican restaurants in town offer substitutions or a la carte items but not here.  If you re not a big starch eater or diabetic  steer clear.

I told Amy   our waitress that I felt like I died and gone to heaven  she was excellent and went above and beyond to ensure we were satisfied. Christy the manager walked around with a smile on her face and stopped by to greet us. Love this place  food and service was excellent   Definitely be back

This is  hands-down  my favorite restaurant in town. I would call it a hidden gem - tucked away as it is in a kind of random strip mall right beside Mopac - but clearly there are a ton of other people who love it as much as I do  since the place is always busy. It s well worth the wait  though  and I always come away happy. The food is generally wholesome  delicious  and always prompt. It s a great place to go to accommodate groups with disparate eating   food preferences  i.e. near-carnivores and vegans can both find something awesome   and they try hard to accommodate all sorts of diets.   Beyond that  the place just radiates warmth and friendly neighborhood vibes - I regularly see the owners and veteran waiter-folks stopping by to chat with folks who come in regularly.  Some tips   Las Calabasas is probably my favorite thing on the menu  delectably rich little pieces of squash happiness  with pepitas and basil to boot.  The other sides are also generally the bomb - you can t go wrong   The best salsa by far is Salsa X.  Try the enchiladas with the mashed potatoes inside - forget what it s called  but it s awesome.  I leave every single time in a great mood. Long live El Dorado

Not a type of person to write a review but I had to let my experience be known considering the fact that this place had really good reviews    Let me start by saying our table was given to a party that had just walked in after we sat their waiting for over 30 minutes  Maybe my skin color had to be white to get seated right away  Our waiter forgot about our appetizer and the food was mediocre  definitely not worth the wait. I am happy to say that I will not be returning to this so called restaurant

Yelp user for years but this is my first review. I use Yelp to find places and get an idea about them. I hope to provide that useful information  but I also have something to say about the other reviews  since I can t comment directly on them haha. We ll get to that...  El Dorado Cafe was excellent. First time there. Already know for sure we ll be going back who knows how many times. Our server  Eric  was great. Recommended sauce X  and it was yum. If you re a salsa snob  give it a rest  bring your own  I dunno. For the casual chips and dip before the real thing... excellent salsa.  We got there around 2pm. Were told 15 minute wait. Got seated after 5 minutes. They serve breakfast until 3pm. I got Joey s happy plate  girlfriend got Gloria s Chilaquiles. There were probably ten or more other things on the menu we wish we had the stomachs to try. I m definitely going to get something on the breakfast menu next time.  We both cleaned our plates. Very good food. Friendly servers. Owner manager or someone in charge came by to ask us how we were.  This place has 4 stars as of now. It should have 5. You guys  Yelp is here to help others find good places to go. It s not about you. Somebody gave this place 1 star because they don t take reservations and they wanted one. No mention of the food or service. It s a small cafe. Go to Chili s or something if you need reservations  you dummies. Another person gave them 1 star because they ve been several times and there s always a wait  Uhhh doesn t that mean they re good  Sorry you had to wait  but you should realize nobody waits 40 minutes for a 1 star restaurant. They wait because this place is awesome.  Don t Yelp for your own satisfaction. Yelp to help.
Super great. I ordered the tamarindo but it did not taste like a tamarindo at all. The quesadilla was good and salsa was so good I wanted to drink it. I m definitely going back

Had dinner and it was pretty good. Definitely recommend getting an appetizer because the meal portion sizes were slightly small.  We got the salsa sampler which was pretty good. Overall the service was great.
My favorite place for casual Mexican dinner - interesting cocktails and terrific flavors .

One of my fianc  and I s favorite brunch spots. We always opt to sit at the bar. Great  friendly  attentive service. Our favorite dishes are the Tio White Potato and La Bomba. Also really enjoyed the Suadorado  horchata plus chameleon cold brew .

Salsa X is so good it s dangerous    I had the taco salad  it was super fresh and delicious.  I also tasted the Cubano that is also super yummy. The waiter was nice and friendly and provided great service.

Perfect Brunch  Me and 16 of my closest friends  and 2 precious babies  had breakfast at El Dorado yesterday. They don t take reservations but I did call in advance to warn them of our large party. They made everything easy breezy. We love tasting  ALL  of the amazing salsas and yummy food. I loved showing my friends my new favorite place to eat in Austin
Amazing little hole in the wall. Fantastic food  great service  and a lovely restaurant.

I have yet to have anything bad here  And I ve definitely had things that were unique and delicious  like the pork tacos I had today with the candied onions and pineapple pico  The workers are the friendliest  the salsa selection fantastic  and the drink specials all contribute to making this my favorite restaurant in Austin. I ve only written one other restaurant review on Yelp  and that was to warn people  so...
Awesome    Really diverse menu. The owner is a chef and you can really tell he loves what he s doing.  By far my favorite new restaurant

The service was great and the food tasted even better  We re not from the area and they treated us with a free dessert and made sure we were well taken care of  Will definitely be recommending them to our friends and family.

Excellent   I was looking for a new brunch spot to take my friend from Denver. This place was the perfect combo of brunch fun with Austin style breakfast tacos. She said her tacos were two of the best she s ever had.  Amy behind the bar made us delicious Sunday Funday cocktails and Joel came out to say hello and ensure our food was good.  Loved the vibe and the good tunes. Will definitely be going back soon

I have been twice  once during a soft opening and another time this past week. Both times I had excellent customer service and delicious food. Both times were very busy. Once you order a drink at the bar  there s a stylish lounge area in the back where you can wait for your table.   Menu highlights  so far   pork green chile  carne adovado  order with a side of mashed potatoes    papas rellenas  supa queso. I have tried several more items at their previous pop-up at Dia s market and assume they will be just as good if not better here. The salsas are fresh and consistently awesome  salsa X  el scorpio  . The house margarita is great  I also really enjoyed the sandista  watermelon cocktail . They have available the watermelon agua fresca for kids. There is also a kid area in front and a kid section of the menu.   The restaurant itself is beautiful and exudes such a pleasant vibe. The only  problem  is that we ve had to wait a bit here and there for a table or food or drinks  but that doesn t deter us. We plan to go back often

I absolutely LOVE this place  Food is amazing and the staff super friendly. The owner seems to always be on site and attending to any and all needs. My boyfriend and I had been looking for a great new place  as we had grown a bit tired of the regular spots  Maudie s  Chuys  places like that.   The food here  I honestly can t say enough. Most places  especially Tex-mex spots  can give me stomach aches rather quickly  due tothe amount of oils and poor food brands produce used for the dishes. I don t get anything like that here.   Highly recommend

Just in ATX for a quick visit and we went to the nearest place with great reviews.  We both got the enchiladas classicas-  they were potent  I could still taste the bitterness hours later.  I think it s an attempt to make an authentic enchilada sauce  but it s a major fail.  Since you want to go authentic  why the weird white rice that has nothing to do with mexican rice   The sopapilla cheesecake was ok  but why is it called cheesecake if it s more of a flan taste and texture    I would go by here if I was starving  but probably not. We were given a choice of 2 salsas  I asked for both and we were told that would be an extra  1.50.... ok fine  except neither was great  so I should have asked them to waive it.  Honestly  this place was so disappointing that I would have given it fewer stars... HOWEVER   our waiter was attentive  maybe a little much with the menu description and Spanish food term lesson  and the restroom was clean  and smelled delightful  they even have a jar with tampons in the stall  how thoughtful

I ve been coming this restaurant constantly since I moved from Los Angeles to Austin. This is the best Tex- Mex restaurant So far . Not only the food but also the cocktails are amazing. I wish you guys would add some SEA FOOD  I really wish that as a PESCATARIAN   costumer. Also  the staff is amazing

We met some friends here for dinner last night and I was pretty underwhelmed.  The wait wasn t bad and the service was okay.    I liked the house margarita - it wasn t too sweet and was fairly strong.   Husband ordered two Negra Modelos  a glass of house wine and a house margarita and it was  29 before tip - a little steep.   We ordered the flauta app and guac - both came out quick and both were pretty tasty.  The menu is varied  and it s not tex-mex which is a-okay with me.  But prices are pretty steep for what they re offering.  I had the chicken tinga with two sides  can t remember what they called it - maybe Chi Chi .  I picked garlic mashed potatoes and a side salad.  Both of those were fine - the potatoes weren t hot.  The chicken consisted of pieces of breast meat - and on the dry and tough side and the sauce was fine.  Not amazing but wasn t bad.  For  15.95 though - I expected to be a little more wowed.    We ordered the sopapilla cheesecake and I was SO excited for this as it s one of my favorite deserts.  This one was served warm  it s cheesecake for goodness sake   and it was super dry.  Wasn t even close to being okay.  We had breakfast here last summer  and it was really good  and we had wanted to come back for dinner.    But  after last night  I kinda doubt we ll be back.  Maybe for breakfast if we find ourselves back in the area but definitely not for dinner again.

Finally tried this place after driving by it hundreds of times with my girlfriend. Food  drinks  service  and atmosphere are fantastic. This place is literally better than kerbey lane and magnolia cafe and flies under the radar. Arturo and Marisa are killing the game at the bar making bomb drinks and being SUPA dope.
Happy to eat in it take out.  Delicious  fresh  affordable food. Great bar   So happy to have a neighborhood restaurant
Good flavors for Tex mex  but skimpy on meat in the dish- mainly fillers of the chips. Salsa had a burned flavor.

I found this place via the Austin Chronicle. Comfort food is a good description as it was certainly rich. I had Rene s awesome enchiladas and my buddy had Joel s happy plate. Both were great. One knock is that they only allow one salsa for free. I think that they should allow sampling of smaller size salsas so you can figure out which one you like best. Otherwise  great spot that I will be returning to.

When we first arrived we were greeted by a very nice hostess who informed us that the wait time for a party of 10 would be about 45 minutes.  We waited for an hour while other parties who arrived after us were being seated.  When we finally sat down our waiter seemed annoyed at the fact she had 10-11 different orders.  The food and drinks took a very long time to arrive and one order was never delivered yet charged for.  When we asked for our checks. The waiter brought back one large check and suggested we all split it evenly because she could not split the check. From my previous experiences restaurants who wait on large parties will ask if the checks will be split and if so among who so there is no confusion at the end.  When the checks arrived a second time two were repeated  one of our party guest asked for a to go box for her leftovers and was brought a piece of foil paper. Overall the waiter seem inpatient  and annoyed to with our party.    Overall  the food was okay. The service was horrible.  I would not recommend it for a party of 6 or more people.

I have been for breakfast and for lunch. Breakfast was just ok  nothing special. The waitress was not very helpful about gluten free and dairy free offerings.   Lunch was fabulous. The waiter was very knowledgeable about gluten and dairy free contents of the menu. He checked on us regularly for anything we might need. The Carne Adovado was sensational as were the frijoles  I d order them again in a heartbeat. The mojo veg weren t cooked properly  the carrots were hard and the cauliflower was overdone. I ll order something else instead of that next time. My date loved his enchiladas classicas.

I came here once and immediately left because the server was pretty short and rude. It almost made me not want to come back. I mean this place is packed and it s in a north Austin strip mall.  Now- I got in this time because I was a solo person at the bar.  LET ME TELL YOU- within the time I got my food - I assume he owner or chef came to check on me. He was definitely not a staff member. But the most AMAZING PART- I m sitting next to a blind man. In the time I ve been here they ve had a woman physically help him to his seat  a seasoned server explain basically the whole menu for him and wait while he was doing the decision process in his head  have a male staff member escort him to the bathroom  and have engaging very helpful and non condescending conversations with him.  This truly was great. Besides the hosts seemingly bad attitude I was so pleased.
Incredible food and really good margaritas  Get the house salsa  believe it is called salsa  X  . Looking forward to having brunch here again.

Delicious food  I m vegan and my friend was keto and we were able to find yummy options  It was also pretty inexpensive  Their salsa was delicious  100  recommend  Just don t get the michelada  only thing I didn t care for.

Food is good. The servers are really odd at this place though. Been here twice. The dude that waited on us Sunday was acting like we were doing something wrong by sitting and ordering not sure what his deal was.  Week before similarly quirky waiter seemed like he had something. Going on too. Maybe the kitchen isn t nice to the waitstafff or they need a better manager     Food sure is good
The mild avocado hot sauce is divine and the medium as well. Everything is super fresh and tasty. So glad to have a New Mexican spot. Yummy for my tummy and the service is spot on
Eldorado has great food and drinks.  El Scorpio salsa has the perfect spice level and taste.
The food was fairly good  but the restaurant is VERY loud. My friends at the same table couldn t hear me. Why go out

Try the La Bomba   Trust me. This is such a cute  delicious breakfast find. My partner and I really want to come back for lunch or dinner and try the salsa platter  because the one that came with her migas was smoky and divine. Great atmosphere  super friendly service. 5 stars

Found this place listed in Austin Monthly magazine on a Christmas trip home and immediately looked it up on Yelp. Solid restaurant choice away from the parking hassles of downtown and South Congress Avenue  Had the 3 enchilada plate and it was reasonably priced and delicious....nothing extraordinary but nice non-chain option with a menu for everyone.

I must confess that the whole week leading up to my trip to Eldorado Cafe  I had eaten tacos every day and the actually day of  I had Torchy s for lunch. It s not very often that I order a salad at a restaurant  but this visit was one of those exceptions. I got to try two different salsas. The medium one which was salsa x and the hot one which I can t remember the name. Salsa X was amazing   I can t quite put my finger on what s so good about it but I think I loved it because it s super garlicky  The fresh hot chips were pretty great with the salsa x too. Then I moved on to order the Taco Salad. Holy guacamole this is the best taco salad I ve ever had  The chicken  pickled onions  avocado  lettuce  and everything else they put in tasted so great all mixed in. I chose the sesame arbol dressing and it was the cherry on top  Mmmm the combinations of flavors was just to die for  I can t remember what the rest of my party ordered because I was way too into my salad and that s saying something.

We read about this restaurant in the newspaper and thought we d try it out....we were NOT disappointed    The food was fabulous BUT the customer service was even better...we had a blast reminiscing with the owner about old Austin places    We ve been in Austin since 1974 and have seen a lot of changes...restaurants come and go...hope this one is around a long time

We had a wonderful time at El Dorado this morning  Our waitress and the owner were welcoming  warm and friendly.  From the moment we walked in we had the feeling of old Austin.  The food was fresh and delicious. I had the Migas and my Wife had the Huevos Rancheros. Both were exceptional and a different take on traditional Tex-Mex.  Thank You to Joel and his Friendly crew.  This was our first time and we will definitely come back

Seriously this place is fantastic. The Carnitas Cubanas were excellent. Also the Joey plate. The enchilada sauce is made from scratch and absolutely delicious. Get the spicy salsa and queso. You can not go wrong eating here. Our new favorite place for after hockey practice

Consistently great  This has become our go to breakfast spot over the last year. Even when we switch it up from our usual- Freddie s plate  Matt s Everything Taco  Nomad plate- we have never left disappointed. I have attempted to re create the potato hash breakfast side at home  mine doesn t compare  because it is so unique and flavor filled. I am a harsh Mexican food critic so the fact that we have been pleased with every menu item we have tried at breakfast  lunch  or dinner is a huge win

I LOVE ELDORADO    It is one of my favorite restaurants in town. The food is delicious  the service is great  and the staff is super friendly. Their Salsa X and Verde get two thumbs up. I m a personal big fan of the Fuertes plates and the enchiladas. My boyfriend loves their breakfast  especially the Nomad plate. I honestly can t say anything other than good things. 5 STARS

The margaritas here are the best   Came here for some drinks with a friend and we ended up also having dinner. The food was great and the salsa was tasty and definitely different. We both had enchiladas and left stuffed.

O M G this is such good food Mmmmmm ....everything on menu is delightful  We have been many times and not disappointed in the lest...not even once  I highly recommend this place....it is worth every minute of the wait time to be seated   The Service is the best I have had in anywhere. I really liked how the staff work together to make things happen fast

Always delicious.  The owner often comes by our table to check on us whenever we eat here.  Good vibes.  Everything is made fresh and we enjoy the unique recipes.  The salsa is divine  salsa x is our fav.  The shiny ribs are awesome.  We ve always had a good experience.  It can get crowded
This place is amazing. Good people  great atmosphere  even better food. 10 10 would recommend.

This place. Everything is good.  From the staff to the chips to the fantastic main dishes to vegetable medley.  Seriously who does a bangin veggie medley   They do. It s crowded always because it s so good.  A testament to their talent. There are 7234 Mexican restaurants in Austin  totally made  up number but seems realistic  this one is where I take my out of town guests.    Keep doin it y all   You rule

There s so much great Mexican food to be had in Austin and this is some of the very best I ve had in over 20 years of living here. Our party of three had the Short Rib Salpicon  Enchiladas Suizas  chicken   and Guisos de la Casa  hongos - vegan . Sides varied and all were delicious. The salsa sampler is a must  the avocado salsa was a unanimous favorite . Cocktails were very good. It s a bustling little place with a cheerful atmosphere and extremely friendly staff. The best part were so many of both great vegetarian and vegan options. It s not easy to find unique and filling dishes for non-meat eaters and I really appreciate the accommodating menu. I honestly can t wait to go back.

This is our first time here and we will definitely come back. Great chips and salsas  Our waitress Amy was smart and informative. The shiny ribs weee amazing and the enchiladas were great  We were so glad to find this hidden gem

I am a Tex-mex loving pescatarian that recently found out I m also lactose intolerant. Well  the veganchilladas here are so good  I don t even miss the dairy  I also love the atmosphere and decor  super cute yet cozy. Friendly service and they always have been fairly quick with getting my food out
Pretty good spot  The salsa sampler was really fun  and I enjoyed my enchiladas. The staff was really friendly  and knowledgeable about the menu. Looking forward to trying more dishes

Great place  great food and great management. Met the owner who takes the time to talk to everyone  while we thoroughly enjoyed a salsa sampler and two  entrees. His attentive approach shows through in the service  and the food was distinct and delicious and priced very reasonably. We ll be back soon

As a proud Houstonian  I ve found it hard to find good Mexican food in Austin. I know this is a controversial topic to Austinites  but finding replacements for my favorite Houston Mexican spots in Austin has been tough. Not to mention  finding a fresh tortilla is almost impossible. All that being said  El Dorado is a godsend and I am so happy to have found this place. Make sure to try the salsa sampler and the Carnitas Cubanas.

Yummy food and margaritas  Not traditional Mexican or TexMex but delicious nonetheless. Sauces and dressings are fresh and homemade. We ll be back when we have a hankering for something outside the Mexican TexMex box.

My Uncle drove in from Dallas to take me to dinner.  A friend recommended this place and he was so impressed he bought me a gift card to take my friend to dinner there   Awesome food  awesome atmosphere and our waiter Hollis was awesome as well

Quickly earning a spot on my list of top Austin restaurants. The chilieverde salsa is a perfect mix of spice and flavor  though for those with a high spice tolerance might want more kick.   We ve been for breakfast and lunch  both are strongly recommended.
Awesome food and service. Family-owned Austin business. I m a vegetarian  and they have delicious options for me and my meat-eating friends. Wish I could give 6 stars

I m a local neighborhood patron and I ve been here several times  especially for breakfast. I absolutely love the food and service. The waitstaff was attentive  friendly and generally helpful. My only complaint is that the squash side dish on more recent occasions wasn t cooked enough  same with the three potato hash. When it s cooked right both are amazing   I love their take on the more interior Mexican dishes  I m more traditional Tex-Mex for enchiladas and prefer different sauces  more San Antonio style Chile con carne gravy like. But that s personal preference I guess. Their breakfast tacos and delicious salsas are my favorite in town.

Came in on a Sunday night and was seated immediately. The chips and salsa came immediately and the server was nice enough to let our table try a mild  medium and hot salsa for free. All 3 were good  I dont remember exactly what type was which . I went for Joel s Happy Plate  which I thought would be more substantial for 3 enchiladas. I ended up cleaning my plate and being slightly hungry still which was strange for a Tex-Mex place. The flavors of the dish were nice but not overly spicy. The black beans on the side were seasoned and garnished well  and the rice dish was nice too. The enchiladas themselves were solid but not spectacular  with the only remarkable thing being that the 1 beef enchilada was really well filled with beef for an enchilada. Overall a good tex-mex place and I would choose this over many other options in the area.

A new favorite neighborhood spot  They have a variety of salsas to choose from  delicious queso  cocktails  and desserts. Reasonably priced and delicious  right down the road. The staff is friendly and helpful  too.
Amazing food. Great margaritas. Terrific staff. Will definitely be back. Joel welcomed us and made certain we were satisfied with the food   drink and service.

We all loved this place   Very tasty food that is higher quality than most joints.  It s a bit more Mexican than Tex-mex and food is closer to Fonda San Miguel than Chuys.  Atmosphere is upscale strip center.  Nice drinks  apps  and food choices.  We will be back

Our first time here   we ordered the kid s chicken and rice taco meal   enchiladas suizas    carnitas  and some agua frescas. Chicken was very flavorful  enchiladas were okay  and carnitas were good.  The white rice and black beans that accompanied the meals were not tasty.  Rice was quite bland   it actually tasted like cardboard. The agua frescas were watered-down and definitely not worth  4 each. The portions were small for the inflated price.  We paid over  60 for lunch   We won t be coming back.
Good food don t think it s Tex mex  cooks are from Guanajuato. family Friendly environment

I ordered the Shepard s Pie and 2 -16oz salsas from the take-out menu. My picky kiddo LOVES their salsa. He puts it on everything and most importantly  eats what he puts it on  Pretty sure he would drink it  if I let him. It really is the best. When I got home I realized the salsas were smaller than ordered  8oz . This is not the worst thing ever  in the grand scheme of things  Covid-19  it s pretty minor. But  given that I needed more salsa  I called them. I explained what happened. They offered to set it straight. I went by the restaurant  parked my car  and called. It s crazy awesome how they have set up take-out orders amongst all the current chaos. Anyhow  a large bag was set on the chairs for me to pick up.
