Finally  after we were already full but wanted to try one more things  came the Roasted Cauliflower tacos - a wonderful way to end the meal  because this may have been the best thing I ve ever eaten  at least in the top 10  I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone and I will be coming back again and again.
Thank you The Skinny Confidential for this great recommendation. Creative Mexican Cuisine. Out of the Streets and into a beautiful fine atmosphere. Service  food  cocktails A

We had the most MAGICAL dining experience at Suerte the other night thanks to our fantastic server Colby  This guy knows his STUFF. I asked him to give us the menu spiel and he went above and beyond to describe not only the menu but also the values and integrity of the restaurant. I love that he highlighted the dishes that were often overlooked  we went with all of his recommendations and were not disappointed. Holy moly MASA- wow. We even had a ratatouille moment where the masa took my friend back to his abuela s kitchen  making masa and beans. The drinks were unexpectedly delicious- complimenting flavors and nice presentation. Dessert  we had the cascara  was my favorite part and we almost didn t order it  But seriously- to the managers and folks that run this place- this review is really how spectacular of a dining experience we had because our server Colby guided us through. Will be raving about this dinner and restaurant for the rest of time

I came to suerte around 9pm on a Saturday night -- it was still packed and for good reason  The servers are extremely knowledgable so be sure to ask them for recommendations.   This is not the place to come if you are craving traditional Mexican  but if you want to try something new it s a great spot. I started with the refried lentils and I am hooked  I got a quesadilla as my main and it was the fanciest  most unique and delicious quesadilla I have ever had. Others had the tacos  broccoli  and the fish and really enjoyed everything.   The cocktails were inventive and tasty and the house margarita was the perfect amount of sweet tart. There is a large list of spirits  and they can make pretty much and drink you request. You can also order a cocktail while waiting to be seated  The menu is a little pricey so be ready for a large bill  but this would be a great spot for a special occasion. Next time I come I would order multiple things are share amongst the table

Went for the half price mezcal Mondays and learned some valuable things about myself.  1 was that.... just because I like mezcal margs doesn t mean I m ready to sip straight Mezcal. I tried one that tasted like a new boot but like... in a good way  The happy hour only applies to straight mezcal pours-- not any kind of mixed drinks. I m not hard enough to sip this stuff straight but if I WAS this would be awesome.   Wtf this masa is good. Great for gluten free. Get the brisket tacos. Just do it. One of the best things I ve put in my mouth for a while. I m still thinking about the chips. Can t wait to go back

Delicious bright flavors thoughtfully executed food.  The pork in the pozole was moist  tender  and smoky.  Real winner  only I wish the bowl was 3x as big    Great attention to detail  cozy decor  and even a couple of non-alcoholic cocktails on the menu.

i love this place  i went on a nice saturday afternoon and was lucky enough to snag a seat on the patio. it gives you roof top vibes without being too elevated  but privacy from onlookers   i don t like strangers watching me eat  unless they are eating too.. haha    when i went  i wasn t super hungry  so i ordered tostadas.  pats self on back  excellent choice  i had the shrimp tostada which was well balanced   fresh and the pickled carrot tostada.. now  i know what you re thinking--  why the hell would anyone want a pickled carrot on a tostada     with peanuts i might add.   now  when i read this dish on the menu... i knew it could go either terribly bad or terribly good. it went further than my expectations as far as flavor  and that pickled carrot was very balanced. it was a surprisingly delicious dish  needless to say i ordered another one  not that hungry my ass    i also order the whisky cocktail that was perfect    omg.... i almost forgot... i also tried the caramel crossianty dessert. i wish i could have one of those every day with my tea. they are delicate   delicious.

Not the best food or the best ambiance but the combo of the two works well. Got the chips and salsa and renowned tacos and both lived up to the hype. Not sure what they do to the tortillas but whatever it is makes the experience.

I don t get it. We were excited to try this because of the reviews  but left disappointed-- their decor makes for a cold  albeit hip  atmosphere. Loved our server and my cocktail  the Don Dario  was delicious. We started with chips con lentils and yogurt  somehow our teeth survived eating this brutally hard chip  which had good flavor but meh  next we tried the carrot tostado  and had sense to ask for a softer tortilla- it was okay but overpriced. The huarache chicken was mediocre and felt like we paid too much for something we could get at a local taco shop and might be better there. The shining star was the grilled squash-- won t be back and not quite sure why Austinites are going crazy for this place-- the food was okay but not for the associated price tag.

Dined at Suerte last night  and really really wanted to be impressed  but just wasn t.   My chef husband and I don t mind paying a substantial amount for food...that warrants it. Unfortunately  we were really underwhelmed by Suerte mainly for the following reasons.   1. Food  as many have stated  the food is very expensive and small portions. We don t necessarily care about that at all  if the flavors are spot on. That wasn t our case with the 9 dishes we ordered. The best things were probably the peaches  amp  mangoes and the sweet corn appetizer. We also ordered the brisket tacos  and honestly have had better tacos at Tacodeli. The churros were atrocious. Gummy on the inside  the chocolate sauce unappetizing  and no cinnamon whatsoever. But the worst dish was probably the carnitas tamale. The  ber fatty pork belly was very out-of-place with the dish  and nothing gave the dish any texture because everything was very soft and mushy.   2. Service  our server  he never gave us his name  was cold and not personable. He never once asked us what we thought of the food  if we were enjoying our experience or anything. The dishes came out in the wrong order  though this is probably not his fault . He just really didn t seem to care if we liked our visit or were enjoying the food at all.   3. Ambiance  tables are so close together that at one point the neighboring table s servers butt was almost touching my water glass when she was talking to her table. The restaurant also gets SO LOUD you can t hear the person sitting directly in front of you.   Overall  we can t quite figure out why Suerte has blown everyone away  because it did not do that for us. Probably won t return.

Hands down the best meal that I ve had in a long time  period. If you love Barley and Swine and Odd Duck  this is a must. Personally I loved it more and found it a better value. I m not sure what the previous reviewers were complaining about - we sat at the bar and the bartenders were super attentive  knowledgeable  and friendly.  I look forward to coming back to Austin to eat here again.   Maybe I ll come back and describe the individual dishes when not comatose from gluttony.  Drinks were unique and phenomenal. Get the Rosalinda.

Good food. Interesting flavors. Had chorizo  lentil with chips and carne asada. Also had house margarita. To be concise  great food. But for level of quality taste in correlation with price. Too expensive.

I ve been here twice now and I m still blown away so I know that the hype is real. This place is that good.   I took my parents here on a Sunday night and didn t wait at all. Our waitress was so kind and aware of my food allergies and she was very diligent in making sure the kitchen could accommodate me. She even answered our random questions about where the light fixture came from and she seemed to know about every detail of the restaurant. It was very impressive.   And the food  I mean come on. It s unbelievable. We ordered tapas-style and shared everything. Every dish was better than the next. We got the chips con refried lentils  amp  yogurt  sweet corn esquites  squash tamal  quesadilla con tinga de jamaica  suadero tacos  mushroom frito  and carne asada between the four of us.   Every dish was a hit. Not a single one disappointed us. Not a morsel was left on any plate. But if you asked me what you have to get  I d say the chips con refried lentils  quesadilla  and suadero tacos. I wish I had those in my life every day.   Drinks are great too  I love the Paloma. I m not usually a sangria fan  but theirs tasted fresh and not too sugary sweet. They have a full bar so my parents went with martinis that they said were great.   If you go here prepare to spend a lot of money. You won t walk out disappointed that you splurged because it s such a great experience. Awesome date spot. I sat at the bar for dinner my first time and still enjoyed it so if you don t have to wait to sit at the bar  go for it

Literally waited 2 hours when they said no longer than 1 hour. No one apologized. We went to the bar to gets drinks and  appetizers  that were apparently shareable. I guess a 15 dollar appetizer is made for a 30 lb female because it was gross and a small portion size. Work on your hostess work and your portion size.

Suerte had excellent food  especially the Tamal El Mole Blanco  which was sweet  spicy  soft and crunchy all in one dish.  Really a marvel of different tastes.  But what sets Suerte apart was their customer service.  They noticed a branch that was interfering with our outdoor patio dining experience and came out and trimmed it for us.  So if you like food and foliage that is pretty but won t be in your face while eating food  eat here.

A fancy casual dining establishment that offers exciting visions of haute cuisine wondering the southwest desert.   The crab is fresh and full of flavor  while still having this light and refreshing feel. The almonds provided little nuggets of dense crunch. The celery aioli was just the right amount of creamy that never felt overwhelming. The spicy sharp freshness of the celery was a beautiful idea. The fermented Chile rojo was like a beast on a leash. It attacked the forefront every now and then  but minded itself once everything came together. The tostada was a lovely  coarse crunch that made it feel like a crab was shuffling on top of a rock on the beach shore.  The governator taquitos were not fried to a traditional crisp. Rather they were like mini fried tacos. The shrimp almost had a chicken like texture  and even taste with everything . By itself it did taste like a mild shrimp. The cheese was lovely in its stringy  salty gooiness. The tortilla did add some pepper taste  although it wasn t pronounced. The salsa on the side added some acidic zest.  The lamb barbacoa was not really what I expected  but it was still a delight to eat. I love the portion size for this  even if it s a bit pricy. By no means should you think you re getting a family size portion. The amount of meat they serve fits within the confines of a banana leaf. The meat was primarily lean  yet still moist. I would have liked to see more fatty pieces thrown in the mix  but that s my personal preference. The house made tortillas truly elevate this meal from great to amazing. They have the stone ground corn taste I would desire from homemade  yet still have a delicate  consistent texture that holds up. The pickled veggies are a nice touch  but make sure to ration them for every taco. They offer three sauces  with the tarragon salsa being the best flavor. Its definitely a strong flavor  but I think that s why it works. The sesame habanero sounds great on paper  but its too weak to excite the tongue. The spice level is like a watery tabasco. The mint yogurt is kinda in the middle  where its got more flavor than the sesame one  but not enough compared to the tarragon salsa. This one works best for adding moisture and a level of freshness  but that s it. The bacon bean puree is dangerously delicious. I could have eaten a barrel of those beans. Such a rich  meaty  smoky profile that really hits home the use of smoke in this meal.   The blondie was a savory  yet sweet marvel. The squash ice cream definitely had that root vegetable taste  but clean. The corn masa brownie was the true delight of this meal. It was a great mixture of what I would want from a blondie  but still what I would expect from masa. The cajete was not as integrated as I would have wished  but it was present  it created a lovely  complex depth to the very light  sweet profile.  I like the vision of this chef. They made it fancy enough to justify the prices and presentation  but left it super casual. Among the fog of tex-mex and breakfast taco  this places shines as a beacon of Latin inspired cuisine. This place isnt perfect  but its definitely worth a reservation.
Guaranteed a great Mexican meal in Austin  TX  Lots of plant based dishes to choose from. Loved the Romanesco dish - TLAYCOYO  Casual and comfy atmosphere. Def recommend

I loved every minute here  Food was delicious.  Waitress was friendly  charming and knowledgeable  We loved her   Appetizers  we had the shrimp lime thing  delicious and refreshing   And the potatoes - fantastic and had a nice kick.   But i think the potatoes were more of a side dish than an appetizer   For dinner  we had the corn  so delicious   and the brisket tacos. The brisket tacos that were out of this world - maybe one of the favorite thing I ve ever eaten   Highly recommend this place

Several people had recommend Suerte to me so for a date night  my husband a I finally tried it out    We had a great dinner at the bar with some great recommendations from our bartender. Our favorites were the crab tostada  El Blondie and the tacos we had from the Vit T menu. Drink were awesome as well  The only thing we were sort of disappointed about was the carne asada entree. It was okay but for the price point there just wasn t anything special about it. I wish there was something more to give it a little more depth. We will definitely be back

I really loved this place. My favorites were the concha de chocolate  shrimp tostada  and quesadilla de aguacate. Also a shout out to the lengua taco for the more adventurous eater  Super cute decor and chill vibe  I will definitely be coming back next time I m in Austin.

If I could give it a 4.5 I would just because the prices are a little high for me but 5 stars if you are looking for a nice fancy dinner. The inside is so instagrammable and cute   I have had the refried lentils which don t look like anything special but they were TASTY. The red chorizo molotes were also a good starter - the green sauce it comes with is banging.   I highly recommend the ceviche suerte - it is so fresh but the portion is small so you ll want one to yourself. The quesadilla was also SO good and so unique. The tortilla was crunchy and idk what was even in it but it tasted so good and creamy.  Goat barbacoa is also a must - it was a bit salty but with the pickled veggies and guac it was very good.   Also  you have to get the swizzle drink it was like spicy blueberry WOW. I ll be craving this again asap.
A must  The cocktails were incredible. Highly recommend the Aguachile appetizer and Cascara for dessert

It s loud  hipster  and the best place I ate in Austin    We came at happy hour  which was terrific  because we could try multiple small plates for  5 each. One thing was better than the next   The tacos  carne asada  carnitas  molotes...like none you ve had before  Delicious   Drinks are great  but the star is the unusual twist on each dish. I ve travelled throughout Mexico  and this restaurant pulls influence from several.  Writing this now that I m hoping  and my mouth is watering.  Yeah  it s a little pricey  and portions are small except for the  36 carne asada. As I said  happy hour is the way to go.

Read about this place in a magazine and it was eh  ok but not the best. Server was not about it - maybe cause we walked in late or whatever but she seriously ruined the vibe. Food was 5 10 but def want to come back in 13 months assuming it ll be better after covid.

Owner reached out and gave a sincere and much appreciated apology  even though one wasn t necessary. I applaud business owners that take the time to read customer feedback and wish more establishments realised that reviews can make or break their business.  Unfortunately some don t care or realise this until it s too late. Suerte knows what s up and strive to keep on top of their game   that s worth an extra star to me.

Three of us went to their Saturday brunch.  Loved the interior and the little patio.  Service was good.  We shared one of their pan dulce items it was good. The migas had way too much hollandaise sauce on them.  Seemed like mostly sauce. The shrimp tostada was refreshing according to my friend but it was rather small  especially for the price.  The winner was the pork  amp  huevo.  It was really good.

Food is authentic  delicious and handcrafted. Cocktails and various alcoholic options are impressive. The blue masa tortillas were awesome- made fresh and in-house  Wait staff is knowledgeable and passionate

worst wait list experience i ve had in a long time. spent over 2 hours waiting  just to be told they had the wrong phone number. very disappointed that an otherwise good place is ruined by poor service.

Holy moly - I am reviewing this from my toilet - I m dying.  This is possibly the worst diarrhea I ve ever had in my life.  The food was tasty but good god it s not worth it.  I m really in pain. On Sunday I fast so I know it s not from anything today and it s evident in my stool that it s from Suerte.  Please save yourself because this is sheer agony. Please be careful.

I wanted to like it  but suerte didn t live up to expectations.  For a Mexican restaurant  if didn t seem like any other place in Texas or Mexico that I ve been to.  They are trying too hard to be different  and the food suffers.  The beet tamale was study  but flavorless.  The brisket tocos  one of their specialties  was also modestly flavored.  No mmmmm moment.  The brisket was crunch from singed blackened beef  very unhealthy- nitrisome ns  and burnt was the predominant flavor.  On the plus side  the Rose Modesto from Mexico was quite nice.  Overhyped.  Over priced.

We visited Suerte for Brunch this Sunday  which has been recommended to me by several colleagues.  It was my lovely wife and 13 year old daughter who accompanied me.  We all have dined at La Condesa many times over the years and have enjoyed the growth and even explosion of New Mexican Cuisine interpretations such as ATX Cocina and Comedor.    Suerte did NOT disappoint.  One of the Yelp reviewers stated that she nearly cried during her culinary experience.  I must say - I came close to tears after I savored my first bite of the Duck Confit Flautas with Mole.  The Mole was ridiculous   Lick-the-plate deliciousness   The Corn Pudding Tamal was recommended by our server and it definitely delivered   Shrimp Tostada was an honorable mention.  We chowed down several other menu items but these three listed dishes  especially the first two  will resonate in my hedonic region of my brain and certainly bring my back.  Service was decent and parking was easy via complementary Valet.    The decor and layout of the restaurant was modern  airy- lots of large windows facing 6th street.    Cool hip joint - I ll be back.  Oh one thing  it s as expensive as any place  downtown  to prepare you for possible sticker shock.  Part of the expense was related to our DELICIOUS craft cocktails  Bebida Rosada  amp  Craft Sour  in addition to the  totally-hit-the-spot  Mexican Ros  .  TheMexican Ros   Cabernet Sauvignon grapes  was a perfect accompaniment to our Brunch

We came for brunch on a Saturday and the restaurant just feels hip and chic with its bright and open layout and lively atmosphere. We sat at a table by the window  which was nice and our server was quick to greet us. The waitress let us know that they were out of multiple things on the menu  including all of the dulces  the sweeter treats  and their duck Confit flautas dish  which we were most looking forward to so this was pretty disappointing.  For the food we did get  both the tostadas were good with the beet one being my favorite  it was refreshing and bright. The salad was very good too  it was one of the larger dishes we got  although when we ordered it the waitress called it out as being very small and that we would need two for the table - that wasn t the case but it was a yummy dish so we weren t mad to have two servings. These were a nice balance to the fried and dacedently creamy rest of the meal. The tacos we got added a nice variety  the vegetarian ones were flat with nice flavors and the snapper one was crunchy and fried. The huevos dish was a bit one note but still good nonetheless  the hollandaise sauce was done well and richly creamy. The red tomato sauce dish was creamy as well and very good. We ordered some mimosas which were your average mimosas but they had some brunch cocktails that looked really good that I want to come back to try   Overa  it was a little frustrating that they were out of so many menu items relatively early in the day  but the food was good and the atmosphere makes you happy to be there

We had just arrived in town and was told all about lucky hour at this high end restaurant. Following directions we gave it a shot  we tried every appetizer on menu as well as the tacos of the day  my sister ordered 2 drinks and I ordered 1. We also ordered the peach tres leches cake because we have sweet teeth. Our bill for 3 drinks 6 plates of food and dessert was  56. I highly recommend lucky hour. Such a great experience

Had brunch here with some friends.  I got the Migas.  They were good but not outstanding.  Service was pretty good. My coffee took forever to come which was disappointing since I need my caffeine lol.  We also shared 2 desserts and those were good as well.  I ve heard great things about this restaurant so I intend to come back for dinner at some point  hoping to have something really memorable

The food was pretty boring they have a couple tacos and only one vegetarian option. SO overpriced for what you get and the plates are lacking. We had to order and pay on our phone and they didn t tell us there was some secret 20  charge of 18  to  pay the kitchen staff during this time  um it s not my job to pay the kitchen staff  were here to pay for the food we ordered and ate so I think this place os Very shady.   Update  I see someone has responded but AGAIN I say  it s not my job to pay extra money to fund you and your staff and your restaurant when I come there. I come to pay for food I order  and tip if I have good service. If you plan on making your customers pay extra charges on top of the already very expensive lack luster food that you re saying is  laid back  idk what s laid back about 4 options of food and crazy prices but go ahead. but at least teach your employees to disclose that so you don t scam anyone else ok      I have never heard of such a charge in my life. I ve heard of a charge If you have a big party of people  but we had 4 people and 4 boring tacos and some waters lol. Didn t constitute an 18  charge

Another fantastic meal with friends here but this time did brunch   Palomas here are a bit diff but worth the try  Actually one of my faves in the city currently. The sweet breads are made in house and delish   The chilaquiles were on point   Looked like a small portion but perfect in all reality  Thanks again for a solid spot to go when looking to show off Austin

We came to Suerte for brunch because we had heard a lot of good things about their menu. Looking at their online menu  it looked great   The only disappointment we had was that we were sat and it took about 15 minutes for someone to attend to our table. Unfortunately  we were hangry and a bit more impatient than usual. However  after I called the hostess over to let her know that we had yet to meet the waiter  a very pleasant woman  manager  maybe  Not sure  came over and was very apologetic  knowing that it was our first time to the restaurant and hadn t been attended to. She did promise to make it up to us  and she did   The favors of all the dishes were absolutely on point  and while not adhering to conventional Mexican flavor pairings  it still felt very homey - like comfort food that my Mom would make. The cocktails were also very good.   We absolutely loved the shrimp tostada. The acidity of the marinade with the creaminess of the crema was very well balanced and I wanted MORE.   Overall  super solid place and I am curious to come back to experience the dinner menu.

This is my new favorite restaurant in Austin. Service  food  ambiance and the drinks are perfectly executed. Start with the ceviche and make your way to the Goat Barbacoa while sipping on a Don Dario.  Can t wait to go back and try the rest of the menu

I absolutely love this place  The atmosphere is great  the staff is super friendly  and the food is just out of this world good.   Their Luck Hour is where it s at if you re looking to save a few bucks  but you better get there ASAP if you want to take complete advantage of it.   It can be a bit cold on the inside so if you re prone to getting chilly easily you may want to bring a light sweater.  Their chips and salsa  while not traditionally served  is fantastic  Their house made mesa chips are amazingly flavourful and hold their crispness even if you take awhile to devour the dish.   The ceviche... it s great. You should get it if you re a fan of any ceviche. It s a lot less citrusy than most thanks to the cucumber which was surprising.   The award winning Suadero Tacos blew me away. I eat these every night in my dreams. I would request these on my death bed they re that good.  I think what surprised me the most was the Grilled Sweet Papas. Less sweet than you d expect thanks to the spice of the garlic chile black pepper oil and very filling.   Do yourself a favor and check out this east Austin gem

Aaron   I appreciate your response and am glad to be heard after we left your establishment. I do want to acknowledge your team s willingness to accommodate our party of ten despite not having a reservation and in conflict with your large party policy. Clearly you did not have to seat us at a table. However  as you know we were willing to go elsewhere but after conversation your team set a place for our group. If your team actually thought that members of our group should not have been served then I would have hoped that you would have politely asked us to leave. If this is the case then I would encourage TABC to audit your establishment for the public safety of our community.   Please be assured that based on my experience at Suerte and this back and forth on Yelp from Suerte s management I will never recommended this restaurant to anyone. In addition  I will contact TABC directly to ensure that the State plans a visit soon.   Original post  Great atmosphere but don t expect to be treated well. We walked in to celebrate a friend s birthday and the wait staff made us feel like second class citizens even though we had a  270 bill. All of our out of town guests felt uncomfortable  tense  and feel like we were not treated well. Oh did I say we came in at 5pm on a Saturday...
Amazing Food  Service  Atmosphere   And Special Thanks to Iron Cactus-for their Awful Service  that ALLOWED Us to FIND THIS AWESOME RESTAURANT

Quality masa made in house   quality tortillas. Suadero tacos  4  are a must although they are slightly too salty. Fantastic black bean tamal with beet cream topped with crispy quinoa. Goat Barbacoa was delicious with the fresh herbs  yoghurt sauce and dollop of bacon beans. Tuna snapper quesadilla also a must. House cocktails are decent. Absolute brilliant ambiance  would come for the setting alone.

So we finally came to suerte for what was described to us as  life changing tacos .  Wow they were amazing  I will dream about these tacos for the rest of my life. Suerte is very close to whislers and Lazarus if you are familiar with east Austin. Our bartender  Celia hopefully i spelt it right  was awesome and had great recommendations. We started with the nada Paloma - a Paloma made with mezcal and the Mexicano mezcal. If you haven t had much experience with mezcal it has a very Smokey flavor but is great in drinks and alone if you have the right one. Suerte has a huge list of them   We decided to start with the tacos of the day which were shrimp tacos with potatoes  onion  cilantro and avocado on a small corn tortilla. Easily the freshest and best taco I have ever had. We next decided to get the brisket tacos- they come with four. The tacos have an avocado cruda  onions and cilantro as well on corn tortillas. We had three tacos each and we were so full. We got tres leches as well and they even put a candle in it because my boyfriend mentioned it was my birthday. These tacos are seriously life changing so be prepared to be disappointed by every other taco place ever    We will def be back when we come back to Austin

Suerte certainly lives up to the hype  we have now been to dinner and brunch  Brunch today was delicious  my favorite was the beet tacos and agua Fresca lemonade. I really like the interior of this restaurant and the bathroom wall paper. To be honest  I don t remember everything we ordered when we had dinner. But everything was very good  Also  good to know- we did not have reservations today for Sunday brunch but were able to be seated right away as a table of 4. Will definitely be back

I love Cabo Bobs  I wish they would come up to Plano  but I used to go to Cabo Bob s in various locations around Austin 5 days a week for multiple years and my visits back to Austin are not the same without a burrito with a fresh pressed tortilla. I found this place probably close to a decade ago  Has time gone by that quickly  I have had countless events catered by Cabo personally and privately and it is always a hit  Even with all of those visits and probably a years salary minimum spent here  my enthusiasm has not wavered in the slightest and it s still one of my favorite places on earth. If I could have food from only one restaurant for the rest of my life  it would be Bobs.   This location has plenty of parking and has a tendency to get quite a line  but they move relatively quickly. In either case  it is worth it

This place is always packed  service is quick but the lines are too still too long. The tacos are available with different tortilla flavors and myriad toppings to choose from  make each one unique to taste. Chips and queso is just okay.

I m not a particularly big fan of the build-your-own concept in general. I m no expert  I want  you  to tell me the best combination of ingredients. But I wanted to try their tacos and build-your-own is the only vegetarian option.  It s fun that they offer five different varieties of in-house tortillas but the Smoky Cheddar that I chose had no structural integrity whatsoever. All three of my tacos fell apart immediately upon picking them up.  I hate zucchini on tacos so I skipped the grilled veggies blend and went straight for the Baja Beans  THANK YOU for having three bean options ... all of which are vegetarian -- black  pinto  or baja   saut ed poblanos and onions  cheese  and fresh cilantro. I upgraded for some extra guacamole and queso.  The flavors didn t meld well. Everything was okay but not great. Perhaps they have wonderful burritos but I wouldn t recommend going for tacos. There are far better places in Austin.    Ranked as  112 on my taco list of 144 locations AustinTacoMojo.com

I am SO happy right now. The only thing wrong with this place is it s not located in South Florida   REAL authentic tortilla chips. So many choices of Taco or Burritto shells the corn taco is so good it puts all other corn tacos to shame  Like the Smoky Cheddar shells too. The fried fish is amazing especially with poblano pepper onions  rice beans  cilantro and Pico de gallo. Also shredded pork so good.  The line is out the door during lunch but so worth it

As usual cabo bobs never disappoints. Super huge portions and bomb toppings. The star is always their tortillas. Its been years since I ve been back in Austin and like everything else  prices have gone up but the portions and quality has remained the same  Will be back the next time I m in Austin.
Don t bother coming into this location  you will wait forever while they prepare the to-go orders ahead of you. Order to-go or go to one of the better managed locations.

Cabo Bob s has been on my radar since undergrad  sooo  not to date myself but 10  years now  . They stand out to me because they re Chipotle-style - in terms of serving - BUT they press and make fresh flour tortillas in front of you to start your order    The tortilla doughs are made from scratch  amp  there are 4 different flavors   Buttermilk  Ancho Chili  Cilantro Tomatillo  Smoky Cheddar. If you get a full-size burrito - pro-tip  you can mix 2 different doughs    I went for the Bob s Special Deluxe Fish Tacos  Cilantro tomatillo  ancho chili  amp  buttermilk tortillas  crispy fish  Chipotle Crema  Mango Pico  guacamole  cheese  shredded cabbage  -- pretty damn good fish tacos. The fish was crispy and tasty. I didn t think I would like guac and cheese and crema but I was wrong  all the flavors paired really nicely together. I could taste the subtleties from the different doughs.   We stopped at this specific location on the way to the airport  but Cabo Bob s has locations all over ATX

I stopped by Cabo Bob s Burritos while visiting Austin because of recommendations from friends. The food did not meet my expectations. You start off picking a tortilla  they come in unique different flavors. Another thing I did like was that the tortilla was pressed right when you made a selection. Then  you choose your meats  toppings  and sauces. The meats were standard although there was some choices I have never seen at other burrito places  fish and brisket . The toppings were basic and they have many different options for sauces.   The burrito was extremely bland and stuffed with mostly rice so thats all you can taste. The meat quality was very poor. I could barely taste the ancho ranch that I asked for in my burrito. I got two burritos with the same fillings but they were very disproportionate for the same price. The queso was poor quality and it tasted equivalent to the nacho cheese you get from the gas station. The tortilla chips on the other hand were thick and crispy and probably the best part of the meal.  The line was very long and it wrapped around the restaurant to the door. I waited 30 minutes to order my burrito. The inside of the restaurant was not very clean. The tables were dirty along with the bathroom which was too gross for me to use. Even though there was a lot of people waiting in line  there was plenty of seating in the restaurant. The ambiance is very nice and relaxed.   Cabo Bob s lacks flavor even when you use their sauces. Overall  the quality of the ingredients are decent minus the meat.

We ordered the Deluxe Fish Tacos and the Best Steak Burrito  with smoky cheddar tortilla  off the specials menu. Both were very good  I loved the flavors of the fish tacos with the mango pico. I also added some of their 66 Red hot sauce which was spicy but delicious  Next time I think we would build our own because I would prefer corn tortillas and my husband wanted extra meat in his burrito. We will definitely be returning though
Delicious  yummy  and sooo satisfying. Better than Chipotle  My friend had this catered for her wedding and it was loved. The tortillas in particular are so good.

Went for lunch and it was very busy. Chose to do mobile ordering assuming orders would be taken in order  but they gave a return time instead. It would have been quicker to wait in line and order. The staff will not rush our order even if it is slow. Lesson learned. The food was good and the portions were big.

Honestly food was really bland. Saut ed onions were raw. Everything was ice cold think cold chipotle on steroids. No flavor. And the staff was super rude. I went to go pick up and recognized my order. I said awesome that s me right there she looked at me and said name I told her my name and she said yeah this isn t yours rudely. I kept trying to get her attention and she finally turned back while hiding the receipt and asked me for the last name as if I was trying to steal their unseasoned cold burritos. When I said the name she didn t even apologize or anything just rudely handed me the bag. Won t go back. And don t recommend it.

This summer like many of you I want to try out new-to me spots and support more Austin businesses in this stage of the pandemic.   In late June  I decided to try Cabo Bob s in South Austin for the first time  and it was a great dinner.   As a pescatarian  usually at burrito places  I have the vegetarian option because they lack a fish or shrimp option. Enter Cabo Bob s  which has a tasty fried fish option.   One of the coolest things is that they have fresh raw tortilla dough prepared  so when you order  they make your taco or burrito tortillas on the spot on a giant grill. The tortillas taste amazing too with multiple flavors.    My partner had the fish burrito  which was delicious on a cilantro tomatillo tortilla. I tried the fish tacos  which were also fresh and yummy with mango salsa.   My areas to improve would be the queso was cold  but the staff gave us a warm one upon request   and the flavors of the beans and veggies are all a bit bland. One thing that would be great for vegetarian and vegan options is for the saut ed veggies to be more flame grilled instead  this would amp up the veggie flavors too.   The outdoor patio was so great to enjoy eating out safely  and the sweet mint iced tea was literally the best tea I have had in years. I would come back here just to enjoy more tea  I saw a person carrying out a large gallon of it  and I was like  Yep  that makes sense    Cabo Bob s is a great  affordable option  and I have already been back again since my first visit. Lunch was even better than dinner. Add this spot to your list

When I discovered Cabo Bob s had fish tacos and fish burritos along with the other usual tortilla fillings and extras I made it a point to check it out. I really miss the Baja Fish Tacos and Burritos that I loved while living in San Diego and although there are several restaurants in the Austin area that offer fine fish tacos they just weren t doing  it  for me.   So it was with real anticipation I got in line and watched the counter folk assemble the orders ahead of me while listening to the customer s preferences. The different flavored flour tortillas are huge and they fill them up with your choice of protein along with varieties of beans  rice  cheese and assorted veggies and sauces to you get it just the way you want it. Nice.  I ordered my Fish Burrito with a few substitutions - brown rice instead of white  Baja beans instead of black  and a serious  walk thru the garden  that made for a bodacious bountiful and tasty crispy fish burrito. It s the closest thing to the ones I left back in SoCal and it was tasty and filling.   One caveat - the fish really needs more seasoning. I ve had several of these now and while the whole burrito is a thing of beauty  the fish itself is kinda bland. They also used far less crema in the mix than I preferred so I had to ask for more which they added with a smile but I was surprised at how little they routinely provide.  On one visit I had the Baja Fish Tacos instead. They were very tasty and also came very close to the ones I remembered and you get three tacos per order for the same price as the burrito. I found the burritos more filling but both were quite tasty. Their other fillings were more popular with the line of customers ahead of me and all looked and smelled delicious but the Fishy ones are the ones I crave the most. Vaya con Pescados
Amazing food every time  Get the fish when its fresh and you won t be disappointed.

First stop after flying in to AUS and it did not disappoint  Delicious fish tacos     Topping them with 66 Red Sauce was perfection for me.  Chips and queso were good too. Clean dining area  quick service  and portions were generous. We originally declined the punch card   just visiting   but we left with one  We ll be back.

Very poor service  Has the option to order online and or call the restaurant. When I went to order online a message pops up and says not taking orders at this time. Tried calling the restaurant to see if I could place the order  amp  the lady said yes. So I said I d call back when my order was complete. Went through the process of getting everyone s order  called back TWICE then no one answered the phone. Ridiculous

My husband is torn between Chipotle and Cabo Bob s - and that s a really good sign. It was a large burrito  with plenty of protein  we added extra   and delicious for a night out.   Tip  order ahead on their website - the lines can get long otherwise.
For those that haven t been  consider it similar to Chipotle but A HECK OF A LOT BETTER with fresh ingredients   One of my favorite places for a quick bite to eat
Really cool atmosphere with a nice outdoor seating area. Lots of options for endless possibilities from tacos  bowls  and burritos. Friendly staff and delicious food.

My favorite place in Austin for 5 years straight  Eric one of the managers is so wonderful and kind  big fan of his. Love all the people and homemade tortillas and fresh ingredients  you can t go wrong here
This location is always clean and fast. You get your food in a few minutes  Food always tastes freshly cooked and  great  better than chipotle in my opinion

Didn t know what to expect but I was satisfied. At first site of all the different toppings Is overwhelming but you can t go wrong here. The food is good. I like the different tortilla options you can choose from it just takes burritos to another level.

I frequent this spot  probably once a month.  Always great service.  My visit today may have been the best ever.  I usually get mine to go  as I did as well today.  The line wasn t long at all  and the employees were on point.  I probably was in there no longer than 3 minutes while ordering 3 burritos.  Speedy and quality service   This is how it should be done and can be an example to a lot of establishments.  I will continue to give them my business.

I mean what is there not to love about Cabo s  Except I wish they had different sizes for tortilla options like free birds does  Other than that 10 10 would recommend  P.s. try the pork very tender and juicy

We are on our first trip to Austin coming from one state park to the other. We got hungry and as last minute decided to come into this place. These fish tacos are certainly different than your standard beer battered fish tacos  however the flavor between the pico tortillas and fish with their salsa is mind blowing. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone out here visiting that really makes fish tacos. Variety of tortillas is also a great addition especially cilantro tomatillo.  Thank you Bob   -David-

Been here multiple times  It s an upgraded version of Chipotle. So many toppings to pick from. They have different tortilla flavors too and make the tortillas fresh depending on what flavor you choose. I usually get the burrito or the bowl with chicken. Portion sizes are huge. Paying extra for the queso as a topping is so worth it

If you re looking for a good burrito... look no further. At Cabo Bob s you can can choose between 4 different tortilla flavors for either tacos or a burrito. They make the tortilla fresh in front if you  very cool to see. I got the ancho chile tortilla  it was a nice addition of spice. My boyfriend got the buttermilk flour one  he enjoyed it. I got a steak burrito and the steak was nicely seasoned and you get a good amount. You can choose from brisket  steak  chicken  grilled veggies or crispy fish. They have a bunch of toppings. Everything looked very fresh. I got chips and queso. The chips are VERY fresh and crunchy   I m usually a die hard chipotle girl but after going here... things have changed

We typically order Cabo Bob s just for dinner for two adults  but wanted to try out their catering for a Kentucky Derby party and we were not disappointed. Our order consisted of beef  pork  and veggie tacos complete with every side--beans  corn  multiple salsas  veggies  and more. We even got corn and flour tortillas and endless nachos to keep our guests fed  with options  and happy.  The food just needed to be heated up upon picking up and setting it out  and Cabo Bob s provided all the containers and utensils. The food also tasted just as good later on in the night when we were going for another round.
Food wasn t what I expected. They seemed to rush me. I have bad anxiety  so I picked right away because of the long line. I wish I would ve pick something else besides burrito.
Amazing burritos  quality ingredients  and one of my favorite spots to frequent. Love Cabo bobs and all of their options

Decently priced. Not better than Fuego but still a good burrito taco stop. We did the create your own bowl and burrito. They give generous portions but the meat can be seasoned a little better. The tortillas are fresh and made when you order. Also  the staff is helpful and friendly. Overall  good experience.
Great    Loved it never been there before  Quesadilla with extra beef faijta sooo good   Recommend 100
Cabos has the most amazing burritos  tacos and queso in ATX hands down. Their brisket and fish tacos are TO DIE for and their chips and queso are a must add in every order

I ve been a fan of Cabo Bob s for quite some time. Recently there has been a new guy working the rice and protein section who is SO STINGY with the rice and meats. I asked for double meat and I got 1 4 of an extra serving but was charged at the register for double. This male employee hold up the entire line making the  normally quick process  quite long. And on top of alllll of that nonsense the cashier woman was extremely rude  I gave her my punch card and she let out an annoyed sigh... then I asked for a new one and she threw down the hole puncher after aggressively punching the card.   Y all need to get your act together or I will take myself to chipotle.

Ever since living in San Diego for 10 years prior to moving out to Austin  I ve been in search of California style burritos Mexican food and this place does not disappoint in the slightest  I ve been here 3 times so far and the level of customization on their burritos is sooo gooddd. Think chipotle but actually authentic and much more elevated  Last time I got the cilantro lime fresh pressed tortilla with grilled steak and all the fixings  Pro Tip  ask for a mixed tortilla  they have 4 flavors and you can even customize your tortilla profile e.g.  ancho chili with cilantro lime or smokey cheddar with buttermilk flour . They have an outdoor patio for eating during these COVID times which I really appreciate. I ve also had their crispy fish tacos in the past and they were incredible   You ve gotta try their queso  such cheesy goodness. 10 10 would recommend you check this place out
The Smokey cheddar tortilla is fabulous. The chicken has so much flavor but isn t spicy. Great find in the southern Austin area

Found a spot on yelp that had 800 plus reviews and 4.5 stars. That s hard to get without being awesome. It was awesome  We each ate a burrito bigger than Ruth Porter Gilmore s face. The line at 8 pm almost stretched out the door. I had an ancho Chile tortilla hand pressed and cooked in front of me. Ruth has cilantro tomatillo tortilla. I had Baja beans  squash  brisket  guacamole  cheese  onions  sour cream and lime juice. Ruth had steak  Baja beans  onions  cheese  lettuce  green salsa and colantro. There were happy faces all around. No wonder people gush. The bill was 20  with drinks. The only way this gets cooler is if they raise Anthony Bourdain from the dead and he joins us for dinner. It might be cooler if it were a taco truck  but alas the ingredients in my burrito alone would have broken the axle. I d go here if I were u before I died. I need to come back just so I can try a different tortilla or 2. BTW every 8th burrito is free with a punch card. It s good I don t live in Austin. This is living well.
Get the Fish Tacos and thank me later  The chipotle crema and mango pico add so much flavor to the tacos.

I live a Ketogenic Lifestyle  looked through the menu and made a bowl that sounded amazing.  I paid for double protein - no way I got a double portion. That s really my only complaint. The rest of what I ordered was good  it was well sauced and had decent flavor. I did curbside pickup - no fork or napkins in the bag was annoying. Not enough to eat for the price I paid.

Great tacos  Classics are great  just fish tacos are my go to   or make your own. Tortillas are fresh - you can even mix flavors for a burrito. Skip the salads - I had one and it was pretty meh - shredded iceberg as a base so pretty lack luster.  Also. Make sure if you order online you are selecting the correct store - it s so easy to mix up Anderson LANE with Anderson MILL. They re great and will fix it. But you ll have to wait...not that I ve done this before....

I like Cabo Bob s and have had it a few times  but I  recently ordered ahead of time online for a larger order. My husband went to pick it up  and no one had a clue about the order. I called them and the girls said she could have it ready on Monday  It was Wednesday. Then she said she could not refund until Monday. I did not want a refund  I just wanted the food. So I asked if I could just read my order off and she entered it-like why was that not an option to begin with. The original order must have magically surfaced because magically it was ready. My other issue was we ordered fish nachos  and guess what  There was no fish. So...not sure if this is the location we will go to again. It was a bit of a hot mess.

Chipotle on steroids- enough said.   Food  5 5 Ambiance  4 Bang for the buck  10 5  I had heard about this location from someone out of town and it is definitely worth the reviews and price. FYI if you get a burrito you will leave full for the next couple of days.

Food is good  pretty large portions  still have yet to finish a bowl or burrito in one sitting .   Tortillas are fresh  ingredients are all pretty fresh. Nothing to write home about  but would go back if in the area and the chick-fil-a line is too long. Prepare to wait for a pretty minute  line can get pretty long.

First time visiting the Ben white location and omg everything was great    Rick  store manager  was awesome  Making sure everything was running smoothly with his crew and customers  Ramiro  manager  was helping out in the line and working together with the staff while also keeping up with Managent duty  All staff looked great   Working hard and keeping great service at all times  Definitely going back and totally recommend if you are in the area

Ok.OK.. I ll give a three as their salsa was great.  The green one IS spicy and great.  Got their pork burrito..first time.  What is it with San Antonio and NOT cooking their rice.  It shouldn t be crunchy.Crunchy.. had to tear burrito apart to get to meat and items as it wasn t entitle. Handmade Tortilla cooked right there is pretty good.  Just wish I could actually eat what I ordered. It was mostly rice.. and that wasnt ettible.. beans were cooked well and flavorful.
Like Chipotle but better. Nice people too. Try the fish tacos  they re awesome. Nice find

Melissa and Alex are great good hearted managers of the 2 locations I m familiar with. If you have 30 bucks you can buy 5-6 kid burritos so don t be afraid of the price. Everyone in Austin knows bout this place and loves it. They are very very clean having good plastic glass screens to protect the food. They serve with gloves. There is 3 locations 500 Ben White by Walmart is a great location you can grab gas and groceries there before so they flavor there tortillas Smokey cheddar  orange  butter milk  white    ancho  red  cilantro green. They have a ocean surfer theme it s so cool .

To keep my review concise  so you get all the info you need quickly  I have created standard headers with info I hope you find helpful in making a quick and knowledgable decision about your dining choice   -Cuisine Type  Casual Mexican  -Food Review  You order at counter and follow the assembly line process as they build your order.  I tried the fish tacos and I was NOT HAPPY   They were small and very disappointing.  The fish must have been fried much earlier because any crunch and contrast in texture was non-existent.  Def not worth the calories as I was considering this a splurge in my otherwise clean eating.  My daughter ordered a burrito.  Dont remember it much except it as on the smoked cheddar tortilla.  We were both excited to try this but honestly  I dont know what the positive comments are on this because any smoke cheddar flavor was very mild and not worth even mentioning. I have a strong sense of taste and it was negligible so that being said  I would not factor that into any reason to go.  Overall  I didnt enjoy although my hopes were high because the place looked fun and like it might have been a great alternative to Chipolte.  Actually  I prefer Chipolte overwhelmingly to this and I really wish I could say differently.    -Service  Efficiently moved through line.  -Ambience  Sat outside and was super casual and fine.  -Parking  Plenty in strip shopping center  -Price and Value   Not great for what I ordered.  If tasted good I guess it would be a great value.  -Overall Comments   I see no reason to go back.

We ve had Cabo Bob s on our radar since they were  a single location  now there are 3 and deservedly so.  They are similar to Chipotle s but so much better.  Wifey loved her chicken bowl with lots of veggies and I snarfed a beef and queso burrito that also had loads of tasty goodies  didn t think I could finish it all but things that taste this good have a habit of disappearing.  This will not be our last visit....and soon

Overdue review here   So I loved taking out of town family friends to eat here because their food is delicious and they have their own flavor if you re comparing them to other popular burrito places. What makes Cabo Bob s stand out is their freshly pressed tortillas and options of tortilla flavors  Buttermilk flour  Ancho Chile  red   Cilantro Tomatillo  Green   and Smokey Cheddar  Orange .  They have Chicken  Fish  you ve gotta try it  veggie  no meat   pork  brisket  and steak burritos.  I also recommend their nachos. Yum. Load them with all the goods. Or try their chips and queso. The freshly made chips are great.   Now onto Covid precautions. We were glad they offered online ordering  and curbside pickup. You just pull up to the curbside sign  by the door on the side with the outdoor seating  and they bring your order to you. It s perfect  and staff were wearing masks. We ve been a couple of times and I continue to recommend it.  Our brother in law loved it  and to our surprise they opened a Cabo Bob s in San Antonio by his work. So he got to continue enjoying it after first trying this Cabo Bob s location.

This is like a chipotle but so much better. The line is long but worth it.   I ordered the  1 fish tacos and had it on 3 different tortillas. Surprisedly  the server accidentally put guacamole in it but I didn t mind  It was actually really good with it. Ordering is pretty simple and they are quick to finish orders.   The fish tacos is the most popular and  glad I was able to try it  There is a hot sauce stand but it actually wasn t that good. Had a lingering smell of vinegar.   The experience was good and it was good portions  I could only finish 2 out of the 3 tacos.

These are  were   the best burritos in town but their quality control has been getting worse with each visit. This is my 3rd or 4th straight curbside order that has been wrong. They forgot all vegetables and sauces in my burrito and excluded everything I asked for on the side as well.  The receipt taped to my bag clearly shows what I asked for on the side.  To top it all off  their online ordering portal is one of the worst I ve seen. This is the last time I order curbside at Cabo Bob s.

Cabo Bob s serves up consistently fresh fish tacos  amp  burritos at reasonable prices. I usually go with the Deluxe Fish Tacos  and my husband opts to build a burrito. It s fun to try the different tortilla flavors  and the food really hits the spot. Highly recommend ordering ahead online to avoid waiting in line.
If you are looking for a quick easy dinner this is your spot. You will never want to visit chipotle again  They offer sooo many options and the possibilities are endless.
The tortillas make the whole burrito. It s SO good and much better than the other chains with the same concept. I wish I had more time to eat it again before I leave town

One of my favorite spots in town. I love Cabo bobs. They make amazing make your own burritos and make the tortillas from scratch right in front of you  I always order the cilantro tomatillo burrito and go with the fried fish. Queso is extra but it goes really well with the fried fish . It s a lot of food for the price and if they have a punch card that if you buy 6 meals you can get a free one the next time you order food
Probably the best fish burrito I have had in Austin. It definitely tasted like it is from scratch.  First time trying their location and it will not be the last.

How  Why  Who  What   Is what I found myself asking just a few bites into my massive ly disappointing  burrito. How and why is this rated so high  Who eats this  And what is good about this place  Not sure what s worse the steak or chicken  Chicken was a pretty poor attempt of BBQ  wasn t expecting anything near Valentina s but this still fell way short of my low expectations  and the steak had zero flavor  a consistent theme . White rice flavorless  black beans eh  guacamole don t bother  and the salsa probably worse then all the above. Go enjoy a taco elsewhere. If you re thinking and craving a burrito please read this review and find another place.

Chipotle on steroids   The menu is bigger...  fish tacos  different flavor tortillas  multiple been options  etc  much more options... and in my opinion for what I had every bit as good if not better   I had a bowl... steak  with brown rice  black beans  sour cream  queso  and mango salsa. Man it was loaded and good   The mango salsa was a perfect compliment to the steak    One thing for sure the queso is 200x better then Chipotle    The design is the same assembly line like food prep. However the eating area is more upscale... more styled.  The chips are made right there and fresh. The staff are fast and helpful. Overall the experience was great.  Be sure to try the hot hot sauce... it is excellent  Not just flaming hot... but flaming hot with flavor... truly delicious.

I have been coming here for 3 years now and I think it s time I speak up about my experience as it is long overdue. The food is delicious  The food alone is 5 stars  My family and I come 1-2 times a week because we love it so much. However  their employees and different managers they ve had are always extremely rude. My mom  sister  and I are all petite 5 0 -5 2  women  so the regular sized burrito is enormous for us  especially myself since I have the gastric sleeve surgery. We always order the mini burrito and respect the 3 topping rule as well as order an adult sized drink even though it comes with a drink already. Every time we come  the employees repeatedly tell us  only 3 toppings  over and over again. The last time I was here  the manager was counting down each topping  saying  2-1 more sides  and went as far as telling me  I m just making sure   when I told her I knew how to count and was aware of how many I had left. Today I was told sauces are also considered a  topping  and given attitude as well as an eye roll when I told her we ve always been able to add sauces after our 3 toppings. After being practically shamed for ordering the mini burrito the first couple of times  we called and asked to speak to the manager in hopes of getting some clarity. This was in about 2020 and the manager said there is no age requirement or rules in place about adults not being able to order the mini burrito. With the amount of dirty looks and attitude we get from employees every time we order these  we ve started to wonder if maybe they pay for the ingredients or are on a commission based salary because it truly seems like it s personally affecting them every time. I understand it s extremely busy and some employees may be tired  but their attitudes are horrible every single time. It is extremely unpleasant to be treated like a criminal for ordering a smaller burrito due to my portion preferences. To be very honest  this could be seen as a form of discrimination. I hope this reaches the staff as I would love to continue coming even more than 1-2 times a week and not be upset disappointed after every time.

This is my new favorite spot if Austin  Was driving through Austin on a Saturday night and did a search for the best fish tacos in Austin and this place was on the list. These fish tacos did not disappoint  They were huge and full of flavor at a really good price  The staff was super friendly and let me try a few of the many tortilla flavors they have.  Now they just need to open up a restaurant in Houston

Bottom line  run  do not walk to come here. Frickin  amazing   One of the best burritos I ve ever had in my life -- and I live in Los Angeles. Renowned food critic  Jonathon gold must MUST  Visit this place. Arguably better than La azteca tortilla in east La.   Very flavorful  their homemade smoked cheddar tortillas are omg scrumptious  and wholly original and deserve to be shared to more than the confounds of Los Angeles.  Get the smoked cheddar burritos you won t regret it.  Steak and queso burrito with everything please. Big fat and juicy burrito. If calories kinda weren t a thing  I d choose this anytime.

This place is subway meets chipotle  Their house made salsas are always delicious  the four options of tortillas are spun and cooked right in front of you   You could never go wrong with any of your options. Yummy
Get the fish tacos  So good - you can never go wrong here. There are so many options and the staff is willing to mix it up and give their recommendations  as well.

Ordered with Door Dash. Burrito tortilla was burnt. I didn t receive my queso  salsa  or sour cream that I ordered. Very disappointed....  Replying to owner manager comment   you do have Door Dash. I literally just ordered from you.  I have included a photo screenshot of your restaurant on the Door Dash App. I ordered your Brisket and Queso Burrito. Explain that please...

Great experience   This place reminded me a lot of chipotle and freebirds but with a more lively atmosphere . I ordered a super steak burrito and it was huge   way to big to finish Alone.  the prices are similar to other food places with similar walk down and pick your toppings style .  If you want to try a slightly cooler chipotle this is your place

Was recommended shortly after w moved to Austin and we have been back a few times already  Whoever wrote chipotle on steroids didn t miss.   My husband got the burrito and the portion was huge. And everything about it was delicious - the steak was juicy and flavorful and he was able to mix his burrito flavors which is awesome  I got the crispy fish tacos  2  and chicken taco  1 . I could barely finish my meal because they give you so much. Not complaining because every bite was just as good as the one before.   Needless to say it is one of our new favorite Austin spots. Huge fans

The meal was excellent  or would have been if it wasn t cold  disappointed that the order service was so bad.  It would have been much faster  at least for me  to have placed an order over the phone rather than enter all sorts of required information on their website that made no difference and can only be used for marketing purposes.  I received an email saying  Estimated pickup time is 6 - 8 minutes   and I arrived about 10 minutes later. Apparently  it is not possible to call them  and talk to a real person   the store only accept texts. Sent multiple texts saying that I was in the designated parking place outside. Finally went inside  which I did not want to being high risk  and saw my order sitting on a rack  but I was told by an employee that I was not able to grab it  before the order taker could mark it off. That made sense  but having to wait another 10 minutes for the cashier to tell me that I could take it was unacceptable  she could have just written the name or order number on a piece of paper and marked it off on her register when convenient.  Ended up taking OVER 30 minutes from when I received the email which would not be a big deal  except it had gotten cold and I had based my next appointment based on the time the website promised the food and more importantly  the email that Cabo Bob sent  to me  confirming it.

This place is an Austin staple. Fresher than the competition  more options  and locally owned. It s a mix of Cali-Mex  Tex-Mex  and then something else that s all it s own. The  2 and  6 are my go-to s
Fantastic place to get HUGE burritos. Great taste and lots of options. Similar to Chipotle but better. If you like a good burrito and are very hungry you gotta check this place out.
I really enjoyed the fresh toppings and the chips and salsa with the x hot was very yummy.

Not sure why there s so many good reviews for the fish tacos but I ordered them tonight and they were so bland. Tasted like nothing. Maybe I got a fluke but I definitely wouldn t come back for them. My husband really enjoyed his queso brisket burrito though.

Came here on a weekend random Austin trip. Portions are huge  prices are reasonable  food is bland. So I guess you technically get what you pay for. I don t salt any of my food and all I could think about when eating this is that it needed salt. Still happy to be able to get in and out on a Saturday night on a holiday weekend without much trouble

I was a little intimidated because I had never been here  it was super busy during the lunch hour  and there were SO many options. I opted for one of the specialties listed on the wall  brisket and queso  so as not to hold up the line trying to make all my choices.   I loved that they had a few different  flavors  of tortillas to choose from  and that the tortillas were  grilled  to order. I also loved the house sodas   My burrito was fantastic. Wish they had one of these where I live

Oh man they said this was chipotle-like... no way  They have a variety of tortillas and the steak burrito I got had the meat cooked different than Chipotle   I like chipotle. This one was Like-it in that it s a fast food chain with a line out the door  but the food quality was great

Easily my fave burrito spot ever. The homemade tortillas are unmatched. I always get the Baja fish on half tomatillo buttermilk. The staff are always really friendly. love this place and I hope they never change.

I grew up in the Service industry as a kid and I value customer service more than I would say the most. This is my first time trying Cabo Bob s burritos and let me just tell you something  I called and got a to go order and was promptly greeted by Urban  he was very knowledgeable about their food and products line  Now I give him extra points because it happened to be six minutes before they closed  urban didn t even flinch whenever I asked him if it was too late to order something to go he happily said   that he would be more than happy to accomadate out needs  upper management is lucky to have him as an employee and from personally speaking he is awesome.  And deserves a raise  -  thank you Urban and staff

Honestly  was pretty excited to try this place out. Got the deluxe fish tacos and wow they were terrible. My expectations for this place were way to high. I did like the different drink selections but the food is very bland in taste  even with mango pico and guacamole. Even the rice was mushy and had no cilantro as stated  cilantro lime rice.  Fish was very light  tasted mostly the batter.

There was about 10 people in front of me  person up front was getting orders made and the employees for some reason were doing orders wrong. I ordered a 6  first bite in and there was no queso in the burrito. Killed 15 minutes of my lunch overall trying to order and paying.

I stopped by Cabo Bob s with my roommate and her mom after we went couch shopping next door. My roommate kept on describing how great the food was and we couldn t resist getting some food. We all decided to order fish tacos after seeing the reviews on Yelp. I love the Just Fish Tacos and the mango pico really adds an extra juiciness. The others also really enjoyed their Baja fish tacos. Considering the fact that we only finished two of the three tacos  this places is a delicious bang for your buck. I ll definitely be back in the future to try some of their other items.
Great hangout. Giant burritos . Just wish the servings of meat were larger. Eclectic ambiance.

Great place for Burritos  either pick from their menu or simply decide your own filings.  Wash it down with a Mexican Coke.  Great friendly service  I even saw one server signing to a death customer to ensure his burrito was just as perfect.  Really awesome experience.

Wow  It s a better version of chipotle where they give you flavored tortilla options that are made fresh as ordered  Super flavorful  lots of different options for toppings  exactly on par with Chipotle in terms of price  but I really loved the chile tortilla  Also I brought my dog inside while standing in line and this seemed ok. I then sat outside enjoying the shaded patio  so dog friendly I guess.

It s not good. What are you people going on about  Their guac is literally smashed avocado with NOTHING ELSE TO IT. Not even salt or garlic or cilantro or ANYTHING AT ALL. At least in a true Cali burrito you re getting real guac or the option for avocado slices  and thus know you re bringing a creamy flavor in that gives zero zing punch .  I got a cripsy fish burrito with  everything  and it was the most bland burrito I ve had in forever. It was also rolled improperly so the ingredients were doled out in segments instead of all together. The salsa was all at the bottom  which may explain why it was so bland.  Basically  Cabo Bob s read to me like someone taking the Chipotle model and giving it some interesting twists and choices. Perhaps if I had chosen a different burrito or service person to roll it  there d be another star. But no  guys. Not deserving of 4-5 stars.   Also  they weren t enforcing social distancing well enough. I had one person pressuring the people behind me to approach to order even though I had no way to move ahead because the line was stopped. One customer had his mask around his neck  another pulled hers far from her mouth to shout her order. I felt super unsafe and got a really  meh  burrito out of the risks. Oh yeah  and I ordered chips and guac and they were the worst I ve had in recollection. Sorry  Cabo Bob s  a bad review is rare from me and I won t be back.

Cabo bobs has the same concept as freebirds and chipotle they just have their own spin on it. I like it a lot. We got the veggie bowl and they don t charge for guacamole like the other places which was a plus cause I was going to get it no matter what. Get there early cause it fills up quick.

Love this place. Amazing selection of ingredients to put in tacos  a burrito  a salad  nachos  or a salad.  They even have fish and mango salsa AND they cook the tortillas right in front of you with lots of choices to choose from   Their salsa is pretty dang good too and I absolutely love their chips and queso   They have a reward card and their customer service rocks    Wish there was one of these closer to North Austin - and thats my only complaint lol  If you have not been here - you have got to check this place out.... if there is a line  and lunch rush gets super busy - no worries  it goes super fast

Cabo Bob s Burritos is one cool joint. They have the science of making mass amounts of burritos down to a tee. Step here. Slide over. Pay. Then eat an awesome burrito. Grade  A   The wife and I where in the mood for some food  but no one could decide where to go. We are new to Austin and there are many places to try. Somehow we decided on Cabo Bob s Burritos.  I am glad we did. It was delicious. Made to order tortilla in 30 seconds. Now this is fresh. Lots of options to fill this baby up. Chicken  steak  brisket  fish  pork and veggie. All look good  but the brisket was a home run. Beautiful flavor. Yes Beautiful. It was moist. It was smokey. It was very tasty.  All the typical fillers  rice  beans  vegies  etc. Make sure you try some of the spicer sauces. It was another beautiful thing. Hot and hot and real hot. Delicious for real hot spice lovers.  Everything was fresh and cooked in small batches to maximize freshness. Let s face it  712 reviews  4.5 stars. Something good is happening. The people have spoken.  Cabo Bob s Burritos  is an excellent choice for an inexpensive meal. Fun ambiance. Plenty of seating. CC friendly. Fast service with a smile. Plenty of parking. No beer. Ouch  but lot s of non-alcoholic beverage options.  I ll be back.....

This place is always packed   I love that you can pick out what tortilla you want and they press it right there and cook it in front of you. What I don t love is that sometimes they stick and can get a little disfigured  but that makes your tortilla have character right    I ve always had take out and the line can go pretty quick. My favorites are the crispy fish tacos and the steak burrito. The steak burrito has a choice of beans and also a choice of rice. Love options and I m glad this place opened and it s way better than chipotle. I mean  who wants to get food poisoning  Not me    Next time you re in there try the mint sweet tea. It s extra refreshing
Best burritos in Austin   Fresh food  fast service  amp  staff is always polite. My top 5 places to eat in AUSTIN

Quite disappointing being they have a 4 1 2 star rating making me skipped out on my Asian to try something new. The line was to the door which is fine but it took near 30 minutes to get to order because staff was extremely slow and disorganized. I highly suggest y all to check in with Freebirds staff management    Okay so 19 bucks for our  8 chicken burrito and  3  3 fish tacos. Burrito was dry and the salsa took the taste buds off my tounge. The fish tacos where  okay  even though it looked like something my kids eat from the freezer isle. I m SO disappointed and hope it was just a bad day but if you re like me and seek something new regularly you might want to think twice on this one.  I m adding a star for the immediate response from management.  For being attentive

Cabo Bob s for the win  Seriously  how many ways can you do a burrito theme   Lots of tortilla options  cooked fresh before your eyes  After coming here for several years  I just found out that they will even mix your tortilla flavors  No kidding  the dude in front of me asked for an Ancho Chili  amp  Cilantro tortilla  and the tortilla maker guy just grabs both doughs  tears them and mixes them  What  Whole new world if you re a tortilla fan.   Anyway  lots of other options as well. I m a salad guy myself on account of the fact that I look a bit like Tommy Boy if I eat too many tortillas  but the salad with the right fixin s and salsas  and it s a winner every time.   I also snag some chips  amp  queso  and go to town on that. The chips have a great freshly cooked crunch  and the queso works perfect with it. Not like that nasty queso they have at another burrito joint.  So yeah  hit up Cabo Bob s. Be prepared for all the options  and enjoy

Wohoo   Love this Mexican place. They make burrito in front of you.Also  they have much to offer in their menu. It s a lit  chipotle. What I love    1. Price point is amazing  2.staff service on mark. 3. Taste top notch  Burrito are made from scratch in front of you.Salsa and other condiments are made from scratch too. Nice location you can go Walmart shopping  from here     It s   distance

Great atmosphere and food  I loved the vegan burrito  got it in a bowl  and my family enjoyed their meals as well  chicken tacos  steak burrito  and a few build your own options . The burritos are large and super fresh. The staff was also great  really friendly.

There s a reason there s usually a pretty long line here. There are a lot of burrito joints in Austin  but Cabo Bob s is one of the best.  The main difference in a burrito is the ingredients  of course . They have 4 different types of tortilla wraps and when you order  they smash it down and grill right before they start putting in the ingredients. Doesn t get any fresher than that. I love the smokey cheddar tortilla.  I usually get the shredded pork or chicken  but they have steak  brisket and very nice looking fried fish  I just don t like fried fish getting soggy in a burrito . They have three different types of beans and two types of rice as well as the usual other fillings.  Their burritos are huge and I never am able to eat a whole one which is a shame because they don t taste quite as good warmed up later.
Their curbside is super on point and PERSONABLE      Cabo bobs has a vibe and QUALITY that s chipotle could neva

One of my go to Mexican spots near UT. Love the soft tortillas. I m a fan of the rice bowl here along with their fresh guac. I m not a fan of Cabo Bob s Queso as it is a little runny but great nachos and rice bowl options available here.
Best fish tacos I ve had in a long time  Good fresh ingredients.  Curbside pickup available and though the line was long on a Saturday night  the staff worked hard to service quickly.

My favorite local burritos  11 10 every time. A must eat for me when visiting the city. My favorite thing is the cilantro tortillas and the reusable drink cup hehe You can enjoy a delicious casual meal for a budget friendly price. YOU ROCK CABO BOB s

The manager needs to tell his cook to cover is nose. The cook was  dick nosing  over his mask. All the front line servers and cashiers were wearing their masks correctly. Love their food  but their cook today at 1 00 pm needs to follow proper safety protocols.

Cabo bob s is not bad and cheap. It was super crowded when we came on a Saturday near 2pm. Line was long  no tables available  and when they did have some  they were dirty and had trash left behind. The tacos here are cheap and good but I wish they double wrapped their tacos. Their tortillas are made in house and super delicious so why not add two  Plus they re so thin they break.
