The very first time I visited Austin  I got off the plane starving but looking for something local.  My search brought me to Cabo Bob s.  I have visited every time that I ve gone to Austin since then.  Here is what keeps me coming back   1   It is very easy and quick to get to from my hotel. 2   The food is AMAZING.  The past two times I was here I got pork tacos and this time I went for a pork bowl - always so good. 3   You can spice it up as much as you d like.  I love spicy stuff so I always cover my food in the squirt bottles of their own special hot sauce that they have.  They also have a great green salsa and fresh jalapenos. 4   There are a ton of options.  There are several different types of meats  tortillas  veggies  and even beans to choose from.  You could come here every day and not get bored with what you ordered. 5   For the amount of food you get  really well priced.  As you can tell  I am a huge fan.  I m excited to come back to Austin in October and December to try something else on their menu
Good fresh and fast. Parking can be a little crazy because this plaza is always busy. This place reminds me of chipotle style restaurant. Super good will be coming back.

Listen. This is it. This is the realest deal for me. I will be here for lunch literally every day. The deluxe  2 fish tacos completely live up to the hype and it is amazing. It s a fair amount to eat for one individual for lunch so think about take out containers. But that incredibly crispy  battered fish  those amazing tortillas  please don t ask me to pick a favorite     the mango pico de gallo UFFF perfect perfect all year round lunch. The build your own burrito is a spiritual experience to say the least. Their portions are perfect - they don t encourage wasting but they really want you to be nourished  Try their bowls if you re trying to be healthy they are way more flavorful  fresh and flyyyy than chipotle bowls that s for sure.

My opinion of Cabo Bob s has changed so I needed to update my review.    The food is still great quality  but the Dublin Dr Pepper is gone.      What has really changed my opinion is the business practices.  First  I learned that this is their only location  which is shocking because the decor and efficiency scream chain but they are just smooth as silk.  Secondly  they use many local ingredients and all of the sauce  salsas  and tortillas are all made in house.    I have now had the burritos  tacos  and salads and you cannot go wrong with any of these.  They don t use standard iceberg lettuce  instead using a green spring mix  also the fish is always fresh and delicious.  They seemed to have changed to a better cut of beef recently too but I cannot confirm that.  I am also a fan of the chicken as it is always tender pieces of all white chicken.    One of the things I had always been curious about was why there is a constant stream of firefighters  cops and EMS here.  Well it turns out they give a 50  discount to them and that is awesome in my book.  Combine that with the fact they take Hilltopper bucks and you can see how Cabo Bob s pays it forward.  Keep up the good work Cabo Bob s.

First of all do not go here unless you are super hungry. The burritos are HUGE. Loved that there was options for tortillas and loved it even more that it was freshly made in front of us.   Sadly they had run out of guacamole. And a Mexican restaurant without guacamole might as well be not open.   We ordered 2 of the vegetarian burritos and they were good. The cilantro lime rice was very nice.

I stopped in after a long day driving while passing through TX and went with three tacos.  The counter service was both friendly and helpful as well as quick.  The pork and brisket were both juicy  tender and delicious.  I went with minimal toppings of onion and cilantro with the tomatillo sauce on corn tortillas.  The toppings were refreshingly fresh.  I was surprised at the overall quality as it looks like a chain restaurant and I was too hungry and tired to try another option. I would certainly go back again.

We were passing to go to San Antonio  Yelp   where can we get fish tacos  this place popped up. Order some bija tacos and some burritos for the kids. If the kid can t wait to try the food then says  OMG      This is the best burrito I have ate   Then this place is good. Definitely coming back when I m Austin.

Cabo bobs always comes THRU  Today I had an online order to pickup around 11. When I get there it hadn t been made yet  and they felt really bad. I didn t really care since I was 10 min early than the time on my pickup and they had a large catering order they were working on. The manager  I believe  handed me a cup and said  have a drink on me   That really made my day  So I get my drink and wait for my order. It comes out quickly  just 5 minutes later  and they gave me free chips and queso on top of my free drink for the  wait   It was my lucky day  Moments like these keep me coming back to cabo bobs every week     This place is BY FAR much better than chipotle or free birds. Especially since the ingredients are so fresh and the fish is so good    And their XXX sauce is awesome

Everything here is good. Just go. Skip Freebirds  skip Chipotle. Yes  I did say to skip Chipotle. You won t miss it  and you re missing out if you don t go to Cabo Bob s. So go.  Why aren t you there yet

My go-to place to eat in Austin. Inexpensive  quick  even during lunch when the line is near the door   fresh  and delicious. There s nothing on the menu that I don t like  though my usual order never changes much . They also have a super realistic punch card system-- free burrito bowl after six visits. I could probably fill up a card in a month without batting an eye.
This place puts Chipotle and Freebirds to shame... it s that good   packed most of the time unless u get there early

I m not a Chipotle girl. I believe authentic Mexican food can t come in the form of  Subway  style ordering. I thought I would hate this place for that very reason. But  instead of comparing this to  authentic   I took joy in the process of seeing my delicious burrito being made from start to finish. Starting with choosing my flavor of tortilla. Can t go wrong with the fish burrito. Customize it the way you want. Still hate Chipotle  but Bob now has my heart...

I came in and everybody was super nice and the food was great it was fast it was out very quickly the price is a great for the amount of food that you get large variety of drinks and everybody in the staff is very nice and helpfully uj

Cabo Bobs is great. A little packed during lunch but I suppose that is tribute to how good the food is there.  I like that they offer multiple tortilla types and the fish offering is interesting  and tasty   BUT I am disappointed they don t offer a steak item. I also find their salsa to be quite mild. For those two reasons Cabo Bobs gets docked a star but otherwise this is a good choice for a lunch outing if you don t mind a wait.
I absolutely love Cabo bobs  So fresh and delicious  Chipotle can t even compare to the goodness you get at Cabo bobs

The burritos here were so good and huge  It had a similar feel and style as chipotle  but the food itself was way better  So many more options to choose from. I could only finish about 2 3 of my burrito and took the rest to go. I ate it cold for breakfast the next morning and it was still just as good  The sauces they have are so good and they have a ton to choose from

Cabo bobs is 100000 times of an upgrade for chipotle. Their different tortilla flavors are so tasty  You can never go wrong with their veggies and pulled pork  They have fresh jalape os which is a plus for me
Fantastic burritos  some of the best I ve ever had. But whatever you do  don t go here   Please don t   I really don t want to wait in a longer line.

It was good  but other than the freshly made flavored tortillas  I really didn t see much difference between them and the other burrito places such as Chipotle  FreeBirds  and one other one in San Antonio that I can t recall the name of right now.  Don t go out of your way for this one y all.  Just go to the closest burrito place to you.

Food was good but really don t see a difference between them and Chipotle. They give you a choice between a few different tortillas but my husband got the cooked cheddar and I got the cilantro tomatillo and I didn t taste a difference between the two.

Did you know that you can place your order via their website so that when you arrive  you can skip the queue and head straight to the to-go  section  aka the register   There  you ll find your made-to-order food perfectly packaged and ready to go home with you. Thank you for nailing the customer service piece  Cabo Bob   gang

Finally got around to trying this spot after years of seeing St. Edwards folks eat and hearing the ads.  Glad I finally did.  Might have to give up other burritos and Mexican food.    Lots of people talk about the fish tacos here but I went for the  7 special.  Fajita beef  rice and beans  salsa  grilled onions  added some guac  smoky cheddar tortilla.  Amazing.  Huge burrito  you better come hungry.  The flavors and ingredients matched up well.  And  importantly to me  the burrito was mixed up inside.  It wasn t like most places where all the sour cream is concentrated on one part  all the guac on another.  Every bite was different.  And delicious.  And be sure to try out the flavors on the soda fountains.  All Dublin drinks.  The sweet peach soda is the best.  Not too sweet  definitely peach and a gorgeous pink color.  Was delightful.
Amazing burritos and bowls. Plus queso. Plus Dublin fountain soda. What more do you need to know  I usually get the veggie burrito bowl but I have also tried the fish tacos and they re legit

Cabo Bob s is as colorful as Jenny L s hair. Now I could have gone with  Cabo Bob s is the Barley Swine of Chipotles  or  This place is a Freebird s Gone Wild  but using Jenny s hair seems much more colorful. Oh  c mon  it s more fun than saying  This restaurant is yummy.    The bottom line is Cabo Bob s is just another corporate assembly-line taco place  but I think their stuff tastes better. Don t take my word for the fish  amp  meat goo - and the word is apparently good - but if you re going to do veggie vegan at a taco venue  I don t know who s doing it better. I could literally flip a coin over the best deal here - the  10 ginormous 17-Veggie Bomb for  7  or the three-taco seasonal veggie basket you load with all the toppings for  6. Part of Cabo Bob s charm are the four kinds of tortillas  freshly pressed to order. Interesting stuff.   You know this place is a national franchise just waiting to happen  and it s cool they re based here in Austin. Their mantra of  No HFCS  in anything they have is clever  but I pretty much stick to iced tea in restaurants. So Dublin Dr. Pepper is now called  Doppelg nger   Whatevs. Incidentally  this intersection at Ben White and I-35 sucks  but I actually use the optometrist next door  there s a pedi place next to that where hip Yelpers groom themselves after a UYE  and that Murphy s across the parking lot is among the top-five lowest gas prices in town. It s easy to make an afternoon of Cabo Bob s. They re closed on Sundays  btw.  One anecdote  If it s crowded  and someone ahead of you suddenly puts in an extra order  they have to press new tortillas which will create some delay and confusion as this new order cuts its way through the assembly-line to catch up to the person. Keep an eye on your stuff  and make sure their stuff is not being accidentally put on yours. It s really not a big deal  the staff handles it nicely  and it was actually fun to watch - a kind of mesmerizing Three-card Tortilla Monte. We ll just call it another part of the Cabo Bob s charm.
Cabo Bob s is sooo good   If you are looking for a casual amazing burritos with homemade tortillas def check it out  The food always taste fresh.

This place kind of reminds me of a Baja-style Rudy s that followed a freebird to spring break in Rosarito Beach and got knocked up by Chipotle over Mexican Cokes  with rum  and nine months later  had a little Cabo Bob.   While there is no BBQ and gas station here  the line feels very Rudy s-esque with the iced down bottled drinks in in metal troughs while you stand in line  minus the booze    and the high fructose corn syrup   . They have the thing I always thought Rudy s should make a staple instead of white bread... tortillas. And these are not your grandma s tortillas. No siree...   The flour tortillas come in white  green  red and orange and they make them from scratch using only tree hugging ingredients like unbleached flour without all the extra junk  artificial flavors  colors  and things I cannot pronounce  added. The place them on a big rotating round griddle  flatten them and watch them bubble up as they cook. It looks like a landing pad of big and small tortilla UFOs.   - White   Buttermilk Flour Tortilla  - Green   Cilantro Tomatillo Flour Tortilla  - Red   Ancho Chili Flour Tortilla   - Orange   Smokey Cheddar Flour Tortilla that has cheddar and BBQ sauce mixed in.   They also offer corn tortillas  not sure they make them there  but they are non-genetically modified and made only with corn  no gluten added .   They have a variety of specials to choose from or you can build your own burritos  tacos  bowls and salads  choosing from a list of fillings  beef or chicken fajitas   shredded pork carnitas  crispy tilapia  shredded brisket or seasonal veggies. My only beef here is that the only fish offering is fried  think grilled my friends .   I ordered the Baja tacos  a plate of 3  but subbed one out for the pork so I could try it with the Ancho Chili tortilla. The fish tacos were served in the corn tortillas with a white crema sauce  cabbage  salsa  lime  cilantro and onions. I had them use the mango pico instead of the red salsa and easy on the cilantro and onions. They were tasty and each had 2 pieces of fish in them  but I would have preferred my fish grilled.   The shredded pork in my other taco was moist  but needed a little more zing in its flavor. The Ancho Chili tortilla was my favorite part of the meal.   I watched people ordering their burritos and walking out with big fat ones  but unfortunately for me  while all ingredients are healthy... those lack portion control and always leave me feeling way too full.   They have indoor and outdoor seating. Outdoor  however are several picnic tables next to the parking lot and the view is of people going through a Starbucks drive through. Perhaps they could make that a little less open and put up a barrier.   Inside has a beachy decor and clever graphics.   I like that they are going for natural  healthy  not high fructose corn syrup tree hugging goodness here. I was alarmed that they do not offer recycling options for their glass bottles and plastic cups. I realize the city does not make it easy for businesses  but believe they need to carry this natural friend of the earth message through to the trash and recycling.   All in all  I would give them 3.5 stars. That is between A-OK and Yay  I m a fan. I am rounding up  because Jenny L. set up a UYE here  and she rocks stars

Cabo Bobs vs Chipotle.   Cabo bob s has its own special hot sauce. Chipotle has salmonella.  Cabo bob s has great big round tortillas of different flavors. Chipotle does not  that I know of .  Cabo bob s charges for guacamole. Wait. So does Chipotle.  Chipotle has beer. Cabo Bobs has an amazing soda selection.    Overall  I really like the meat selections and veggie selection at Cabo Bobs. Everything comes out warm and fresh. I am a fan of hot sauces  so I love the salsa and hot sauce variety. I usually go with the chicken bowl  filled with veggies and goodies    Verdict  Cabo Bobs is def. my place of choice. Unfortunately  due to convenience  I often go to Chipotle.

You know what I like about Yelper Jenny L.  - She doesn t hate me to my face.  Mostly. - She actually responds when I speak to her.  That  and she usually responds in English. - She doesn t judge.  Well  except when I mismatch plaids and stripes. - She doesn t smoke such that I m downwind.  In exchange  I kindly repress flatulence. - She doesn t criticize me when I eat things in front of her.  Especially things that were once alive. - She organizes lots of cool UYE events.  Almost all of which I sign up for and never show to despite my best intentions  which has to piss her off.  Except today.  Jenny managed to find the one place in Austin out of the one-thousand-I-haven t-been-to-and-really-wanted-to-go-for-like-two-years-and-counting and held a UYE event in the middle of the day on a Saturday when I was  a  Awake b  Well c  Motivated d  Sociable e  In-town  So  to make it look good  I ordered the tacos filled with fried finned thingys that once dwelt in the sea  sorry  Jenny  that s as much as I can sanitize it .  The thingys were very not greasy  and not too batter-y  as I like it.  They were wrapped in wonderful  airy-light buttermilk tortillas  just enough to provide a good food seal but not filling in and of themselves.  Overstuffed with generous helpings of Chipotle Crema  Mango Pico  Shredded Cabbage  I don t think any of those items once sentient beings  so I will call them by name .  Hearty  yet delicious  meal.  You don t leave hungry here.  Be sure to discover the sauces early  and try the XX for sure as I discovered it only too late.  That happened right after I negotiated the hostage exchange between Jenny and Tiana for the XX sauce.  I felt so diplomatic.  I even took a hit off it while Jenny glared at me to get her sauce back.  It was all good.  Service was a little absent-minded at times  much like this review   but highly efficient.  They made up for it with their vast array of pure cane sugar sodas from Dublin Bottling.  I would have had a field day here  but I stopped after one refill  switching from Orange Tangerine to Vanilla Creme.  I will definitely be back to try the rest of the flavors.  But  enough about the food  lest you think this was all about the restaurant or something.  Back to the real point of this review  if there ever was one. - Jenny rules - Yelp rocks

It s Lupe Tortilla quality for ten bucks. If you just want good food for a reasonable price. This is the spot for you.  The beef fajita burrito is the best in town. The fresh hot tortilla which comes in four options. Try them all

Do NOT eat  food poisoning in 18 minutes  After reading all the yelp reviews  I was intrigued. I ordered a pork burrito with cheese tortilla  added queso because of course  always add queso   standard veggies  salsa. I went back to my hotel  as I m visiting from out of town  ate half the burrito and felt really full and the burrito was REALLY good. I had already recommended it to my coworkers. 18 minutes in and I got the worst cramps I ve ever had and laid on the floor in agony before throwing up everything I had eaten. Even after throwing everything up  I still had agonizing cramps. I am known in my family for not throwing up  even to the point where doctors have given me medicine to induce vomiting and I still would not throw up. This burrito caused vomiting in 18 minutes. Not a great experience.
4 stars for taste  5 stars for freshness and quantity.  Good value for fish  steak burritos  plus you get a frequent dining card.  Cops and firemen frequent this place a lot  so you know it s good.
OMG so glad my coworkers introduced me to Cabo Bobs. I think I ve eaten there over 50 times in 2018  Food is so amazing    Service is great too

Love Love Love   They make the meat in the green egg...gives it the best flavor.  This place puts Chipotle and Freebirds to absolute shame.  If you want a bomb burrito  bowl or salad...this is the spot

The food is absolutely amazing they give you plenty of food and I agree it s better than Chipotle  I love going here but the customer service is awful  no one is ever friendly they always want to rush you out of there and always have a straight face. It makes you feel you re doing something wrong. I ve came to this location many times and everyone is like this each time even though there s about 5 employees you speak to while you go through the line. I went to the one near UT once and every staff member was so friendly which made the experience so much better however it s not close to home.
Always one of my favorite choices in Austin. The fresh made Tortillas are fabulous. Lots of choices for filling your burrito  bowl  tacos or salad

I came into cabo bobs having a pretty crappy day until i stood face to face with a lady named Renee... Believe me when i tell you that this lady has an awesome sense of humor which really threw me off guard .i mean you dont really expect to laugh the whole time youre ordering food. I asked her if i was able to get double meat she replied and said sure u can get TRIPLE meat if you would like  and i DEFINITELY recommend the queso.what a way to UPSELL i mean for crying out like she probably couldve sold me her name tag thats how GOOOOOD she is. i even went home and told my friends about the great experience i had and begged them to come with me so they could meet this beautiful soul.. Im greatful because there arent many people who can turn a frown on my face upside down. RENEE YOU ROCK .

Came in for tacos and haven t been here in a while as I get mad at the terribly lazy employees that work here. With that being said I am very upset that the manager slopped together my tacos in the worst way possible. I would have needed a shower to get clean after the disgusting tacos this man made for me. 3 times a week I would come now it s once every 2 weeks and now I probably won t come back. Get employees that care about their job
This place deserve more than 5 stars  it is very clean  healthy and very tasted at the same time. It is very easy to tell that they use very fresh ingredients

One time review - normally I love this place  but today they gave me food poisoning. I noticed a funny smell in the tacos but dismissed it because I d never had problems here before. Recommend avoiding steak fajita meat for a bit after this review until they get new protein.
The food is great. The staff is friendly with smiles on their faces. They re pretty fast too so if there s a line  it won t be too long.  They even have real sugar cane soft drinks.

Excellent food  great customer service  for a good price. Similar to Chipotle but better. The tortillas are made fresh... like right in front of you. Then you load up your bowl  taco  or burrito with all the extras.

On a scale of 1-10  I would say the food here is a solid 10. The only suggestion I can provide is the service is lacking the speed needed to accommodate a line of people. It took about 8-10 minutes of waiting to get through the line  when we re used to speedier service at a similar place like Chipotle. Fish is amazing though and well worth the wait  I love that Cabo Bob s offers a burrito card that they can punch through For every 6 burritos you buy  you get your 7th one for free  Very great deal if you go often. Will definitely be coming back regardless of the aforementioned problems.
We loved this Mexican food we had it last night and we are thinking about going again tonight I definitely recommend this.

I ve had freebirds. Chipotle. Costa Vida. Baja fresh.  El pollo loco. But this one surpasses them all and takes the cake   So so fresh and generous on their servings.  Your tortilla don t get made until you order it. And contain different flavors to boot.  Best fish tacos I ve had.  My daughter had brisket and that didn t disappoint eothetb.  Great staff and servers.  Wish they open one here in DFW
Delicious fish tacos on fresh tortillas. We aren t from the area  we found this restaurant based on yelp reviews. It did not disappoint. Next time I d like to try the brisket and beef.

Made a recent return visit to Cabo Bob s cuz it s been way too long since I ve had their awesome fish tacos. I love their flavored tortilla options  ordered a Taco Dinner which comes with three.    It s a similar set-up to other taco places  pick your dish and the tortilla  but here they press the tortilla right there for you as opposed to it already being prepared.  I went for the black beans   onions   cilantro   mango salsa  awesome     lettuce   diced jalapenos.  Not only did my 3 tacos look so awesome and appetizing  they tasted even better.  Add in a side of the chipotle sauce and I like to mix the hot and mild pepper sauces to get some nice heat.    Everything was excellent  and love their chips too.  Those flavored tortillas were superb  only wish they were a little more on the thicker side of things as sometimes the flavors of the taco overpower the taste of their thin tortilla.  I think the smokey cheddar is my favorite by far  so maybe next time I ll just upgrade to a burrito to get more tortilla.  Regardless  Cabo Bob s has best fish tacos in town - hands down.  It s a simple combination where freshness and quality are key  and I won t wait too long to come back for more.

I ve been coming here for over a year now and What can I say about Cabo Bob s... It s simply one of the best places in Austin to grub    My first time here was when I went on my first date with my beautiful girlfriend  She truly picked the right spot for our first date to have food together. I remember my first bite I was blown away  the fish tacos and fish bowl is always superb  always fresh and crispy  the toppings are generous  the food is scrumptious and I ve never had a bad experience during and after eating here. I would also like to add that their Chicken Fajita is seasoned perfectly and I just can t enough of this place. Dr. BAJA will always hit the sweet spot. The Chips are super crispy and the red and green salsa is great.   Keep doing a fantastic job in delivering fresh  fast  and delicious Food Cabo Bob s   My girlfriend and I are customers for life  _
Place is delicious. I always get three tacos and make them how I want. Blows Chipotle and Freebird s away. Get here and get here quick.
Best burrito place in Austin   Most unique and fresh ingredients and super friendly employees   Great options for vegans   vegetarians and omnivores too
I m a big Tex Mex fan and like the regional and national chains. I loved this restaurant as an alternative.  The food  is great and the atmosphere is fun. You must check it out.

Hard to beat this place.   The tacos are flavored just right  the burritos are enormous and the service is speedy and friendly.  Not thrilled with the crispiness of the flour tortillas  but that s a small whine compared to the flavor profiles goin on here.  And coupled with a cool assortment of cane sugar soft drinks  lookin  at you  cherry limeade    this is a fun treat that won t break the bank  but might stretch your stomach  -

Burritos are huge and made with fresh tortillas  you get to pick from several types . Food is tasty and good amount of food for the price. Downside is the choice or lack thereof  of fountain sodas. Many are  home made sodas  or you must buy sodas in the glass.

What is Cabo Bob s  Now I finally know.  My co-worker recommended this place  quite a few times actually...and I never really believed him or ever gave this place a thought. Why  I have no idea  all taco suggestions should be welcomed with open arms and an open mind.  Is it like a Chipotle Qdoba Freebird  Some would say the strategy is a little  yes.  BUT THE FOOD ISN T. Buttermilk flour tortilla - yummers  And that isn t your only option for tortilla. I ve had the fish tacos and the chicken tacos. Both delicious. Tasty. Savory. Warm. Taco-licious. Generous serving  friendly service. The only thing I wish they had is corn but I can do without it.

The food in this place its amazing  Highly recommend it  they had different types of tortillas which are made to order  you heard it right  they cook your tortilla right in front of you. The ingredients are really fresh and flavors are amazing. Love the cheese sauce they put it on my burrito. I would totally go back multiple times if it was close to my house.

This place is the reason I stopped going to Chipotle. It is everything Chipotle used to be but better. The tortillas are so delicious  I could eat them on their own. My only complaint is regarding the chicken  it really could be seasoned a bit more. Everything else about this place is awesome

I came here on a Friday night around 8 45pm  cutting it close I know . The food is fantastic but one employee  the first one I interacted with might I add  was rushing us to pick what we wanted  wasn t listening to any questions I had  and even had the nerve to make a clearly aggravated face at another employee when I wasn t ordering as fast as he wanted me too.  The second it hit 9 00pm they turned the lights off in the dining room even though there were still multiple tables still eating the food they had just gotten.  I ve worked in restaurants for the past 7 years fast food and full service and would never turn the lights off on a customer the second the restaurant closes.  Give it 15 minutes at least   Anyway  I ve been going to Cabo Bobs for years and this location today has left a bad taste in my mouth.  Hope this helps.

Ok now I have to say that Cabo Bob s thumps its direct competitors mainly Chipotle.  How do they do this you ask.  2 words.  Fresh Tortillas  .. Not only fresh but 4 flavors are available for both tacos or burritos.  Flavored tortillas can really add additional flavor and these do.  The toppings are fresh as well as the salsa.  They also are good about not letting the meat sit and get cold especially the fish.  They are good about frying it in small batches so that is always fresh.  So to recap  Fresh Tortillas   fresh salsas  fresh toppings   One more thing.  Don t be scared of the line as they keep it moving even during the busiest of times.

Can it be  Did I finally find an establishment not on the West Coast that serves fish tacos worth writing home about  Does this place serve only REAL sugar soda choices  Do they have an overwhelming amount of options that allows for hundreds of different creations  enticing me to eat here again  Is this place seriously only 10 minutes away from my home and work  Is their service really that friendly and quick  Was the restaurant clean  Do they make their own chips  Did I eat my fish tacos alarmingly fast  Was I shameless enough to steal a beef fajita taco from the 2 year old in our party  Am I still full from my 11 00 lunch throwdown 6 hours later   Ladies and gentleman  the answer to all of these questions is YES. 4 and a half stars and 216 reviews ain t lying. Stop reading  and indulge.

This place is probably taken for granted. What more can you ask from a burrito with good portion sizes and fresh ingredients    I got the brisket burrito with the ancho chili tortilla and it was delicious. Compared to its competitors  rhymes with poopotle and poobirds   this place is better in my opinion.   Tip  it gets very busy during lunch time. Arrive early
The food here is great for a burrito taco bar.  Their brisket is tender and the fried fish is good.  The line takes awhile to go through  but it s expected.

I always make it a must to stop by here when I m in the area. They are quick and the food is delicious. We always order chips and queso and are never disappointed.   I always get the bowl with steak or chicken  white rice  lettuce  cilantro  pico and cheese. My meal is always warm and is plenty for me to get full on.  I would highly recommend if you like burrito style cooking places like Chipotle or Torchy s.

Been curious about this place for awhile  several friends who lived south had mentioned it before. I had an excuse to visit to support WAP  Worker s Assistance Program  for a friend during Amplify Austin 2014 last year.  Yes I m a bit behind on my reviews.   Ordered the salad with half shredded pork   half chicken  wanted to try both   white rice  beans  pico de gallo  cheese and some sort of veggies I believe. It reminded me somewhat of Chipotle  but seemed a bit more expensive. It was definitely fresh  but I felt the flavor lacking more.

I absolutely love this place. I started coming here when they first opened years ago  but now my trips are few and far between since I ve moved out of the state. I made it back to Texas in June and my first stop was Cabo Bob s  literally within 40 minutes of getting off the plane I was in the restaurant .   Pros  - Outstanding food quality and freshness. - Bold  refreshing flavors on the tacos and hearty  delicious flavors on the burritos  - They have a entire soda fountain stocked with pure cane sugar sodas - Homemade guacamole and fresh tortilla chips that they actually cut and fry right in front of you   Cons  - The lines can get very long during lunch hours. With one service line  you can end up waiting 20  minutes.  - They can be a little pricey. For tacos  a drink  and some chips  expect to spend close to  15-20.  MY FAVORITE   2 DELUXE FISH TACOS

The food is pretty good  but so not worth the wait   This place is SO unorganized that I called in and placed a pick up order  just to come in 30 minutes later and - not only had they not started it  but fixed the 6 other people s orders in the line first. Sorry  but not coming back here for a long time

Look  I like burrito assembly line lunch places as much as the next guy.  But this is in a whole other class  I regularly drive from my place of work in Westlake Hills and from my home in South Austin to eat here - both around 7 miles away.  The tortillas  meats  fish  vegetables  and salsas are all superior to any of their competitors. And yes  the fountain drinks and bottled sodas are the cane sugar variety.  My only complaints  1  There is not one close to my home or work and  2  They are not open Sundays.

I would definitely choose this place over Chipotle or Freebirds  Bigger burritos at a cheaper price. The home made tortillas really make everything stand out above it s competitor  You won t regret eating here.

I ve been to Cabo Bob s a few times and while I don t hate it  I just don t love it either. Freebirds will always be number one in my heart  followed by Chipotle  and lastly Cabo Bob s. On my first trip I had the  2 delux fish taco meal which includes three tacos on three different tortillas - cilantro tomatillo  buttermilk  and ancho chile. Surprisingly I didn t taste much difference between them. Also the mango salsa pretty much overpowered all the other flavors. Sad face. The fish was crispy and cooked well though  so at least there s that.  The next time I did a create your own burrito on a cilantro tomatillo tortilla  slightly too hard   with chicken  dry   white rice  flavorless   pico  red salsa  cheese  sour cream  cilantro and jalape o. Maybe I just chose the wrong combination but I wasn t thrilled with my choice. I ended up dousing the burrito with a side of queso  which was not great on its own but better on the burrito.   Another thing CB s has going for them is their fountain soda selection. I might give them another shot but more than likely I ll drive an extra couple of miles to Freebirds.

Been eating at Cabo Bob s for a few yeas now and it has always been my top burrito place in Austin  the service and quality of this place is top notch  THANK you also for not adding onions into the guac  I always do half steak half chicken burritos and it is always amazing. They cook the meats on a green egg grill and it makes the big difference

Excellent food  totally worth giving it a try  As you walk in you choose your flavor of tortilla and then follow it along as the other ingredients are being added. You can choose to omit or add items to your burrito.  My husband and I were satisfied with one burrito and my teenagers ate half of theirs  Prices range from  6-9 per burrito.  Oh their fountain drinks are a sweet surprise  flavors like cherry limeade  red creme soda and vintage cola

This place way better than any Chipotle  The homemade tortillas that they press and make as you order are pretty amazing  Lots of choices for you salads  burritos  nachos  tacos  and bowls   Try this place out you won t be disappointed. The line is long FYI

I m not really sure why the reviews for this place are so good. I went here the other day based on the reviews online when I was in the area. I had the fish tacos   and my S.O. got the veggie tacos. Don t get me wrong  there was absolutely nothing wrong with this place. However  I wasn t blown away either. They are better than Chipotle  but there are much better taco places in town. I guess maybe if I got the burrito  I would feel differently...   But for those wishing to eat awesome tacos  this place is just ok. I would DEFINITELY choose Torchy s instead if given the option.   The real critique I would have is that it s not authentic Tex-Mex. The flavors are just much to mild. I felt like I needed to douse my taco in Cholula  and that would have given it the spice it needed.

The burrito I had was amazing  I chose the bacon beef with a Smokey cheddar tortilla. It was one of the best burritos I have had in a long time. Also had the chips and queso. Both were perfect  Fun atmosphere with a Cool vibe. I ll definitely be back here on my next trip to Austin

After three years  John  the owner of Cabo Bob s  is still making a great product.  I ve tried pork  fish and beef in taco or burrito form. I ve tried brown rice  white rice  black beans  pinto beans  grilled onion  grilled poblano  grilled squash and zucchini  queso  pico de gallo  mango salsa  cilantro tortilla  ancho tortilla  cheddar tortilla  flour tortilla... they are all just so good   I can t wait until he opens his North Austin location.

I had heard enough and had to try it out for myself ..  and I am in love. One  any restaurant that not only sells Dublin Dr Pepper  but goes to the point of putting it in a fountain machine  is awesome   Thank you Cabo Bob    The choices of tortilla flavors is really nice and that they make them right in front of you is great too. All the meat and ingredients are fresh and look great. The beef fajita meat - wow  I wish I could cook fajita meat like that at home. The flavor is great and so rich. Mmmm..  I got the three taco order and was more than pleasantly filled. Not too much  not too little  juuust right. The chipotle hot sauce was my only disapointment  was spicy hot  but almost like Tabasco and not like a spicy pepper sauce. But alas  Cabo Bob won me over. I definately will be back  and will try to always get tacos with my Dublin Dr Pepper.  9

Cabo Bob s kind of has a one-up on all of the other burrito chains in town  coming from someone who also highly loves Chip tle and Fre birds . You really can t beat fresh made tortillas on the spot in four different flavors  ancho chile  what up  . The tortillas are the PERFECT amount of chewiness and charred well.   Dare I also say that their cilantro lime rice is probably the best out of all three  I m really not sure what kind of juices they put in all of their stuff  but I love the fish tacos and burritos and found myself eating every last bit of them even when I was stuffed to the max. That is dedication  or just a very  very strategic recipe .   Don t get me started on the chips. Ok I already started  but their chips kind of rock. XOXO Cabo s  see you soon.

I had a dismal first experience at Cabo Bob s  and then concluded after reading 742 5-star reviews  that it must have been my fault.  So  after 2 years  I returned for another attempt.  The verdict  I m not there yet  but I see the potential.  The problem  there are a million options  and the ones that sound good to me end up tasting foul or not playing well with others.  And I have never had this problem  anywhere  including my own kitchen.  Lesson 1  more is not better when it comes to flavored tortillas.    I tried the ancho chili first.  No bueno.  Last time  I tried  but couldn t resist the cheddar.  Another mistake  albeit a better one.  They both tasted muddled  burnt  and slightly bitter.  Buttermilk has got to be the answer.    Lesson 2  maybe try tacos  The burrito worked on paper.  It almost worked in my mouth.  I blame Cabo Bob s for using muddled and conflicting flavors at low levels.  If you re trying to produce big flavor  you re liable to get cacophany.  Conclusion - the burrito is a hot mess.  Lesson 3  try fish tacos  I m going to start over  throw out the burrito  though I think I was almost onto something  and just do the dang fish tacos.   Lesson 4  do some homework  With the unhelpful mass herding by unenthusiastic employees through an option-rich assembly line of ingredients  I know I m missing key stuff.  Specifically  I felt as if there were a sauce missing that would tie the whole burrito together.  Now that I ve seen the online menu  I see there are all manner of tasty sauces to choose from.  The sauces are seriously under-presented at the restaurant.  I didn t have a clue what was available.  Now I m ready.  I m coming back with a vengeance.

What you need to know - the food better than Freebird s.  What you won t like - the people  atmosphere and overall  attitude  of Freebird s is missing.  You start by selecting a tortilla flavor - seconds later a ball of raw dough is placed on some sort of flattening device and your raw tortilla is placed on a rotating hot plate. A couple rotations and a flip and you re ready to fill it with smoked goodness. Smoked  Yes  If you look back in the kitchen you ll find 2  Big Green Eggs  - ceramic kamado ovens that slow cook the meats and don t allow for any moisture or flavor to escape. The rest of the process should be familiar although it looks like they use a cilantro lime rice a la Chipotle and offer an assortment of sauces at the end. To drink you ll find  Dublin  Dr. Pepper  made w  cane sugar  on tap which is only one of a very solid assortment of self serve beverages.  The little ignorable aggravation is that because of the large tortilla cooker  the rest of the line is a bit cramped and certainly doesn t flow as well as other burrito joints.

I ve said it once and I ll say it again  Cabo Bob s has some of the best fish tacos I ve ever had. So many options to customize your order  it s ridiculous - but they don t loose the quality or flavor of anything by giving you so many options.  Start with choosing your tortilla  which you get to choose  or mix  amp  match if you re getting an order of tacos which comes with 3   Buttermilk  Ancho Chili  Cilantro Tomatillo or Smoked Cheddar.  Then  you get to choose what filling you want - my favorite being the crispy fish tacos because they aren t heavy but have great flavor or the chopped chicken  breast .  Brown rice  yes  a mexican grill has brown rice - pretty great  and makes me feel a tiiiny bit better  then of course you get 3 choices of beans to include.  Toppings are endless  salsas make you stop and think - because there are about 6-8 choices and even if you want them all  choose wisely. My favs are the fresh red and chipotle crema    The people who work there are also super nice and efficient  always working to get the line moving as quickly as possible  so don t let that line scare you .  So  if you want a delicious burrito  tacos or bowl made with fresh ingredients  skip the competitors and go to this local hot spot.
It s ok.  Nothing to write home about.  There are much better places in Austin for tacos and burritos.

It s all about dem fresh-pressed tortillas  Love how they have several different doughs to choose from. Their crispy fish is amazing stuff and they don t skimp on the portions.  For those who care  they forgo the HFCS route and offer a wide variety of soda options all with natural sugar.  I m not a big soda drinker but I appreciate the  in my opinion  tastier and  healthier  option.  If they ever open a location in Houston I d never go back to Chipotle or Freebirds.

I ve got to say this is probably one of the better Burrito places in Austin. Most places focus on tacos but this place is all about awesomeness in the form of tasty burritos. Lots of parking  good food  ample space in the restaurant. YUM

Plain and simple  this place is yummy  No need for a fancy review. Just go try this place.  Rule of thumb  Go for anything with fish in it   I ve had the fish tacos and a fish burrito. Both of them are pretty filling and taste pretty good.  The Smokey Cheddar tortilla seemed pretty legit. Start off with some rice  beans  meat  or fish   non-meats and cheese.. then add some lime  hot-sauce and a coke and there you have it  A work of art  Bon Appetit

I like that they use fresh tortillas  however  freshly made tortillas should taste awesome and my cilantro tortilla tasted like nothing maybe needed salt  and it was so thin that it could not hold all my veggie ingredients well..it was falling all over the place  and the girl in the assembly line looked at me weird when I asked her to cut it in half.  All in all  they are better than freebirds and Chipotle   not as good as authentic southern California burritos  but good if you like gringo burritos.

Their fried fish was absolutely delicious  We got the burrito bowls and they have a lot of topping and protein options. My husband got a burrito bowl with a double order of the fried fish and it was heaping  I got a bowl with the chopped brisket and it was pretty good. Overall  this place is pretty good.

My new favorite Mexican fast food restaurant    It s like Chipotle on steroids. You start by choosing your tortilla dough. Yes  The tortillas are freshly made and they have 4 flavors  regular buttermilk  ancho Chile  cilantro tomatillo  and something cheddar  I think  . If you are the indecisive type   cough  ladies   you can choose from a number of specialties. If you want to DIY  you can choose from a variety of meats. Then they got all sorts of grilled veggies  rajas  calabacitas  and cebollas guisadas. The queso blanco is also an option and is amazing  Then you got your standard salsa bar  sour cream  cheese  etc. All for the same price as Chipotle  if not  cheaper. Had this place twice in a row and I will be coming here more often. This place will not disappoint
Delicious food and convenient location. Employees are helpful and friendly. Restaurant is clean and organized.
Love this place.  Tortillas are fresh  ingredients are bomb  and it s definitely huge steps up on chipotle freebirds.  If you want a solid burrito  you can t go wrong with Bob s.

I ve heard about this place for a while  but I was always slightly skeptical.  After all  just how good can fish tacos be   The answer  my friend  is pretty freaking awesome.  You haven t had fish tacos until you ve had Cabo Bob s.  Got the deluxe baja fish tacos.  Three crunchy fish tacos on three different tortilla types.  The fish was fresh and crispy.  It didn t feel greasy or overfried at all.  They added a lot of slaw on top  which made the tacos pretty substantial.  The lime mixed with sauce was citrusy  refreshing  creamy goodness.  Absolutely perfect.  Let me say this - I had the unfortunate experience of going there on a night I had a painful canker sore.  Cabo Bob s made me want to eat through the pain and finish every single bite - even with the extra lime juice I added liberally to all my tacos.    I ll definitely be back   I want to say I ll try some of their other items  but the fish tacos are such a winner that I may never need to try anything else.

Blows away anything by Freebirds  Chipotle  you name it. It s better here. Everything tastes so fresh. They have a large variety of tortillas. My favorite is the tomatillo. Just go and prepare to eat a lot. There s always a line at lunchtime but they move quickly and the service is great. Also they have cane sugar soda in the fountain. It s incredible stuff. You will be a convert to the religion of Cabo Bob s.

I ve been going there so many years - one of the first customers when it opened.  My husband and I loved it so much and we were scared it wouldn t make as it had so few customers.  What a contrast today - the line is always SO LONG no matter what time of day.  Always worth the wait

This was my first time visiting after seeing good reviews and it being short distance from my hotel during my Austin visit.   I had an awesome burrito big enough to share  but instead decided to save for leftovers. The tortillas are made in front of you  try the cheddar  and the other ingredients were also fresh. I had the shredded pork. Yum. The atmosphere was fun and casual and the staff were friendly.   It s convenient too - right off the interstate.

Meh. I had never heard of this place  and when I went in and saw the menu  I was hoping for something at least similar to Freebirds. But no luck on that. The food was ok  not inspired  but ok. But my burrito was rolled so poorly and loosely that it basically fell apart after about three bites and was a big pile of ingredients in a foil wrapper  which was also coming apart in little pieces. My SILs tacos looked good though. I might try this spot again if need be  but I wouldn t do a burrito.
Outstanding burrito--especially for a fast food place.  Portions are very large.
I wish this burrito fast-service mini-chain would expand out of Texas. It was VERY good. Highly recommend it.

yeah.  Definitely one of the better lunch spots in the area  as well as one of the better burrito places around. Seeing them make every tortilla in front of you as well adds to the experience. It can get crowded though  I d recommend going a little early than normal lunch times. There s a good variety of meats and sauces  as well as easy options for eating low-carb paleo whatever the cool kids are calling it now.
Love this place  Fresh  offer good variety  the brisket tacos are great  I love chipotle  but if you like that concept but with some variety - check this place out

Are you freaking kidding me  I will never eat anywhere else ever again.   OK that s an exaggeration  but holy ish this is crazy. I got the fish tacos  and I just never thought I d say this  but I liked the tortilla best. WHAT  everything inside this taco was incredible  fresh veggies  amp  salsas  amp  fish and STILL  I found myself saying  This tortilla is incredible   So that s a good thing.  My buds got burritos and assured me the same was true of theirs.   Right off the highway  and though I don t move to Austin until next week  I m glad this was my first Austin dining experience and I am sure to become a regular.  BONUS  Jumbo sized bottles of Mexican Coke which  if you know anything about me  I live for.
I have been ordering at Cabo Bob s since they first opened. I either order the Smokey cheddar chicken burrito or the fish tacos. I do agree with other reviewers that it s better than Chipotle.

This is hands down the BEST burrito place in town. I have been coming here since day 1  and will keep going until the doors close. which prob will never happen  b c they rock     I wrote a lengthy review  but then thought  why tell you what EVERYONE else told you  The food is great  tortillas are the bomb  everythings fresh  ect. Its broken recordish to keep gushing about it  so ill keep this short and just say EAT HERE and drink a Dublin Dr. P

These people have to be paying yelp a bunch of money to keep their reviews high   Simply no other explanation at this point.  I live near this place and have periodically stopped by hoping for delicious.  Not once has it come through.  Have had cold and bland tasting tacos and burritos every time with one exception.  The one time it wasn t bland it was still cold but not bland because the the fish taste dipped in salt.    The staff and atmosphere fit the same description as the food.  Really people   How exciting can choosing your own type of tortilla be

Cabo Bobs is a  make your own taco burrito bowl  fast food joint  but here s why it s better than the others   Variety- They have a big variety in their menu and toppings without being overwhelming. You can even choose from 4 different types of freshly made tortillas.   Fish Tacos- Cabo Bobs advertised their amazing fish tacos  so I had to order the  2 fish tacos plate from the pre-selected menu.  Fish tacos may undoubtedly be the best invention of all time  when done correctly. Cabo Bobs serves the perfect fish tacos with light  crispy  fried fish that is not too greasy  with cabbage and mango slaw toppings  and the perfect chipotle sauce on top. The  2 plate also includes 3 flavored tortillas and guacamole. Perfection. Don t even think about altering this delicious creation.   Value- For the menu  ingredients  and portions their prices are great  I dare you to not love this place

Love love love this place  Similar set up as Chipotle but omg is the menu 10x better  I love that you can choose different tortilla flavors. The fish tacos are amazing. I m definitely coming back to try other food on the menu  I highly recommend trying this place out

AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING  I am so glad I read all these great reviews and came to try it out today. First  they make fresh tortillas right in front of you and there are FOUR flavors....then you can pick your meat. I ordered the fish taco  which was divine  and then the pork and chicken tacos. Everyone says the rice is great  and it was. And the soda s made with real cane sugar - you must try the rootbeer  Wowza...Oh and three drinks and three lunch meals for  21  Wow  am I happy to be in Texas and not CA...can t beat these prices

These people couldn t understand what I wanted in English or Spanish. I forgive you  high schooler  just follow your fellow burrito wrapper s lead. Props for getting me through the line in less than ten minutes.   The burritos themselves were  A-OK . Nothing outstanding or remarkable to say  BE  5 BEST IN AUSTIN      Man  get that out of my face

It could be because I m a St. Edward s graduate that I have such a love for this place...whatever the reason  Cabo Bob s is hands down 100X better than competitors like Chipotle and Freebirds.  Two words my friends - Fish Burrito.  And don t you dare knock it until you ve tried it.  They have really fresh ingredients and the decor is really great.  They also have old-fashioned sodas   Where else can you find quality cream soda    NO WHERE.  That s where.  Their queso is also really great     Beware - if you go during peak hours be prepared to wait in line...it is soooo worth it though.

This place is a hidden gem in South Austin...I wish there was more locations throughout Austin. I realize that the Mega-burrito offerings are vast here  but Cabo Bob s brings it in a good way. The one thing I love is the freshness of the tortilla  it s made in front of you as you wait. Second  the flavors  once again really fresh and innovative  I personally love the Ancho Chili  but have heard great things about the other offerings. The rest is in line with other places with one expection  the hot sauce that says hot  is really hot...careful. The sodas are a little wacky but the tea is perfect. The space is a little small and get really crowded during lunch..come a little early to avoid the rush. I really wish I could come over and over. By far  my favorite mega-buritto taco bar in Austin...

Big fat delicious tacos. They make the tortillas fresh when you order and you can choose the flavor. Also They have so many employees in the assembly line that the line moves really quick even when it s full.

Austin s best  fast  burrito joint you probably have never tried. I had the brisket queso option and I was mind blown with the flavor  the massive size and price.   Also  the tortillas alone are worth the trip. They actually press and grill a fresh dough ball for your burrito. None of this steam a nasty chalky flavored tortilla you get at Chipotle or Freebirds.   Hands down. The best  fast  burrito in Austin. Awesome dudes

The service was fast even for the size of the crowd. The staff was friendly and patient. The food was good and the options were plenty. I would definitely return. The tables were clean  even the outdoor area was clean.

Best soda selection  all Dublin  real sugar   . The food is top notch  the fresh made-to-order tortillas set them apart. All the meats are flavorful  brisket and chicken are my favorites. Relatively cheap  under  10 usually.

Got burritos for the family. Delicious. Even for picking up and taking home 45 minutes away. Still delicious. Food is almost always spot on and fresh. My kids LOVE  the green burrito   it always makes them smile.  Starting with the ingredients.  Oh boy do they matter    Elevation burger should take lessons  Anyhow.. Everything is so fresh and packed with flavor. Nothing I ve had there is lacking anything IMO. The beans are great...nice flavor... The rice.  Spot on. Love the cilantro rice..always.  Mixed veggies.. Squash onions and peppers...mmm delicious.  The cold toppings.. All fresh. Onions. Cilantro. Pico. Cheese. Sour cream. Avocado. Tomato. Lettuce. Wonderful.    Now the kicker.. The meat.. Holy mother of god.  They have good meat. And I mean that.. I m not a big meat person.. But boy I love their meat  And their standards. All natural meats.. Organic brown rice. Homemade salsas. Sodas with real sugar  I do not indulge in those but I m glad they have them as opposed to the garbage most other places sell .. You can do gluten if needed. Or vegaterian..even Vegan. There is something for everyone.. And I have since found out they have a punch card... Wahoo     If you haven t yet.   Give them a whirl. You will NOT be disappointed. I promise.    We don t eat here often.. But love it when we do. Thanks again for great food...
I went in with my friend recently and jc was really nice and helped me out when I was unsure what to get
Loved the tortilla but other than that there is nothing special about this place and the taste.. so bland both fish and meat..Needs more seasoning...

The food is fresh and delicious.  The cilantro tortilla  made fresh in front of you  is my favorite for the burrito   Again  fresh and tasty and affordable. Didn t give 5 stars because the salsa lacks spice- if the red salsa  or green for that matter  had more flavor and heat  this would be the perfect spot for me

One of my favorite places in Austin  Their steak and fish tacos could rival any other taco in the city  hands down. The staff is always friendly and the managers are wonderful. Angie is the bomb and will take care of you for any parties or events  Check it out  you won t be disappointed

The insanely high review average of this place got me all excited and I had to go as soon as I found out about it  I live in North Austin..South Austin seems so far.... .   I left disappointed and realized  immediately  that I d choose Freebird s any day of the week. Here s why    On the pro side  - They home-make your tortilla  from dough  when you order - both tacos and burritos  all flavors - They have awesome real cane sugar sodas in their fountain machine  Why I wasn t all that pleased  - No nachos on the menu  Freebird s nachos are some of the best in the land  - The guac  while fresh  is super boring - And the worst thing.....when they make the burritos  they don t let the juices of the ingredients  i.e. beans  meat  drain from the slotted spoon. The extra juices go into the burrito  causing it to become massively soggy in the bottoms half AND shower your hands and arms  and maybe lap if you re not carefull  in beany  meaty runniness.  - Their pork isn t nearly as flavorful and tender as Freebird s  I realize I m in the minority  but I ll stick with Freebird s.

Wow  this was a random stop   Had a conference in Austin  near Bee Caves and thought I d stop by on the way to pick up some lunch... picked burritos because I wanted to redeem the FAIL that last night s Freebirds did  for the 3rd time . Never heard of this place but found it a strip mall near a Walmart.  Went it and noticed that the menu was not much different than Chipotle or Freebirds so ordering wasn t tough. Toughest part was picking the fresh homemade tortillas  Settled with the cilantro tomatillo but bet all the other ones were great too. Built the burrito just like I like it  beef fajita  white rice  pinto beans  lettuce  sour cream  cheese  gauc and pico. Extra pico. I was so happy with the way it looked  didn t even add any sauces to it.  Good  First bite in. The buttery freshness of the tortilla  WOW. This pretty much made my burrito. Don t wimp out and get the bowl  tortilla is a must   Not as good  How they charge extra for sour cream... gauc I d understand.  Other to note  I didn t try any of the hot sauces  next visit will definitely eat in and try them. Another thing was that they had a menu of themed burritos where they build it for you  not bad if you can t decide

This place is absolutely amazing. The highest quality of every single incredible ingredient  starting with their fresh tortillas. Easily one of the best fish tacos I have had  but I also really love the steak fajita tacos. There is always a crazy line  but you can call ahead and order  which saves time if you re in a hurry. And no matter how busy  they re in a larger shopping strip  so parking is never an issue. The owner is really kind and has greeted us multiple times just to check and make sure everything was great. Really kind staff otherwise as well. So basically  you have the Baja Surfer vibe which works well  combined with amazing service and ridiculously great food.

Great place  Plenty of parking. Clean bathroom and interior. Friendly fast hard working staff. The burritos are big and great. The pop machine has all kinds of wonderful beverages. I recommend it to everyone

I went during a busy Thursday lunch  and ordered the Fish Burrito on an Ancho Chile tortilla.   I was impressed that the tortillas were made fresh  but mine was overlooked and fell apart.   For the fish  it was nothing more than fried fish sticks which was very disappointing.   I ll come back  but I ll be sure to try something else.

Now I know why the line is so long here  GREAT food  huge portions  and super reasonably priced. Loved it. A great menu full of options.  A must try when in south Austin.  Not sure I d go here for dinner  more of a quick lunch type atmosphere .

The food here is great  The only reason I m not giving 5 stars is the service. The get so busy that they really rush you through the line  and it s also hard to hear them sometimes and so by the end of the line you may or may not have on your taco burrito what you wanted. The food is delicious though and I will be going back  just maybe at a slower time.

I love this place. I ve been eating here since the grand opening way back when there was still cardboard covering the windows and it looked like an abandoned warehouse. Since then  the food is just as great as it s always been. And I like the people who work here too  many of whom havebeen working here for several years. The fact that folks continue to work there after many years speaks volumes about how management must treat employees  which is awesome.  In any case  the food here is delicious. From the freshly pressed tortillas  in differing flavors   to the tasty chips guacamole  to the real cane sugar soda fountain  Cabo Bob s does things right. I ve tried all of the meats  and I m partial to the steak  pork  and fish. The selection for toppings on the burritos tacos bowls are varied and should suit most any one s taste. And the XX hot sauce to finish with is perfect if you like a spicy kick   I could go on and on about Cabo Bob s  but I ll just admit that I can find no fault with it. I ve never had a bad meal there. This place is golden  baby.

Wow. I m so impressed  Fresh tortilla  so tasty  They even have fish for toppings  I didn t get it though  I got chicken. Everything tasted so fresh  I m coming back and bringing my friends  Not a lot of us know about this place. I can t believe I never heard about this place.

The best burrito I have had. End of discussion.  The fish burrito was really really unbelievable.  They have several different types of tortillas to choose from  as well as really fresh and tasty ingredients.  I have also heard great things about their tacos as well.  Every time I come I say I will try something new but I just can t get myself to not order the Fish Burrito.  Also they have really good ice.  Thats a big win.    They are a great spot for a fast and delicious lunch or dinner.

Cabo Bobs delivered exactly as advertised. Great food for cheap prices with sizable portions. I went with the beef brisket burrito and it was so tasty that I will undoubtedly be very torn the next time I visit Cabo Bobs. Do I stick with what I know is amazing or venture to try something else on their vast menu. I truly believe that no matter what I choose I will not be upset.  Everyone in my party really enjoyed their meal and the atmosphere is fun and lively even though it really is just a fast food place. If you haven t experienced Cabo Bobs yet you are missing out and you should remedy that immediately.
Good food -- especially loved the chips and queso  Parking was difficult on a Saturday afternoon  but once we got inside there was plenty of seating and the line wasn t too bad.

We are in town for the weekend and MAN is this place awesome  Huge burritos and super fresh and delicious ingredients. The house-made tortillas are awesome too   I will definitely be back next time I m in town

This place is great  Huge  7 dollar burritos and punch cards  buy 6 get one free . It is very similar to to chipotle  but with a few differences that make it stand above. First  they have a selection of tortillas that are made from dough and cooked in front of you.  They also have brisket and fish as meat options along with mango salsa and cabbage to make some killer fish tacos. Lastly  they make their own house hot sauce which I thought was really tasty. Idk if this is a chain yet  but it should be.

This place is incredible   I ve ordered Cabo Bob s for big lunches for my clinics but I had never actually been into one. It s delicious   WAY better than Chipotle and Freebirds  So many more options to choose from including fish and tons of different grilled veggies.   Salads  burritos and tacos are HUGE  Everything is fresh and delicious.  The 66 Red Pepper Sauce is a crazy delicious topping that you don t need but want more of  per the two guys at the table next to me... they were right    Cool vibe inside  We need one of these North  Cheaper than the other chains. I would love to go to this place any day  any time  So Good

This is definitely the type of food u have to thank The Lord for. I ve eaten and I can t get up. The chipotle crema is alright  not much flavor. And the 66 red sauce is just alright too  kind of tastes like a BBQ sauce  pretty hot. But I can t talk Or type I m kinda full. Mango pico yes  flavor of mango isn t strong and the touch of cucumber is perfect. I was gonna get the bowl to save on carbs  but when u see them making it fresh right in front of you  you just have to get it. I guess this is what real tortillas are supposed to taste like  great texture. Although he kinda burned mine  oh well. Ok I m either gonna go take a long walk or go to sleep. This is the equivalent of eating a Ben  amp  Jerry s. Perfect for after a breakup where u just want to be numb lol.

I have read reviews and have been wanting to stop by for months  but I m never on the southside. I got lucky and found myself in the area and decided to stop by.  The line looked very intimidating  to the door   but it went very fast. Actually  the line was long enough for me to finally decide what I wanted to eat when it was my turn to order.  I decided on the  6 Brisket  amp  Queso Burrito. My friend had the  2 Deluxe Fish Tacos. Both were very good and filling. We were both so stuffed we didn t finish our food.   Good size portions and good pricing.

One of the things I miss the most about Austin is Cabo Bob s.   You can t really beat the tortillas  three different flavors  that you can combine into one   and they are made right in front of you. The ingredients are always really fresh and tasty.  I always get the  9 when I m there. The burritos are massive so I usually eat half of 3 4 of one and save the rest for dinner.   This location is pretty popular so the lines can get pretty long though they tend to move pretty fast. What really blows is the parking  you have a Starbucks  a chick-fil-a  and a Walmart near by so leaving the parking lot can be a total pain. But the food is totally worth it.

As other reviewers have stated Cabo Bob s is a solid option as an alternative to Chipotle and Freebirds  but on my visit the rice was crunchy  which was a total downer and led to me knocking a star off. I think the food is pretty solid otherwise and may try the place out again if in the area and in the mood for fast tex-mex.

I don t usually write reviews but I was so impressed with this place that I decided it was worth writing about.  Let me preface this with  I m a huge fan of burrito s   Before I moved to Texas I was a huge chipotle fan and then I discovered Freebirds.  I d driven past this place for two years and had always wanted to check it out.  Today I went in for lunch and they asked me what kind of tortilla I wanted.  I chose the cilantro and to my surprise they pulled out a ball of dough and made the tortilla right in front of me from scratch.  Let me tell you it was the best damn tortilla I ve ever had on a burrito.  The chicken was your average better quality cooked chicken  the cooked peppers and saut ed onions though were a nice addition.  I added a few more things like sour cream  pico  lettuce  jalenos s  and some of their special Xxtra spicy Chipotle sauce.  It was a pretty big burrito almost the size of a Monster burrito from Freebirds.  They folded it so well that I was able to eat the entire thing without any sauce or pieces fall out of it onto my tray.  It turned out to be one of the best burritos I ve had since I moved here.  I really liked the Xxtra hot Chipotle sauce which added a nice touch but I wish it was a little hotter.  As a seasoned spicy foods fanatic I like my food hot hot hot.  For me it was maybe 5 10 hot.  Something with habanero s would have been an excellent addition.  All in all I definitely recommend this place.

Definitely enjoyed this place    First let me say  I have never really been exposed to Mexican food much being from New Orleans  but I definitely was ready to put on my sombrero and do a dance after I ate here      I had a fish taco with all the fixings and a veggie burrito on a fresh tomato basil tortilla that was just divine    Mind you I was SUUUPPPERRR stuffed  because my burrito was Ginormous  yes  ginormous  it s a word I coined and I use it often    To top everything off this place is super convenient  easy to get to  fast and great service
Its a great place for some nice burritos -- the cashier Alisha was super nice and I would recommend cabo to anyone
Easily my favorite burrito place. I prefer it over Chipotle or Qdoba which are my other burrito experiences. Not a huge fan of the seafood motif on the walls  but the food was top notch.

Used to love coming here. I had recommended this place to all my friends and coworkers. I was going here for years and had always received a military discount after showing my military ID card. Today  I was told that is not enough to get the discount and I to be in uniform in order to get it. I explained that I ve been coming here for years showing my military ID  but was still refused.  Too bad  I ll have to take my business somewhere else now.

BEST build-your-own-burrito option in Austin   Different tortilla options  which are grilled to order  not just warmed on a press like other similar joints.  They also offer a menu of tried and true favorites if you re not in the mood to build your own.  Their chicken is smokey and they offer some great salsas to compliment your burrito  tacos  bowl  quesadilla or nachos.  Unlike Chipotle  they also have queso on their menu and I ve even seen them offer seasonal soups at times.  Highly recommended

I m tired of getting ripped off here. Customer service is terrible  the food is subpar and they have messed up my order every time I have visited. I have given them many opportunities to make it right and instead they blame me for their mistakes. I order a kids meal  I get charged a la carte items  more than a combo . I ask for corn tortillas  I get flour. It never fails. Chicken  Nah  I hate you so I ll give you steak and then charge you more. I came here to support local business but they obviously aren t treating their staff right since CHIPTOLE makes more eye contact than these zombies that work at Cabo Bobs on Ben White. I don t understand how this place has a following.
Very good food. Very clean.  Way better than chipotle   They even have gatoraid and Dublin soft drinks.  The tortillas are made to order as well

This is one of my favorite places to eat. Soo fresh and delicious. The fish tacos are soo good  not too fishy and the brisket and queso tacos is something I definitely reccomend. The tortillas are made fresh everyday and right in front of you. What more could you ask for.

Been going here weekly for years now  forgot to Yelp how good it was. You can get steak or chicken fajita meat or fish along with rice  beans  veggies  and typical burrito condiments like pico de gallo or mango pico. 5 stars for several reasons   Doesn t take long to order and get your food. Staff is always real friendly. Portions are huge if you want. I don t drink soda but they only carry the good sugar cane Dublin sodas  not the nasty corn syrup stuff. Buy 6 get 1 free punch cards. Super cheap for a huge amount of food.. A step above Chipotle or Freebird s in my opinion. Great place

Burritos here are giant. And when I say giant  I mean they are almost my face size. The price is also a good deal. The taste  however  isn t amazing. It s good as a quick meal  but you can t expect to have the best burrito here.
I usually order online and have never had a problem. Good burritos and good service every time.
Everything I have tried has been AWESOME  Go early or expect a wait. The online order app is very user friendly and you can get in and out in no time at all.
I m glad I checked yelp for lunch today  It s the only place I ve ever seen that makes your tortilla to order and I could taste it. The fish burrito was very yummy.
This place is amazing  Great food. Great environment. Staff is super friendly.  They care about there food and you can see it when they make my tacos. Love love love

Happened to walk past looking for food and decided to give it a try. Delicious  My boyfriend says he still likes chipotle better but is different enough I would compare it more to a costa vida or cafe rio. More like a surfer version of chipotle. I recommend giving it a try. They also have a unique drink selection. Red cream soda as well as vanilla and sweet mint tea.

Cabo Bob s  I was so excited to try this place.   What I like about this place 1  Easy  amp  plentiful parking in a lot right infront 2  Clean  amp  pretty fast 3  Service was great 4  Lots of different hot sauces 5  Great variety of healthy toppings Sauteed Poblano Peppers  Saut ed Onion  Saut ed Zucchini  Shredded Lettuce  MoJack Cheese  Pico de Gallo  Chopped Onion  Cilantro  Sour Cream  Diced Fresh Jalapenos  Mango Pico  Shredded Cabbage 6  Freshly made tortillas  right infront of you  in 4 different flavors  Ancho Chili  Cheddar  Cilantro  or Buttermilk 7  unique sodas  What I Got   Pork Burrito- Brisket  Cilantro Rice  Baja Beans  Sauteed Onions  amp  Peppers  Queso  Pico  Jalapenos  Sauteed zucchini  Lettuce  Cilantro  Sour Cream   amp  66 Red Sauce  6.50  And I wish I could give a 5 star review...It was definitely a quality burrito... and probably would be a great option for vegetarians since they have such awesome toppings... but honestly  I think it taste-wise  it was just OK. I personally still prefer Chipotle s meat  amp  seasonings in their rice  amp  toppings.

VERY similar to Chipotle  except that they don t have barbacoa  Cabo Bob s has more options  seems a bit more fresh and they have different kinds of tortilla . There always seems to be a long line whenever I ve been there  but the lines moves quickly. I m craving it as I type this  If you like Chipotle  you ll love this place.

I love me some Cabo Bob s. I don t know if the owners discuss promoters or detractors  I know i do in my business  but I am definitely a promoter. Super fresh and basic. No added or unneeded ingredients. There isn t a better tortilla out there  I get there right at 11am to avoid the line but if there is one  it s totally worth the wait. It can be pricy but I always add chips  guac and a drink. It comes out to about  13 but for what and how much you get  that s really not bad. Keep it up and please add like 10 locations so I don t have to drive as far

I ve always been a chipotle kind of person but this place... let me tell you. I love the atmosphere  even though it is sometimes backed up you have this care free vibe that makes the wait worth it  The servers don t make you feel rushed even though they know it ll be nonstop. Now to the most important review. I always like to get something different and that has never failed me. Every time I think it can t get any better it does. Meat is always cooked perfectly and they have the best tortillas
My husband eats here literally 3x per week. He says ordering online is the way to go if you don t like standing in line at lunch. Delicious  amp  dare I say  better than Freebirds
Fish Tacos   They are amazing I ve only had this at Cabo s but I love them that much  I ll stop by every chance I get just for those tacos  so if you love fish i highly recommend these

This place is basically Chipotle. I got the fish tacos and the fish is sooooo gross  it tastes like dirt. Not good quality at all. Better stick to Torchy s    But I guess it is what it is. I just expected better with all the raving Yelp reviews... when am I going to stop trusting Yelp

Seriously love this place  Is it authentic Mexican  No. But is it an upgrade from Chipotle and Qdoba and other giant burrito chains  Absolutely   Their tortillas are to die for. Freshly made  chewy  and do a great job of holding up to the food.  I ve tried almost all of the meat options and love all of them  and they have more options for rice  beans  veggies  etc. than other chains.  They also make huge tacos and burritos so it s super filling and a great value. The tacos are almost too big - they include rice and beans which lots of places put on the side. I was actually surprised that one of my saucier tacos didn t completely fall apart.  They do catering  most of my meals have been when they ve catered work lunches  and the spread has always been great.  Be prepared for a long line at lunch - consider ordering ahead through their website though and your food will be ready to pick up in under 20 minutes
Cabo Bobs does not skimp on the portions. Their Just Fish Tacos are wonderful. Two thumbs up  They made them super fast  too

Best burritos in town  and the staff is always friendly. Tonight I came in after close without realizing they were trying to shut down the restaurant. The manager was incredibly kind  prompt  and helpful in putting together our order while not making me feel rushed.
