As a service industry worker  I love seeing good service even at the end of the night  and this place is definitely on top of their customer service.

This is my third time back to cabo bob s and it was delicious every single time   I can only review the nacho s for now...maybe one time I ll get something else but for now I can t seem to stop craving those nachos    The chips are freshly made in the restaurant and you can choose your meat and toppings.FYI the queso sauce is to die for    The meat is seasoned very well  Today I got extra fajita beef and extra queso sauce and was in heaven  I m visiting until but I guarantee I ll be back at least twice before I leave
The amazing service combined with killer food makes this place a 5 star experience every time. A million times better than chipotle

In Austin and really didn t want to eat chain but we didn t have a lot of time and yelp was very positive about it  at least at this location.  To be fair I would prefer to eat a few things before reviewing but it is very unlikely that will happen so the review is on one menu item.  The fish tacos.  Quite good but not outstanding.  I do really like the soft shells were pressed and warmed right in front of me.  Price was also very reasonable.  Good choice for quick and affordable fast food with a Chipotle or Moe s chain model.
The flavor was not good. The service was great but other than that the food was mediocre at best

This place is consistently good. I have gone there regularly for over two years now. The shopping center where it s located can get a little too crowded during the lunch rush  so I try to strategically plan my Cabo Bob visits before or after it. At the moment  I like this place better than Chipotle for their variety alone.

Ok  I work near the Cabo Bob s on Ben White and have not been inclined to try it until recently.  I figure that since I LOVE another taco joint  why try one that is similar in  formula .  I was pleasantly surprised when this turned out to be quite different.  A very California vibe with  somewhat cheesy  surfer decor and not just one flour tortilla flavor but four     The fish tacos are something only a 5 yr old could love  I swear they put fish sticks on it  .  But when I tasted the pulled pork taco I was suddenly very happy to be at Bob s.  The briscuit taco was also delicious.  Queso is made with white cheese and very good.  I will stick to my fav  Chipotle  for the best chips and guacamole though. Bob s is pretty bland.  Lastly  if you are in need of some soda made with pure cane sugar they have multiple options.  The formerly dubbed  Dublin Dr. Pepper  is now called Baja but the taste is still delicious.  After two visits it is A-OK.
Great Place. Our hotel is close and we stumbled upon Cabo Bob s and its excellent. Fish tacos were great as was the burrito bowl and queso.
2 Deluxe Fish Taco as you get a sample of all the tortillas  The fish is crispy and not soggy with it s light batter. A good quick lunch place with tasty choices.
My favorite place for burritos    Always fresh and you can pick your ingredients. So yummy.

I ve eaten a lot of fish tacos and most say these ads the best I ve had. Period. Get the combo that has the 3 diff tortillas. It s amazing   Will be back FO SHO   Don t 2nd guess coming here. Do it  you won t regret it
A burrito the size of a baby  And tastes just as delicious   Order the  10   Feed your entire family for a week.   OR feed Sally Struthers a mid-day snack.

Really solid food and great folks. Stopped in for a quick bite and I wasn t disappointed. Great value  food is large for what you pay and high quality. Would definitely come back next time I m in the area

I can t seem to try anything besides the Just Fish Tacos. That mango salsa is so good. The last two times the fish has been a little too salty for me. I still eat it. If they could tone down the salt just a bit then the tacos would be perfection.  The line is often long  but it moves quickly. Somehow we always find a seat.   The tortillas are cooked right in front of you and they are so delicious.  The noise level is a bit high  but I believe that s to be expected in a place like this.   I like the HFCS free soda choices  but I usually just get the iced tea.   The only thing I don t like about Cabo Bob s is the terrible parking lot  Getting out of the parking lot requires a lot of patience and care. Between that and the fact it s clear across town from me  I don t go here too often. I would not be sad if a location opened up north.

I would say these guys rank up there. The tortillas are ALL really good and made right in front of you  that is a huge plus. It was a bit busy and we went in super late   literally thirty minutes to closing  the staff was relaxed and polite. I tried three different tacos  the fish  the beef  and the chicken  all good. The burritos are massive and inexpensive for what they give.

This was an excellent find  We were visiting Austin for the Holidays and looking for a quick place to eat. A search via yelp showed us this choice and we decided to try it out. We are so glad we did  They have all fresh ingredients and make their tortillas right there for each order. Good ambience  Great food and Excellent service  We went back thrice in the 1 week we were there. Definitely 5 stars    Will go back again when visiting Austin next.

This is my first time eating here  and I was impressed with the menu and the fresh tortillas being made. I opted for a bowl with carnitas  white rice  tons of cilantro and the chipotle crema. The flavor of the food is good I was just a very disappointed in the temp. I expect the sour cream and guacamole to be cold but I would of like for the rice and carnitas to be hot. I would definitely try it again over Chipolte due to the fact that they serve cilantro.
I always come here when I m craving a burrito  it never disappoints  They always have good seating in and out. I love Cabo Bobs

I ordered the Cabo Bob Chicken Bowl and it was awesome  i was visiting Austin and i came across this place on yelp. The customer service was great and the food is better than Chipotle. Living in Houston  i wish that this place was out there. i will be back in June  so it is a must that i go back. i might just try the burritos
First time coming here and we decided to try the deluxe fish and the brisket burrito. The brisket burrito is huge  the fish was very good and both were more than fullfilling. Happy Holidays
My burrito was pretty messy but just as delicious. Got the Brisket and quest burrito. Was not disappointed.
Great great food. Simple menu but quality. Worth finding this hidden gem in Austin  It s on the south side of the street by other trucks if you need  help finding it

I don t live in Austin so was excited to try this place  I LOVED the fresh made tortillas and smoked cheddar flavor was my favorite. The fish tacos are super yummy and huge  I could have a whole meal with just one taco  The ones in LA seem to be so much smaller. I used to like Freebirds a lot but realized they were super salty and made me feel bloated after a meal. Cabo s wasn t overly salty  just the right amount of salt and flavor and I think the tortilla and the spicy sauce really separates them from the rest... Oh and I love that they have mango salsa  my fav. Def coming back if I get the chance

This place beats chipotle  free birds  and any other burrito place on taste hands down. They offer a huge variety of meats including chicken  steak  crispy fish  etc. I cannot stress how satisfying the burrito wrap is with four distinct and delicious varieties.  Finally  they offer old fashioned cane sugar filled soda s and a killer sweet mint tea. This is the first 5 star fast food-esque I have truly been to in many years.

If Jimmy Buffet bought out chipotle or freebirds and remade it in his image  you d have Cabo Bob s. Staff was nice  place was clean  giant burrito was burritolicious- it just feels like more of the same. Not bad  but there are so many places like this it s hard to find anything that stands out as unique.

Got a take out vegetarian burrito from here the other night and it was huge and delicious.  Most places hide the guacamole but I tasted it in every fresh bite.  The veggies and tortilla were all awesome. I will gladly return.

I have been visiting this place ever since they opened and let me tell you that the quality  service and taste is still excellent.  I loooooove their buttermilk tortilla. Their burritos are chunky  very compact  BIG  lots of ingredients  not stingy at all  ingredients are always fresh. I love that they make the tortillas there.  Eventhough I m hooked to their burritos  I have also tried their fish tacos and it is excellent as well. This place has a five starts in all categories  fast  affordable  taste  quality  quantity  friendliness.  If you are in Austin  try this place. I highly recommended.

The best burritos in town will not go anywhere else but here I am very satisfied with their service and their food will be returning again and will be recommending this place to anybody that comes my way   very clean and professional. The. Cheddar tortilla is the best I highly recommend it to anyone that has not yet been to Cabo Bob s. . Overall awesome location and environment.

Easily the best custom burrito spot in all of Austin. Simply prepared food with a great variety of options on proteins  veggies  and sauces. This is all topped off by the handmade tortillas which are cooked right in front of you. Simply unbeatable

I am a loyal chipotle fan. Whenever someone says another place is better  it never is. However  Cabo Bob s  even as a fanboy of Chipotle  I will say it is much better than Chipotle or any other burrito place.

Chipotle or Freebirds would definitely be better if yesterday was your first time to eat there. The tortillas were fair at best and the chicken was bland. The rice was undercooked and they charged us for a to go container. With so many other Mexican restaurants in Austin there are better places to go.

cabo bobs is so good. I love their queso and prefer their guac to other burrito chains bc it s simple. I love the variety of tortillas and beans and their protein is always good. today I got a fish bowl with baja beans  white rice  cheese and chipotle crema. so so yummy with queso and chips of course bc I m a proper Texan. the only thing about them that is not awesome is the parking lot  getting out of there is sometimes more than frustrating. but for cabo bobs you can be a bit patient.
Cabo Bobs is the luxury version of chipotle. You can never go wrong grabbing a burrito chips and queso.

After finding ourselves outside of the Long Center  we were hungry and looking for some place to eat.  I remembered that there was a fish taco place down South and we would never go there otherwise  it being a 30-minute trip both ways   so we ended up getting super lost trying to find Cabo Bob s.  This eatery is on the north side of 290 71 near 35  in the same complex as the Wal-Mart.  The parking lot is blindingly white  and the atmosphere outside is... well  it is concrete.  However  step into Cabo Bob s and the reggae-margaritaville soundtrack will have you transported.    We both ended up getting the fish tacos  albeit in different form.  I am allergic to mango and so needed to avoid the pico - which they were happy to do  but in case you have allergies be sure to watch the prep carefully so they don t put it on by accident.   I had a  noooooooo   moment there but it was quickly rectified.   Also got chips and queso  and all that good stuff.  The fish tacos were small pieces of tilapia - two per taco - in a crunchy cornmeal shell.  They were rather salty and medium-level fishy which was slightly disappointing.  The chips and queso were fine  everything was pretty much fine  and really salty .  Would I make the trip back   Only if I were going to San Marcos or New Braunfels and was hankering for a burrito.  Was it good for the area   Definitely.   The place was clean  the restrooms were clean  and the servers were as happy as you could be working indoors on a gorgeous Saturday.

I am so addicted to the green salsa here it isn t even funny.  Like I get cravings for it and want to eat it almost all the time.  Other than the salsa  you seriously can t go wrong here. Everything is fresh  the tacos tortillas whatever you want is amazing. I also love their chips  because they re super crunchy and salty and mmmmmmm.   This place puts pretty much every other taco burrito joint to shame.
Amazing tacos  Great sauces. Solid place to come crave your appetite. I will be back soon.

Lest you assume this is a creepy corporate chain  I feel I should  mention the following details   1. First restaurant in the nation to be fructose corn syrup free. 2. Totally F-n local.  3. Organic brown rice 4. real tortillas.
Try the fish tacos they are super awesomely good    The tortillas are super good and the ingredients are delicious.

Very solid food that s fresh and well prepared. Very similar to Freebirds.  I had a brisket burrito. The meat was tender and not fatty. I prefer Torchy s brisket to this place but they were good - just not spectacular.

Smaller than a breadbox  but bigger than a baby s arm...  ...is how I would describe the burritos here. Burrito means  little donkey  and that s what I felt like after eating here. These things are massive   go ahead  say it...you know you wanna  One burrito could have easily fed two normal people or at least be spread out over two meals. Not in my case. Yes...I ate...rather inhaled it in one sitting.   They have a black board with specials. Or you can do the custom route. Choose your tortilla  or option of tacos or bowl   then select your rice then your meat  hehe   next up are beans  then the standard filling options including pico  cheese  and a spicy tomatillo salsa. Imagine an assembly line a la Chipotle  but on steroids    My burrito is as follows...  Ancho chile tortilla  freshly pressed and toasted before your very eyes. Next up  cilantro rice with the option for brown rice. I went with baja beans  which as a blend of red  black  and pinto beans with garlic and onions. For my protein  I chose the crispy fish. Even after sitting in the burrito  it maintained it s crunch. They stuffed about 6 good sized  sticks  in the burrito. Not the minced stuff  either  I finished up with fresh pico  shredded cheese  and fresh tomatillo salsa. You can add guac for an additional fee. The flavors were bold and fresh. I don t know who this Bob fella is  but I can assure him...I ll be back

I write this review with two delicious fish tacos sitting at the bottom of my very happy stomach.  or  I did. I m finishing this review 2 days later   Cabo Bob s is set up much like Chipotle. You start by choosing your tortilla  choice of ancho chile  buttermilk  cilantro   then your rice  meat beans  veggies   toppings. What sets CB s a bar higher than Chipotle is the crispy fish option for the tacos and burritos. Seriously  AWESOME fish tacos. I got the Deluxe  the  2  which totaled out to be  8.65 including tax. A little pricey for fast food  but you get 3 PACKED tacos  so I feel like the price is very reasonable. Mango pico de gallo  big slop of guac. Yum. The quality tastes like something I would get at a sit-down restaurant. Fresh and flavorful.   Clean  fun interior. Tropical baja Cali decor. Ample seating.   Cool stuff  free wi-fi AND freshly pressed tortillas right in front of your eyes.  Bottom line  I M GONNA BE BACK FOR YOU  FISH TACOS. I gave one to a homeless dude on the way back from the restaurant. After all  everyone deserves a chance to eat some good food

You win  Cabo Bob s.  The guy who first introduced me to this place said something really cocky along the lines of  I hope you re ready to write your next 5 star review   and I ve been holding out on the review to spite him but I just can t hold it in any longer    FIVE STARS   I describe it to people this place as a tropical freebirds.  They re world-renowned for their fresh tortillas - you gotta try the smokey cheddar  It s a great place for any meal really  an economical dinner date  a casual lunch after paddle boarding on town lake  or post-game fuel for the entire little league team.  They have your usual chicken beef options but I m pretty addicted to the fried fish and mango salsa.    They have the charm and quality of a local joint with the consistency and execution you d see in a chain.  The staff here is always very friendly  I came here with Alex T. one time and we each got a single order of tacos...using 3 different taco shells...and 3 different fillings...and the staff laughed along with us the whole way through it   Love the counter service  self-serve beverage station  and outdoor seating.

My husband is a regular and he FINALLY took me.  We went on a saturday and I have to say I just love the relaxed  beach  type atomosphere...never mind I am a Cali-Girl.  Spoke to one of the owners  super nice guy and they are LOCALS...gotta love that.....the photos of the kids surfng on the walls are actually one of the owners kids  nice touch.  The tort s are AWESOME...........seriously......crazy good.   I had the fish taco s and they are great all of the items to can choose to go on it are freshly prep d.  I love real tort s.....fresh rice...even organic if you are into that sort of thing oh and pure cane surgar only.     Super clean  even the bathrooms  .  Ya gotta check it out

As most people have said  this place is a solid four stars.   What stood out to me the most was the cane sugar sodas.  Jesus....there is such a difference.  So good.      Cabo Bob s reminds me of a Chipotle on their best day possible.  Their home made tortillas are very good  they don t kill you with rice and beans like the other comparable places  and the people working the counter actually looked like they had a soul.  The chips are delicious and it appears like they fry them fresh for every order..at least mine were.  I will definitely be back.  The chicken was great

Friend tried  and conquered  to convince me how awesome Cabo Bob s was compared to Chipotle and Freebirds... let s just say that if CB was on the UT campus  anything Tex and or Mex would fail because of CB.  Chipotle and Freebirds are both predictable  so if you like to expect the unexpected in the burrito assembly line world  here he is. It all begins and ends with the dough - Buttermilk Flour  Ancho Chili  fave   Cilantro Tomatillo  and Smokey Cheddar tortillas - all start as a risen round mound  then thrown onto a two-way sledgehammer-griddle-disc-mechanism  squashed flat a la Wile E Coyote  and finally tossed onto the toasting turntable. Go see it to believe it.  Now  everybody s CB virginity needs to be lost with the fish burrito  6 hunks of fried fish fillet  the Chipotle FB predictables  rice  beans  etc.   and then... real choices... a squash medley  MANGO pico  sauteed poblanos   MoJack  cheese  and it goes on and on...  Top it off with with some lime and CB hot sauce...and lose yourself.

I returned to Bob s after 2 years away  and this time I was pleasantly surprised at the quality.  Perhaps  it was because I went during the busy lunch hour on a weekend rather than right before closing time.  The food was definitely high turnover  so food had to be constantly made fresh.  There was about 15 staff just spittin  out tacos and burritos and sauteing veggies.  The pricing here is very reasonable.  It is in line with Chipotle prices  and I will list a few comparisons.  Pros  pro-Bob s   Cabo Bob s is local  and it offers only imperial sugar sodas.  CB has 4 unique tortilla choices  and they are pressed and grilled to order.  CB has fish as a choice.  Cons  pro-Chipotle    Chipotle has more flavor boldness in meat and salsa flavors.  Chipotle offers corn salsa... and I love corn.  CB does not offer guacamole as a vegetarian burrito option.  Between Chipotle and Cabo Bob s  neither is better than the other in my opinion.  I mean  who does not like a baby-sized burrito   But... we can all agree on one thing... no one likes paying  1.50 for a slap of guacamole  but it is all something we painfully do anyway... with pleasure.

OK. I will start off by saying some of my dislike is because I never knew how to eat a large burrito. Ha Ha  Truth be told I didn t know you are supposed to keep the tin foil on and rip it as you eat closer to it. So Adam F and I went for lunch one day. I ordered the something or other with chicken and brown rice. It was ok but lacked the flavor that I am used to at Freebirds.   I tore the tin foil off and tried to eat it. It completely fell apart. I kept trying to put it back together but it kept falling all over the place. Suddenly I realized I had made a complete mess and what looked like a five year olds attempt at a salad. I ate about half of it but quite frankly I was embarrassed and didn t really like the flavors that much. I covered the rest with a knapkin and let Adam F finish his.  I decided to stick with tacos from freebirds since I am more comfortable with something smaller.

Got to say I like this place. After perusing Yelp for a recommended palce to eat  I tried out Cabo Bob s. Simple menu  tacos  burritos  but they make the tortillas fresh with your order. And the ingredients were a step above Chipotle or Taco Cabana. I had 3 tacos - beef  fish  and pork  beef was my favorite . Lots of different salsas.   The fresh chips - fried up to order - were delish. The pure cane sugar fountain drinks were a BIG plus  and there s still Diet Coke for those with the crack-like addiction to Aspartame... . I think I still prefer Freebirds but I m definitely going back to Cabo Bob s.

Move over Chipotle and Freebirds  there s a new Burrito Boy in town and he s captured my foodie heart and soul. After a recommendation from a friend and a massive craving for fajitas  I was directed to this awesome place.  I didn t know what to expect  but loved how they already had choices you could pick and choose from. When you re ravenously hungry like I was  the last thing you want to do is sit there and decide what you want in your burrito  or bowl tacos . I simply walked up  opened my mouth and pointed to the inside of my empty mouth and they filled it with the  8  Chicken Bowl.  With guacamole  mango pico and chipotle crema... it was love at first taste. Definitely not something you ll find at your local Chipotle. Oh and hellooooo Homemade Tortillas  The chicken was cooked to perfection and the prices are unbeatable. Feeding a family of 3 for under  20 gets major kudos. Also  my five year old dislikes the kid meals at other places  but he gobbled up his chicken and cheese burrito. Any place that gets my kid to finish his meal deserves our patronage.  We ll definitely be coming back for more and more.  And more.

Recently had the Veggie Burrito and let me tell you... thats some good stuff   I can t get over how huge the burritos are and how much is packed into them.  Easily could be enough for two people.  Of course I was in the middle of a bathroom remodel and hadnt eaten all day...so I was a fat ass and ate the whole thang   I m actually gonna up my stars to 5.  I usually receive 5 stars for really top end places  but the food is so good hear  that for a  fast food  place  it definitely deserves a 5

Cabo Bob s is pretty terrific.  When they first opened a couple of years ago I ordered the burritos until I realized I could only finish about 1 3 and started ordering the bowls.  This is quite a shame because the tortillas are home-made  right in front of your face under a large griddle.  You have different options as to what type of tortilla you want  buttermilk  ancho chili  cilantro tomatillo and smokey cheddar .  If you want you can also get tacos.  My favorite filling is their fajita steak meat.  All their meats are natural and the most popular selection is usually the fish taco.  They have my favorite fish tacos in Austin.  The toppings are widespread such as sauteed onions  peppers  mango pico  regular pico  poblano peppers  zucchini  even pinto  baja and black beans.  Of course they have cheeses  sauces and fresh lime too.  If you like soda you have many options.  All of their sodas are made with pure cane sugar and are all  vintage  labels like old school root beer  Big Red and Dublin Dr. Pepper.  They even have ice bins filled with Mexican coke in the glass bottles  along with Topo Chico and Jarritos.  I used to eat at Chipotle when I wanted this type of stuff but since Cabo Bob s opened this has been my staple.  The guys who own this place used to live in Baja and spent years fishing and surfing there.  The name Cabo Bob is a general tribute to the spirit of the free wheeling surfing dude.  Come and see what the fuss is about.

I ve never eaten at Chipotle or Freebirds so I can t offer up any comparisons to the competition but lemme tell you this.  Fish burrito is the bomb     -The green egg grills are cool -The made-in-front-of-your-eyes tortillas are awesome -The soda fountain drinks are insanely neat -The employees were friendly and kind  The only bad thing I can even bring up is the parking lot.  It s not Cabo s fault  but be prepared for a cluster of cars waiting in line to leave.  They have a mighty good burrito  but not worth a lunch time headache.

Sure  Cabo Bob s has a goofy name  is located in a shopping center and has the atmosphere of a chain restaurant  but they make some of the best Fish Tacos I ve ever had.  In addition  Cabo Bob s  I really hate saying   typing that name   is a strictly high-fructose corn syrup free environment. This means Dublin Dr. Pepper  and a variety of other tasty sodas  on tap. A loss for Big Soda  but a win for your taste buds   And of course  your individual tortillas are made to order  The process is novel and fun to watch but it s also proof of how fresh the food is.  For all of these reasons  it really makes me wish Cabo Bob s WAS a chain so I wouldn t have to travel out of my way to eat there.

I tried Cabo Bob s for the first time today. I hadn t intended to go there  but the line where I d originally been headed was too long  so I thought I d give the place a try. I was pleasantly surprised. Rather than the typical chain restaurant I was expecting  Cabo Bob s is apparently locally owned and had some unique surprises.  First  the tortillas are made to order. I tried the chicken fajita burrito on a buttermilk flour tortilla. The burrito was quite tasty  though the chicken wasn t quite as flavorful as Chango s. Next time  I plan to try the pork burrito  as the pork looked promising.  For me  the best part was the soda fountain. I was very excited when I noticed that the fountain includes several sodas made with sugarcane  including sugarcane Dr. Pepper from Dublin  Tx  Considering that the tiny bottles of Dublin Dr. Pepper are somewhere around  1 at Central Market   1.69 for a self-serve fountain drink is a great deal.  I d love it if they added whole wheat tortillas to the menu  but I plan on going back regardless. And I will probably become a regular  for the Dr. Pepper alone.

I m so glad  Cabo Bobs it s around the corner from my job. I treat myself every week for some deliciousness. I love everything they serve. Even there drinks are delicious. I m actually craving a spinach chicken burrito with que so and guacamole  oh and mango pico
Large burritos.  The seasoning of the sauces could have been better.  Served luke warm.  Wait service was fast and efficient moist of the time.  Very noisy bar atmosphere.

I first must indicate how much I love anything that has the word bob in it...BOB FM  The Bob haircut  so I had a feeling I would like this Cabo Bob idea....  and I was RIGHT   I went here yesterday because it is so close to my job and WOW it put the bob in the bob shoo bob do waa and the ram in the ramma lamma ding dong   I got the cheddar tortilla to start with  I ordered the burrito  which they are HUGE .  It was fun watching the tortillas spinning around and they are MADE FRESH.  This place is like an assembly line  so after you get your fresh tortilla you are guided through and get to pick what you want to  like Freebirds  and then you pay and then you move on.  A highlight of this place for me  aside from the SURF decor that I LOVE  was the AMAZING fountain drink area   Bobtastic    They have imperial sugar fountain drinks Dublin Dr. Pepper  an orange drink made with imperial sugar  all of the drinks were  a regular cola  a root beer  and a MARVELOUS imperial sugar lemonade that is the perfect balance of sweet and tart   This place was so crowded yesterday   It is a very casual place but is so very good  too    I will be ready to go back soon      I also really appreciated their Fuel For The Journey Motto  again a huge fan of JOURNEY  the band   they had going on in there  I found that to be not only accurate but highly appropriate

I love Cabo Bobs  I wish they would come up to Plano  but I used to go to Cabo Bob s in various locations around Austin 5 days a week for multiple years and my visits back to Austin are not the same without a burrito with a fresh pressed tortilla. Even with all of those visits  my enthusiasm has not wavered in the slightest and it s still one of my favorite places on earth. If I could have food from only one restaurant for the rest of my life  it would be Bobs.   This location has some tricky parking  but don t let that detour you if you haven t been

I love my Mecican food   This place is the Chipotle killer.  Anyone who goes to Chipotle instead of Cabo Bob s is on crack cocaine and has a limp tongue.  Better rice  better beans  better veggies - zucchini and squash   Ask Chipotle for zucchini and squash and their head might explode.  Poblano and Onions   Give me my veggies.  Aye Papi
Super yummy  flavorful tacos served in an efficient manner.  Convenient and easy on the wallet too.

We. Love. Cabo. Bob s   Do not let the long line  or lack of parking deter you - Cabo Bob s is a must   It is less than  10 for a build your own burrito or bowl  think Chipotle   and the portions are definitely filling. There is indoor and outdoor seating  dog friendly  and super nice employees - what more could you ask for  Hint - get some limes to squeeze over your burrito or bowl  it just adds an extra something special     Give Cabo Bob s a try - you will not regret it

Just another version of chipotle with not as many options. Its over rated and over priced for the portion sizes. the QUESO is a HELL NO from this place. Its literally just melted velveta with no other flavor  I couldn t even eat it.

Came on a Monday evening. There was some parking up front but it looked like we snagged the last available one. It was crowded though there was space in the outdoor seating. Like what other yelpers have described this place  it s like a Chipotle 2.0 setup. They make their own tortillas in front of you  I got the brisket burrito with the cilantro tomatillos tortilla.  Ambiance  4 5 Very college dining fee Service  5 5 Despite the long line they were fast Food  5 5 It was absolutely delicious  The thing that sets it apart is the freshly made tortilla that you get to choose the batter and see them make in front of you. It was the perfect amount of chewiness  In addition to the brisket I included pablano peppers  onions  zucchini and other fillings. The chips were also amazing   Coming from NC  I wish they have one of these over there  I would definitely be a regular

I was craving trying their  build your own  bowl. The last time I ate here was four years ago  and I remember it being better than chipotle. Recently  I ve been hearing more about how great this place is.   My sister and boyfriend decided to take me here to try it again. The food was fresh and delicious. There is plenty of variety in both meat  tortillas  salsas  and veggies here. They offered local craft sodas  and the food came in a very large portion.   There was parking available. There was lots of indoor and outdoor seating  with fans for a hot day .   This place is worth a hype  Give a try
I love this place. The Baja fish tacos are as good as you re going to find in Austin and their portions are huge

Food  6 5 AMAZING MEXICAN FOOD  I have never had such good Mexican food in my life. They literally make the tortillas right in front of your face  and they even make different flavors of them  All the ingredients are super fresh and the meat is great    Service  4 5 All the staff wear gloves and masks. They are very friendly and diligent. They move fast  while making sure they don t mess up your order.   Quality  4 5 They have an outdoor and indoor dining area with nice chairs and tables. They sanitize the furniture between customers  and make sure they are clean.   Prices  4.5 5 Very reasonable prices  We got 5 tacos and a HUGE burrito for  27  It fed the three of us  The meats were all well balanced in prices and there is even a  double up  on the meat for a little bit more   Overall  18.5 20  If I m ever in Austin again  I will DEFINITELY come back here

For the price and the amount of food  cabo bobs is a new favorite.  As long as they don t change the way that they pile on the food  I ll be a loyal customer here. The flavors sometimes fall flat so you need to make sure to put a lot of sauce on but as long as you do that  it is a good meal     I like how you can make it healthy with all the veggies and additions and overall  it s a great experience.   Also the burrito handler wrapped my giant burrito like a boss... somehow no big leaks  which I wouldn t be able to do..  Just check out how big this burrito is
Huge burritos filled with plenty of food. I always get their crispy fish as my protein and it is amazing  highly recommend. Load up with plenty of food and enjoy

We had a fabulous lunch on our first visit to Cabo Bob s. The fish tacos were as amazing as all had said they were and would be at this location.  I loved the corn tortillas and the mango salsa as well as the chips and queso.  The manager  Edward was very kind and interested how we liked our lunch. I loved that he referred to us as guest and not customers  guest has a better connotation ring to it. We will be back... not tomorrow  but soon. Thanks for a pleasant lunch. Your guest Linda

The best of the make your own burrito places. Fresh ingredients  lots of food  and the best tortillas and chips make Cabo Bob s a standout. Fast efficient service with plenty of staff to navigate all the offerings.

I love chipotle - but then I had Cabo Bob s  WOW - it was so delicious   I m so glad that I decided to stop by. Everything tasted fresher      I decided to build my own burrito  amp  got Smokey Cheddar flavor as my choice of tortilla  amp  Shredded Pork as my choice of meat. It was really cool seeing them press the dough into a tortilla - that s when you know they make it fresh  The mango pico topping is life-changing - the cucumber in it balances the meat and cheese out.   The process was like chipotle  where you tell them what you want  amp  they add it in. I really like how they have a plastic divider with the choices on it  so you can just point what you want.   I hope they open one near Bee Cave so I don t have to drive 25 minutes

You can t go wrong with the ancho chile tortilla. All the tortillas are freshly grilled right in front of you  which lends to their perfect combo of warmth  fluffy-yet-grilled texture  and amazing taste.   The selection of ingredients is unique  roasted poblanos  squash  grilled onions  and flavorful. The excellent quality of the food here is consistent and served with a friendly smile.   There s a sizeable  covered outdoor eating space with fans that s perfect for enjoying outdoor dining.

One of our most visited restaurants in Austin    This is a staple for us  I ve only ever gotten the fish tacos and that s never gonna change  The fish feels crunchy and light. It s seriously perfect. The portions are generous and the tortillas are made in house  I get one buttermilk tortilla and two ancho chili tortillas.

It s often packed with students  and the crowds make the wait long but you can t beat a fresh made tortilla. They let you mix flavors  so your tortilla can be a hybrid if you want. I do a veggie burrito with mango pico. They have a punch card rewards system.
Love this place  professional and speedy. Great flavors and amazing portion sizes compared to others.
I don t know why it took me so long to discover this place  it s awesome    Perfect for catering parties at a reasonable price too. Highly recommend this place.

There is a reason why this place is constantly teeming with students.  I would say this Cabo is the superior version of Chipotle  worth walking the extra few blocks from campus.  You can t really go wrong with anything of their food options - though their burritos are legendary. Many meat options to choose from  would recommend their fried fish. And from there  the rest of their topping options are plentiful  I would recommend the baja beans and the mango pico    All the employees are wonderful  the restaurant is super clean and lively. Great place for all ages

Bad timing at 8 30 on a Monday night  line out the door.  The kitchen tried to work quickly but it took a long time.  Finally got orders in  sat down and munched.  Food was good  tasty fish tacos and chicken burritos.  This issues was my daughter got back to the dorm and was immediately sick.  Not a great start for move in day.  Also  I was a little concerned as we were waiting in line.  We had someone be come in off the street  get a water cup and then proceed to hit every different drink at the fountain.  I hope this is not tied to the sickness.

Think Chipotle but better... a LOT better. Not only are the ingredients more flavorful and not soaked in salt  it s also cheaper  For anyone looking for a good burrito with really tasty tortilla choices  definitely come.  Cilantro tomatillo is my favorite tortilla. The bits of springy-ness from the cilantro helps make an otherwise really heavy burrito a bit easier to stomach and more flavorful. I always ask for the tortillas to be toasted for a little extra longer  and the slightly crispy exterior plus the chewiness of the rest the tortilla and fillings tastes amazing. Fill the burrito with whatever you want  it ll taste good regardless  and definitely give their specialty sauces a try. Their 66 Red Sauce is a more acidic barbecue sauce  and if you like spice  try their XXtra Hot sauce that s both smoky  spicy  and really tasty.   Cabo Bob s always hits the spot  and is definitely worth a visit whether you re from Austin or just visiting
Love this place  The people  the ambiance  the food  esp. the tortillas  all wonderful

I got to try Cabo Bob s Burritos during my trip to Austin  and it was definitely one for the books. Firstly  the parking is minimal. We definitely had to spend a few minutes  trying to look for some parking. When we got inside  we didn t have to walk far because the line was all the way to the door. This was perfect because we got to look through the menu a little bit and decide on what to order  and the service was super fast anyways.  Cabo Bob s Burritos is a  Chipotle -restaurant styled  where you get to pick your fillings  as you like. The thing that makes Cabo Bob s stand out  is the freshly pressed tortillas. Me and my party got the Ancho chilli and Cilantro tomatillo mix tortilla with the Baja fish. We got our variety of toppings  and sat down. I d like to commend Cabo Bob s for their serving sizes because the size of one burrito was perfect for two people to share. But the burrito. It was so delicious  I still think about this burrito  all the way in Florida. If I ever come to Austin again  I would come just for this burrito. HIGHLY recommend.

The burritos here are good. For the style of burrito that they are  they re great. The ingredients are top notch and their tortilla  flour tortilla  game is on point with 4 distinct selections to choose from.  The burritos here aren t really my thing but my family loves them. I typically go with the fish tacos on ancho tortilla and am never disappointed. My only nitpick is that that quality of corn tortilla is lacking and doesn t make it a real option here. I say it s a nitpick because only a handful of places do not have the same issue.  Aside from the food  the people that work here are always fantastic. Professional  polite  and genuinely friendly. More than happy to come here for this reason and the couple of times I ve had any issues they resolve them quickly and with a smile.   I concur with any good compliments you ve read here regarding the food and service. That  however  is not why I m here.    Not the food   You say   Not the service   you inquire     Then what is it   you demand   I ll tell you what it is. The bathrooms. Sure they re single occupancy  which is the best when they re free and the worst when there s a line  but god dammit are the acoustics incredible. I don t know if it s the tile or the high ceilings or the combination of the two along with an ancient aural spell cast within those walls. Don t believe me  Next you go and lock that door behind you sing or whistle a tune. You will be amazed.  I went in  semi-ashamed fat guy just about to stuff some more food down my gullet and came out feeling like Luciano Pavarotti.   12 bucks got me a totally unwarranted ego boost that carried me through the week along with some tasty fish tacos on the side.  Very good food  legit great people  and bathrooms designed  probably  by Hans effing Zimmer.
Had the  2 Fish Tacos. Three different tortilla flavors- ancho chili  cilantro and buttermilk- cooked as you order.  It was delicious.  The tortillas were flavorful.

I am loving Cabo Bob s more and more every time I visit. All their workers are really nice  and I love that you can mix more than 2 types of tortillas in one. I also crave mango pico sometimes  and Cabo Bob s is the only burrito taco place I know that has it. Service is good  and you ll get your food and be on your way in a jiffy.
So so good  I love their toppings and tortilla flavors. Really big portion sizes. The place is always pretty crowded but the line moves fast
Great place    Food is way better than that other burrito place that we won t mention  LOL . Service is fast and good

Cabo Bob s has been tasty each visit I ve had. I have now tried a burrito  a bowl  and a quesadilla. The bowl in my opinion is definitely the best out of the three. This is also the only build-your-own place I would trust eating fish from  it s amazing . The portions are pretty big so I look forward to the left overs my next meal  and unlike chipotle  these are actually super fresh  The rice stays hydrated  and yummy. Would recommend.

Cabo Bob s is a UT Austin cult classic and for good reason  They differ from other  Build Your Own  burrito spots by offering  4 different types of tortillas  crispy fish  baja beans  mango pico  and sauces like chipotle crema and ancho rancho  Plus the ingredients are higher quality which gives it an overall better taste. And the price is comparable to Chipotle  Coming here is a no brainer. I got to give them an 4 5 for doing a great job

I really enjoyed the fresh tortillas and house made  toppings. However  I was really excited to try the crispy fried fish as it had the top reviews. The fish was barely warm and I think had been sitting in the container for a bit. Was expecting freshly fried fish. Other than that it was good and enjoyed the tacos. I also tried the brisket which had good flavor.

My wife and I were walking around admiring the unique and interesting murals in the NW area of UT Austin and decided to have lunch at Cabo Bob s Burritos.  The parking lot was completely full so luckily we arrived by foot and inside found a long line of people waiting to order.  This is a place where you walk up  order  pay  and take your food with you for either take out or sit down. It s a great way to feed hungry college students being next to UT Austin.  The menu is basically about building your own burrito or taco. Looks simple but with all the selection of ingredients it can be overwhelming ... however they have prebuilt selections to help you out.  I was one of those people and selected the Baja Fish Tacos. The tortillas are made there front and fresh. As you slide down to pay you see your meal get made in front of you like an assembly line. No alcohol is served here which may explain why half the orders were for takeout.  We found a place inside to sit but there were available outside patio seating some with dogs with them. It s a nice mostly younger crowd with few parents.   The tacos were amazing and enjoy both. The fish was tasty mixed with Cabo s predefined ingredients and being full sized they filled me up. I was not alone where noticed many others ordered it too.   It was an excellent choice of eatery for lunch and afterwards went back to search for more murals. However they did have a nice one inside too.

This is one of the places I crave the most when I leave Austin for an extended period of time. My favorite thing to get here is the fish burrito. This is a great place to come with friends or just to grab a quick bite.

Sup  Mark the reviewer here. This place is the GOAT burrito place. I m reviewing the location by UT Austin. For  8  there s no other place that ll give you a burrito this size. There are a lot of options for the burrito but I ll come clean and say I never get anything besides fish in my burrito. The fish is fried and they give a serviceable amount. All of the additional toppings you can add inside include rice  beans  cheese  and a variety of vegetables. I partially like the mango pico. They add sauces at the end but tbh it s kinda hard for me to taste the sauces with the mountain of food I get inside my burrito. But my go to sauces are chipotle creama and lime juice which is a nice combination of sour and savory. Anyway  the size of these burritos are huge and fill me up to the brim even though I can eat hella food. In my opinion  the best part about the burrito is the tortilla. Cabo makes the tortilla in front of you and you can mix and match from 4 different flavors. The tortilla is thick and could fill you up alone. It s very sturdy and has good flavor in it. Let s go

Looove their burritos so much  Think of this place as better freebirds chipotle but with more options of toppings to put in your food and freshly pressed tortillas for your burrito  They have about four types of tortilla to choose from  ancho Chile  cilantro  buttermilk  cheese  etc.   and three types of beans  Baja  black  pinto   lots of meat option to choose from  even fish    can t find that at other places . Unlike freebirds  their flavored tortillas actually taste like what they are made out of. One unique option from their proteins is their fried fish  tilapia   and it appears to be very popular among their customers.  I very much appreciate their variety of options for crafting the burritos  tacos  bowls  whatever you prefer. A MUST visit chain when you are in Austin. I promise

Better than chipotle  more options  greater food. It s more expensive than chipotle  but it s well worth it. I ve had the fish tacos  brisket bowl  fish bowl and chicken burrito. Never been disappointed. However  it does get really busy. The tortillas  veggies and salsas are my favorite things to get in any food here

OUTSTANDING  Many great memories here dating back to the summer of 2015 when visiting friends who attended UT at the time.   The following words come to mind when thinking of Cabo Bob s   Flavorful. Quality. Filling.  It starts with the tortillas  which are made in-house right in front of you.  - White  Flour - Red  Ancho Chile - Green  Cilantro Tomatillo - Orange  Cheddar  Go with your gut. It might seem like a tough decision but you actually cannot go wrong      The next challenge  choosing what to fill your tortilla with. We ve never gone wrong ordering from Bob s Specials. Whether it s the fish tacos or brisket  amp  queso follow your heart s desire. As with the tortilla  there s a high likelihood you ll enjoy what you ordered.   And that s it. For under  10 out the door get ready for a FEAST.
OH MY GOD BEST FOOD EVER. I love this place. 100000  recommend. The only place that I take my friends when they come and visit. 10 10

When I say I want a burrito  I don t want just any burrito. I want THE burrito. Cabo Bob s is quite literally the best burrito place I have ever had the fortune of eating at. I ve been here many more times than I can count  all because of the quality and quantity of food you get. The value is through the roof  it s insane. You get MASSIVE burritos with much BETTER ingredients and TASTE for cheaper than what chipotle  qdoba  and all the other places can even think of offering.  The fish burrito is my go to choice here  definitely get the fish  chipotle cream sauce  and 66 chili sauce.

You can t go wrong with Cabo  It s cheap and has massive portions. Typically  I would get a bowl at places like here  but I highly recommend getting anything that has their tortillas. I love mixing the doughs. Each burrito can easily feed me for two meals which is incredibly  and I ll return even if I m not near campus anymore

Maaaaaaaan I am really upset with myself for not coming here sooner  I ve lived within a mile of this location of Cabo Bob s for the past 5 or so years and never thought to try this place even though plenty of people encouraged me to over the years. I ordered a chicken burrito online and within 2 minutes my food was ready - good thing I live so close  When I got to Cabo Bob s I parked in one of the curbside pickup spots and texted the number I was there. They were so fast that when I looked up from my phone  a staff member was already at my window with my food  ... yes she scared me  yes I jumped... . My burrito was delicious and I loved being able to choose a custom tortilla flavor  the smoked cheddar was perfect  I can t wait to come back for more

I dig the decore more than anything else. When I walked in it struck me as a seafood chipotle and frankly...that s what it was but that s bot a bad thing. I of course got a few fish burrito and destroyed them in a matter if 3 minutes which is good and bad cause I was still hungry . Been meaning to make my way back there  def worth the trip

I can t imagine my life before Cabo Bob s. What was I doing with my burrito life    I am in LOVE with their ancho chili tortilla. Their buttermilk and chilantro lime is pretty good too. I just love the ancho chili tortilla because it gives a unique rich flavor and depth to all the rest of the ingredients. Watching them make the tortillas right in front of you when you order  each order  is pretty cool too.   PRO-TIP  get the tacos so you can order all 3 flavors of tortilla to try them out or you re indecisive like me   You can definitely taste the freshness of all their ingredients. Pictured is their chicken tacos  come with 3 just 2 fit on the plate . I once got their fish tacos and they were really good too

Incredible fish tacos  ESPECIALLY because of the tortilla. The fish was perfectly crispy and not dry at all  the fillings  and jalepeno sauce in particular  were really tasty and complemented the flavors well  and the cilantro lime tortilla was soo good.

Literally my all time favorite burrito place. Cabo bob s puts chipotle to shame. I first went here while a freshman at UT and it became a staple in my life ever since. I went every year for my birthday while living in Austin. I love their cheddar and buttermilk flour tortillas combined into one mixed burrito tortilla. And their queso is soooo good  They expanded to the Houston and San Antonio area but need to come up to Dallas

At first the service was great but by the time I made it to the last two ladies all service went down hill. After getting back to our Hotel we sat down to eat and the food was just like the service Poor.
Literally amazing. This is better than chipotle  idk how it just is. You need to eat here.
A very big burrito  But it tastes good and is cheap. Recommend. If you are hungry  please visit.
The best burrito in Austin   I usually get half chicken half fish. Mango pico is the best addition. Really casual spot that usually always has a line out the door.

Chipotle but make it tropical  I love the from scratch  fresh tortillas at Cabo Bob s that come in    variations. I got the cheddar one for my  1 Just Fish Tacos  and they were lightly toasted and flakey  Like chipotle they ve got complimentary fixings that you can choose from or go with their set menu. I recommend leaning towards the crispy fish options  since their mango pico is unique and a must try  The pico is fruity  fresh  and a little spicy. I also got their chips and queso  which wasn t too exciting. Still some solid Texas queso though  They also offer Mexican sodas  always a welcome addition to tacos.  Usually spots near the university are too hard to get to  but Cabo Bob s has this huge parking spot all to itself. I came here during the winter holiday time  so there was even more space. Their main locations are scattered through out Austin  but this is a Texas chain for now.

Normally I never have any complaints when it comes to Cabo everything is really fresh and always tastes good but today my bowl was super greasy and there was an entire puddle of grease that I had to drain from my bowl. Really ruined the entire meal for me which sucks because I always look forward to getting Cabo.

Ever since living in San Diego for 10 years prior to moving out to Austin  I ve been in search of California style burritos Mexican food and this place does not disappoint in the slightest  I ve been here about 2 times so far but the level of customization on their burritos is incredible. Think chipotle but actually authentic and much more elevated  Last time I got the cilantro lime fresh pressed tortilla with grilled steak and all the fixings and I absolutely will be back to this establishment. They even have an outdoor patio for eating during these COVID times which I really appreciate. I ve even had their crispy fish tacos in the past and they were incredible   10 10 would recommend you check this place out.

My tortilla was under done and tasted like dough. When I told the crew at the front they were rude and acted like it was a chore to re make it. They were so rude. They barely put any rice  beans or meat in the second burrito. Rip off and rude workers
Really enjoyed the fish tacos and watching their efficient half-automated taco-burrito production line producing my dinner   This place rocks. Thank you

This place had a massive line when my boyfriend and I got in from out of town  so I had pretty high expectations based on how many people were at the location. It has a very similar set-up to Chipotle  but it is exponentially better. Despite how long the line was  they were able to move people through decently quickly. My boyfriend and I both ended up getting the tacos and they were delicious. It is a generous portion without being an absurd amount of food. When going through the line  they also have signs on the shield between the workers and the customers for the customers to point to so you aren t trying to yell which I thought was a nice touch. It was definitely loud on the inside  so this prevents things from getting messed up by difficulties in communication. The salsa was great  they had a large soda selection  and it is clearly a very popular place for a reason. I m from Ohio and was in Austin visiting and the next time I am in the area I will most certainly be going back.

We made a quick stop here for lunch during our visit to Austin. The line was long when we first arrived but don t be frightened  it moves really fast. Once in front  we picked what we wanted in our burrito and moved asking pretty quickly. There were stickers to help with digital distancing and everyone had to have their masks on. The was outside sitting since the inside was getting full. The burrito was good and it did the trick. It was big  do I had leftover to snack on later in the day.

This is THE burrito place to go to. If you are visiting Austin please do not waste your time at Chipotle or Qdoba. I I come here regularly  3  times a week  and I can confidently say that they make the BEST burritos.   Your journey starts with four different options for the kind of tortilla you want  you can also ask them to combine them to make your burrito unique  . From here  you get your choice of rice  beans  protein  and veggies. Their fried fish is my favorite- you must try it. Next  you can choose from a standard selection of toppings including sour cream  lettuce  and salsa. Last  choose your dressings- I recommend chipotle cream  lime juice  and 66 sauce. Their 66 sauce is incredible and I would honesty buy it in buckets if they had that option.   All in all  this is a must try place in Austin- you cannot find a better lunch or dinner place at this price point. Not to mention their burritos will honestly last you two meals considering how big they are .

My first meal in Texas was an absolute treat  We were looking for a last-minute place to grab a bite to eat and were lucky to find Cabo Bob s Burritos was open. I saw there were great Yelp reviews so we decided to give it a try  plus I can always go for a delicious burrito. There was a long line  which was not surprising given the fact Austin is a college town and it was a Thursday night. It gave us all enough time to figure out what we wanted. I was able to choose between one of their menu items or I could have made my own burrito - the choices were endless. Even the tacos looked amazing - I COULD NOT DECIDE   Before I go any further  I could tell there was great morale among the workers. Even though they were working non-stop  they had smiles on their faces and honestly seemed that they enjoyed what they were doing. I also liked how they guy who was first in the  assembly line  was REALLY enjoying making those fresh tortillas  yup  they make them fresh to order  .  D  I ended up choosing the Chicken Burrito with a cilantro tortilla. It was the perfect size  served hot  and it was absolutely DELICIOUS. This was an authentic Tex-Mex experience that you cannot get outside of Texas. I highly recommend you pay a visit to Bob s for a legitimate Tex-Mex burrito. I would definitely try their tacos too

Cabo bob s hooks it up  These guys know whatsup. No stinginess or low quality here. Just a solid meal.  Don t be surprised to wait 10-20 minutes in line. It s worth the wait. When you serve quality food  people will wait In line

This place is the BEST food in Austin Texas  The staff is so kind. Edward  the manager  always makes the experience great    Cabo Bob s is set up chipotle style. It is so delicious. Their homemade tortillas are incredible. My favorites are ancho chili and cheddar  Their 66 red sauce is the BEST hot sauce. Plus  their mint tea is something I crave regularly.   They have a location close to campus that is very convenient for students.

I love this place. Cabo Bob s is the best burrito chain and for the price of about  7- 8 you really can t get anything better. Usually  at restaurants when you re out to eat  you sacrifice quantity for quality  or vice versa. At Cabo Bob s  get burritos any size and stuff it however big you want. It s seriously the best place around campus and the best bang for your buck.   Food  Oh my god. They hand make their tortillas right in front of you  and they have a wide range of ingredients that you can t find anywhere else. You can t even compare it to Chipotle  Qdoba  or any other burrito place. You can choose from pork  steak  fish  which is bomb   and chicken among other options. Splash some lime juice with mango pico and you re all set   Service  Nothing out of the ordinary  but they sure don t question you if you pack your burrito with a lot of ingredients. Friendly staff.  Atmosphere  Great vibe  and there s usually a wait when you go at peak times  so make sure to account for that    Overall  it is the best burrito place to hit up when in Austin  maybe ever. Might go back this week lol.
tortillas are amazing   make sure u get it on the side if u get a bowl. it s a good everyday kind of meal and pretty healthy too  i loveee the fish it s so good

This spot is my go-to spot by UT for when I am craving some delicious tacos. For my order  I usually get two brisket tacos and one steak taco and it never fails to disappoint.   In terms of the overall experience  if you haven t tried Cabo Bobs you are missing out because this place is the best and I am going to tell you why. No matter the day the staff are always friendly and are always give great recommendations if you want to try something new.   Beware though sometimes the line can be long especially during peak eating times such as lunch dinner but don t worry usually this place moves the line quickly. Probably my favorite feature of Cabo Bobs is the vacation-like atmosphere as well as the punch card where after 6 visits you can get a free entree or a T-shirt.

To me this beat Chipotle  Uberitto  Bullritos  Freebirds  and all the other Mexican burrito places you can think of. They have this extravagant fish  which I ve heard is the most popular meat  because it s so good. Cabo Bob s has Mango Pico de Gallo which I absolutely loved. You can blend in 2 different tortillas  into one big burrito which I thought was sooo dope. Will for sure be hitting this again next time I m in Austin. Danrates  9 10 Fish Burrito    7 Follow me on Instagram   Danhafeats

Visited late on a Saturday night. Had a long line  but it went by quickly and the staff was very friendly and on task. The floors and restrooms were a bit dirty and seating was hard to find. The food itself was flavorful  everything from the protein to the veggies. In addition  they have healthy options  plentiful portions  and filling entrees. I will definitely visit again for a meal on the go

I ve only been here twice. The first time I got a fish burrito  which is their most popular item  and the second time was recent  and I got their best beef burrito. Surprisingly  I prefer the beef burrito. It was very melty and the cheese and beef came together well. Both times that I ve been here  I would only eat half of the burrito and save the rest for another meal  which is a very good deal considering how cheap it is. There s a reason why Cabo Bob s is so popular for students. My second visit left more of an impression on me than my first one  and I actually want to come back and possibly try a different combination or the same beef burrito.
Ordered a pick up for lunch. First time here. A buddy recommended the fried fish. Had a burrito with that  Baja beans and lots of other stuff. Fantastic. Will be back to try different things.

Came here for a quick lunch. It s the type of place where all of the items are on display and you pick what you want on your burrito bowl  etc. Everything was very tasty and portions were really good for the price. The restaurant itself was clean and had indoor and outdoor seating. Line was a little long at lunch but it moved quickly. We really liked how the tortillas were freshly made in front of you.

These tortillas are sent from heaven. All the ingredients are fresh and delicious  and you get a lot for the price  They also always get my order right when I order online  and have it ready quickly. This is my go-to spot near campus
We had a really delicious chicken burrito and I enjoyed the sauces that came with it.  The chips were thick and crisp which I loved.  Great queso

Surprised it took me so long to post a review for the best damn burrito place in all of Austin. If you find yourself hungry in Austin and you ve never been to Cabo Bob s  then it s time to ask yourself what went wrong in your life. Luckily  the answer to your problem is simple - Get to Cabo Bob s now   Easily  the best thing about CB s are the homemade flour tortillas which come in Buttermilk Flour  Ancho Chili  Smokey Cheddar  and Cilantro Tomatillo  but that just where the fun begins. Next  you load up on the chicken  the shredded pork  the brisket  the steak or even the crispy fish  followed by the beans  rice  queso  veggies and assorted toppings.   Don t forget the queso and chips and the sweet tea  or cold bottled soda  and you re ready to dig in.   They ve got several area locations  but we favor the west campus restaurant because it s the favorite hangout for Longhorns students and staff  especially before big games and after study hours. Grab an amazing mouth full  drop fewer bucks than you d expect  and hook  em Horns at Cabo Bob s.

Hands down the BEST FISH TACOS I have ever tasted.  I am NOT exaggerating.  So delicious and loaded with fish   I got the deluxe fish tacos with cilantro lime  smoked cheddar and regular flour tortillas. WOW. I was happily surprised by the cheese one as I have never found anything like that before   My husband who got a brisket and queso burrito mentioned how this was his very first time in years where he enjoyed the tacos more than the burrito    And I m talking about a  1 burrito fan who enjoys burritos just like a man enjoys Sunday football on his couch with a beer in hand .   The restaurant may remind you of a Chipotle just because of how the choice of the ingredients is set up behind a glass for you to pick more easily. However  in my opinion Cabo Bob s is a one of a kind. So  please  go and enjoy because I m telling you it s 100  worth it.

This is my favorite place to eat on campus. The way the food is served is similar to Chipotle where you go down the line telling the server what you want. However  something about their food makes it so refreshing and guilt free. Food quality is nothing like chipotle  it s much better   I usually order the fish bowl  tortilla on the side of course      with lime juice and all the veggies. It s a place where you can choose to eat health or not based on what you want to put in your order. Also their special flavored tortillas are amazing    This place is definitely a must try if you like great service  short wait  and great quality food.   Tip  they have a punch card system  After you purchase 6 orders at Cabo  your next order of burrito bowl is on them

Came here all the time while going to school at UT. Have never been to the other locations but this place was great. Somewhat remote and to itself. It provides a nice outdoor eating area away from all the commotion. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting the Austin area

No place will ever compare to cabo bobs. WAY TOO GOOD. I go to college out of state  so when I come back home to Austin  the very first thing I do before I even get home is go to cabo bobs. Theyre food is incredible.  I recommend getting the buttermilk tortillas for either your burrito or tacos. Bury me at cabo bobs. 10 10 every time I go. Love it

Hands down my favorite burrito place. Portions are large and all the food tastes fresh. The staff is exceedingly friendly. I have been going to this place for years now and it has always exceeded expectations. The ambiance is very nice and gives off beach vibes.
chipotle on steroids and delivers every time. fantastic casual dining place  and just as good for pickup

I love this place  It s so delicious and their portions are generous. Their employees are always kind and service is speedy. I love the variety you can get in meals  such as fish  chicken or beef. This place is way better than Chipotle and would recommend to anyone visiting Austin.   05 29 2019 - Place is still amazing

Hands down the best fish tacos ever  I always get the  1 fish tacos and it always taste amazing and fulfilling  The fish is crispy and seasoned to perfection.   Everything is fresh and made to order which is great. You can see them make the food in front of you as it goes down the assembly line.   I wished there was a location closer to me so I wouldn t have to drive so far. Great atmosphere and friendly staff. Prices are very affordable for the portion.

It has been said before  but perhaps not during a coronavirus shut down  Cabo Bob s is as good a Mexican restaurant as you will ever find.  I went in yesterday to pick up an order made online.  All the employees were wearing substantial masks and all the take out orders were well sealed and stapled.  As always  the place is immaculate and the ambiance is friendly and cheerful.  In the midst of this shut down there is even an optimistic defiance  everything will be made perfectly according to their high standards and the welcome each patron receives is as hearty as it is sincere.  Many have praised the food to the heavens  something it well deserves.  Let me add that  in my opinion  their buttermilk taco  around any filling  is absolutely addictive  in the best way   these are times that we are asked to practice social distancing so it is delightful to know there is such a superb local spot that allows you  in safety  to engage in a friendly community and be so rewarded with the best food in town.  thanks  Cabo Bob s
Great burritos and LOVE the queso   No matter what you get it s always delicious. Both the burrito and the tacos are both super great

I love Cabo bob s food  their fish is delicious  but I have to say this... they get my order wrong every time. And I mean every. Single. Time. Whether it s online or in person  it s incorrect. Today  in store  I ordered a  2. No changes or substitutions. Tried to make it easy. They still got their own creation incorrect. I had to ask for sides of three ingredients they missed. Pleaseeeeee do better.
The fish burrito was amazing    Had it on the cheese tortilla. Great vibes all around inside and out. We ate our food on the patio. The salsa verde had a nice tiny kick to it as well
Delicious fresh tortillas at any location. Great choices for any burrito  taco  or bowl. Highly recommend grabbing a bite.

Unsung hero in Austin for a burrito bar.   Cabo Bob s does not get enough credit  undermined by similar chain restaurants like Chipotle and Freebirds But Cabo Bob s blows them out of the water     Ingredients are extremely fresh and different from your typical choices with options such as the mango salsa and tomatillo sauce. No one else that I know of is doing crispy fish either  and they re doing it right. They do not skimp on the portions and burritos bowls come out huge.  Different flavored tortillas for you to choose from and are pressed fresh to each order.  It is one of my new favorites in town  I only wish they had some more locations up North  and that they weren t closed on Sundays.   Most of the time they do have quite a long line and moves kind of slow  but in the end it s totally worth it

Hands down  the best burrito place around campus. It s not even a contest. The huge portions  the variety of options  the excellent choices for tortillas  cheddar tortilla   Sign me up homie   and the many tvs  this place is the bomb. Only downside  the fact that its located in the far north of the drag. If it was located where the current Chipotle is on the drag  they will need a line manager outside the store.  I almost always get the fish burrito every time I come. It s the absolute bomb  By far the best fish taco or burrito you will have. The pico de gallo with mango is super fresh and phenomenal.  For  7  I definitely can t a find a better place that provides as much value. They also offer a punch card where every 10th burrito is free.  Have been coming here for 3 years and definitely will be back.
Blows Chipotle away.  That s all.  Nuff said.  I get the bowls  but everyone else likes their fresh tortilla options

Ordered online and pre-paid for a pork bowl with red  amp  green salsa  cheese  and basically all veggies.  Got it home and discovered a rice and beans bowl with no salsa and NO PORK.  Thanks guys.  Knocked it out of the park there

This is literally my favorite restaurant. Throughout college  Cabo has always been a place of happiness  great food  and great service. Whenever I have to leave Austin  one of the things that I will miss most is Cabo. Ivan in particular has provided wonderful service all throughout Covid. Anyone looking for a genuine Austin experience - this is the place.

This Cabo bobs is one of my favorites everyone is so friendly and everyone is so hardworking. They treat you like if you were part of their family. Once you come a few times they ll know your order lol. Shout out to Brisa I hope I spelled that right she makes the most sick mixed tortillas and is a bad ass at the dough presser. She knows what she s doing if she is ever on press ask for a mixed tortilla you ll be in awe   Thank you guys keep up the great food and service if I could give you guys more stars I would

Always a good place to go to when in Austin  When my group of friends and I arrived  there was a line that snaked around just to order. Granted  it was a Friday night and it took about 20-25 minutes to get through the line  but it was definitely worth the wait. I recommend if you do want to get food from here during rush hour  order online so you can pick it up.   The food was made quickly and looked fresh. They were very efficient and made the process seem effortless despite how busy they were. I got the Crispy Fish Burrito with a buttermilk flour and cilantro tomatillo tortilla.I also added my own toppings inside of it. The food was hot and ready to eat and I honestly don t think I ve ever had a better burrito than Cabo.   There was plenty of seating here  however  the only complaint I have is that the tables and chairs were slightly dirty after customers would leave. Other than that  Cabo is one of my favorite places to come to when I visit
The food here is delicious and the burritos are huge. The fish is lightly breaded and fried  but not oily at all. I really enjoyed the burrito with fish here. The chipotle cheddar wrap is the best

This spot has adjusted nicely to Covid-19. It has lots of outdoor seating and a quick  safe ordering process. I really enjoyed my lunch eating on their shaded outdoor patio.   I deducted a star from Cabo Bobs because its food didn t have enough spice and flavor. The recipes here accommodate too many palates and are too safe. This is an Austin restaurant and it should have weird  crazy flavors.

This place is awesome. It s like chipotle but way better ingredients and a much wider array of choices ie three different types of rice beans  multiple tortillas for your burrito and the chips are made awesome. Customer service is also very good here  employees greet you and try to get you through the line as fast as possible

I always feel like I m back in college since there are a lot of students and long lines. It only reinforces how yummy and greatly priced their food is.   The fish tacos and burritos are amazing. The fish is lightly breaded and tastes delicious with a squirt of lime juice.   It s build your own with soooo many great options. The portions are large  so you ll surely fill up even when you re super hangry  You can t go wrong with Cabo Bob s

Food  5 5  - I m not going to lie to you - Cabo is hands down the best burrito chain I have ever head. The variety is several orders of magnitude better than Chipotle or Qdoba with expansive options for tortillas  meats  toppings  and sauces. I live down the street from Cabo and eat here at least once a week  usually more.  Service  4 5  - The staff is nice and usually game for a conversation. The line could move a little more quickly  though they can t help when they regularly get swamped around dinner time.  Ambiance  4 5  - Pretty much what you d expect from a surfer-themed burrito joint. It s definitely a vibe  and you can t go wrong with eating in.  Value  5 5  - Cabo is several cents cheaper than Chipotle and the burritos are far more filling. I eat A LOT  and a Cabo burrito leaves me feeling like Santa Claus. Plus the punch card makes every 7th burrito free  which is a pretty hefty discount over the long run.

BEST BOWLS IN AUSTIN. Way prefer this over chipotle or Qdoba. Cabo s queso is the perfect taste for any bowl. Plus the nacho cheese and chilantro tortillas are the way to go  All of the meat options here rock and are consistently fresh and delish.

Move aside chipotle  Uberito  and firebirds  there s a new sheriff in town. Cabo bob s surpasses them all. Love love love the fact that they create the tortilla in front of us  as well as multiple toppings and sauces. The mango pico de Gallo is phenomenal. This with fried fish is my go to every time

Terrible first time experience. Food to pick up 300 minutes late  no delivery to car as promised. Cash register person didn t know what he was doing. Food orders wrong. Food cold. Didn t get what paid for. I ll never order or eat here again. Food quality also low. Very subpar.

Cabo Bob s made me feel like I was in burrito heaven. I have had terrible experiences with burritos in the past that either give me food poisoning or fall apart after a bite. My friend kept pushing me to go to this place and I finally agreed.   Initially  when I came here I was planning on getting a rice bowl but when my friend ordered a burrito I saw that they made the burrito tortilla fresh on the press in front of us so I was like hmm maybe I ll give burritos another chance. I ordered the chicken burrito with sour cream  cheese  pico de gallo  rice  and lettuce. This looked like a promising burrito and I was so excited to try it.  The first bite did not disappoint. In that first bite  I could tell all the ingredients were fresh and flavorful. The chicken itself was 10x better than Chipotle s  which has always tasted weird to me and is sometimes cold. I couldn t finish it because it s giant    The day after I wanted to come back. This is a place that would be impossible to get tired of. I just wished I lived closer because it s a 30 minute walk from my dorm       All in all  I highly recommend this place to burrito lovers and burrito haters  like me in the past . You won t regret eating here
The manager contacted me and gave me a meal on the house to give them another chance. Food was fresh per usual and no bug this time.  Kudos to the management here

I love this place  It s so delicious and their portions are generous. Their tortillas are freshly pressed and cooked and come in various flavors. I always get the steak  but all the proteins are delicious - yes even the battered fish  There are plenty of toppings to choose from when you build your own burrito  but there are also their own designed tacos.  The food was made quickly and looked fresh. They were very efficient and made the process seem effortless despite how busy they were. ALSO  if you re trying to get the most bang for your buck  I would suggest getting the bowl with your 2 small tortillas on the side for no extra cost  Their employees are always kind and service is speedy.

This place is the BOB.COM. I ve only been in Austin a few days and have mostly been eating and drinking  but I ll forever have a satisfied food baby from this place. The burritos are the size of a new born   This place is neat because they press the tortillas in front of you  and they let you pick the flavor of the tortilla. The concept is similar to a chipotle  but like 10 times better.   I got a burrito with crispy fish and the actual fish was cooked great and tasted amazing. I put some queso on the burrito and they was a great touch  They also have a mango salad to add to burrito which was a great sweet kick.   When I m Austin  EAT.
