Cabo Bob s is one of my favorite places to eat in Austin    For those that do not know what Cabo Bob s is  think of it as a local style Chipotle except with more options to customize your order. For example  there are 4 different tortilla options - buttermilk flour  ancho chili  cilantro tomatillo  and smokey cheddar - which you can also combine any of these different options together if you can t decide between 2.  I always get the burrito and typically  change it up a little each time I go and would recommend you do the same and try out different things each time you come in  Some things that I ve tried and loved - the smokey cheddar tortilla  ancho chili tortilla  cilantro tortilla  chicken  brisket  chipotle crema  and their 66 red sauce.  They also have a few TVs set up  typically playing a sports game   which I really appreciate.   There is usually a pretty long line around lunch and dinner time but would say not to be intimidated because the line moves pretty quickly   Overall  I don t think you can ever go wrong with Cabo Bob s  Great burritos and friendly employees   Note - they are closed on Sunday s

I love cabo bob s - the fried fish   FOOD   This place works like Chipotle and Q doba  BUT the best thing was its fried fish as meat option. Another really good thing is that the tortilla and its choices of tortilla. It s somehow manage to hold the biggest burrito...  ATMOSPHERE   FISH SEAGULL BOAT WATER  YUHH  amp  it s clean  SERVICE   They re great   SURROUNDINGS   It s far end of Guad-ish.

I can t believe its taken me 4  years to write a review for the best burrito place on planet earth. To give you a little preface    If burritos were people  Cabo Bobs would be Beyonc .  If burritos were NBA players  Cabo Bobs would be Lebron James.  If burritos were artists  Cabo Bobs would be Drake.  If burritos were animals  Cabo Bobs would be the GOAT.   Need I say more  I dare you to try this place out for yourself and see if you feel otherwise. You can customize the burrito to your hearts desire but below are the things you MUST get in your burrito  ancho chili tortilla  brisket  queso  chipotle crema  saut ed onions  hot jalape o  pico  and LOTS AND LOTS of Red 66 Xxtra Hotxx. You can thank me now or you can thank me later.

Really yummy and fresh food  The employees were all really nice and welcoming. The pricing is really reasonable for what you get and I had a good experience my first time. There was a pretty sizable wait time in line during the lunch rush but once you got to the point that you could order the process to checkout went very quickly and smoothly.

When Cabo Bob s first opened up on 71 and I tried it  I fell in love.  These huge burritos at dirt cheap prices   And fried fish tacos burritos too   Fantastic.  A few years removed now from college  however  and the luster has dulled.  I came back to Austin and went to the West Campus location.  I d been here before  but it was radically different than a couple years ago.  It seemed to be a thousand times more popular  with a 20  minute wait just to get to the counter.   This seems promising   I remember thinking to myself.   If it s popular  it must still be just as good as I remember    Unfortunately  not  however.  The burritos are still  admittedly huge.  You also get your choice of tortilla dough  which you can even mix   and you can watch them flatten and toast up the huge tortilla right in front of you.  That s pretty cool and mesmerizing to watch.  Unfortunately  however  the food quality wasn t as great as I remembered.  I had fried fish with brown rice  and the fish didn t leave much of an impression on me.  The small pieces of fish weren t very flavorful or substantial in the burrito  lost in a sea of carbs and veggies.  The brown rice too was bland and dry  making the burrito overall flavorless and a disappointment.  The veggies were good  but I left feeling full - filled with sadness and regret.  Maybe it was college me that was just so enamored with huge burritos  but I don t think it s worth it anymore.  If all you care about is quantity though  Bob s got your back.

This place is amazing  Basically local styled Chipotle Qdoba but so much better. If you re into big burritos  you can order one with a special tortilla  e.g. cheddar cheese flavor  since they make them in-house. You can also ask for a bowl   the tortilla on the side which is what I usually do. Load up on all the free extras  Of course  the queso and guacamole are good add-ons. Expect this place to be packed during lunch hour with college students. Young vibe and solid food  definitely a favorite

I remember going to cabo bob s for the first time when I was a wee little freshman at UT. Back then  I ordered some tacos which were pretty good  but nothing mind blowing.  Three years later  I m now a senior at UT and I can say without a doubt that cabo bob s is one of the best places in Austin to eat.  You HAVE to get a burrito  after all it s in the name of the freaking restaurant  The most unique part about this place compared to any other burrito place is that they have different flavored tortillas that you can get. Personally  the ancho Chile is my favorite but you can t go wrong with any of them. The best meat to get here is definitely the fish  it s head and shoulders above the rest of the competition. However  their chicken and steak are also really good if you re not a fish type of person. The sauces are also what makes Cabo s special. Their 66 red spicy sauce is super tasty  and if it s not spicy enough for you there s even an extra hot version.  The only gripe I have about this place is that the wait times can be really long during lunch and dinner hours  but that s just proof that this place is that good.  Once you try cabo s  you ll never want to eat at chipotles qdoba freebirds  again.
Bougie Chipotle is how I describe the place. Without a price upgrade  the food quality increases in terms of flavor and options. I m a huge fan of the crispy fried fish and mango salsa.

I have been to Cabo Bob s multiple times and  man  is this place WORTH. It s Chipotle-style where you go and tell them if you want a burrito or a bowl and the ingredients you want added.   Parking  There is a small parking lot right outside with probably  10 spots. I ve never had trouble finding parking.  Atmosphere  Light-hearted  casual. Indoor and outdoor seating available.   Service  The workers are usually pretty helpful and give generous scoops.  Food  This is where the 5 stars comes in. First  you get to choose between 4 different types of tortillas  made fresh in front of your face. I ll usually get the Cilantro tortilla. Then  the meats. I personally LOVE getting the crispy fish  tilapia . Sometimes  I ll even get double fish portions   If you come here and get these  add some chipotle mayo sauce to your burrito  and you are SET.   The burritos cost like  8 and will heartily fill you up. Come here and you ll won t regret it.

There was once a week when i went to cabo bobs 3 times in one week. I have used up at like 2 punch cards since i found cabo bobs a year ago. I always get the crispy fish burrito with the cilantro tomatillo tortilla. The tortilla is my favorite part  it tastes like those delicious asian green onion pancakes. I always ask for a little bit of queso and lots of lime juice  rice  black beans  lettuce  and cabbage. It s the most delicious thing you can eat on the drag in my opinion. Cabo bobs is better than chipotle and qdoba for those reasons  the ingredients and the tortillas.

Food  5 5 Uhhhh only the best fried fish burritos in town     And mango salsa   Hot sauce bottles that you can take to your table           And what s this....4 flavors of tortillas    Makes this place my favorite spot to get burritos in town  Also they have grilled onions and peppers. What a blessing from heaven  Service  4 5 The people are always happy to help. They re usually super busy juggling an endless stream of customers as well as call in orders. Great people. Many a time they ran out of my favorite fried fish. Got em freshly made and seasoned in just a few minutes. Love it  Atmosphere  3 5 It s a really casual place. Beach theme. Cabo bobs  according to them  represents the spirit of the chill  relaxed individual. I always have a good time w friends here  Bathrooms  3 5 Nothing special to note. Decent cleanliness. Gendered.  Price  3 5 You re probably going to pay around  8-10  That s pretty average I feel like. If you re not the biggest eater  a burrito might get you two meals

Hands down  this is sooooooo much better than Chipotle  After finding out about this place  I don t think I will ever go to Chipotle again whenever I m on west campus.  Cabo Bob s has the same concept as Chipotle. You get in line and decide which ingredients to put in your bowl or burrito.   Ingredients are fresh  meat are juicy  and there is a wide range of varieties for the sauce and the tortilla flavor. There are four types of tortilla flavors you can choose from  buttermilk flour  ancho chili  smokey cheddar  and cilantro tomatillo. My favorite one is the cilantro tomatillo.   If you re looking for the biggest portion size  get the burrito instead of the bowl. But that does not mean the bowl has a small portion size. I usually get a bowl with a side of tortillas  and I get full after eating half of what the bowl has.  There are plenty of tables offered both inside and outside. The restaurant also has couple of large tables that can fit in about six people for each table.  Gosh - I am so glad that I found out about Cabo Bob s. Thank you Cabo Bob s for making something better than Chipotle.

During the CoronaVirus pandemic  this business is allowing patrons to enter inside the main dining room without masks. I imagine the staff here are staying atop standards  the curbside delivery person had a mask  amp  gloves  but it s impossible to manage the standards of people entering   leaving  touching door handles and counter tops as often as I watched them do while I was in the parking lot waiting for my order. Won t be returning here for a good while considering this wild oversight.

2 years later and this place is still the  a href   redir url http 3A 2F 2Fbomb.com amp s bb4f996415a9c2f21137e27cfb68f439a48cec2652b53e9b50dd7e766dbe177e  rel  nofollow  target  _blank  bomb.com  a   I don t eat here very often  but every time I do go here I always end up asking myself   Why don t aI eat here more often      As you can see in the picture  they don t play with their portions. They re huge  They had to double foil my burrito  I prefer the ancho chili tortilla to make a huge burrito. This time I didn t get my typical fried fish  I felt adventurous and went for their pulled pork. I m glad I did because I think it s my new favorite now  Make sure you grab a lot of napkins  the juice from the pork will drip out of the foil.   Service is always friendly and seating areas are clean. Can t wait to come back again

Yum. Cabo beats them all. It doesn t get much fresher than this.  THEY MAKE YOUR TORTILLA RIGHT IN FRONT OF YOUR FACE.   So just imagine how far that speaks into how fresh their other ingredients are.   With several options of meat  and of course the fish  options never get old. I m pretty sure most people come here for the burrito bowl  and more than often order the fish. You have to try it.   I usually order the bowl with tortilla on the side. I ll switch up the meats and get almost all the free options. Mango pico is amazing. I ll put lemon concentrate and chipotle mayo as well as their super spicy home made sauce.   I m actually craving Cabo right now as I write this.   If you live in west campus and haven t visited this place yet  come eat here for your next lunch. I m sure you ll feel the same as I do.

We can t help but like Cabo Bob s. We d been once before  but it never really occurred to us to go again until the wait at El Patio was 1.5 hours last Thursday night. We quickly changed gears and came here.  The line is chaotic. The guy handling the grilling of the tortillas wasn t particularly helpful about getting our daughter s quesadilla made and the guy at the register was very flustered. Everyone else at the other stations was on it. The quesadilla ended up being pretty gross  as is the queso there. Everything else is pretty good though  one of us got a salad with pulled pork and a bunch of fresh toppings  the other got a chicken burrito with ALL the fixings.   There s nothing extraordinary about the food other than that portions are massive  prices are fair  and it s just a bit of a silly experience overall. Also  you get to support a local business. We ll probably be back again in another few years when the burrito craving strikes.

I wanted to love this place. Everyone was like  yes  Cabo Bob s is the BEST  I felt like  as the stars say  A-OK. The first time I had it I went in with the bf. I got the green tortilla  which made my burrito taste a little weird.  Don t get me wrong  I love veggies  but it just had sort of an odd taste to it.  The food inside was fine  but  eh  overall. I gave them one other chance when I was planning an event and a friend said they were fantastic.  So we ordered catering - we got chicken  steak and veggies. They were a good size  pretty filling  but I ate the chicken and it was literally chicken  rice  and maybe something else  beans  . I can t remember now  it was a while ago.  But I wanted more - where was the tomatoes  Lettuce  etc. Everyone seemed friendly  and maybe you ll like it better.  But I think I ll stick to Taco Deli or Chipotle  at least for now.
Best burritos tacos in town. Lines can get long on weekends and during dinner time. Good service  fresh food and really affordable
Their fish tacos are amazing  Best burritos and tacos at UT. It s busy sometimes but worth the wait every time

My first time at Cabo Bob s  It was really busy as it s a holiday and all the students were out of school  but we still got helped in a timely manner. The food was AMAZING  I got the fish burrito with a Smokey cheddar tortilla  there are plenty of flavors for the tortillas and they are freshly made  soooo good . Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating   a friendly staff  All around great place

If I had to pick  I would choose Cabo Bobs over Chipotle any day. You get to pick what flavor tortilla you want  and it s freshly prepared right before you order. Also they have much more variety in terms of toppings and menu  I usually get fish tacos or a chicken burrito. I like to add grill onions and mango pico on everything. Their chipotle creama is a must get. Trust me  that sauce goes well with all their items and brings all the toppings together. After my tacos are made  I like to drizzle some red pepper sauce on top to give it an extra kick.   Great place to grab lunch that comes under  8.

This place hands down has the best burritos in town  Fresh ingredients  including the wow factor of tortillas pressed right before your eyes. So many different options and crazy ways to customize your food  All the meats looked amazing  I had steak and chicken in my burrito while the hubby had the roasted pork. The flavor was out of control.  Every single bite was as savory as the last and I literally can t wait to come back here and try something new   Cabo Bob s did not disappoint by any means  well worth the wait

Every college student tight wallet adults  dreams.   Cabo Bob s knows fish tacos when so many fancy Tex Mex restaurants have failed me.   First  they give you THREE hefty tacos with at least two scrumptious pieces of freshly fried fish filets each.   Second  they make the tortillas right in front of you.   Third  it s less than  10.   You get me   P.S. their burrito is the size of a body builder s biceps if that fancies you instead
Can t beat their deluxe fish tacos. Don t forget to double up the fish. Great food you can count on.

I was so excited to try this place  given the stellar reviews  I had a free meal and then a free burrito on account of them sort of forgetting our order the first time--so  for the price I paid  it was decent  but I wouldn t pay full price.  Upon unwrapping my burrito I found it was busted open in the middle so I had to eat half of it with a spoon. This would have been necessary anyway though as the way the burrito was wrapped  all the good stuff was on one end. And maybe I got a bad batch  but the poblanos were kind of cold and hard to chew. As was the rice  which had a handful of really hard pieces in it that hurt my teeth.   The fish on the taco was okay. Just okay. Just kind of tasted like breading and was maybe a bit dry. They neglected to add the cabbage I asked for. The tortilla on both my burrito and my fish tacos were so soggy they sort of stuck together in a shriveled little cocoon that had the tack of something more like the inside of an egg roll. But this could be because they forgot about our order or something  For some reason it was 15 minutes late  they did give us a coupon for a free burrito though .  The veggie burrito as designed by default had no spice at all and while edible  was  even at the low price of free  kind of disappointing. The one I built myself was better  but the above flaws remained.  The reviews about the  guacamole  aren t wrong  it does in fact taste like plain smashed avocados. Where s the salt  The lime  I routinely make lazy guac by smashing an avocado in a bowl with some juice  salt  and pepper  and that still tastes a lot better than whatever this is.  The queso on the other hand was fine  although I don t know that you can really get queso wrong. I felt like the chips-to-queso ratio was way off though  as I still had half my chips left  even when going easy on the cheese. They also forgot our sauces the first time and forgot the chips for the kids meal the second.  All around a pretty disappointing experience and I genuinely have no idea how people are calling this the best Tex-Mex in Austin or the best fish tacos in Austin. It tasted bland  even with added sauces   looked unappetizing  had funky textures  and the service was consistently below average  aside from the coupon  which was a nice gesture .  I will say though that I baked the second half of my burrito  easily two meals for a tiny gal like myself  and added my own sauce and it tastes considerably better. The limp soggy tortillas are easily the biggest issue with the texture  and baking it was a huge improvement. I ll also say the churro blondie is great.

I would choose Cabo over chipotle any day  I love how fresh the ingredients taste and you can t go wrong with their fried fish. They make the tortilla in front of you and you can choose to mix 2 together  They have a variety of toppings and meats and dressings  I recommend the chipotle creme and fresh lime juice.   Deff get a punch card  It s so worth     Sometimes the lines can get long but they usually move pretty quickly. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. I also never have trouble finding parking at this place

Step aside Chipotle Freebirds Qdoba  This is the must-go for a quick burrito in town. Their tortillas are freshly pressed and cooked and come in various flavors. I always get the steak  but all the proteins are delicious - yes even the battered fish  There are plenty of toppings to choose from when you build your own burrito  but there are also their own designed tacos. ALSO  if you re trying to get the most bang for your buck  I would suggest getting the bowl with your 2 small tortillas on the side for no extra cost   At the end  be sure to use your punch card as you get your 6th meal free  Don t forget to grab their sauces too - it s more on the barbecue side but their XXTRA hot one will definitely make your nose run  Never disappoints and worth the trek from campus
It s a cool experience to see your tortillas being prepared in front of your eyes. They have a great variety of fillings. Pretty cheap and tasty

Delicious   We were headed to Torchy s because we were from out of town and we know Torchy s.  So glad we stopped and ventured in.  Long line but it moved fast.  Great burritos and queso.  Great service  too.

It s months later and I still remember my burrito from Cabo Bob s  I have NEVER had a better burrito  Everybody needs to stop here whether you live there or are just passing through like I was. I am so sad that I can t get this where I live. Enjoy it Austin

After reading other reviews of it being too crowded inside and the fact the pandemic is still happening we decided curbside pickup was the best option and it was so yummy  the reviews were right no one was social distancing so overall picking up was great decision

Definitely 100 times better than any other burrito place out there. Way better than Chipotle or Free Birds. You can get a free entree if you make 6 purchases. Also  they let you mix two different burrito flavors. I highly recommend the Smokey Cheddar Ancho Chile tortilla and a side of Chipotle sauce to pour on your burrito.

This place is delicious. And cheap. For  6-7 you can get three tacos or a huge burrito. The place is set up chipotle style where you can customize your meal thru the line. They also have a menu with ingredients listed if you re not picky and don t feel like picking and choosing thru all the choices of fixings. I got the Baja fish tacos and the flavor was great  they put a good amount of fish  and the tortillas held up the weight of all the fixings. Water was free and drinks cost extra. The only problem we had was with the service. I called ahead to see if our dog could come and the man who answered said no dogs were allowed. A friend told us he s seen dogs there before so we took a gamble and when we got there a lady worker told us it was perfectly ok. The parking lot is also small so I would suggest street neighborhood parking.

This place is an Austin staple. It s fast  causal and close to the UT campus. They have fresh pressed tortillas offered in 4 different flavors  tacos  burritos and bowls. I personally always get fish tacos or a bowl. The servings are generous and the service is quick. The sauces are delicious. I like the kick in the extra hot sauce  Perfect to spice up my entree. All of this for under  10  you can t beat it
The food s good but you could find better places somewhere else. Also  we were able to make tacos just like theirs. It s just like Chipotle or Freebirds.

Good tacos  burritos  and bowls  but the line at this particular location is ridiculous during lunch dinner hours - especially when UT has a game or during graduations.  The one on Ben White would be a better option . 4 star for food  3 for location and wait. Parking is tough during lunch dinner.  Fish tacos are their signature  but their chicken is actually really great. Mango pico is on point.

You absolutely have to come here if you re really hungry. Like you ve probably heard  this place is basically the same concept as Chipotle  where you choose the ingredients that go into your bowl burrito. Unlike Chipotle  which gives you more food if you get the bowl  Cabo Bob s actually gives you more if you get the burrito. In other words  get the burrito if you re choosing between that or a bowl.  Everyone says the ingredients here taste fresher than Chipotle s and it really did feel like they were. If you come here you have to get the fish  like when you choose your meat at Chipotle  except fish isn t an option there  cause that s the best. Fish tacos are just amazing. But really though. Solid option over Chipotle. Just wish it was closer to campus

One of my all-time favorite restaurants in Austin. Cabo Bob s is like Chipotle but 1000000x better  seriously. Get a burrito bowl with queso on top and you ll be in heaven. It s usually my first stop when I land.

My friend is notorious for having the worst palate. His favorite restaurant is CiCi s Pizza  birthday celebrations have taken place here AS AN ADULT . He once said he would take a girl out on a first date to McDonald s  and let her order off the non-value menu.     As you can see  I was skeptical when he told me that Cabo Bob s is legit. Plus  with its location in West Campus  which is generally known for average but overpriced food  I was thinking this might be a trap.   All my doubts vanished when I walked up to the front of the line. I was asked to pick a tortilla flavor. Cilantro tomatillo  please. The guy plops down little colorful balls of dough on the tortilla press and flips them around until they re slightly browned. Yes  Their tortillas are freshly made  And it makes a WORLD of a difference in taste. The rest of the line is done Chipotle-style- customize ingredients to your liking. Let me be clear  I despise Chipotle and would have to be paid to eat there  but this place is higher quality  way fresher  and tastier.   I selected the deluxe fish tacos  and told them to put everything on it. Mango pico  guacamole  cabbage  2 generous pieces of fried fish  all wrapped in a warm  soft tortilla. This is no ordinary fish taco. This is a fish taco I d eat every day for the rest of my life.   Looks like my friend upped his food game  so I ll have to give him more credit. Seriously  the tortillas are bomb. I don t want to waste any more time trying to convince you. JUST GO GET YOU SOME.
Tiny burritos  super inconsistent. Picture of my burrito next to a normal size lighter for reference.

I love cabo  probably the best burrito place in austin  and there s a good reason why. It s not only delicious but you get your money s worth. The restaurant is similar to chipotle in that you pick every ingredient in your burrito. You can also request a bowl or a tortilla. What s unique is that the dough for the tortillas is pretty much cooked in front of you. They compress it in some machine and then cook it on some large circular heated rotating disk.  I normally get the cilantro tortilla  which is the green colored dough  and always add fish as my meat. Without fail  I have never been disappointed by these selections. The burrito costs like  9 dollars  but you ll be so full. The one gripe I have is that sometimes they rip the tortilla when they wrap the burrito so eating it becomes really messy for me. They did this last time I was here.  Parking can be a little bit of a challenge as the lot is pretty cramped. Other than that  the ambiance is nice. You shouldn t have trouble finding seats as you can always go outside if the inside of the building is a little cramped.

Wow  Out of all the reviews I have written  I can t believe I forgot to do this one  well now it s about time I write about it   Cabo Bob s is out of this world. Whether you come for the first time or the thousandth time  Cabo Bob s will never fail you. They have a delicious assortment of meats  veggies  toppings and tortilla selections. This place is way better than Chipotle...or Freebirds...or anything alike   When you first go  you smell the Mexican flavors from the rice and beans to their delicious fish  oh my goodness  it s like an addiction  you can t ever have enough fish . If this your first time going  please order the fish. I don t care if it s in a taco or a burrito  just get the fish. That is all I have to say about that.  My usual run down for this burrito creation is these steps  Half and half tortilla with Tomatillo and Cheddar  White Rice  Black Beans  Fish  Grilled Onions  Zucchini  Cheese  Lettuce  Pico de Gallo  Cilantro  Cabbage  Mango Salsa  Chipotle Crema and Limes on the side.  Give it a try  It s definitely the best mexican burritos in town  and located in North Campus
Two words  FISH TACOS.  Wow. These are delicious.  But so are the rest of their tacos   I love this place. Every ingredient is delicious and the atmosphere is chill.

I come here a few times a week  it is so very good.  Everything is delicious  the portions are huge and the service is fast.   Be sure to get a frequent burrito card to get a free burrito after you rack up enough punches
There is no better place to get a burrito than Cabo Bobs. Anything you get is 5 Stars and there s nothing else to say.
Mediocre. It looks awesome with the freshly made tortillas but the food tastes bland. Wish the fish was available grilled too  would be better than fried alone.

O M G. If you haven t been to this place you have to go    My sister has been telling me for months this place is better than other burrito places and she is definitely right. They have so many options and THEY MAKE THEIR OWN TORTILLAS right when you order -- game changer. All the ingredients are amazing  the meat is so juicy  and they have several veggies options. The line was out the door when we got there for a late lunch but the line moved quickly and it was definitely worth it. I can t wait to go back.

I ve been to this Cabo Bobs 5 or 6 times and everything I ve ordered has been great. The meat is always perfectly cooked  and the non-meats are always fresh. Imagine like a much better version of Chipotle.

Beware   Even though it says west campus  cabo bobs is pretty far  do not plan on walking from on UT   Bwfore you order  you can see how they make their taco and chips  and it was really interesting to watch  Cabo bobs is a typical pick your own food type of restaurant  very similar to chipotle. They are well known for their fried fish. I ordered a burrito with fried fish and it was HUGE. The fish was crispy and crunchy and their hot sauce and the rice balanced each other out well. They are very generous with their servings and the meal feels slightly more nutritious then your average fast food restaurant. I would definitely come back to try the fish tacos next time

Was in town and chose this place on a whim.  O.M.G YOU GUYS   They make their tortillas fresh  right in front of your F  amp  ING FACE      I told this to my 9 year old nephew and he said  Like  they crush the wheat   No  they don t crush the wheat  but they DO CRUSH IT     So you can pick from 3-4 flavors of tortilla. They have the dough balls ready then they press them flat and huge  then throw them on a rotating gridle and cook them up. Do you know how fantastic it is to watch your tortilla get all bubbly and griddled  F  amp  ING FANTASTIC     I had some kind of pork  sorry  don t remember because my mind was blown by the tortillas  with white rice  baja beans     and other delightful fillings  like the squash zucchini - YUM    It was huge and delicious and I kept telling myself to STOP EATING but I just couldn t   Carb overload  but totally worth it.   P.S. I had the green tortilla - Tomatillo  amp  Cilantro I think  So yum.  F CK IT  I never give Five Stars  but it s been over a week and I m still dreaming about those damn tortillas. Tomatillo and CRACK is more like it.

This place can be hard to find  but it s pretty close to University of Texas. This place is made for the adventurous burrito lover. They have a variety of tortillas to choose from  proteins  and extra fillings. To me  this place is pretty much an upgraded Chipotle because it is the same concept but so so SO much better. I ordered a crispy fish burrito with a cilantro tortilla  avocado  and other fix-ins. My boyfriend ordered a brisket burrito with queso that was also amazing. Their burritos are also so fat  they can be eaten for both lunch AND dinner. If you re looking for amazing  cheap food...you should definitely come here
Satisfying burritos made out of very fresh ingredients  amp  especially fun is that the tortillas are freshly baked to your liking. Enough to keep you full for the whole day  amp  happy on top

Thank you Cabo Bob s  for being my little piece of paradise in Austin  I m a sucker for a killer fish taco and you can definitely find that here. I love that the tortillas are made to order. So  The chips are perfect and thick  they hold up great for dipping so you have to try the chips  amp  queso  I love this place and can t wait to come back

Every time I go to Austin  I always make time  to make a visit here  I ordered  6  which is brisket fajita burrito  but I don t get all the add-ins. I always drench it with the hot sauce they have   My only complaint is that they don t give enough meat...my whole burrito was filled with rice  It s sad  but I still come back  It s just like another chipotle restaurant but with more variety. At first I didn t really like it  but I m definitely hooked now. My favorite thing to order here is the chips and queso   Oh my gosh this is the best thing here   The chips are so fresh and are just one of a kind. I always ask for a refill on the chips and cheese  usually they don t charge me  if I m lucky . To top it all off  I always order a Mexican coke. It s literally just the best drink to eat with the burrito and queso  It compliments so well    I definitely recommend it  And if anything  ALWAYS order the chips and queso

ONE WORD  ERASMO            He is the most wonderful person. After picking up our orders and realizing we were missing a couple items  we called back to be greeted by his warmth and willingness to listen. He gave us corrected orders immediately. Rarely do you meet someone who makes you feel so special as a customer.

High quality ingredients. Everything was freshly made  the tortillas  the salsa  the pico di gallo. The portions were HUGE  especially for the price. The burrito was just so bland  I got steak with brown rice  looked like cilantro in the rice  black beans  grilled onions  salsa  guac  pico and cilantro on a cilantro tomatillo tortilla. It should have been flavorful. But it just wasn t.  The meat didn t have any flavor. The salsa and pico and guac didn t have any flavor. Maybe if I had gotten it with queso it would have helped  A different meat  Everyone raves about these burritos and I was just so disappointed.

It s good. They make their burritos fresh which is a huge plus. There s a big parking lot out front  so it s very easy to find a spot.   They have decent options for vegetarians  and everything tasted very fresh  I personally am not a fan of cilantro  and they put cilantro in almost everything  rice  salsas   so beware of that. However  the food was still delicious  You can even get burritos with two flavors  I recommend the cheddar .   Overall  it s a delicious and efficient place to get solid burritos close to UT campus.

These people are the best - I come for lunch all the time and everyone is super nice and serve you fast. I ve had pretty much all the items on the menu. Everything is very good....  Plus the atmosphere has a great casual feel and they keep the place clean.
This place is what burritos should be   They take fresh dough  then press and grill your tortilla of choice right there as you order.  The staff is always friendly and the food is amazing

Love this place  Been coming here since it opened  at original location off of Ben White   Freshest ingredients that are super delicious. Always a friendly staff - especially Beto who presses your tortillas

CABO BOB S IS THE BOMB   Hands down  best burrito place in Austin...Makes competitors like Chipotle  Qdoba  and Freebirds look like a joke.  You can get burritos  tacos  or salad bowl and even give you selection of different types of tortillas. The tortillas are made fresh right in front of you and they cook all their meats on Big Green Egg grills. They also have queso  salsas  and their own house made hot sauce.  They also do punch-cards so you can get a free burrito after 6 visits. HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Great spot not just food wise but the employees there make you feel like family. They really do. The cashier Brisa was doing such a great job  had a line to the door but she was always so polite and friendly. He had ordered a chips and guacamole  the people working were a little busy so they brought it out to us. As soon as we got it Brisa was quick to apologize on the delay but honestly there was no need to. We were always treated like family there and can understand if there s a little delay. When you are treated like that by a restaurant it feels so great  So thank you guys. Also Beto    The press guy such a great help  Made sure we got what we were looking for and gave us a couple suggestions that we will be trying out pretty soon  They love their job and it shows

I walked in the Anderson location last night craving a burrito and boy did I get that craving taken care of. I picked the Smokey cheese tortilla which is by far the best tortilla that I have ever had in my life and added lettuce  cheese  pinto beans  black beans queso plus that delicious fish their known for. Just simply a delicious meal for  8.60 you can t beat that anywhere. See you next week.

Cabo is clearly the go-to burrito for students and one of the best in Austin. Everything is done right from the fresh pressed tortillas to the flavorful meats to the wide variety of toppings and sauces. There s also punch cards that make every 7th burrito free  which is a great deal if you frequent the area. Oh  and did I mention that the burritos are cheaper and larger than Chipotle s

This place is a tad bit farther from campus compared to chipotle or qdoba but it s totally worth it   There plenty of seating inside and outside.  I typically get either the burrito or the tacos because they make the tortillas right in front of you so you know it s super fresh  I normally go with the cilantro one. They also have fish which I know chipotle doesn t have and it s super delicious  The portion sizes are similar to chipotle so I definitely have leftovers.   If you re ever craving delicious tacos and burritos  come here  It s worth the distance  I m so sad they only have locations in Austin. Hopefully they ll expand to Dallas soon

If you are looking for the TGI Fridays of Tex Mex  come see Bob.   Everything is smothered in cheese - the crappy waxed coated pre-shredded kind from the grocery store.   I literally had 4 or 5 bites of my dinner as it was just a pile of melted cheese.  The guac and  homemade  chips were...okay at best.  Also - the Gluten free chips  yes we tried both options  tasted like old leaves.  They literally have a house birthday song - we had the unfortunate luck of hearing it three times that night.   As a tourist in Austin looking for TexMex  I was really disappointed.

This place is just amazing. I can t even tell you how many of my friends make this their first request when they come to Austin. They make the tortillas fresh in front of you-and this is one of the limited quick service places where I recommend the fish. Everything is fresh and it s always worth any line that s there.

A good supplement to chipotle  I love the fact that you can pick your tortilla flavors which are made right in front of you. You can either pick the specials that already have the fix ins chosen for you or you can build your own creation- chipotle style. The battered fish is a great tasty meat choice. I order a salad  which comes with 2 tortillas of my choice  and then make my own little tacos. I like how there is more variety in the toppings and sauces also. For a quick and cheap dinner fix to fill you up  cabo bobs is an excellent choice  It will leave you with a happy wallet and tummy.

This is a 5 star place for me  The authenticity of this restaurant should get all the credit it deserves  Think Chipotle but homemade tortillas and love in every bite  They have different type of uniquely flavored tortillas you can choose from  Buttermilk flour  Ancho Chili  Smokey Cheddar  or Cilantro Tomatillo. I tried the Cilantro Tomatillo and my boyfriend tried the Smokey Cheddar  we were both very satisfied with our choices  They are so delicious AND they put it on the hot surface for a few minutes so it is nice and warm and even has wee bit of a crisp once you bite into it  They have the similar assembly line like Chipotle where you pick your beans first  then rice  then protein  greens  and lastly sauces cheese. They have an option for beans that includes a variety of beans in it  I chose that and it was great  The burrito was so fat after they rolled it. That first bite sent me into a great time portal of when I used to eat Burritos in Mexico as a child  it also had a slight chimichanga taste which sent me into overdrive. It made the Latina in me want to get up and hug kiss every single person working in that kitchen  This place is authentically the bomb  Please do yourself a favor and try it  you will be back  I promise  and so will I.

In the great Campus Burrito Battle of the 2010 s...   Qdoba never really stood a chance. Freebirds was plucky  but generally too stoned to challenge Chipotle s tinfoil throne.  Enter Cabo Bob.  The pinnacle of the fast casual burrito. End your search here. This is it.   Why   You know how GI Joe used to say  knowing is half the battle    The other half is home-made tortillas. Cabo Bob has them in four flavors.  Then your kind burrito-rista  burrista   loads the tortilla with a wide variety of veggies and stuff. It s all pretty damn good. As is the hot sauce.  The nationwide battle may still be raging  as Cabo Bobs only just opened their third location. But ended  the Campus Burrito Wars have.

I cannot explain how good of a burrito this place really has    I really couldn t see myself getting any other burrito from anywhere else. The tortillas are actually incredible. If you actually think chipotle is better than Cabo bobs you legit have the tastebuds of a dog. If you ve never eaten here and you like chipotle come here once and you ll never go to chipotle every again and I put that on G

I think that Cabo Bob s was really good and I really enjoyed the service there.  I would definitely go back there again. The parking there is pretty tight and there is a big lunch crowd  but the service was good and I think there ingredients are really fresh and I would say it is better than Freebirds. I like how they make their own tortillas right in front of you and the price is reasonable.

Cabo Bob s... you are the reason why I will never eat chipotle again in my life. Your burritos amount to the size of a small child. The tortillas are fresh pressed and grilled to perfection. The fried fish is always hot and crispy inside the mound of my burrito. Your options for brown rice that still taste great makes me feel like I m being healthy. The options for saut ed squash  bell peppers  and onions is a mild surprise to a burrito. The mango salsa and the chipotle sauce are standouts from the traditional burrito fillings. The punch card is a gift to man kind as is the entire establishment. One burrito a day is all I need  and after 6 days I get a free one. Thank you for existing in my life.  Sincerely   Comatose Brian as a result of your heavenly burritos

Great for a quick and affordable lunch  Always busy with college kids  expect a long line reaching the entrance. It s a bit of a walk from the UT campus  but very worth it.  The concept is like Chipotle and Freebirds  but Cabo Bob s is the best. There are so many choices and the ingredients are very fresh. Never disappointed when I come   I usually get a chicken burrito bowl. The chicken is tender and juicy. The fish tacos are also really good. I love their house-made sauces  especially the Ancho Rancho and the hot sauce.  I have been here multiple times and will definitely be back
We like to come here almost every week  My order is  1 come with 2 pieces of fishes tacos    I order you got 3 tacos  so awesome

So I was fairly disappointed by this place since it received such high praise and ratings. So I came across this place by word of mouth from a co-worker who works in the area. The first issue with this place is the location  it sits on UT s campus. Of course if your a student this is great but if you re a normal government employee it s too busy for a quick run for food. The food itself isn t bad cuts squarely in the middle of Chipotle Qdoba and Torchy s and here in lies my problem. They have no where near the flavor of Torchy s but have more customizability than Chipotle. Everything taste fresh which is awesome but the food is lacking that little punch you get from Torchy s. So if you want great tacos go to Torchy s if you want a great burrito or bowl go here or Qdoba only difference is this place maybe slightly healthier. So probably the real difference here is the food had more of a South West flair instead of the oh so familiar Tex Mex flavors which may be the welcome change you need.

Probably the most popular spot for UT students to grab a quick meal. Their queso and tortillas are AMAZING. For all the counter-service restaurants  Chipotle  Qdoba  etc   Cabo Bobs definitely comes out on top. Usually pretty busy whenever I go but always worth the wait. If you aren t wanting a long wait  try going at a less busy time and avoid the post-football game rush. Also  they are closed on Sundays so hopefully you aren t craving a big burrito with queso then...  Check out their website  they have a great story and a fun-loving atmosphere. Also a great restaurant to cater for events.

If there s one food item i m passionate about in Austin  TX  it is Cabo Bob s burritos. Think everything that makes Chipotle  Freebirds  or other build-your-own burrito places good  and make it exponentially better  and you have Cabo Bobs. Incredible queso  pico  all their meat is cooked on a Big Green Egg. Their Red 66 sauce really pulls it all together. Cabo Bob s is a must have.
Can t beat the handmade tortillas  and different flavors  here. I recommend a mix of the cilantro tomatillo and ancho chili. Definitely go

1  Tasty.  2  Brown rice available   Take that  Freebirds.  3  Vegan burrito on the menu.   No need to ask for it special.   4  Long lines   lunch and dinnertime are a plus or minus depending on your perspective.   Plus b c it popularity suggests quality.   5  They made an in-kind donation to my kid s school.

Capsule review  Cabo Bob s offers good variety and  value to make it a solid player in an Austin market overflowing with taco and burrito choices. Full review below.  At first  I was simply ignorant of Cabo Bob s existence  and afterward I merely ignored it. It s just too far to casually walk from my campus building for lunch  and  given that Chipotle satisfies my chain burrito needs  I assumed it wouldn t be worth the effort.  But lo and behold  Yelp intervened. I saw 4.5 stars  and considered the possibility of a hidden gem. And a hidden gem it is  I almost dropped the five-bomb on it  but some hitches are keeping me at four. I ll be back to reconsider  though.  Nothing about the look of the place promises much  it s like a discount Joe s Crab Shack on the inside  with nautical murals on the walls and wooden tables meant to resemble reclaimed ship wood. There s a huge outdoor picnic-bench area as well for braving the heat. Still  I kinda hate the all-things-Cancun ethos  so I was a little leery.  Service concept is that Subway-inspired DIY assembly line. They have ten preset burrito options  plus tacos and sides   if you re in a hurry or choice frightens you  or the build-your-own. There are four yummy tortillas to pick from  pressed and roasted right in front of you. Just the tortilla alone made me quietly vow to divorce Chipotle  but the fact that you can get fried fish helped as well. I went with brown rice  a mix of black and pinto beans  fish  sauteed poblanos  two salsas and some guac. They have two additional hot sauces on pumps by the drink fountain.  Not only was the burrito excellent  I could have split it with someone and walked away full. My will to overeat was overwhelmed  and I threw away a quarter of it despite its fresh-tortilla-fishy-burrito goodness. And before I added the guac  this log of food was only going to be  6.99. Damns.   Staff were super friendly  although it looked as if service had gone a little off the rails as the manager ran some orders to people standing around waiting  I was nearly handed someone else s food  side cups had run out at the condiment stand  etc. Everything was fixed  but the shift could maybe have run a little more smoothly.   Still Cabo Bob s is an easy keeper  and also  forgive the alliteration  very viable  for vegetarians and vegans--you won t leave this one hungry.

I keep wondering what makes this place so special and I ve determined that it s definitely something about the tortillas  Fresh and full of flavor  they make the meal. Ask for a stamp card  otherwise they don t give you one
Actually the best place ever like I don t know how I lived without CB before college. Better than chipotle by farrrr

Best burrito I ve had in Austin. All of the ingredients are fresh and tasty and the burrito doesn t fall apart in your hand. It s a better quality Chipotle Qdoba. Those places have been ruined by these burritos. Highly recommend as a place to eat

No idea what the hoo-ha is about. A true experience in mediocrity. Service was good  selections seemed good- however-the tacos  amp  burritos were 50 shades of bland  with toppings to match. Nothing to taste here folks. Will come again if nothing else is open.    Addendum  I did take the leftovers with me. Courtesy of being extremely poor while I bide my time as a gypsy before succumbing to a job again

What makes Cabo Bob s different from Chipotle or Qdoba  Sure  Cabo is a little farther up north but it s well worth the trek for students due to their freshly made tortillas  variety of tortilla choices  variety of meats  including fried fish  and toppings  including mango pico or whatever that is    The fresh quality of their food and the abundance of options make Cabo Bob s a top contender for a fast burrito taco bowl.   You can t go wrong with picking a premade order number off the wall  like fish tacos  or just making your own as your eyes do all the choosing for you as you walk down the eye. And be sure to speak up so the workers can hear you because it can get loud in here    Definitely snag a punch card here. They don t make you reach the double digits before they reward you. In fact  you could probably eat here every day and then get a free meal on the weekend.

This is a Gem  Large portions  unbelievably low prices  and fresh Tex-led made right in front of you. I fed three people for  26  I ordered the Fish tacos and they were nothing short of delicious and fresh  The salsa is not as spicy as I usually prefer  but the variety of fresh toppings gives it all the flavor

This University burrito shop is a true hidden gem  though I can t figure out why. So few of the people with whom I ve talked food have heard of Bob s  but with freshly made tortillas for your burrito right in front of your eyes  it s a must visit on any  ATXFoodie tour. Oh  and the sauce  CrayCrayGrayt from their hot sauce to their slightly sweet salsa verde  it s a perfect complement. Oh yes  chips. Hell yes. Fresh fresh crispy fresh.  We ve had the pork  the veggie  both fish and the chicken so far. We will make it through the whole menu of specials before end of next month.
The burritos are really good. They are usually very large and the tortillas are home made. Always a good meal when you are really hungry.
Best fish tacos IN LIFE EVER...cooked to order home made tortillas...omgggg  what more could you ask for     Great customer service  Mmmmm

Cabo Bob s takes Chipotle to a whole new world.  From the variety of fresh made tortillas to the large amount of stuffings  you really can t beat this place.  Not only are they very friendly but they also make every item extremely filling and for a great price. I got three different tacos and they were all massive.  I am definitely coming back here again

I had never had Cabo Bob s until it was catered at Healing with Horses Ranch s volunteer appreciation party.  I really liked all the fresh ingredients  Pico  Chicken  Beef  Tortillas...  The chips and queso where so addictive

Chipotle who  I went to Austin with my friends and decided to eat here on a whim. Honestly  the best decision that we made bc this place is a bang for your buck  They re very versatile and you are given the choice of a bowl  tacos  or burrito  love that  . It s very filling and tasty. Highly recommend
Great taste on the build a burrito I had the fish and it was delicious nice and crisp just the way I would ve done it if I had made it myself hope to visit again soon

The food here is pretty good  but the workers ruin the experience. The food wrapping is gross  and they do a poor job at it. Makes me angry looking at it  and makes me not want to eat it. Don t ever to-go from here or you will regret it. Not worth the money i paid to get a burrito this quality. All exploded. I d rather go to chipotle for a cheaper price.

Came here on my younglife team retreat and these are the responses from some of the members of the team  Alex  this was my high school experience. It s so good.  Logan  I was hungry and it was food Madi  so yummy I ate my tacos really fast Joy  the tacos and nachos were really good   Lauren  loved the tortillas Zac  solid pepper sauce loved the extra kick Tres  if any place has homemade tortillas I m in Come here    Great place for yummy food and good convo

These are some big ass burritos  I didn t choose much filling to go in my burrito but the burrito still ended up being humongous. The guy in front of me got almost every filling and his burrito was on the verge of rupturing but what I love about this place is that they press their tortillas right in front of your eyes and cook it on a heating plate so you can see the tortilla bubble and brown up. For the filling  I recommend you definitely get the mango salsa and chipotle sauce because they add a nice and fresh spicy kick to the burrito. This place is the same concept as chipotle and free birds but they have a nice selection of burrito fillings including zucchini   Which I really liked  so I would definitely recommend coming here.

This place was so filling   I got the bowl with two tortillas and it was enough to take home to make it a second meal  I highly recommend eating it soon though because it will go bad if you leave it for too long  I will make sure to stop by the next time I m in Austin to try there fried fish

Incredible food at an incredible price. This place is easily one of the best deals in Austin. The service is fast and the homemade tortillas are amazing and the portions are giant. What more is there to say

Bad ass taco and burrito joint. Get this... They cook your tortilla made to order in front of you. Not heat it up like chipotle. When you order the flavor tortilla you want. They slap a ball of raw dough onto a revolving grille. It puffs up like a ballon then get to filling my friend. The rest of the show is much like chipotle but a little more creative.
really good fish tacos  great queso. ask for extra chipotle crema on the tacos for even more flavor

I ve been to Cabo bobs at least a dozen times over the last year and the quality has dropped every time I ve been. I would have given it 5 stars after my first 2 visits. I like how they press the tortillas fresh and I ve had no problems with their structural integrity until recently. The last 3 times give been the burritos have fallen apart instantly. I always order online so I don t see them make it.   The worst part is that they took the best meat they have off of the menu about a month ago  the bacon ground beef. That was one of the best burrito fillings I ve ever had. I ve since tried every meat other than the fish and they re all mediocre. The steak I had was dry and there is nothing to say about the chicken.   Bottom line  worth a try but I would avoid ordering online if you want your food made correctly.  Edit  I go there so often because I pass by this place every day
Beat burrito place on the planet. Very cool option for what you can get here. Very healthy. Laid back atmosphere. A must try

Fresh tortillas cooked right in front of you. Friendly staff and lots of seating. One of the best burritos I ve had. Everything is so fresh and they have so many ingredients to choose from. The punch card is also a great deal 6 burritos and you get one free

I ordered lunch today from the one on Anderson lane and Shoal Creek today for the company I work for  Austin s Communication Station It was easy to order and amazing food. Very reasonably priced. Our company will use them again.

Holy Amazing   Chipotle is usually my go to   would order from them once a week    but my friend told me about Cabo Bob s  and I knew I had to give it a try.This is during Covid-19 so we ordered pick up online. The online ordering was easy and  straight forward- our order was ready within 10 minutes. The gentleman who brought out our order was very friendly and efficiently. I usually get burrito bowls or salad but I knew I had to try a burrito from Cabo Bob s and I am so happy I did . First off  the size of the burrito is HUGE. It was bigger than my bicep. I got two meals out of it   and the leftover was still  super good reheated in the oven . I love the large variety of toppings they offer- they have fresh jalape os as a topping option too   The mango salsa was a super yummy addition to the burrito  you can also tell the tortilla is fresh and made in house . We also got the chips and queso. The chips were super crispy and fresh and I liked how they didn t overdue the salt on it as many other places tend to do that . The queso was delicious - better than chipotle in my opinion. Cannot wait to get cabo bobs again

Learned of this place 8 years ago  have since become loyal to their hot sauce  driving from Houston TX twice a year to purchase the LARGE bottles 2 at a time. Today  the tacos were great  but no supply on hoy sauce. Thanks to a kind manager who.heard my desperation and filled a large to.go bowl to tide me overuntil we come back.  We.love Cabo Bob s
The fish tacos are great  The prices and portions are very good

The tortillas are made to order which makes them head and shoulders better than any other tortilla spot in town. In an effort to cut calories  I often opt for a bowl at Chipotle but I just can t say no to a made-in-front-of-me tortilla

This place has quickly become one of my favorite places to eat a quick lunch. I always get the crispy fish tacos  which have never disappointed me.   I m always skeptical of new places when I already have similar restaurants as favorites  but this quickly became  1 on the list. I m always craving the crispy fish tacos. The only downside is the location. I live all the way on MLK so if I decide to walk here  it takes quite some time. I normally drive if I m too lazy. The parking lot has many parking spots so that s always a plus.  If you haven t tried this place  I would highly recommend it  You definitely won t regret it.

Huge portions and everything is tasty. Basically  only burritos  but lots of options. Kind of like a gourmet Chipotle  but quality and price are better. I wonder if all the college kids who eat there appreciate the place - yeah  I guess they do  Given the numbers. Probably best to come at an off time.

This is one of my favorite places for lunch in Austin. They give you a great discount on your order if you re in the military  and it doesn t matter if you re dining in or getting it to go. Let me say it is one of the best discounts in town.  The concept is about the same as Chipotle  but Cabo Bob s is way more festive and has way more choices for tacos  burritos  burrito bowls  and the service is much better. I will put up with the complete lack of good parking  its very awkward location  and its always busy and bustling atmosphere just to get lunch here  I usually get fish tacos with all 3 different flavored flour tortillas  or a burrito bowl with shredded pork or something. I also get their very tasty chips and salsa. Be mindful there are two salsa choices  red and green  and that green sauce is really spicy  Definitely a great place for lunch whether you re dining in or out.

Great burritos and tacos mainly for their tortilla choices. Nacho Chili  Smokey Cheddar  cilantro tomatillo  and buttermilk flour. This trip I got three tacos and my husband got a burrito. Both were good however previous times have been more filled with toppings. I think it may be because line was long and they were in a rush to get everyone s orders. We went on Friday night after winter break so the line was out the door with college students. Usually it s not too loud with reggae music playing but once the college students are back there s a lot of commotion.  Still one out favorite places to get burritos in Austin.

Wow  Been coming in once or more weekly for almost 6 months and nothing has been bad. The staff and management are great and the flavor and quality of food is very consistent and reliable. I work in culinary and it s great to have a place that I can grab dinner when I m too tired to cook for myself. My advice is they shouldn t change a thing  unless it s to take care of the employees who are making Cabo Bob s Burritos a winner. I notice that restaurants that retain long term employees usually have better and more consistent food and customer service. Cabo Bob s Burritos seems to get this and I hope they keep it that way
First time customer and will certainly be coming back  Fish burrito was as big as my head  The cheddar tortilla was perfect  Great atmosphere

Cabo Bob s never disappoints  Their ingredients are always fresh and their tortillas are honestly the best in town. I love that you can customize everything and make it healthy if you want to. I could eat there everyday  Just wish they were open on Sundays

Cabo Bob s is my go to taco place for fish tacos. I come here alllll the time but I never took the chance to write a review. Every time I come here the fish tacos are crispy and hot  I like that they have different types of tortillas  buttermilk flour  ancho chili  smokey cheddar  or cilantro tomatillo  you can choose from. I could eat Cabo Bobs for a whole week in a row  I have  with no regrets. Will stay a loyal customer

This place is da bomb. I have been eating at CB for years now. The Rio Grande store is always so friendly and helpful. The food is always on point and the queso is definitely the best in Texas. I wouldn t call it a meal  it s an experience. From the aesthetically pleasing atmosphere  to the food  to the people  this is my favorite restaurant in Austin. 10 stars out of 5  would eat here again.  PS. Management must be doing something right.

I was really excited to give this place a try after hearing about their fresh tortillas. While their tortillas did not disappoint  other aspects did disappoint. Set up like Chipotle  I made my own chicken burrito with veggies  beans  lettuce  and pico. The staff was kind  patient  and even rewrapped my burrito with a new tortilla after it busted open. The burrito was the size of a 8 lb baby.  Okay  maybe not  but it was huge. Refer to the photo with my hand for reference.  The burrito size definitely adds points for the bang for your buck. But the seasoning of the ingredients in the burrito fell flat. It was quite bland. Thinking some of the guacamole from my guacamole and chips order could zest it up  I transferred some to my burrito. No luck. Although I would give this place another try for affordability  it is not a meal I will ever crave.

DISCLAIMER  This review is solely based on the fish burrito.  Fresh tortillas   Check.  Huge burritos   Oh yes.  Good prices   Thumbs up   The style of ordering at Cabo Bob s is similar to that of Chipotle.  The main difference is that their four different kinds of tortillas is made to order and you can feel and taste the difference.  There s also a lot of variety in their toppings and sauces  which makes the experience all the more exciting.  What brings my rating down is their fried fish.  At first  I was hesitant to try it since I feel that frying a fish is cheating  seafood snob alert .  But in the end  I decided to give it a shot since it received so many compliments.  However  the fried fish just didn t impress.  Its flavor was a bit bland and tasted like any fried fish from a fast food restaurant.  Maybe I got them from a bad batch.  Maybe I got the very last aged pieces of fish from the bottom of the container.  Who knows   But if I do come back  I ll probably try their brisket or their beef burrito instead.  I won t let this one experience define my perception of this place  but if I could  I would give it 3.5 stars.
Lemme start by saying this. Tortillas were phenomenal. I don t know if I like the flavor combo and the cheese and cilantro tortilla. Other than that  I love that they offer fish too

I ordered Cabo Bob s catering for an event at work and I was super impressed  It was so easy to order and they were able to accommodate everything we needed. Gluten free  vegan  and vegetarian options. Delivery was on time and setup for us  super helpful . We had a taco bar and it was DELICIOUS  I am super impressed overall with quality  service  and cost. Will definitely be using Cabo Bob s for future catering needs  Thank you

I don t know why anyone even goes to chipotle anymore. No just kidding I do  it s much closer to campus... But seriously  if you want a cheap  quick  and amazingly tasty burrito  don t go to chipotle  come here.  Why do I like this place so much    1  They appealed to the inner child in me  is that a tortilla press   WOW it made the dough ball flat  WOW now it s spinning and cooking      1.5  No but seriously  fresh tortillas make such a difference. This coming from someone who usually opts for the bowl.  2  Fresh ingredients with flavors that taste home-made and warm and happy. I love how they season their proteins.  3  Queso. In the freaking burrito. Their queso is the bomb diggity.  4  The patio is adorable and perfect for nice weather outdoor eating.   5  PARKING LOT.  Come  it s worth it

Now there are many a places these days that put Mexican flavors into one tantalizing dish  but this one is a local option.  Now I can t say that this is better then the others but the staff is the greatest.  As you may know I feel that the staff is an important part of the dining experience  but this is a fast food wait in line place  Having said that  EVERYONE from the person who took my order to the person who took my money wanted to make sure I got what I wanted.  I ordered a   8  but I m not a big fan of cilantro.  Not a big deal  just a preference.  They made a point of getting me some rice that didn t already have some in it. And every step of the way they wanted to make sure my taste buds got what they wanted. Alas  I got no names  but the staff who was working for the lunch crowd on Saturday December 10th kudos. Let s face it YOU RE the reason I ll be back
Satisfied  I always order their fish taco  one order comes in 3 tacos. This is my forth time here and I took with my family who are from OOT. Still thumbs up experience.

Cabo Bob s food is great and their to-go packaging gives me peace of mind  but during COVID-19  they are not requiring patrons to wear masks unlike most other eateries. They do not even have a sign on the front door recommending it. Subsequently  of the 30 people I see in line  almost all college students  only a handful are wearing masks. I left promptly and placed an order for pickup online. I will not be entering the restaurant again until I know that customers are wearing masks and taking precautions out of respect for the community  even if they feel healthy and indestructible.

This place hearkens back to my middle school glory days as that fat 6th grade kid on the middle school track team - days when I would get to enjoy a HUGE delicious burrito after a meet from Mission Burrito in Upper Kirby in Houston.  This place is as good as burrito places come  at least the ones I ve experienced .  This place is Chipotle on-roids - the degree of customizability  for your burrito is unparalleled by other Austin establishments  from four varieties of tortillas  to countless number of toppings  etc .  Most of all  everything is fresh.    Best of all  THEY HAVE FISH TACOS  which I would not have expected to find near campus.

Want something that doesn t feel like a corporate burrito factory  Cabo Bob s is the spot. Awesome folks like Theresa  Elliot  and Sarai are ready to get you great food with a smile and good conversation. Thank you all and John for reminding me how fun and delicious this place is

Good fattening burritos. Brisket  carnitas  other good meats and stuff. The pop machine has Cane Imperial Sugar flavored pops  including a variant of dr pepper  i think its called Dr Baja. All kinds of sugary goodness. Or you can have iced tea.   Has a patio. Staff is usually friendly. Only a couple retards working there. Its usually clean. Bathrooms are cool. About the parking  Im not sure  I usually park at the laundromat and come here while my clothes are washing.

Cabo Bob s is an excellent lunch spot in west campus  They have ample parking and seating  the food is fresh and they always have friendly service. For just  8.49 I got 3 DELUXE FISH TACOS that were filling and juicy.   A lot of people compare this place to chipotle  but I feel like the fried fish tacos are what make this place distinct.
Love this place   Super good and I go all the time  One request- pls no more carrots in the squash zucchini  otherwise amazing in every way

Absolutely love this place.  The food is always fresh  portioned well and so very tasty.  The staff are always pleasant and attentive.  The restaurant itself is clean and inviting. I wouldn t change a thing

Service  Every time I go to Cabo s  there s always a long line  because it s good food AND close to campus   however  they re very great at getting you through the line in a timely manner.   Ambiance  Very upbeat and chill place to eat at. Plenty of tables to accommodate for small and large groups.  Food  I ve tried pretty much everything they have to offer in a taco form. Hands down - crispy fish tacos  3 tacos per order    whatever toppings you prefer   chipotle crema   fresh lime on the side. The chipotle crema is a must  I ve ordered the crispy fish taco without it once and I hated myself for it. Disclaimer  it s good without the chipotle crema  but it s life-changing with it and this is coming from a person who dislikes creamy sauces 99  of the time. If I had to pick at one thing  then it s probably the tortilla because I prefer a fluffy corn tortilla  but it s nothing that ll stop me from coming. If you like spicy  DEFINITELY try their Red Hot Sauce and or XXtra Red Hot Sauce. I d recommend spooning it into your food in case you don t like it it s too spicy. I eat really  really  really spicy so the XXtra Red Hot is only a kick for me. To help you gauge the spicy level -  the spiciest  at an Americanized Thai food place is a barely a kick to me.  Overall  If you re in the area  definitely stop by. It s great food and a good portion for less than  10 - mine is always less than  8  In my  I breathe tacos  opinion  of all the taco places within the WEST Campus area  Cabo s definitely tops them all. If you think otherwise  please let me know because I would love to find an excuse to try a new taco place.

WOW   This is like a more mom-and-pop form of Chipotle. My friend Morgan  who goes to UT Austin  took me here singing all the praises of a college student looking for a solid burrito bowl. You can get their specials or build your own burrito and watch it all come to fruition. What shame they re only in Austin

Finally I reached a day with no leftovers where I could try one of my bookmarked Yelp spots and I decided it was between Cabo Bob s or Gourdough s Public House for a Donut burger with bacon  cheese  mayo and a fried egg  and I decided to put the coronary on the backburner for now.  I m glad I saw this place on the front page here as it was awesome  fairly priced  and who doesn t love fresh tacos   I love that you can choose your tortilla flavors and not only for the big burrito tortillas.  I opted for the Ancho Chile  Smoky Cheddar  and Cilantro Tomatillo tortillas with the brisket  fajita chicken and shredded pork tacos.  I loaded up with grilled poblano peppers  onions  lettuce  pico  and tried 3 different sauces as well.  Basically everything sounded good  so I had one of everything.  The tortillas are freshly made  and flattened on a machine that is what the trash compactor on the Death Star wishes it had been.  It gets those bad boys thin and quickly so before they throw it on a griddle to cook until they are slightly crisp and still pliable.  You then load up with a variety of fresh toppings of your choosing.   All the veggies looked fresh and appealing  and the meat was moist and flavorful.  There were ample sauces to choose from as well.  I d say the fajita chicken was my favorite meat as it had that great grilled charred chicken flavor  along with maybe the smoky cheddar or ancho chile tortilla which were super fresh tasting  nicely flavored and made a huge difference to the overall taco.  After I finished eating  I debated going immediately back into line to try the beef fajita and crispy fish tacos as well  but refrained for another visit.    I ll definitely be back

Wow  this location surpassed the old location. If I could give it 6 stars I would.  Yes  while the food quantity they give is less than the location down on Ben White  let me tell you the one reason why this place has really set itself apart in the lives of college students and makes an already Cabo enthusiast jump for further joy  UMeTime. For those of you who don t know what this app is  basically at different time intervals throughout the day  they blast out deal specials for various restaurants near campus. Well looks like Cabo Bob s hopped onto that list because they have some really awesome deals  BOGO burritos occasionally  taco  chips combos  food item   drinks...yesterday I got 3 fish tacos and a drink for  5.49. That s right with tax that s under  6. It s not like Cabo Bob s was pricey to begin with  always been affordable and filling  but getting a drink thrown in for that really just puts it over the top.  Fuel for the journey eh  Gonna be making a lot of pit stops here then.

Arnold invited me back to give them another try and I m glad I did.   The counter staff was super helpful with suggestions and I ve found  my  burrito  so to speak.   Ancho chile tortilla  cilantro lime rice  BBQ brisket  cheese  salsa  and 66 Red Xxtra Hot.  And some more 66 Red Xxtra Hot when you bring the burrito to the table.  The food was definitely better than my last visit and I credit the presence of management ownership for a good chunk of that.   It s a pleasure supporting a local business that wants to make things right.   Today  my burrito was made right and I had the opportunity to meet some of the management team.  Definitely a local business worth supporting.

I absolutely love cabo bob s. starting from the location  right off rio grande is a good central location. because it is so central the parking situation sucks. during high traffic times  lunch and what not  your parking can be a little stressful. now once you have parked  well its only up hill from there. as soon as you walk in the menu is visible. as you stand in line contemplating what you want to eat  so see people walk off with food and then you taste buds start watering. you also get ideas as to what looks good and what you don t want. finally you are at the tortilla guy. you chose  I chose a bowl  they are starting to grow on me..........then I pick white rice  then a meat  then some beans  and so on and so on and they make it fit all so perfectly. if you are on a diet  they have healthy options. if you are on a budget  go to McDonalds. so I get my bowl and I pay. now seating is tricky because its not wait to be seated its a first come first serve. which means you may have to sit in a booth  table or bar table. if you aren t picky then you will have a spot to sit. larger groups I suggest as soon as you walk in start finding a seating area. my hubby usually get chips on the side to eat with his bowl. good idea if you don t think the bowl will fill you up. listen to me when I say.............Cabo bob s is the truth. GO. you wont be disappointed. last reason I love this place.............THE MUSIC JAMZ lol
Best burritos on campus. I fell in love with this place ever since the first time I came. Great service  nice people  and a chill atmosphere.

Cabo Bob s is one of the best burritos in the world. I ve been here so often I ve lost count of the punch cards I ve made it through. I recently moved away from Austin and the Cabo Bob s is one of my biggest cravings...  The can t stop won t stop eating good  - FRESH TORTILLAS. OH MY GOD. - Fried fish is on the spot - Hot sauce is absurdly good  The bad  - Lines can get a bit long - Cashier can get judgmental if it s your 2nd meal of the day there  Some tips and tricks  - Mix tortillas  yes you can do this . I usually get a half ancho chili half smokey cheddar for a burrito. - Half  amp  half meats usually yields more quantity - Buy tortillas by themselves to-go

Very tasty tacos and burritos. Their tortilla have great flavor. My favorite is anchor chilly. Compared to Torches and Taco Joint which are more TexMex like flavor  Cabo Bob s is SoCal style.  The punch card gives 1 more meal for every 6  must be used in your next visit .

We flew 1200 miles and this was our first stop and it did not disappoint. We had the Deluxe tacos and brisket burritos and they were phenomenal  Fountain drinks were not traditOnalaska in that we has the old time cream soda and the peach soda. Winning

A great experience. Staff is very friendly  atmosphere is on point  as a company they are very charitable  the beverage choices are great  and the burritos are great and reasonably priced.  Perfect location.
Hands down my favorite quick meal in town. You can tell everything is made fresh  and the meat is high quality. And those tortillas. Seriously.

I was trying to think of a clever opening line for this  similar to  This place is like a Turkish Chipotle.  But all I could come up with was   This place is like a Fishy Freebird   and that s not quite what I was going for. Not everything I do on Yelp is a home run.   But if the game we re playing here is clever tacos  then keep your eye on the Bob. Their tortillas are pretty innovative  their proteins pretty perfect  and their veggies full of vim and vigor. They do lots of creative sauces  and they offer a killer vegan burrito  if that s your style. And they really do have one great soda fountain - no HFCS here. In fact  everything I said about their original store on Ben White holds true at this new location - the only difference I could see is the service line moves from left to right. You ll catch on.  Granted they re brand new  but the staff was super friendly  they kept offering suggestions on how to  pop  flavor into my fish bowl  and I was in-and-out of there for under  10. Incidentally  their  Dr Baja  is our Dr Pepper  and real sugar in soda is a subtle world of difference.  The bottom line is this Cabo Bob s does a whole lot of things right  they re good  they re local  and now they re definitely a lot more accessible. In our very own hometown Field of Tacos - perhaps the most competitive game in town - I think we can point to these guys and call   Score.

Update  Review on a follow up by owner   The owner Bob messaged me back and offered to try to make things right.
